19623: api_opt_sock_lowat_udp4(Opt) ->
19624:     Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
19625:                    socket:setopt(Sock, socket, Opt, Value)
19626:            end,
19627:     Get  = fun(Sock) ->
19628:                    socket:getopt(Sock, socket, Opt)
19629:            end,
19630:     InitState = #{domain => inet,
19631:                   type   => dgram,
19632:                   proto  => udp,
19633:                   set    => Set,
19634:                   get    => Get},
19635:     ok = api_opt_sock_lowat(InitState).
19636: 
19637: 
19638: api_opt_sock_lowat(InitState) ->
19639:     Seq = 
19640:         [
19641:          #{desc => "local address",
19642:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
19643:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19644:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
19645:                    end},
19646: 
19647:          #{desc => "open socket",
19648:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
19649:                          type   := Type,
19650:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
19651:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, Type, Proto),
19652:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
19653:                    end},
19654:          #{desc => "bind",
19655:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA}) ->
19656:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
19657:                                ok ->
19658:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound"),
19659:                                    ok;
19660:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19661:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
19662:                                    ERROR
19663:                            end
19664:                    end},
19665:          #{desc => "get current (default) lowat",
19666:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
19667:                            case Get(Sock) of
19668:                                {ok, LOWAT} ->
19669:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("(default) lowat: ~p",
19670:                                                [LOWAT]),
19671:                                    {ok, State#{default_lowat => LOWAT}};
19672:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
19673:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed getting (default) lowat:"
19674:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
19675:                                    {skip, Reason};
19676:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19677:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) lowat:"
19678:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
19679:                                    ERROR
19680:                            end
19681:                    end},
19682: 
19683:          #{desc => "change lowat ( + 1 )",
19684:            cmd  => fun(#{sock          := Sock,
19685:                          default_lowat := DefaultLOWAT,
19686:                          set           := Set} = State) ->
19687:                            NewLOWAT = DefaultLOWAT + 1,
19688:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try set new lowat to ~w", [NewLOWAT]),
19689:                            case Set(Sock, NewLOWAT) of
19690:                                ok ->
19691:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("LOWAT change success", []),
19692:                                    {ok, State#{new_lowat => NewLOWAT}};
19693:                                {error, enoprotoopt} ->
19694:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("LOWAT not changeable", []),
19695:                                    {skip, "Not changeable"};
19696:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19697:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed changing buffer size:"
19698:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
19699:                                    ERROR
19700:                            end
19701:                    end},
19702: 
19703:          #{desc => "validate lowat",
19704:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
19705:                          get       := Get,
19706:                          new_lowat := ExpLOWAT} = _State) ->
19707:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try validate lowat (~w)", [ExpLOWAT]),
19708:                            case Get(Sock) of
19709:                                {ok, ExpLOWAT} ->
19710:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("lowat validated:"
19711:                                                "~n   LOWAT: ~w", [ExpLOWAT]),
19712:                                    ok;
19713:                                {ok, LOWAT} ->
19714:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("lowat invalid:"
19715:                                                "~n   LOWAT:          ~w"
19716:                                                "~n   Expected LOWAT: ~w",
19717:                                                [LOWAT, ExpLOWAT]),
19718:                                    {error, {invalid_lowat, LOWAT, ExpLOWAT}};
19719:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19720:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get lowat:"
19721:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
19722:                                    ERROR
19723:                            end
19724:                    end},
19725: 
19726:          #{desc => "close socket",
19727:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
19728:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
19729:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
19730:                    end},
19731: 
19732:          %% *** We are done ***
19733:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
19734:         ],
19735:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
19736:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
19737: 
19738: 
19739: 
19740: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
19741: 
19742: %% Tests that the timestamp control message header is received when
19743: %% setting the socket 'socket' option true when using sendmsg/recvmsg
19744: %% on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
19745: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
19746: %%
19747: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, socket, timestamp, boolean()).
19748: %%
19749: %% All subsequent *received* messages will be timestamped.
19750: %%
19751: 
19752: api_opt_sock_timestamp_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
19753:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
19754:     tc_try(api_opt_sock_timestamp_udp4,
19755:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_sock_timestamp() end,
19756:            fun() ->
19757:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
19758:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, socket, timestamp, Value)
19759:                           end,
19760:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
19761:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, socket, timestamp)
19762:                           end,
19763:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest) ->
19764:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
19765:                                              iov  => [Data]},
19766:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
19767:                           end,
19768:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
19769:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
19770:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
19771:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
19772:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
19773:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
19774:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
19775:                                           ERROR
19776:                                   end
19777:                           end,
19778:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
19779:                                  proto  => udp,
19780:                                  send   => Send,
19781:                                  recv   => Recv,
19782:                                  set    => Set,
19783:                                  get    => Get},
19784:                    ok = api_opt_sock_timestamp_udp(InitState)
19785:            end).
19786: 
19787: 
19788: 
19789: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
19790: 
19791: api_opt_sock_timestamp_udp(InitState) ->
19792:     Seq = 
19793:         [
19794:          #{desc => "local address",
19795:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
19796:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19797:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19798:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
19799:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
19800:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
19801:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
19802:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
19803:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
19804:                    end},
19805: 
19806:          #{desc => "open src socket",
19807:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
19808:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
19809:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
19810:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
19811:                    end},
19812:          #{desc => "bind src",
19813:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
19814:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
19815:                                ok ->
19816:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
19817:                                    ok;
19818:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19819:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
19820:                                    ERROR
19821:                            end
19822:                    end},
19823:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
19824:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
19825:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
19826:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
19827:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
19828:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
19829:                    end},
19830:          #{desc => "get current (default) timestamp for src socket",
19831:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
19832:                            case Get(Sock) of
19833:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
19834:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src timestamp: ~p", [Value]),
19835:                                    ok;
19836:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
19837:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src timestamp: ~p",
19838:                                                [Unexpected]),
19839:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
19840:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19841:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) timestamp:"
19842:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
19843:                                    ERROR
19844:                            end
19845:                    end},
19846: 
19847:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
19848:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
19849:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
19850:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
19851:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
19852:                    end},
19853:          #{desc => "bind dst",
19854:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
19855:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
19856:                                ok ->
19857:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
19858:                                    ok;
19859:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19860:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
19861:                                    ERROR
19862:                            end
19863:                    end},
19864:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
19865:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
19866:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
19867:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
19868:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
19869:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
19870:                    end},
19871: 
19872:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (WO TIMESTAMP)",
19873:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
19874:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
19875:                    end},
19876:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
19877:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
19878:                            case Recv(Sock) of
19879:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
19880:                                    ok;
19881:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
19882:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19883:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19884:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
19885:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19886:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
19887:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19888:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
19889:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
19890:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
19891:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
19892:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19893:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
19894:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
19895:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
19896:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
19897:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
19898:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
19899:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
19900:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19901:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19902:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
19903:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
19904:                                    ERROR
19905:                            end
19906:                    end},
19907:          #{desc => "send rep (to src)",
19908:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, send := Send}) ->
19909:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP, Src)
19910:                    end},
19911:          #{desc => "recv rep (from dst)",
19912:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, recv := Recv}) ->
19913:                            case Recv(Sock) of
19914:                                {ok, {Dst, [], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
19915:                                    ok;
19916:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
19917:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19918:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19919:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
19920:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
19921:                                    ERROR
19922:                            end
19923:                    end},
19924: 
19925: 
19926:          #{desc => "enable timestamp on dst socket",
19927:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
19928:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
19929:                                ok ->
19930:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst timestamp enabled"),
19931:                                    ok;
19932:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
19933:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting timestamp:"
19934:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
19935:                                    ERROR
19936:                            end
19937:                    end},
19938: 
19939: 
19940:          #{desc => "send req 1 (to dst) (W TIMESTAMP)",
19941:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
19942:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
19943:                    end},
19944:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
19945:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
19946:                            case Recv(Sock) of
19947:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := socket,
19948:                                              type  := timestamp,
19949:                                              value := TS}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
19950:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received req *with* "
19951:                                                "expected timestamp: "
19952:                                                "~n   ~p", [TS]),
19953:                                    ok;
19954:                                {ok, {Src, CMsgs, ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
19955:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected control message(s):"
19956:                                                "~n   CMsgs: ~p",
19957:                                                [CMsgs]),
19958:                                    {error, {unexpected_cmsgs, CMsgs}};
19959:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
19960:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19961:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19962:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
19963:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
19964:                                    ERROR
19965:                            end
19966:                    end},
19967:          #{desc => "send rep (to src)",
19968:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, send := Send}) ->
19969:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP, Src)
19970:                    end},
19971:          #{desc => "recv rep (from dst)",
19972:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, recv := Recv}) ->
19973:                            case Recv(Sock) of
19974:                                {ok, {Dst, [], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
19975:                                    ok;
19976:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
19977:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
19978:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
19979:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
19980:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
19981:                                    ERROR
19982:                            end
19983:                    end},
19984: 
19985: 
19986:          #{desc => "send req 2 (to dst) (W TIMESTAMP)",
19987:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
19988:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
19989:                    end},
19990:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
19991:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
19992:                            case Recv(Sock) of
19993:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := socket,
19994:                                              type  := timestamp,
19995:                                              value := TS}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
19996:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received req *with* "
19997:                                                "expected timestamp: "
19998:                                                "~n   ~p", [TS]),
19999:                                    ok;
20000:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20001:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20002:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20003:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20004:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20005:                                    ERROR
20006:                            end
20007:                    end},
20008:          #{desc => "send rep (to src)",
20009:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, send := Send}) ->
20010:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP, Src)
20011:                    end},
20012:          #{desc => "recv rep (from dst)",
20013:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, recv := Recv}) ->
20014:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20015:                                {ok, {Dst, [], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
20016:                                    ok;
20017:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20018:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20019:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20020:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20021:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20022:                                    ERROR
20023:                            end
20024:                    end},
20025: 
20026: 
20027:          #{desc => "disable timestamps on dst socket",
20028:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
20029:                            case Set(Sock, false) of
20030:                                ok ->
20031:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst timestamp disabled"),
20032:                                    ok;
20033:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20034:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting timestamp:"
20035:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20036:                                    ERROR
20037:                            end
20038:                    end},
20039: 
20040: 
20041:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (WO TIMESTAMP)",
20042:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
20043:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
20044:                    end},
20045:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
20046:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
20047:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20048:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20049:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received req *without* timestamp"),
20050:                                    ok;
20051:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20052:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20053:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20054:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20055:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20056:                                    ERROR
20057:                            end
20058:                    end},
20059:          #{desc => "send rep (to src)",
20060:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, send := Send}) ->
20061:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP, Src)
20062:                    end},
20063:          #{desc => "recv rep (from dst)",
20064:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, recv := Recv}) ->
20065:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20066:                                {ok, {Dst, [], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
20067:                                    ok;
20068:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
20069:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
20070:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20071:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
20072:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
20073:                                    ERROR
20074:                            end
20075:                    end},
20076: 
20077: 
20078:          #{desc => "close src socket",
20079:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
20080:                          sock_src := Sock,
20081:                          lsa_src  := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
20082:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20083:                            State1 =
20084:                                unlink_path(Path,
20085:                                            fun() -> maps:remove(lsa_src, State) end,
20086:                                            fun() -> State end),
20087:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State1)};
20088:                       (#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
20089:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20090:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
20091:                    end},
20092:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
20093:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
20094:                          sock_dst := Sock,
20095:                          lsa_dst  := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
20096:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20097:                            State1 =
20098:                                unlink_path(Path,
20099:                                            fun() -> maps:remove(lsa_dst, State) end,
20100:                                            fun() -> State end),
20101:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State1)};
20102:                       (#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
20103:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20104:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
20105:                    end},
20106: 
20107:          %% *** We are done ***
20108:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
20109:         ],
20110:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
20111:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
20112: 
20113: 
20114: 
20115: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
20116: 
20117: %% Tests that the timestamp control message header is received when
20118: %% setting the socket 'socket' option true when using sendmsg/recvmsg
20119: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
20120: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
20121: %%
20122: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, socket, timestamp, boolean()).
20123: %%
20124: %% All subsequent *received* messages will be timestamped.
20125: %%
20126: %% There is no mention of this not working for TCP in the man page
20127: %% on a SLES 11 SP4 machine (=> 3.0.101-108.87), but it does not
20128: %% (we don't get a timestamp control message header when its enabled).
20129: %% It also does not work on SLES 12 SP2 (=> 4.4.120-92.70), 
20130: %% so we start by skipping from that version (4.4.120) or older!
20131: %% Don't actually know if its the distro or the (kernel) version...
20132: %%
20133: 
20134: api_opt_sock_timestamp_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
20135:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
20136:     tc_try(api_opt_sock_timestamp_tcp4,
20137:            fun() ->
20138:                    has_support_ipv4(),
20139:                    has_support_sock_timestamp(),
20140:                    is_good_enough_linux({4,4,120}),
20141:                    is_not_freebsd(),
20142:                    is_not_openbsd(),
20143:                    is_not_netbsd(),
20144:                    is_not_darwin()
20145:            end,
20146:            fun() ->
20147:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
20148:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, socket, timestamp, Value)
20149:                           end,
20150:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
20151:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, socket, timestamp)
20152:                           end,
20153:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data) ->
20154:                                   Msg = #{iov  => [Data]},
20155:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
20156:                           end,
20157:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
20158:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
20159:                                       {ok, #{ctrl := CMsgs,
20160:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
20161:                                           {ok, {CMsgs, Data}};
20162:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
20163:                                           ERROR
20164:                                   end
20165:                           end,
20166:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
20167:                                  proto  => tcp,
20168:                                  send   => Send,
20169:                                  recv   => Recv,
20170:                                  set    => Set,
20171:                                  get    => Get},
20172:                    ok = api_opt_sock_timestamp_tcp(InitState)
20173:            end).
20174: 
20175: 
20176: 
20177: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
20178: 
20179: api_opt_sock_timestamp_tcp(InitState) ->
20180:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
20181:     ServerSeq =
20182:         [
20183:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
20184:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
20185:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
20186:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
20187:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
20188:                    end},
20189:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
20190:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20191:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
20192:                            ok
20193:                    end},
20194: 
20195:          %% *** Init part ***
20196:          #{desc => "which local address",
20197:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
20198:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20199:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
20200:                    end},
20201:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
20202:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
20203:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
20204:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
20205:                                {ok, Sock} ->
20206:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
20207:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20208:                                    ERROR
20209:                            end
20210:                    end},
20211:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
20212:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
20213:                          lsock  := LSock,
20214:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
20215:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
20216:                                ok ->
20217:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
20218:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20219:                                    ERROR
20220:                            end;
20221:                       (#{lsock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = State) ->
20222:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
20223:                                ok ->
20224:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
20225:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
20226:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
20227:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20228:                                    ERROR
20229:                            end
20230:                    end},
20231:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
20232:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
20233:                            socket:listen(LSock)
20234:                    end},
20235:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
20236:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
20237:                          tester := Tester, lsa := #{path := Path}}) ->
20238:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
20239:                            ok;
20240:                       (#{tester := Tester, lport := Port}) ->
20241:                            %% This is actually not used for unix domain socket
20242:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
20243:                            ok
20244:                    end},
20245: 
20246: 
20247:          %% The actual test
20248:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
20249:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20250:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
20251:                    end},
20252:          #{desc => "await connection",
20253:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
20254:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
20255:                                {ok, Sock} ->
20256:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: ~n   ~p", [Sock]),
20257:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
20258:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20259:                                    ERROR
20260:                            end
20261:                    end},
20262:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
20263:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20264:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
20265:                            ok
20266:                    end},
20267: 
20268:          %% *** First message ***
20269: 
20270:          #{desc => "await (recv) request 1",
20271:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
20272:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20273:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20274:                                    ok;
20275:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20276:                                    ERROR
20277:                            end
20278:                    end},
20279:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv request)",
20280:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20281:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_req),
20282:                            ok
20283:                    end},
20284:          #{desc => "await continue (with send reply)",
20285:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20286:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_reply)
20287:                    end},
20288:          #{desc => "send reply",
20289:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
20290:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP)
20291:                    end},
20292:          #{desc => "announce ready (send reply)",
20293:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20294:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_reply),
20295:                            ok
20296:                    end},
20297: 
20298:          %% *** Second message ***
20299: 
20300:          #{desc => "await (recv) request 2",
20301:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
20302:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20303:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20304:                                    ok;
20305:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20306:                                    ERROR
20307:                            end
20308:                    end},
20309:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv request)",
20310:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20311:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_req),
20312:                            ok
20313:                    end},
20314:          #{desc => "await continue (with send reply)",
20315:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20316:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_reply)
20317:                    end},
20318:          #{desc => "send reply",
20319:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
20320:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP)
20321:                    end},
20322:          #{desc => "announce ready (send reply)",
20323:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20324:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_reply),
20325:                            ok
20326:                    end},
20327: 
20328:          %% *** Third message ***
20329: 
20330:          #{desc => "await (recv) request 3",
20331:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
20332:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20333:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
20334:                                    ok;
20335:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20336:                                    ERROR
20337:                            end
20338:                    end},
20339:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv request)",
20340:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20341:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_req),
20342:                            ok
20343:                    end},
20344:          #{desc => "await continue (with send reply)",
20345:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20346:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_reply)
20347:                    end},
20348:          #{desc => "send reply",
20349:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
20350:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REP)
20351:                    end},
20352:          #{desc => "announce ready (send reply)",
20353:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20354:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_reply),
20355:                            ok
20356:                    end},
20357: 
20358:          %% *** Termination ***
20359:          #{desc => "await terminate",
20360:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
20361:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
20362:                                ok ->
20363:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
20364:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20365:                                    ERROR
20366:                            end
20367:                    end},
20368:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
20369:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
20370:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20371:                            {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)}
20372:                    end},
20373:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
20374:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
20375:                          lsock    := Sock,
20376:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
20377:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20378:                            State1 =
20379:                                unlink_path(Path,
20380:                                            fun() ->
20381:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
20382:                                            end,
20383:                                            fun() -> State end),
20384:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
20385:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
20386:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
20387:                                ok ->
20388:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
20389:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20390:                                    ERROR
20391:                            end
20392:                    end},
20393: 
20394:          %% *** We are done ***
20395:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
20396:         ],
20397: 
20398: 
20399:     ClientSeq =
20400:         [
20401:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
20402:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
20403:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local} = State) ->
20404:                            {Tester, Path} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
20405:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, server_path => Path}};
20406:                       (State) ->
20407:                            {Tester, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
20408:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, server_port => Port}}
20409:                    end},
20410:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
20411:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20412:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
20413:                            ok
20414:                    end},
20415: 
20416:          %% *** The init part ***
20417:          #{desc => "which server (local) address",
20418:            cmd  => fun(#{domain      := local = Domain,
20419:                          server_path := Path} = State) ->
20420:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20421:                            SSA = #{family => Domain, path => Path},
20422:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA, server_sa => SSA}};
20423:                       (#{domain := Domain, server_port := Port} = State) ->
20424:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20425:                            SSA = LSA#{port => Port},
20426:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA, server_sa => SSA}}
20427:                    end},
20428:          #{desc => "create socket",
20429:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
20430:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
20431:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
20432:                                {ok, Sock} ->
20433:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
20434:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20435:                                    ERROR
20436:                            end
20437:                    end},
20438:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
20439:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
20440:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
20441:                                ok ->
20442:                                    ok;
20443:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20444:                                    ERROR
20445:                            end
20446:                    end},
20447:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
20448:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20449:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
20450:                            ok
20451:                    end},
20452: 
20453:          %% *** The actual test ***
20454:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
20455:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
20456:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect)
20457:                    end},
20458:          #{desc => "connect to server",
20459:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, server_sa := SSA}) ->
20460:                            socket:connect(Sock, SSA)
20461:                    end},
20462:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
20463:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20464:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
20465:                            ok
20466:                    end},
20467: 
20468:          %% *** First message (default=wo timestamp) ***
20469: 
20470:          #{desc => "await continue (verify timestamp off)",
20471:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
20472:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, verify_timestamp)
20473:                    end},
20474:          #{desc => "verify timestamp off",
20475:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
20476:                            case Get(Sock) of
20477:                                {ok, false = _Value} ->
20478:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("timestamp: ~p", [_Value]),
20479:                                    ok;
20480:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
20481:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected timestamp: ~p",
20482:                                                [Unexpected]),
20483:                                    {error, {unexpected_timestamp, Unexpected}};
20484:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
20485:                                    {skip, Reason};
20486:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20487:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting timestamp:"
20488:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20489:                                    ERROR
20490:                            end                                   
20491:                    end},
20492:          #{desc => "announce ready (timestamp off)",
20493:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20494:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, timestamp_off),
20495:                            ok
20496:                    end},
20497: 
20498:          #{desc => "await continue (send request)",
20499:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
20500:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_req)
20501:                    end},
20502:          #{desc => "send request 1 (to server)",
20503:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
20504:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ)
20505:                    end},
20506:          #{desc => "announce ready (send request)",
20507:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20508:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_req),
20509:                            ok
20510:                    end},
20511:          #{desc => "await recv reply 1 (from server, wo timestamp)",
20512:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
20513:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20514:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
20515:                                    ok;
20516:                                {ok, {[], UnexpData}} ->
20517:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_data, UnexpData}};
20518:                                {ok, {BadCMsgs, ?BASIC_REP}} ->
20519:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_cmsgs,
20520:                                             BadCMsgs}};
20521:                                {ok, BadReply} ->
20522:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply, BadReply}};
20523:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20524:                                    ERROR
20525:                            end
20526:                    end},
20527:          #{desc => "announce ready 1 (recv reply)",
20528:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20529:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_reply),
20530:                            ok
20531:                    end},
20532: 
20533:          %% *** Second message (w timestamp) ***
20534: 
20535:          #{desc => "await continue (enable timestamp)",
20536:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
20537:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, enable_timestamp)
20538:                    end},
20539:          #{desc => "enable timestamp",
20540:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
20541:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
20542:                                ok ->
20543:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("timestamp enabled"),
20544:                                    ok;
20545:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20546:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed enable timestamp:"
20547:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20548:                                    ERROR
20549:                            end                                   
20550:                    end},
20551:          %% Linux peculiarity observed here...
20552:          %% Detected on Kernel 4.15.0-72 x96_64.
20553:          %% The option set to enable receiving timestamps just above
20554:          %% has failed to be effective down in "await recv reply 2
20555:          %% (from server, w timestamp)" below, unless we put the
20556:          %% sleep between setting the option and informing
20557:          %% the writer that it shall write to the other socket end.
20558:          %% A sleep 1 ms improves a lot but does not remove
20559:          %% problem completely. Believe it or not.
20560:          ?SEV_SLEEP(100),
20561:          #{desc => "announce ready (timestamp on)",
20562:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20563:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, timestamp_on),
20564:                            ok
20565:                    end},
20566: 
20567:          #{desc => "await continue (send request 2)",
20568:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
20569:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_req)
20570:                    end},
20571:          #{desc => "send request 2 (to server)",
20572:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
20573:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ)
20574:                    end},
20575:          #{desc => "announce ready (send request 2)",
20576:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20577:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_req),
20578:                            ok
20579:                    end},
20580:          #{desc => "await recv reply 2 (from server, w timestamp)",
20581:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv, get := Get}) ->
20582:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20583:                                {ok, {[#{level := socket,
20584:                                         type  := timestamp,
20585:                                         value := TS}], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
20586:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received reply *with* "
20587:                                                "expected timestamp: "
20588:                                                "~n   ~p", [TS]),
20589:                                    ok;
20590:                                {ok, {BadCMsgs, ?BASIC_REP}} ->
20591:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("received reply *with* "
20592:                                                "unexpected cmsg headers:"
20593:                                                "~n   ~p"
20594:                                                "Current timestamp value: "
20595:                                                "~n   ~p",
20596:                                                [BadCMsgs, Get(Sock)]),
20597:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_cmsgs,
20598:                                             BadCMsgs}};
20599:                                {ok, BadReply} ->
20600:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply, BadReply}};
20601:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20602:                                    ERROR
20603:                            end
20604:                    end},
20605:          #{desc => "announce ready 2 (recv reply)",
20606:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20607:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_reply),
20608:                            ok
20609:                    end},
20610: 
20611:          %% *** Third message (wo timestamp) ***
20612: 
20613:          #{desc => "await continue (disable timestamp)",
20614:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
20615:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, disable_timestamp)
20616:                    end},
20617:          #{desc => "disable timestamp",
20618:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
20619:                            case Set(Sock, false) of
20620:                                ok ->
20621:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("timestamp disabled"),
20622:                                    ok;
20623:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20624:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed disable timestamp:"
20625:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
20626:                                    ERROR
20627:                            end                                   
20628:                    end},
20629:          #{desc => "announce ready (timestamp off)",
20630:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20631:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, timestamp_off),
20632:                            ok
20633:                    end},
20634: 
20635:          #{desc => "await continue (send request 3)",
20636:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
20637:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_req)
20638:                    end},
20639:          #{desc => "send request 3 (to server)",
20640:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, send := Send}) ->
20641:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ)
20642:                    end},
20643:          #{desc => "announce ready (send request 3)",
20644:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20645:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_req),
20646:                            ok
20647:                    end},
20648:          #{desc => "await recv reply 3 (from server, wo timestamp)",
20649:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv}) ->
20650:                            case Recv(Sock) of
20651:                                {ok, {[], ?BASIC_REP}} ->
20652:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received reply *without* "
20653:                                                "timestamp"),
20654:                                    ok;
20655:                                {ok, {BadCMsgs, ?BASIC_REP}} ->
20656:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_cmsgs,
20657:                                             BadCMsgs}};
20658:                                {ok, {[], BadData}} ->
20659:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply_data,
20660:                                             BadData}};
20661:                                {ok, BadReply} ->
20662:                                    {error, {unexpected_reply, BadReply}};
20663:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20664:                                    ERROR
20665:                            end
20666:                    end},
20667:          #{desc => "announce ready 3 (recv reply)",
20668:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
20669:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_reply),
20670:                            ok
20671:                    end},
20672: 
20673:          %% *** Termination ***
20674:          #{desc => "await terminate",
20675:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
20676:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
20677:                                ok ->
20678:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
20679:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20680:                                    ERROR
20681:                            end
20682:                    end},
20683:          #{desc => "close socket",
20684:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
20685:                          sock     := Sock,
20686:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
20687:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20688:                            State1 =
20689:                                unlink_path(Path,
20690:                                            fun() ->
20691:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
20692:                                            end,
20693:                                            fun() -> State end),
20694:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
20695:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
20696:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
20697:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
20698:                    end},
20699: 
20700:          %% *** We are done ***
20701:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
20702:         ],
20703: 
20704: 
20705:     TesterSeq =
20706:         [
20707:          %% *** Init part ***
20708:          #{desc => "monitor server",
20709:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
20710:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
20711:                            ok
20712:                    end},
20713:          #{desc => "monitor client",
20714:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
20715:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
20716:                            ok
20717:                    end},
20718: 
20719:          %% Start the server
20720:          #{desc => "order server start",
20721:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
20722:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
20723:                            ok
20724:                    end},
20725:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
20726:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
20727:                            {ok, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
20728:                            {ok, State#{server_port => Port}}
20729:                    end},
20730: 
20731:          %% Start the client
20732:          #{desc => "order client start",
20733:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid, server_port := Port} = _State) ->
20734:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Port),
20735:                            ok
20736:                    end},
20737:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
20738:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
20739:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
20740:                    end},
20741: 
20742:          %% *** The actual test ***
20743:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with accept)",
20744:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20745:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, accept),
20746:                            ok
20747:                    end},
20748: %%%         ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
20749:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with connect)",
20750:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20751:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
20752:                            ok
20753:                    end},
20754:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
20755:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20756:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, connect)
20757:                    end},
20758:          #{desc => "await server ready (accept)",
20759:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20760:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, accept)
20761:                    end},
20762: 
20763:          %% *** First message (default=wo timestamp) ***
20764: 
20765:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with verify timestamp off)",
20766:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20767:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, verify_timestamp),
20768:                            ok
20769:                    end},
20770:          #{desc => "await client ready (timestamp off)",
20771:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20772:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, timestamp_off)
20773:                    end},
20774: 
20775:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with send request 1)",
20776:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20777:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_req),
20778:                            ok
20779:                    end},
20780:          #{desc => "await client ready (with send request 1)",
20781:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20782:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_req)
20783:                    end},
20784:          #{desc => "await server ready (request recv 1)",
20785:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20786:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_req)
20787:                    end},
20788:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with send reply)",
20789:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20790:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_reply),
20791:                            ok
20792:                    end},
20793:          #{desc => "await server ready (with reply sent)",
20794:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20795:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_reply)
20796:                    end},
20797:          #{desc => "await client ready (reply recv)",
20798:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20799:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_reply)
20800:                    end},
20801: 
20802:          %% Second message (w timestamp)
20803: 
20804:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with enable timestamp)",
20805:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20806:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, enable_timestamp),
20807:                            ok
20808:                    end},
20809:          #{desc => "await client ready (timestamp on)",
20810:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20811:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, timestamp_on)
20812:                    end},
20813: 
20814:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with send request 2)",
20815:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20816:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_req),
20817:                            ok
20818:                    end},
20819:          #{desc => "await client ready (with send request 2)",
20820:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20821:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_req)
20822:                    end},
20823:          #{desc => "await server ready (request recv 2)",
20824:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20825:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_req)
20826:                    end},
20827:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with send reply 2)",
20828:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20829:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_reply),
20830:                            ok
20831:                    end},
20832:          #{desc => "await server ready (with reply sent 2)",
20833:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20834:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_reply)
20835:                    end},
20836:          #{desc => "await client ready (reply recv 2)",
20837:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20838:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_reply)
20839:                    end},
20840: 
20841:          %% Third message (wo timestamp)
20842: 
20843:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with disable timestamp)",
20844:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20845:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, disable_timestamp),
20846:                            ok
20847:                    end},
20848:          #{desc => "await client ready (timestamp off)",
20849:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20850:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, timestamp_off)
20851:                    end},
20852: 
20853:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with send request 3)",
20854:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20855:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_req),
20856:                            ok
20857:                    end},
20858:          #{desc => "await client ready (with send request 3)",
20859:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20860:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_req)
20861:                    end},
20862:          #{desc => "await server ready (request recv 3)",
20863:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20864:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_req)
20865:                    end},
20866:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with send reply 3)",
20867:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20868:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_reply),
20869:                            ok
20870:                    end},
20871:          #{desc => "await server ready (with reply sent 3)",
20872:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20873:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_reply)
20874:                    end},
20875:          #{desc => "await client ready (reply recv 3)",
20876:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20877:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_reply)
20878:                    end},
20879: 
20880: 
20881:          %% *** Termination ***
20882:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
20883:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
20884:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
20885:                            ok
20886:                    end},
20887:          #{desc => "await client termination",
20888:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
20889:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
20890:                            State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
20891:                            {ok, State1}
20892:                    end},
20893:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
20894:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
20895:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
20896:                            ok
20897:                    end},
20898:          #{desc => "await server termination",
20899:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
20900:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
20901:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
20902:                            {ok, State1}
20903:                    end},
20904: 
20905:          %% *** We are done ***
20906:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
20907:         ],
20908: 
20909: 
20910:     i("start server evaluator"),
20911:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
20912: 
20913:     i("start client evaluator"),
20914:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, InitState),
20915: 
20916:     i("start tester evaluator"),
20917:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
20918:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
20919:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
20920: 
20921:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
20922: 
20923: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
20924: 
20925: %% Tests that the add_mambership and drop_membership ip options work.
20926: %% We create one server and two clients. The server only send messages,
20927: %% the clients only receives messages.
20928: %% An UDP datagram is forbidden (RFC 1122) from having a source address
20929: %% that is a multicast address (or a broadcast address).
20930: %% So, the server create a socket "for sending" and the clients sockets
20931: %% "for receiving".
20932: %% Sending socket:   Bound to the local address (and any port).
20933: %%                   When sending, the dest will be the multicast address
20934: %%                   and port of the receiving socket.
20935: %% Receiving socket: Bound to the multicast address and port.
20936: api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership() ->
20937:     [{doc, "OTP-15908 (ERL-980)"}].
20938: 
20939: api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
20940:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
20941:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership,
20942:            fun() ->
20943:                    has_support_ip_add_membership(),
20944:                    has_support_ip_drop_membership(),
20945:                    has_support_ip_multicast()
20946:            end,
20947:            fun() -> api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership_do() end).
20948: 
20949: 
20950: api_opt_ip_add_drop_membership_do() ->
20951:     Set = fun(S, Key, Val) ->
20952:                   socket:setopt(S, ip, Key, Val)
20953:           end,
20954:     AddMembership  = fun(S, Val) -> Set(S, add_membership,  Val) end,
20955:     DropMembership = fun(S, Val) -> Set(S, drop_membership, Val) end,
20956: 
20957:     ServerSeq =
20958:         [
20959:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
20960:          #{desc => "await start",
20961:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
20962:                            {Tester, MSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
20963:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, msa => MSA}}
20964:                    end},
20965:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
20966:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
20967:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
20968:                            ok
20969:                    end},
20970: 
20971:          %% *** Init part ***
20972:          #{desc => "which local address",
20973:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
20974:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
20975:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
20976:                    end},
20977:          #{desc => "create socket",
20978:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
20979:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, udp) of
20980:                                {ok, Sock} ->
20981:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
20982:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
20983:                                    ERROR
20984:                            end
20985:                    end},
20986:          #{desc => "make recv socket reuse addr",
20987:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
20988:                            case socket:setopt(Sock, socket, reuseaddr, true) of
20989:                                ok ->
20990:                                    ok;
20991:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
20992:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed set reuseaddr: "
20993:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
20994:                                    ERROR
20995:                            end
20996:                    end},
20997:          #{desc => "bind recv socket to multicast address",
20998:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, msa := MSA} = State) ->
20999:                            case sock_bind(Sock, MSA) of
21000:                                ok ->
21001:                                    Port = sock_port(Sock),
21002:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to:"
21003:                                                "~n   ~p", [Port]),
21004:                                    {ok, State#{msa => MSA#{port => Port}}};
21005:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
21006:                                    ERROR
21007:                            end
21008:                    end},
21009:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
21010:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
21011:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
21012:                            ok
21013:                    end},
21014: 
21015:          %% The actual test
21016:          #{desc => "await continue (add_membership)",
21017:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
21018:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, add_membership)
21019:                    end},
21020:          #{desc => "add membership",
21021:            cmd  => fun(#{sock     := Sock,
21022:                          msa      := #{addr := MAddr},
21023:                          local_sa := #{addr := Addr}} = State) ->
21024:                            MReq = #{multiaddr => MAddr,
21025:                                     interface => Addr},
21026:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try add membership to:"
21027:                                        "~n   ~p", [MReq]),
21028:                            case AddMembership(Sock, MReq) of
21029:                                ok ->
21030:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("membership added"),
21031:                                    {ok, State#{mreq => MReq}};
21032:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21033:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed adding membership to: "
21034:                                                "~n   ~p"
21035:                                                "~n   Reason:  ~p",
21036:                                                [MReq, Reason]),
21037:                                    ERROR
21038:                            end
21039:                    end},
21040:          #{desc => "announce ready (add-membership)",
21041:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
21042:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, add_membership),
21043:                            ok
21044:                    end},
21045: 
21046:          #{desc => "await continue (drop_membership)",
21047:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
21048:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, drop_membership)
21049:                    end},
21050:          #{desc => "drop membership",
21051:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
21052:                          mreq := MReq} = State) ->
21053:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try drop membership from:"
21054:                                        "~n   ~p", [MReq]),
21055:                            case DropMembership(Sock, MReq) of
21056:                                ok ->
21057:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("membership dropped"),
21058:                                    {ok, maps:remove(mreq, State)};
21059:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21060:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed drop membership from: "
21061:                                                "~n   ~p"
21062:                                                "~n   Reason:  ~p",
21063:                                                [MReq, Reason]),
21064:                                    ERROR
21065:                            end
21066:                    end},
21067:          #{desc => "announce ready (drop-membership)",
21068:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
21069:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, drop_membership),
21070:                            ok
21071:                    end},
21072: 
21073: 
21074:          %% Termination
21075:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
21076:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
21077:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
21078:                                ok ->
21079:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
21080:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
21081:                                    ERROR
21082:                            end
21083:                    end},
21084:          #{desc => "close socket",
21085:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
21086:                            socket:close(Sock),
21087:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
21088:                    end},
21089: 
21090:          %% *** We are done ***
21091:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
21092:         ],
21093: 
21094: 
21095:     TesterSeq =
21096:         [
21097:          %% *** Init part ***
21098:          #{desc => "monitor server",
21099:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
21100:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
21101:                            ok
21102:                    end},
21103: 
21104:          %% Start the server
21105:          #{desc => "order server start",
21106:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid, msa := MSA} = _State) ->
21107:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, MSA),
21108:                            ok
21109:                    end},
21110:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
21111:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
21112:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init) of
21113:                                ok ->
21114:                                    ok;
21115:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21116:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Start of server failed: "
21117:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
21118:                                    ERROR
21119:                            end
21120:                    end},
21121: 
21122: 
21123:          %% *** The actual test ***
21124:          #{desc => "order server to continue (add-membership)",
21125:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
21126:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, add_membership),
21127:                            ok
21128:                    end},
21129:          #{desc => "await server ready (add-membership)",
21130:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
21131:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, add_membership)
21132:                    end},
21133: 
21134:          #{desc => "order server to continue (drop-membership)",
