21135:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
21136:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, drop_membership),
21137:                            ok
21138:                    end},
21139:          #{desc => "await server ready (drop-membership)",
21140:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
21141:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, drop_membership)
21142:                    end},
21143: 
21144:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
21145: 
21146:          %% *** Termination ***
21147:          #{desc => "order server terminate",
21148:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
21149:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
21150:                            ok
21151:                    end},
21152:          #{desc => "await server termination",
21153:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
21154:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
21155:                            {ok, maps:remove(server, State)}
21156:                    end},
21157: 
21158:          %% *** We are done ***
21159:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
21160:         ],
21161: 
21162: 
21163:     Domain = inet,
21164:     i("get multicast address"),
21165:     MAddr  = which_ip_multicast_address(),
21166:     MSA    = #{family => Domain, addr => MAddr},
21167: 
21168:     i("start server evaluator"),
21169:     ServerInitState = #{domain => Domain},
21170:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
21171: 
21172:     i("start tester evaluator"),
21173:     TesterInitState = #{domain  => Domain,
21174:                         msa     => MSA,
21175:                         server  => Server#ev.pid},
21176:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
21177: 
21178:     i("await evaluator(s)"),
21179:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester, Server]).
21180: 
21181: 
21182: 
21183: which_ip_multicast_address() ->
21184:     which_multicast_address(inet).
21185: 
21186: which_multicast_address(Domain) ->
21187:     case os:type() of
21188:         {unix, linux} ->
21189:             WhichMAddr = fun([_, _, MAddr]) -> MAddr end,
21190:             which_multicast_address2(Domain, WhichMAddr);
21191: 
21192:         {unix, sunos} ->
21193:             WhichMAddr = fun([_, MAddr, _]) -> MAddr end,
21194:             which_multicast_address2(Domain, WhichMAddr);
21195: 
21196:         Type ->
21197:             %% Actually, what is "not supported". is netstat!
21198:             not_supported({multicast, Type})
21199:     end.
21200: 
21201: %% Note that the 'netstat -g' table looks different on linux and SunOS
21202: %% Linux: IfName - RefCnt - Group
21203: %% SunOS: IfName - Group  - RefCnt
21204: 
21205: which_multicast_address2(Domain, WhichMAddr) ->
21206:     IfName = which_local_host_ifname(Domain),
21207:     %% On some platforms the netstat barfs out some crap on stderr
21208:     %% before the actual info...
21209:     %% ...without the 'n' (that is; just '-g') this command can take a
21210:     %% *long* time. *With* the 'n' its much better. But just to be on
21211:     %% the safe side, we add a timeout of 10 seconds.
21212:     case ?LIB:os_cmd("netstat -gn 2>/dev/null | grep " ++ IfName, ?SECS(10)) of
21213:         {error, timeout} ->
21214:             skip({netstat, timeout});
21215:         {ok, []} ->
21216:             %% Can't figure out if we support multicast or not...
21217:             not_supported(no_netstat);
21218:         {ok, NetstatGroupsStr} ->
21219:             try
21220:                 begin
21221:                     NetstatGroups0   = string:tokens(NetstatGroupsStr, [$\n]),
21222:                     NetstatGroups    = [string:tokens(G, [$ ]) || 
21223:                                            G <- NetstatGroups0],
21224:                     MAddrs           = [WhichMAddr(NetstatGroup) || 
21225:                                            NetstatGroup <- NetstatGroups],
21226:                     which_multicast_address3(Domain, MAddrs)
21227:                 end
21228:             catch
21229:                 throw:E:_ ->
21230:                     throw(E);
21231:                 C:E:S ->
21232:                     not_supported({multicast, {C,E,S}})
21233:             end
21234:     end.
21235: 
21236: which_multicast_address3(_Domain, []) ->
21237:     not_supported({multicast, no_valid_addrs});
21238: which_multicast_address3(Domain, [MAddrStr|MAddrs]) ->
21239:     %% Even on linux some of these are not actually addresses, but
21240:     %% "host names", such as all-systems.mcast.net. But both
21241:     %% address strings, such as "224.0.0.251" and host name strings
21242:     %% gets translated into an address by the inet:inet:getaddr/2.
21243:     case inet:getaddr(MAddrStr, Domain) of
21244:         {ok, MAddr} ->
21245:             MAddr;
21246:         {error, _} ->
21247:             which_multicast_address3(Domain, MAddrs)
21248:     end.
21249:     
21250: which_local_host_ifname(Domain) ->
21251:     case ?LIB:which_local_host_info(Domain) of
21252:         {ok, #{name := Name}} ->
21253:             Name;
21254:         {error, Reason} ->
21255:             not_supported({multicast, Reason})
21256:     end.
21257: 
21258:     
21259: 
21260: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
21261: 
21262: %% Tests that the pktinfo control message header is received when
21263: %% setting the socket 'ip' option pktinfo is set to true when using
21264: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
21265: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
21266: %%
21267: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, pktinfo, boolean()).
21268: %%
21269: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the pktinfo control message
21270: %% header will be with the message.
21271: %%
21272: %% Note that it *should* be possible to explicitly send pktinfo also,
21273: %% but this have not yet been implemented (in socket), so that part
21274: %% we do not test!!
21275: %%
21276: 
21277: api_opt_ip_pktinfo_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
21278:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
21279:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
21280:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_ip_pktinfo() end,
21281:            fun() ->
21282:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
21283:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, pktinfo, Value)
21284:                           end,
21285:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
21286:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, pktinfo)
21287:                           end,
21288:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
21289:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
21290:                                           iov  => [Data]},
21291:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
21292:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, Info) ->
21293:                                   %% We do not support this at the moment!!!
21294:                                   CMsg = #{level => ip,
21295:                                            type  => pktinfo,
21296:                                            data  => Info},
21297:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
21298:                                            ctrl => [CMsg],
21299:                                            iov  => [Data]},
21300:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
21301:                           end,
21302:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
21303:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
21304:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
21305:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
21306:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
21307:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
21308:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
21309:                                           ERROR
21310:                                   end
21311:                           end,
21312:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
21313:                                  proto  => udp,
21314:                                  send   => Send,
21315:                                  recv   => Recv,
21316:                                  set    => Set,
21317:                                  get    => Get},
21318:                    ok = api_opt_ip_pktinfo_udp(InitState)
21319:            end).
21320: 
21321: 
21322: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
21323: 
21324: api_opt_ip_pktinfo_udp(InitState) ->
21325:     Seq = 
21326:         [
21327:          #{desc => "local address",
21328:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
21329:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
21330:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
21331:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
21332:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
21333:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
21334:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
21335:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
21336:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
21337:                    end},
21338: 
21339:          #{desc => "open src socket",
21340:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
21341:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
21342:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
21343:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
21344:                    end},
21345:          #{desc => "bind src",
21346:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
21347:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
21348:                                ok ->
21349:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
21350:                                    ok;
21351:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21352:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
21353:                                    ERROR
21354:                            end
21355:                    end},
21356:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
21357:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
21358:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
21359:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
21360:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
21361:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
21362:                    end},
21363: 
21364:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
21365:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
21366:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
21367:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
21368:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
21369:                    end},
21370:          #{desc => "bind dst",
21371:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
21372:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
21373:                                ok ->
21374:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
21375:                                    ok;
21376:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21377:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
21378:                                    ERROR
21379:                            end
21380:                    end},
21381:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
21382:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
21383:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
21384:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
21385:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
21386:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
21387:                    end},
21388:          #{desc => "get default pktinfo for dst socket",
21389:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
21390:                            case Get(Sock) of
21391:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
21392:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvttl: ~p", [Value]),
21393:                                    ok;
21394:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
21395:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src pktinfo: ~p",
21396:                                                [Unexpected]),
21397:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
21398:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21399:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) pktinfo:"
21400:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
21401:                                    ERROR
21402:                            end
21403:                    end},
21404: 
21405:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo (explicit) pktinfo)",
21406:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
21407:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
21408:                    end},
21409:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
21410:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
21411:                            case Recv(Sock) of
21412:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
21413:                                    ok;
21414:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21415:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21416:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21417:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21418:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21419:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21420:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21421:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21422:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
21423:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
21424:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21425:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21426:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
21427:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21428:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21429:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21430:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21431:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
21432:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
21433:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21434:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
21435:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
21436:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
21437:                                    ERROR
21438:                            end
21439:                    end},
21440: 
21441: 
21442:          %% *** We do not *yet* support sending pktinfo ***
21443: 
21444:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit pktinfo)",
21445:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
21446:          %%                   Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, PktInfo)
21447:          %%           end},
21448:          %% #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo pktinfo",
21449:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
21450:          %%                   case Recv(Sock) of
21451:          %%                       {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
21452:          %%                           ok;
21453:          %%                       {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21454:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21455:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21456:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21457:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21458:          %%                                       "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21459:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21460:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21461:          %%                                       [Src, BadSrc,
21462:          %%                                        [], BadCHdrs,
21463:          %%                                        ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21464:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21465:          %%                       {ok, UnexpData} ->
21466:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21467:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21468:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21469:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21470:          %%                                       "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
21471:          %%                                       [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
21472:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21473:          %%                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
21474:          %%                           %% At the moment there is no way to get
21475:          %%                           %% status or state for the socket...
21476:          %%                           ERROR
21477:          %%                   end
21478:          %%           end},
21479: 
21480:          #{desc => "enable pktinfo on dst socket",
21481:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
21482:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
21483:                                ok ->
21484:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst pktinfo enabled"),
21485:                                    ok;
21486:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21487:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting pktinfo:"
21488:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
21489:                                    ERROR
21490:                            end
21491:                    end},
21492: 
21493:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit pktinfo)",
21494:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
21495:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
21496:                    end},
21497:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default pktinfo",
21498:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
21499:                            case Recv(Sock) of
21500:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
21501:                                              type  := pktinfo,
21502:                                              value := #{addr     := Addr,
21503:                                                         ifindex  := IfIdx,
21504:                                                         spec_dst := SpecDst}}],
21505:                                      ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
21506:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Pkt Info: "
21507:                                                "~n   Addr:      ~p"
21508:                                                "~n   If Index:  ~p"
21509:                                                "~n   Spec Dst:  ~p",
21510:                                                [Addr, IfIdx, SpecDst]),
21511:                                    ok;
21512:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21513:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21514:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21515:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21516:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21517:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21518:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21519:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21520:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
21521:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
21522:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21523:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21524:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
21525:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21526:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21527:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21528:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21529:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
21530:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
21531:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21532:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
21533:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
21534:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
21535:                                    ERROR
21536:                            end
21537:                    end},
21538: 
21539: 
21540:          %% *** We do not *yet* support sending pktinfo ***
21541: 
21542:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit pktinfo)",
21543:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
21544:          %%                   Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, PktInfo)
21545:          %%           end},
21546:          %% #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w ttl = 100",
21547:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
21548:          %%                   case Recv(Sock) of
21549:          %%                       {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
21550:          %%                                     type  := ttl,
21551:          %%                                     data  := PktInfo}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
21552:          %%                           ?SEV_IPRINT("Got Pkt Info: "
21553:          %%                                       "~n   ~p", [Info]),
21554:          %%                           ok;
21555:          %%                       {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21556:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21557:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21558:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21559:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21560:          %%                                       "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21561:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21562:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21563:          %%                                       [Src, BadSrc,
21564:          %%                                        [], BadCHdrs,
21565:          %%                                        ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21566:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21567:          %%                       {ok, UnexpData} ->
21568:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21569:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21570:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21571:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21572:          %%                                       "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
21573:          %%                                       [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
21574:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21575:          %%                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
21576:          %%                           %% At the moment there is no way to get
21577:          %%                           %% status or state for the socket...
21578:          %%                           ERROR
21579:          %%                   end
21580:          %%           end},
21581: 
21582:          #{desc => "close src socket",
21583:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
21584:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
21585:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
21586:                    end},
21587:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
21588:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
21589:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
21590:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
21591:                    end},
21592: 
21593:          %% *** We are done ***
21594:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
21595:         ],
21596:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
21597:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
21598: 
21599: 
21600: 
21601: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
21602: 
21603: %% Tests that the options control message header is received when
21604: %% setting the socket 'ip' option recvopts is set to true when using
21605: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
21606: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
21607: %%
21608: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvopts, boolean()).
21609: %%
21610: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the options control message
21611: %% header will be with the message.
21612: %%
21613: %% Note that it *should* be possible to explicitly send options also,
21614: %% but this have not yet been implemented (in socket), so that part
21615: %% we do not test!!
21616: %%
21617: %%
21618: %% <NOTE>
21619: %%
21620: %% This test does not currently work. The recvopts is supposed to
21621: %% result in a IP_OPTIONS control message header but does not!
21622: %% So, exactly how we are suppose to use this option is unknown.
21623: %% So, let the test code remain, but skip until we have figured out
21624: %% how to test this.
21625: %%
21626: %% </NOTE>
21627: %%
21628: 
21629: api_opt_ip_recvopts_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
21630:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
21631:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_recvopts_udp4,
21632:            fun() ->
21633:                    has_support_ipv4(),
21634:                    has_support_ip_recvopts(),
21635:                    %% We also use the recvtos and timestamp options
21636:                    %% in this test, so at least one of them must
21637:                    %% be supported
21638:                    has_support_ip_recvtos_and_or_sock_timestamp(),
21639:                    not_yet_implemented()
21640: 
21641:            end,
21642:            fun() ->
21643:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
21644:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvopts, Value)
21645:                           end,
21646:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
21647:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, recvopts)
21648:                           end,
21649:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
21650:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
21651:                                              iov  => [Data]},
21652:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
21653:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, Info) ->
21654:                                   %% We do not support this at the moment!!!
21655:                                   CMsg = #{level => ip,
21656:                                               type  => options,
21657:                                               data  => Info},
21658:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
21659:                                               ctrl => [CMsg],
21660:                                               iov  => [Data]},
21661:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
21662:                           end,
21663:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
21664:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
21665:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
21666:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
21667:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
21668:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
21669:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
21670:                                           ERROR
21671:                                   end
21672:                           end,
21673:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
21674:                                  proto  => udp,
21675:                                  send   => Send,
21676:                                  recv   => Recv,
21677:                                  set    => Set,
21678:                                  get    => Get},
21679:                    ok = api_opt_ip_recvopts_udp(InitState)
21680:            end).
21681: 
21682: 
21683: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
21684: 
21685: api_opt_ip_recvopts_udp(InitState) ->
21686:     Seq = 
21687:         [
21688:          %% Start by figure out which of the ip:recvtos and/or socket:timestamp
21689:          %% options we can use.
21690:          #{desc => "test for ip:recvtos",
21691:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
21692:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("test for ip:recvtos"),
21693:                            case socket:is_supported(options, ip, recvtos) of
21694:                                true ->
21695:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("use ip:recvtos"),
21696:                                    {ok, State#{recvtos => true}};
21697:                                false -> 
21698:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("do *not* use ip:recvtos"),
21699:                                    {ok, State#{recvtos => false}}
21700:                            end
21701:                    end},
21702:          #{desc => "test for socket:timestamp",
21703:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
21704:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("test for socket:timestamp"),
21705:                            case socket:is_supported(options, socket, timestamp) of
21706:                                true ->
21707:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("use socket:timestamp"),
21708:                                    {ok, State#{timestamp => true}};
21709:                                false -> 
21710:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("do *not* use socket:timestamp"),
21711:                                    {ok, State#{timestamp => false}}
21712:                            end
21713:                    end},
21714: 
21715:          #{desc => "local address",
21716:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
21717:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
21718:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
21719:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
21720:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
21721:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
21722:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
21723:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
21724:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
21725:                    end},
21726: 
21727:          #{desc => "open src socket",
21728:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
21729:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
21730:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
21731:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
21732:                    end},
21733:          #{desc => "bind src",
21734:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
21735:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
21736:                                ok ->
21737:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
21738:                                    ok;
21739:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21740:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
21741:                                    ERROR
21742:                            end
21743:                    end},
21744:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
21745:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
21746:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
21747:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
21748:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
21749:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
21750:                    end},
21751: 
21752:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
21753:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
21754:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
21755:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
21756:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
21757:                    end},
21758:          #{desc => "bind dst",
21759:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
21760:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
21761:                                ok ->
21762:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
21763:                                    ok;
21764:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21765:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
21766:                                    ERROR
21767:                            end
21768:                    end},
21769:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
21770:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
21771:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
21772:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
21773:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
21774:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
21775:                    end},
21776:          #{desc => "default recvopts for dst socket",
21777:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
21778:                            case Get(Sock) of
21779:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
21780:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvopts: ~p", [Value]),
21781:                                    ok;
21782:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
21783:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvtos: ~p",
21784:                                                [Unexpected]),
21785:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
21786:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21787:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) timestamp:"
21788:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
21789:                                    ERROR
21790:                            end
21791:                    end},
21792: 
21793:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo (explicit) options)",
21794:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
21795:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
21796:                    end},
21797:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
21798:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
21799:                            case Recv(Sock) of
21800:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
21801:                                    ok;
21802:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21803:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21804:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21805:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21806:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21807:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21808:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21809:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21810:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
21811:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
21812:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21813:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21814:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
21815:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21816:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21817:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21818:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21819:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
21820:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
21821:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21822:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
21823:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
21824:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
21825:                                    ERROR
21826:                            end
21827:                    end},
21828: 
21829: 
21830:          %% *** We do not *yet* support sending options ***
21831: 
21832:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit options)",
21833:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
21834:          %%                   Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, Opts)
21835:          %%           end},
21836:          %% #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo options",
21837:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
21838:          %%                   case Recv(Sock) of
21839:          %%                       {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
21840:          %%                           ok;
21841:          %%                       {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21842:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21843:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21844:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21845:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21846:          %%                                       "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21847:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21848:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21849:          %%                                       [Src, BadSrc,
21850:          %%                                        [], BadCHdrs,
21851:          %%                                        ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21852:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21853:          %%                       {ok, UnexpData} ->
21854:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21855:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21856:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21857:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21858:          %%                                       "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
21859:          %%                                       [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
21860:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21861:          %%                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
21862:          %%                           %% At the moment there is no way to get
21863:          %%                           %% status or state for the socket...
21864:          %%                           ERROR
21865:          %%                   end
21866:          %%           end},
21867: 
21868:          #{desc => "enable recvopts on dst socket",
21869:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
21870:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
21871:                                ok ->
21872:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvopts enabled"),
21873:                                    ok;
21874:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
21875:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting recvopts:"
21876:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
21877:                                    ERROR
21878:                            end
21879:                    end},
21880: 
21881:          %% This specific option, recvtos, is tested in another test case
21882:          %% Note that this may not actually be supported here!!
21883:          #{desc => "maybe enable ip:recvtos on dst socket",
21884:            cmd  => fun(#{recvtos := true, sock_dst := Sock} = _State) ->
21885:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("enable ip:recvtos"),
21886:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvtos, true);
21887:                       (#{recvtos := false} = _State) ->
21888:                            ok
21889:                    end},
21890:          %% This specific option, timestamp, is tested in another test case
21891:          #{desc => "maybe enable socket:timestamp on dst socket",
21892:            cmd  => fun(#{timestamp := true, sock_dst := Sock} = _State) ->
21893:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("enable socket:timestamp"),
21894:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, socket, timestamp, true);
21895:                       (#{timestamp := false} = _State) ->
21896:                            ok
21897:                    end},
21898: 
21899:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit options)",
21900:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
21901:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
21902:                    end},
21903:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default options",
21904:            cmd  => fun(#{recvtos := true, timestamp := true,
21905:                          sock_dst := Sock,
21906:                          sa_src   := Src,
21907:                          recv     := Recv}) ->
21908:                            case Recv(Sock) of
21909:                                {ok, {Src, Opts, ?BASIC_REQ}} 
21910:                                  when (length(Opts) =:= 2) ->
21911:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Options: "
21912:                                                "~n   Opts:  ~p", [Opts]),
21913:                                    ok;
21914:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21915:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21916:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21917:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21918:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21919:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21920:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21921:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21922:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
21923:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
21924:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21925:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21926:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
21927:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21928:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21929:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21930:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21931:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
21932:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
21933:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21934:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
21935:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
21936:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
21937:                                    ERROR
21938:                            end;
21939:                       (#{timestamp := true,
21940:                          sock_dst := Sock,
21941:                          sa_src   := Src,
21942:                          recv     := Recv}) ->
21943:                            case Recv(Sock) of
21944:                                {ok, {Src, Opts, ?BASIC_REQ}} 
21945:                                  when (length(Opts) =:= 1) ->
21946:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Options: "
21947:                                                "~n   Opts:  ~p", [Opts]),
21948:                                    ok;
21949:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21950:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21951:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21952:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21953:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21954:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21955:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21956:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21957:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
21958:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
21959:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21960:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21961:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
21962:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21963:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21964:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21965:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21966:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
21967:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
21968:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21969:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
21970:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
21971:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
21972:                                    ERROR
21973:                            end;
21974:                       (#{recvtos := true,
21975:                          sock_dst := Sock,
21976:                          sa_src   := Src,
21977:                          recv     := Recv}) ->
21978:                            case Recv(Sock) of
21979:                                {ok, {Src, Opts, ?BASIC_REQ}} 
21980:                                  when (length(Opts) =:= 1) ->
21981:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Options: "
21982:                                                "~n   Opts:  ~p", [Opts]),
21983:                                    ok;
21984:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
21985:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21986:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21987:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
21988:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
21989:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
21990:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
21991:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
21992:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
21993:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
21994:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
21995:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
21996:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
21997:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
21998:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
21999:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22000:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22001:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22002:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22003:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22004:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22005:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22006:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22007:                                    ERROR
22008:                            end
22009:                    end},
22010: 
22011: 
22012:          %% *** We do not *yet* support sending options ***
22013: 
22014:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit options)",
22015:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22016:          %%                   Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, Opts)
22017:          %%           end},
22018:          %% #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w options",
22019:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22020:          %%                   case Recv(Sock) of
22021:          %%                       {ok, {Src, Opts, ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22022:          %%                           ?SEV_IPRINT("Got Options: "
22023:          %%                                       "~n   ~p", [Opts]),
22024:          %%                           ok;
22025:          %%                       {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22026:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22027:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22028:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22029:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22030:          %%                                       "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22031:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22032:          %%                                       "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22033:          %%                                       [Src, BadSrc,
22034:          %%                                        [], BadCHdrs,
22035:          %%                                        ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22036:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22037:          %%                       {ok, UnexpData} ->
22038:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22039:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22040:          %%                                       "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22041:          %%                                       "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22042:          %%                                       "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22043:          %%                                       [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22044:          %%                           {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22045:          %%                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
22046:          %%                           %% At the moment there is no way to get
22047:          %%                           %% status or state for the socket...
22048:          %%                           ERROR
22049:          %%                   end
22050:          %%           end},
22051: 
22052:          #{desc => "close src socket",
22053:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22054:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22055:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
22056:                    end},
22057:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
22058:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22059:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22060:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
22061:                    end},
22062: 
22063:          %% *** We are done ***
22064:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
22065:         ],
22066:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
22067:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
22068: 
22069: 
22070: 
22071: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22072: 
22073: %% Tests that the origdstaddr control message header is received when
22074: %% setting the socket 'ip' option recvorigdstaddr is set to true when
22075: %% using sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
22076: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
22077: %%
22078: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvorigdstaddr, boolean()).
22079: %%
22080: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the origdstaddr control
22081: %% message header will be with the message.
22082: %%
22083: %%
22084: 
22085: api_opt_ip_recvorigdstaddr_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
22086:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
22087:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_recvorigdstaddr_udp4,
22088:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_ip_recvorigdstaddr() end,
22089:            fun() ->
22090:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
22091:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvorigdstaddr, Value)
22092:                           end,
22093:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
22094:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, recvorigdstaddr)
22095:                           end,
22096:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest) ->
22097:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
22098:                                              iov  => [Data]},
22099:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
22100:                           end,
22101:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
22102:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
22103:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
22104:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
22105:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
22106:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
22107:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
22108:                                           ERROR
22109:                                   end
22110:                           end,
22111:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
22112:                                  proto  => udp,
22113:                                  send   => Send,
22114:                                  recv   => Recv,
22115:                                  set    => Set,
22116:                                  get    => Get},
22117:                    ok = api_opt_ip_recvorigdstaddr_udp(InitState)
22118:            end).
22119: 
22120: 
22121: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22122: 
22123: api_opt_ip_recvorigdstaddr_udp(InitState) ->
22124:     Seq = 
22125:         [
22126:          #{desc => "local address",
22127:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
22128:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22129:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22130:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
22131:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
22132:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
22133:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22134:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
22135:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
22136:                    end},
22137: 
22138:          #{desc => "open src socket",
22139:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22140:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22141:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22142:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
22143:                    end},
22144:          #{desc => "bind src",
22145:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
22146:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22147:                                ok ->
22148:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22149:                                    ok;
22150:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22151:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22152:                                    ERROR
22153:                            end
22154:                    end},
22155:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
22156:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22157:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
22158:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
22159:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
22160:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
22161:                    end},
22162: 
22163:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
22164:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22165:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22166:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22167:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
22168:                    end},
22169:          #{desc => "bind dst",
22170:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
22171:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22172:                                ok ->
22173:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22174:                                    ok;
22175:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22176:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22177:                                    ERROR
22178:                            end
22179:                    end},
22180:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
22181:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22182:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
22183:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
22184:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
22185:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
22186:                    end},
22187:          #{desc => "get default recvorigdstaddr for dst socket",
22188:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
22189:                            case Get(Sock) of
22190:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
22191:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvorigdstaddr: ~p", [Value]),
22192:                                    ok;
22193:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
22194:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvorigdstaddr: ~p",
22195:                                                [Unexpected]),
22196:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
22197:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22198:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) "
22199:                                                "recvorigdstaddr:"
22200:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22201:                                    ERROR
22202:                            end
22203:                    end},
22204: 
22205:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (when recvorigdstaddr disabled)",
22206:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22207:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
22208:                    end},
22209:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo origdstaddr",
22210:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22211:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22212:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22213:                                    ok;
22214:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22215:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22216:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22217:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22218:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22219:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22220:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22221:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22222:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22223:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
22224:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22225:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22226:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22227:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22228:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22229:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22230:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22231:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22232:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22233:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22234:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22235:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22236:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22237:                                    ERROR
22238:                            end
22239:                    end},
22240: 
22241:          #{desc => "enable recvorigdstaddr on dst socket",
22242:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
22243:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
22244:                                ok ->
22245:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvorigdstaddr enabled"),
22246:                                    ok;
22247:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22248:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed enable recvorigdstaddr:"
22249:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22250:                                    ERROR
22251:                            end
22252:                    end},
22253: 
22254:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (when recvorigdstaddr enabled)",
22255:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22256:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
22257:                    end},
22258:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w origdstaddr",
22259:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22260:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22261:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
22262:                                              type  := origdstaddr,
22263:                                              value := Addr}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22264:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("got origdstaddr "
22265:                                                "control message header: "
22266:                                                "~n   ~p", [Addr]),
22267:                                    ok;
22268:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22269:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22270:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22271:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22272:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22273:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22274:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22275:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22276:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22277:                                                 [#{level => ip,
22278:                                                    type  => origdstaddr,
22279:                                                    data  => "something"}], BadCHdrs,
22280:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22281:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22282:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22283:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22284:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22285:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22286:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22287:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22288:                                                [Src,
22289:                                                 [#{level => ip,
22290:                                                    type  => origdstaddr,
22291:                                                    data  => "something"}],
22292:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22293:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22294:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22295:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22296:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22297:                                    ERROR
22298:                            end
22299:                    end},
22300: 
22301:          #{desc => "close src socket",
22302:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22303:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22304:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
22305:                    end},
22306:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
22307:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22308:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22309:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
22310:                    end},
22311: 
22312:          %% *** We are done ***
22313:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
22314:         ],
22315:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
22316:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
22317: 
22318: 
22319: 
22320: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22321: 
22322: %% Tests that the tos control message header is received when
22323: %% setting the socket 'ip' option recvtos is set to true when using
22324: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
22325: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
22326: %%
22327: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvtos, boolean()).
22328: %%
22329: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the tos control message
22330: %% header will be with the message.
22331: %%
22332: %% On some platforms it works sending TOS with the message (sendmsg with 
22333: %% a control message header), but since its not universal, we can't use
22334: %% that method. Instead, set tos (true) on the sending socket.
22335: %%
22336: 
22337: api_opt_ip_recvtos_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
22338:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
22339:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_recvtos_udp4,
22340:            fun() ->
22341:                    is_not_windows(), % IP_TOS on windows
22342:                    has_support_ipv4(),
22343:                    has_support_ip_recvtos(),
22344:                    has_support_ip_tos() % Used in the test
22345:            end,
22346:            fun() ->
22347:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
22348:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvtos, Value)
22349:                           end,
22350:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
22351:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, recvtos)
22352:                           end,
22353:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
22354:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
22355:                                           iov  => [Data]},
22356:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
22357:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, TOS) ->
22358:                                   CMsg = #{level => ip,
22359:                                            type  => tos,
22360:                                            data  => TOS},
22361:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
22362:                                            ctrl => [CMsg],
22363:                                            iov  => [Data]},
22364:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
22365:                           end,
22366:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
22367:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
22368:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
22369:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
22370:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
22371:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
22372:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
22373:                                           ERROR
22374:                                   end
22375:                           end,
22376:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
22377:                                  proto  => udp,
22378:                                  send   => Send,
22379:                                  recv   => Recv,
22380:                                  set    => Set,
22381:                                  get    => Get},
22382:                    ok = api_opt_ip_recvtos_udp(InitState)
22383:            end).
22384: 
22385: 
22386: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22387: 
22388: api_opt_ip_recvtos_udp(InitState) ->
22389:     Seq = 
22390:         [
22391:          #{desc => "local address",
22392:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
22393:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22394:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22395:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
22396:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
22397:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
22398:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22399:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
22400:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
22401:                    end},
22402: 
22403:          #{desc => "open src socket",
22404:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22405:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22406:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22407:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
22408:                    end},
22409:          #{desc => "bind src",
22410:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
22411:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22412:                                ok ->
22413:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22414:                                    ok;
22415:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22416:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22417:                                    ERROR
22418:                            end
22419:                    end},
22420:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
22421:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22422:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
22423:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
22424:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
22425:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
22426:                    end},
22427: 
22428:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
22429:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22430:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22431:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22432:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
22433:                    end},
22434:          #{desc => "bind dst",
22435:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
22436:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22437:                                ok ->
22438:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22439:                                    ok;
22440:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22441:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22442:                                    ERROR
22443:                            end
22444:                    end},
22445:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
22446:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22447:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
22448:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
22449:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
22450:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
22451:                    end},
22452:          #{desc => "default recvtos for dst socket",
22453:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
22454:                            case Get(Sock) of
22455:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
22456:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvtos: ~p", [Value]),
22457:                                    ok;
22458:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
22459:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvtos: ~p",
22460:                                                [Unexpected]),
22461:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
22462:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22463:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) timestamp:"
22464:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22465:                                    ERROR
22466:                            end
22467:                    end},
22468: 
22469:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit tos)",
22470:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22471:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
22472:                    end},
22473:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
22474:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22475:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22476:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22477:                                    ok;
22478:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22479:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22480:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22481:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22482:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22483:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22484:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22485:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22486:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22487:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
22488:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22489:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22490:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22491:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22492:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22493:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22494:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22495:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22496:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22497:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22498:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22499:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22500:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22501:                                    ERROR
22502:                            end
22503:                    end},
22504: 
22505:          #{desc => "set tos = reliability on src sock",
22506:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock}) ->
22507:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, ip, tos, reliability)
22508:                    end},
22509:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w tos = reliability)",
22510:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock,
22511:                          sa_dst   := Dst,
22512:                          send     := Send}) ->
22513:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
22514:                    end},
22515: 
22516:          %% #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit tos = reliability)",
22517:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock,
