22518:          %%                 sa_dst   := Dst,
22519:          %%                 send     := Send}) ->
22520:          %%                   socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
22521:          %%                   case Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, reliability) of
22522:          %%                       ok ->
22523:          %%                           socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
22524:          %%                           ok;
22525:          %%                       {error, Reason} ->
22526:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed sending message with tos: "
22527:          %%                                       "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
22528:          %%                           socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
22529:          %%                           {skip, "Failed sending message with TOS"}
22530:          %%                   end
22531:          %%           end},
22532: 
22533:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo explicit tos",
22534:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22535:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22536:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22537:                                    ok;
22538:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22539:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22540:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22541:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22542:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22543:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22544:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22545:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22546:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22547:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
22548:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22549:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22550:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22551:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22552:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22553:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22554:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22555:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22556:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22557:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22558:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22559:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22560:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22561:                                    ERROR
22562:                            end
22563:                    end},
22564: 
22565:          #{desc => "set tos = 0 on src sock (\"disabled\")",
22566:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock}) ->
22567:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, ip, tos, 0)
22568:                    end},
22569: 
22570:          #{desc => "enable recvtos on dst socket",
22571:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
22572:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
22573:                                ok ->
22574:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvtos enabled"),
22575:                                    ok;
22576:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22577:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting recvtos:"
22578:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22579:                                    ERROR
22580:                            end
22581:                    end},
22582: 
22583:          #{desc => "enable recvtos on dst socket",
22584:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
22585:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
22586:                                ok ->
22587:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvtos enabled"),
22588:                                    ok;
22589:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22590:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting recvtos:"
22591:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22592:                                    ERROR
22593:                            end
22594:                    end},
22595: 
22596:          #{desc => "extract the (expected) recvtos \"default\" value",
22597:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22598:                            {ok, DefValue} = socket:getopt(Sock, ip, tos),
22599:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("(expected) recvtos def value: ~w",
22600:                                        [DefValue]),
22601:                            {ok, State#{dst_def_value => DefValue}}
22602:                    end},
22603: 
22604:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit tos)",
22605:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22606:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
22607:                    end},
22608:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default tos",
22609:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst      := Sock,
22610:                          dst_def_value := DefValue,
22611:                          sa_src        := Src,
22612:                          recv          := Recv}) ->
22613:                            ExpCHdr1 = #{level => ip,
22614:                                         type  => tos,
22615:                                         value => DefValue,
22616:                                         data  => any},
22617:                            ExpCHdr2 = #{level => ip,
22618:                                         type  => recvtos,
22619:                                         value => DefValue,
22620:                                         data  => any},
22621:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22622:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
22623:                                              type  := TOS,
22624:                                              value := DefValue}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
22625:                                  when (TOS =:= tos) orelse
22626:                                       (TOS =:= recvtos) ->
22627:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("got default TOS (~w) "
22628:                                                "control message header", [TOS]),
22629:                                    ok;
22630:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22631:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22632:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22633:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22634:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:"
22635:                                                "~n     Alt 1:  ~p"
22636:                                                "~n     Alt 2:  ~p"
22637:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22638:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22639:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22640:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22641:                                                 ExpCHdr1, ExpCHdr2, BadCHdrs,
22642:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22643:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22644:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22645:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22646:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22647:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22648:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22649:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22650:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22651:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22652:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22653:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22654:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22655:                                    ERROR
22656:                            end
22657:                    end},
22658: 
22659:          #{desc => "set tos = reliability on src sock",
22660:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock}) ->
22661:                            ok = socket:setopt(Sock, ip, tos, reliability)
22662:                    end},
22663: 
22664:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w tos = mincost)",
22665:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22666:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
22667:                    end},
22668:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w tos = reliability",
22669:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22670:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22671:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
22672:                                              type  := TOS,
22673:                                              value := reliability = TOSData}],
22674:                                      ?BASIC_REQ}} 
22675:                                  when ((TOS =:= tos) orelse (TOS =:= recvtos)) ->
22676:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("got expected TOS (~w) = ~w "
22677:                                                "control message header", 
22678:                                                [TOS, TOSData]),
22679:                                    ok;
22680:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22681:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22682:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22683:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22684:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22685:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22686:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22687:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22688:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22689:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
22690:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22691:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22692:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22693:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22694:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22695:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22696:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22697:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22698:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22699:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22700:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22701:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22702:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22703:                                    ERROR
22704:                            end
22705:                    end},
22706: 
22707:          #{desc => "close src socket",
22708:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22709:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22710:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
22711:                    end},
22712:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
22713:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22714:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
22715:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
22716:                    end},
22717: 
22718:          %% *** We are done ***
22719:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
22720:         ],
22721:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
22722:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
22723: 
22724: 
22725: 
22726: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22727: 
22728: %% Tests that the ttl control message header is received when
22729: %% setting the socket 'ip' option recvttl is set to true when using
22730: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
22731: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
22732: %%
22733: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvttl, boolean()).
22734: %%
22735: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the ttl control message
22736: %% header will be with the message.
22737: %%
22738: %% On darwin we don't actually get the TTL we send even after we have
22739: %% enabled TTL. Instead we get the default value (which was 64).
22740: %% Possibly this is because we run the test in the same OS process and
22741: %% even the same erlang process....
22742: %% The same issue on OpenBSD (6.6).
22743: %% Maybe we should send and receive from different VMs, until then
22744: %% skip darwin and OpenBSD.
22745: %%
22746: %% Windows:
22747: %% It seems like its possible to set and get the recvttl option,
22748: %% but not to use the ttl control message header when sending.
22749: %% The following is the list of types (for level ip) which are listed
22750: %% as supported: IP_ORIGINAL_ARRIVAL_IF, IP_PKTINFO and IP_ECN
22751: 
22752: api_opt_ip_recvttl_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
22753:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
22754:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
22755:            fun() ->
22756:                    has_support_ipv4(),
22757: 		   has_support_ip_recvttl(),
22758: 		   is_not_openbsd(),
22759: 		   is_not_darwin()
22760: 	   end,
22761:            fun() ->
22762:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
22763:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, recvttl, Value)
22764:                           end,
22765:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
22766:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, recvttl)
22767:                           end,
22768:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
22769:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
22770:                                           iov  => [Data]},
22771:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
22772:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, TTL) ->
22773:                                   CMsg = #{level => ip,
22774:                                            type  => ttl,
22775:                                            value => TTL},
22776:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
22777:                                            ctrl => [CMsg],
22778:                                            iov  => [Data]},
22779:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
22780:                           end,
22781:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
22782:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
22783:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
22784:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
22785:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
22786:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
22787:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
22788:                                           ERROR
22789:                                   end
22790:                           end,
22791:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
22792:                                  proto  => udp,
22793:                                  send   => Send,
22794:                                  recv   => Recv,
22795:                                  set    => Set,
22796:                                  get    => Get},
22797:                    ok = api_opt_ip_recvttl_udp(InitState)
22798:            end).
22799: 
22800: 
22801: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
22802: 
22803: api_opt_ip_recvttl_udp(InitState) ->
22804:     Seq = 
22805:         [
22806:          #{desc => "local address",
22807:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain} = State) ->
22808:                            LSASrc = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22809:                            LSADst = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22810:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSASrc,
22811:                                        lsa_dst => LSADst}};
22812:                       (#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
22813:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
22814:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
22815:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
22816:                    end},
22817: 
22818:          #{desc => "open src socket",
22819:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22820:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22821:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22822:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
22823:                    end},
22824:          #{desc => "bind src",
22825:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
22826:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22827:                                ok ->
22828:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22829:                                    ok;
22830:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22831:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22832:                                    ERROR
22833:                            end
22834:                    end},
22835:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
22836:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
22837:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
22838:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
22839:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
22840:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
22841:                    end},
22842: 
22843:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
22844:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
22845:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
22846:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
22847:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
22848:                    end},
22849:          #{desc => "bind dst",
22850:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
22851:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
22852:                                ok ->
22853:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
22854:                                    ok;
22855:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22856:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
22857:                                    ERROR
22858:                            end
22859:                    end},
22860:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
22861:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
22862:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
22863:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
22864:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
22865:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
22866:                    end},
22867:          #{desc => "default recvttl for dst socket",
22868:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
22869:                            case Get(Sock) of
22870:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
22871:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvttl: ~p", [Value]),
22872:                                    ok;
22873:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
22874:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvttl: ~p",
22875:                                                [Unexpected]),
22876:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
22877:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
22878:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) timestamp:"
22879:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
22880:                                    ERROR
22881:                            end
22882:                    end},
22883: 
22884:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit ttl)",
22885:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
22886:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
22887:                    end},
22888:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
22889:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
22890:                            case Recv(Sock) of
22891:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
22892:                                    ok;
22893:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
22894:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22895:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22896:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
22897:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22898:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
22899:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22900:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
22901:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
22902:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
22903:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
22904:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22905:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
22906:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
22907:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
22908:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
22909:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
22910:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
22911:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
22912:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
22913:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
22914:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
22915:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
22916:                                    ERROR
22917:                            end
22918:                    end},
22919: 
22920:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit ttl = 100)",
22921:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := SSock,
22922:                          sock_dst := DSock, sa_dst := Dst,
22923:                          send     := Send}) ->
22924:                            case Send(SSock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, 100) of
22925:                                ok ->
22926:                                    ok;
22927:                                {error, einval = Reason} ->
22928:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
22929:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TTL: "
22930:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
22931:                                    (catch socket:close(SSock)),
22932:                                    (catch socket:close(DSock)),
22933:                                    {skip,
22934: 				    ?F("Cannot send with TTL: ~p", [Reason])};
22935:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
22936:                                    %% On some platforms this is not
22937:                                    %% accepted (FreeBSD), so skip.
22938:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
22939:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
22940:                                    (catch socket:close(SSock)),
22941:                                    (catch socket:close(DSock)),
22942:                                    {skip, Reason};
22943: 
22944:                                {error,
22945:                                 {get_overlapped_result,
22946:                                  #{file     := File,
22947:                                    function := Function,
22948:                                    line     := Line,
22949:                                    raw_info := RawInfo,
22950:                                    info     := invalid_parameter = Info}}} ->
22951:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
22952:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TTL: "
22953:                                                "~p => SKIP: "
22954:                                                "~n   File:     ~s"
22955:                                                "~n   Function: ~s"
22956:                                                "~n   Line:     ~p"
22957:                                                "~n   Raw Info: ~p",
22958:                                                [Info,
22959:                                                 File, Function, Line,
22960:                                                 RawInfo]),
22961:                                    (catch socket:close(SSock)),
22962:                                    (catch socket:close(DSock)),
22963:                                    {skip,
22964:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TTL: ~p", [Info])};
22965:                                {error, {get_overlapped_result,
22966:                                         invalid_parameter = Info}} ->
22967:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
22968:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TTL: "
22969:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Info]),
22970:                                    (catch socket:close(SSock)),
22971:                                    (catch socket:close(DSock)),
22972:                                    {skip,
22973:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TTL: ~p", [Info])};
22974: 
22975:                                {error,
22976:                                 {completion_status,
22977:                                  #{file     := File,
22978:                                    function := Function,
22979:                                    line     := Line,
22980:                                    raw_info := RawInfo,
22981:                                    info     := invalid_parameter = Info}}} ->
22982:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
22983:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TTL: "
22984:                                                "~p => SKIP: "
22985:                                                "~n   File:     ~s"
22986:                                                "~n   Function: ~s"
22987:                                                "~n   Line:     ~p"
22988:                                                "~n   Raw Info: ~p",
22989:                                                [Info,
22990:                                                 File, Function, Line,
22991:                                                 RawInfo]),
22992:                                    (catch socket:close(SSock)),
22993:                                    (catch socket:close(DSock)),
22994:                                    {skip,
22995:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TTL: ~p", [Info])};
22996:                                {error, {completion_status,
22997:                                         invalid_parameter = Info}} ->
22998:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
22999:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TTL: "
23000:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Info]),
23001:                                    (catch socket:close(SSock)),
23002:                                    (catch socket:close(DSock)),
23003:                                    {skip,
23004:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TTL: ~p", [Info])};
23005: 
23006:                                {error, _Reason} = ERROR ->
23007:                                    ERROR
23008:                            end
23009:                    end},
23010:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - wo ttl",
23011:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
23012:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23013:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
23014:                                    ok;
23015:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
23016:                                              type  := TTLType,
23017:                                              value := TTL}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
23018:                                when ((TTLType =:= recvttl) andalso
23019:                                      (TTL =:= 255)) ->
23020:                                    %% This is the behaviopur on Solaris (11)
23021:                                    %% and maybe on other platforms...
23022:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) TTL (~w): ~p",
23023:                                                [TTLType, TTL]),
23024:                                    ok;
23025:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23026:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23027:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23028:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23029:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23030:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23031:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23032:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23033:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23034:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
23035:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23036:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23037:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23038:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23039:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23040:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23041:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23042:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23043:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
23044:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23045:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
23046:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
23047:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
23048:                                    ERROR
23049:                            end
23050:                    end},
23051: 
23052:          #{desc => "enable recvttl on dst socket",
23053:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
23054:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
23055:                                ok ->
23056:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvttl enabled"),
23057:                                    ok;
23058:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23059:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed enabling recvttl:"
23060:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23061:                                    ERROR
23062:                            end
23063:                    end},
23064: 
23065:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit ttl)",
23066:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
23067:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
23068:                    end},
23069:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default ttl",
23070:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
23071:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23072:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
23073:                                              type  := TTLType,
23074:                                              value := TTL}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
23075:                                when ((TTLType =:= ttl) orelse 
23076:                                      (TTLType =:= recvttl)) ->
23077:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) TTL (~w): ~p",
23078:                                                [TTLType, TTL]),
23079:                                    ok;
23080:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23081:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23082:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23083:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23084:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23085:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23086:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23087:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23088:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23089:                                                 [#{level => ip,
23090: 						   type  => ttl,
23091: 						   value => "something"}],
23092: 						BadCHdrs,
23093:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23094:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23095:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23096:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23097:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23098:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23099:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23100:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23101:                                                [Src, [#{level => ip,
23102: 							type  => ttl,
23103: 							value => "something"}],
23104: 						?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
23105:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23106:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
23107:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
23108:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
23109:                                    ERROR
23110:                            end
23111:                    end},
23112: 
23113:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit ttl = 100)",
23114:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
23115:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, 100)
23116:                    end},
23117:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w ttl = 100",
23118:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
23119:                            case Recv(Sock) of
23120:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
23121:                                              type  := TTLType,
23122:                                              value := 100 = TTL}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
23123:                                when ((TTLType =:= ttl) orelse
23124:                                      (TTLType =:= recvttl)) ->
23125:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got TTL (~w): ~p",
23126:                                                [TTLType, TTL]),
23127:                                    ok;
23128:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ip,
23129:                                              type  := TTLType,
23130:                                              value := BadTTL}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
23131:                                when ((TTLType =:= ttl) orelse
23132:                                      (TTLType =:= recvttl)) ->
23133:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected TTL: "
23134:                                                "~n   Expect TTL: ~p"
23135:                                                "~n   Recv TTL:   ~p",
23136:                                                [100, BadTTL]),
23137:                                    {error, {unexpected_ttl, {100, BadTTL}}};
23138:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
23139:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23140:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23141:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
23142:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23143:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
23144:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23145:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
23146:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
23147:                                                 [#{level => ip,
23148: 						   type  => ttl,
23149: 						   value => 100}], BadCHdrs,
23150:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
23151:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23152:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
23153:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
23154:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
23155:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
23156:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
23157:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
23158:                                                [Src, [#{level => ip,
23159: 							type  => ttl,
23160: 							value => 100}],
23161: 						?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
23162:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
23163:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
23164:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
23165:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
23166:                                    ERROR
23167:                            end
23168:                    end},
23169: 
23170:          #{desc => "close src socket",
23171:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
23172:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
23173:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
23174:                    end},
23175:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
23176:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
23177:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
23178:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
23179:                    end},
23180: 
23181:          %% *** We are done ***
23182:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
23183:         ],
23184:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
23185:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
23186: 
23187: 
23188: 
23189: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23190: 
23191: %% Tests the ip socket option 'tos' can be set and retrieved from a
23192: %% the socket its set on. It sets the type-of-server field in the IP
23193: %% header for a TCP or UDP socket.
23194: %% There is no way to fetch the value a received IP datagram.
23195: %% Default value is supposed to be '0'.
23196: %% 
23197: 
23198: api_opt_ip_tos_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
23199:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
23200:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
23201:            fun() ->
23202:                    is_not_windows(), % IP_TOS on windows
23203:                    has_support_ipv4(),
23204:                    has_support_ip_tos()
23205:            end,
23206:            fun() ->
23207:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
23208:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, tos, Value)
23209:                           end,
23210:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
23211:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, tos)
23212:                           end,
23213:                    InitState = #{set => Set,
23214:                                  get => Get},
23215:                    ok = api_opt_ip_tos_udp(InitState)
23216:            end).
23217: 
23218: 
23219: 
23220: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23221: 
23222: api_opt_ip_tos_udp(InitState) ->
23223:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
23224:     %% mincost is not supported on all platforms.
23225:     %% For instance, Solaris 10, does not have that constant.
23226:     %% Instead it has two others with, what appears to be,
23227:     %% completely different meanings...
23228:     %% So, avoid the complication by not using this value...
23229:     %% TOS1 = mincost,     TOS1Str = atom_to_list(TOS1),
23230:     TOS2 = throughput,  TOS2Str = atom_to_list(TOS2),
23231:     TOS3 = reliability, TOS3Str = atom_to_list(TOS3),
23232:     TOS4 = lowdelay,    TOS4Str = atom_to_list(TOS4),
23233:     TOS5 = 42,          TOS5Str = integer_to_list(TOS5),
23234:     Seq =
23235:         [
23236:          #{desc => "local address",
23237:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
23238:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(inet),
23239:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
23240:                    end},
23241: 
23242:          #{desc => "open socket",
23243:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
23244:                            Sock = sock_open(inet, dgram, udp),
23245:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
23246:                    end},
23247:          #{desc => "bind",
23248:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA}) ->
23249:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
23250:                                ok ->
23251:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("socket bound"),
23252:                                    ok;
23253:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23254:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
23255:                                    ERROR
23256:                            end
23257:                    end},
23258: 
23259:          #{desc => "get default tos",
23260:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
23261:                            case Get(Sock) of
23262:                                {ok, 0 = Value} ->
23263:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected default tos: ~p", [Value]),
23264:                                    ok;
23265:                                {ok, Value} ->
23266:                                    %% On FreeBSD 14 default value is not 0!
23267:                                    case os:type() of
23268:                                        {unix, freebsd} ->
23269:                                            case os:version() of
23270:                                                {14, _, _}
23271:                                                  when (Value =:= mincost) ->
23272:                                                    ok;
23273:                                                _ ->
23274:                                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected "
23275:                                                                "default "
23276:                                                                "tos: ~p",
23277:                                                                [Value]),
23278:                                                    {error, {unexpected, Value}}
23279:                                            end;
23280:                                        _ ->
23281:                                            ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected "
23282:                                                        "default "
23283:                                                        "tos: ~p",
23284:                                                        [Value]),
23285:                                            {error, {unexpected, Value}}
23286:                                    end;
23287:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23288:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) tos:"
23289:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23290:                                    ERROR
23291:                            end
23292:                    end},
23293: 
23294:          %% #{desc => "set tos " ++ TOS1Str,
23295:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
23296:          %%                   socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
23297:          %%                   case Set(Sock, TOS1) of
23298:          %%                       ok ->
23299:          %%                           socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
23300:          %%                           ?SEV_IPRINT("tos set to ~p", [TOS1]),
23301:          %%                           ok;
23302:          %%                       {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23303:          %%                           socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, false),
23304:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting tos:"
23305:          %%                                       "   ~p", [Reason]),
23306:          %%                           ERROR
23307:          %%                   end
23308:          %%           end},
23309:          %% #{desc => "get tos (expect " ++ TOS1Str ++ ")",
23310:          %%   cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
23311:          %%                   case Get(Sock) of
23312:          %%                       {ok, TOS1 = Value} ->
23313:          %%                           ?SEV_IPRINT("expected tos (~p)", [Value]),
23314:          %%                           ok;
23315:          %%                       {ok, Unexpected} ->
23316:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected tos: ~p",
23317:          %%                                       [Unexpected]),
23318:          %%                           {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
23319:          %%                       {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23320:          %%                           ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) tos:"
23321:          %%                                       "   ~p", [Reason]),
23322:          %%                           ERROR
23323:          %%                   end
23324:          %%           end},
23325: 
23326:          #{desc => "set tos " ++ TOS2Str,
23327:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
23328:                            case Set(Sock, TOS2) of
23329:                                ok ->
23330:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("tos set to ~p", [TOS2]),
23331:                                    ok;
23332:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23333:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting tos:"
23334:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23335:                                    ERROR
23336:                            end
23337:                    end},
23338:          #{desc => "get tos (expect " ++ TOS2Str ++ ")",
23339:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
23340:                            case Get(Sock) of
23341:                                {ok, TOS2 = Value} ->
23342:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected tos (~p)", [Value]),
23343:                                    ok;
23344:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
23345:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected tos: ~p",
23346:                                                [Unexpected]),
23347:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
23348:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23349:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) tos:"
23350:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23351:                                    ERROR
23352:                            end
23353:                    end},
23354: 
23355:          #{desc => "set tos " ++ TOS3Str,
23356:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
23357:                            case Set(Sock, TOS3) of
23358:                                ok ->
23359:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("tos set to ~p", [TOS3]),
23360:                                    ok;
23361:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23362:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting tos:"
23363:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23364:                                    ERROR
23365:                            end
23366:                    end},
23367:          #{desc => "get tos (expect " ++ TOS3Str ++ ")",
23368:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
23369:                            case Get(Sock) of
23370:                                {ok, TOS3 = Value} ->
23371:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected tos (~p)", [Value]),
23372:                                    ok;
23373:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
23374:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected tos: ~p",
23375:                                                [Unexpected]),
23376:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
23377:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23378:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) tos:"
23379:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23380:                                    ERROR
23381:                            end
23382:                    end},
23383: 
23384:          #{desc => "set tos " ++ TOS4Str,
23385:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
23386:                            case Set(Sock, TOS4) of
23387:                                ok ->
23388:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("tos set to ~p", [TOS4]),
23389:                                    ok;
23390:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23391:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting tos:"
23392:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23393:                                    ERROR
23394:                            end
23395:                    end},
23396:          #{desc => "get tos (expect " ++ TOS4Str ++ ")",
23397:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
23398:                            case Get(Sock) of
23399:                                {ok, TOS4 = Value} ->
23400:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected tos (~p)", [Value]),
23401:                                    ok;
23402:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
23403:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected tos: ~p",
23404:                                                [Unexpected]),
23405:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
23406:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23407:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) tos:"
23408:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23409:                                    ERROR
23410:                            end
23411:                    end},
23412: 
23413:          #{desc => "set tos " ++ TOS5Str,
23414:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
23415:                            case Set(Sock, TOS5) of
23416:                                ok ->
23417:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("tos set to ~p", [TOS5]),
23418:                                    ok;
23419:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23420:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting tos:"
23421:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23422:                                    ERROR
23423:                            end
23424:                    end},
23425:          #{desc => "get tos (expect " ++ TOS5Str ++ ")",
23426:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
23427:                            case Get(Sock) of
23428:                                {ok, TOS5 = Value} ->
23429:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected tos (~p)", [Value]),
23430:                                    ok;
23431:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
23432:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected tos: ~p",
23433:                                                [Unexpected]),
23434:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
23435:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23436:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) tos:"
23437:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
23438:                                    ERROR
23439:                            end
23440:                    end},
23441: 
23442:          #{desc => "close socket",
23443:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
23444:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
23445:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
23446:                    end},
23447: 
23448:          %% *** We are done ***
23449:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
23450:         ],
23451:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
23452:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
23453: 
23454: 
23455: 
23456: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23457: 
23458: %% Tests the ip socket option 'recverr' can be set and that the error
23459: %% queue can be read.
23460: %% 
23461: 
23462: api_opt_ip_recverr_udp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
23463:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
23464:     tc_try(api_opt_ip_recverr_udp4,
23465:            fun() ->
23466:                    has_support_ipv4(),
23467:                    has_support_ip_recverr()
23468:            end,
23469:            fun() ->
23470:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Key, Value) ->
23471:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ip, Key, Value)
23472:                           end,
23473:                    Get  = fun(Sock, Key) ->
23474:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ip, Key)
23475:                           end,
23476:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, Tmo) ->
23477:                                   socket:sendto(Sock, Data, Dest, [], Tmo)
23478:                           end,
23479:                    Recv = fun(Sock, Tmo) ->
23480:                                   socket:recvfrom(Sock, 0, [], Tmo)
23481:                           end,
23482:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
23483:                                  proto  => udp,
23484:                                  send   => Send,
23485:                                  recv   => Recv,
23486:                                  set    => Set,
23487:                                  get    => Get},
23488:                    ok = api_opt_recverr_udp(Config, InitState)
23489:            end).
23490: 
23491: 
23492: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23493: 
23494: %% Tests the ipv6 socket option 'recverr' can be set and that the error
23495: %% queue can be read.
23496: %% 
23497: 
23498: api_opt_ipv6_recverr_udp6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
23499:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
23500:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_recverr_udp6,
23501:            fun() ->
23502:                    has_support_ipv6(),
23503:                    has_support_ipv6_recverr()
23504:            end,
23505:            fun() ->
23506:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Key, Value) ->
23507:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, Key, Value)
23508:                           end,
23509:                    Get  = fun(Sock, Key) ->
23510:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, Key)
23511:                           end,
23512:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, Tmo) ->
23513:                                   socket:sendto(Sock, Data, Dest, [], Tmo)
23514:                           end,
23515:                    Recv = fun(Sock, Tmo) ->
23516:                                   socket:recvfrom(Sock, 0, [], Tmo)
23517:                           end,
23518:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
23519:                                  proto  => udp,
23520:                                  send   => Send,
23521:                                  recv   => Recv,
23522:                                  set    => Set,
23523:                                  get    => Get},
23524:                    ok = api_opt_recverr_udp(Config, InitState)
23525:            end).
23526: 
23527: 
23528: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23529: 
23530: api_opt_recverr_udp(Config, InitState) ->
23531:     Seq = 
23532:         [
23533:          #{desc => "create socket",
23534:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
23535:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("test for ip:recvtos"),
23536:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, udp) of
23537:                                {ok, Sock} ->
23538:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
23539:                                {error, _} = ERROR -> 
23540:                                    ERROR
23541:                            end
23542:                    end},
23543:          #{desc => "bind (to loopback)",
23544:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
23545:                            case socket:bind(Sock, loopback) of
23546:                                ok ->
23547:                                    case socket:sockname(Sock) of
23548:                                        {ok, Addr} ->
23549:                                            ?SEV_IPRINT(
23550:                                               "bound to ~p", [Addr]),
23551:                                            {ok, State#{addr => Addr}};
23552:                                        {error, _} = ERROR_1 ->
23553:                                            ERROR_1
23554:                                    end;
23555:                                {error, _} = ERROR_2 ->
23556:                                    ERROR_2
23557:                            end
23558:                    end},
23559: 
23560:          #{desc => "enable recverr",
23561:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
23562:                            Set(Sock, recverr, true)
23563:                    end},
23564: 
23565:          #{desc => "disable mtu_discover",
23566:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
23567:                            Set(Sock, mtu_discover, dont)
23568:                    end},
23569: 
23570:          #{desc => "try (async) read (=> select)",
23571:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
23572:                          recv := Recv} = State) ->
23573:                            RecvRef = nowait(Config),
23574:                            case Recv(Sock, RecvRef) of
23575:                                {select, SelectInfo} when RecvRef =:= nowait ->
23576:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected select nowait: "
23577: 					       "~n   ~p", [SelectInfo]),
23578:                                    {ok, State#{async_tag => select,
23579:                                                rselect   => SelectInfo}};
23580:                                {select,
23581:                                 {select_info, _Tag, RecvRef} = SelectInfo}
23582:                                  when is_reference(RecvRef) ->
23583:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected select ref: "
23584: 					       "~n   ~p", [SelectInfo]),
23585:                                    {ok, State#{async_tag => select,
23586:                                                rselect   => SelectInfo}};
23587: 
23588:                                {completion, CI} when RecvRef =:= nowait ->
23589:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected completion nowait: "
23590: 					       "~n   ~p", [CI]),
23591:                                    {ok, State#{asynch_tag  => completion,
23592:                                                rcompletion => CI}};
23593:                                {completion,
23594:                                 {completion_info, _Tag, RecvRef} = CI}
23595:                                  when is_reference(RecvRef) ->
23596:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected completion ref: "
23597: 					       "~n   ~p", [CI]),
23598:                                    {ok, State#{asynch_tag  => completion,
23599:                                                rcompletion => CI}};
23600: 
23601:                                {ok, _} ->
23602:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
23603:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
23604: 
23605:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23606:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected error: ~p", [Reason]),
23607:                                    ERROR
23608:                            end
23609:                    end},
23610: 
23611:          #{desc => "try send to nowhere",
23612:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
23613:                          sock   := Sock,
23614:                          send   := Send} = State) ->
23615:                            SendRef = nowait(Config),
23616:                            Dest = #{family => Domain,
23617:                                     addr   => if
23618:                                                   (Domain =:= inet) ->
23619:                                                       {127,0,0,1};
23620:                                                   (Domain =:= inet6) ->
23621:                                                       {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}
23622:                                               end,
23623:                                     port   => 44444},
23624:                            case Send(Sock, <<"ping">>, Dest, SendRef) of
23625:                                ok ->
23626:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent"),
23627:                                    {ok, State#{sent => true}};
23628: 
23629:                                {select, SelectInfo}
23630:                                  when SendRef =:= nowait ->
23631:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected select nowait: ~p",
23632: 					       [SelectInfo]),
23633:                                    {ok, State#{sent       => false,
23634:                                                asynch_tag => select,
23635:                                                sselect    => SelectInfo}};
23636:                                {select,
23637:                                 {select_info, _Tag, SendRef} = SelectInfo}
23638:                                  when is_reference(SendRef) ->
23639:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected select ref: ~p",
23640: 					       [SelectInfo]),
23641:                                    {ok, State#{sent       => false,
23642:                                                asynch_tag => select,
23643:                                                sselect    => SelectInfo}};
23644: 
23645:                                {completion, CI}
23646:                                  when SendRef =:= nowait ->
23647:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected completion nowait: ~p",
23648: 					       [CI]),
23649:                                    {ok, State#{sent       => false,
23650:                                                asynch_tag  => completion,
23651:                                                scompletion => CI}};
23652:                                {completion,
23653:                                 {completion_info, _Tag, SendRef} = CI}
23654:                                  when is_reference(SendRef) ->
23655:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected completion ref: ~p",
23656: 					       [CI]),
23657:                                    {ok, State#{sent       => false,
23658:                                                asynch_tag  => completion,
23659:                                                scompletion => CI}};
23660: 
23661:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23662:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected error: ~p",
23663: 					       [Reason]),
23664:                                    ERROR
23665:                            end
23666:                    end},
23667: 
23668:          #{desc => "await receive select|completion message",
23669:            cmd  => fun(#{sent       := false,
23670:                          asynch_tag := select,
23671:                          sock       := Sock,
23672:                          rselect    := {select_info, _, Ref}} = _State) ->
23673:                            receive
23674:                                {'$socket', Sock, select, Ref} ->
23675:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected (read) "
23676:                                                "select message: "
23677:                                                "~n   ~p", [Ref]),
23678:                                    ok
23679:                            end;
23680:                       (#{sent        := false,
23681:                          asynch_tag  := completion,
23682:                          sock        := Sock,
23683:                          rcompletion := {completion_info, _, Ref}} = _State) ->
23684:                            receive
23685:                                {'$socket', Sock, completion,
23686:                                 {Ref, {error, econnrefused = Reason}}} ->
23687:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected failure: ~p",
23688:                                                [Reason]),
23689:                                    ok;
23690: 
23691:                                {'$socket', Sock, completion,
23692:                                 {Ref, {ok, _}}} ->
23693:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
23694:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
23695:                                {'$socket', Sock, completion,
23696:                                 {Ref, {error, Reason} = ERROR}} ->
23697:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected failure: ~p",
23698:                                                [Reason]),
23699:                                    ERROR
23700: 
23701:                            end;
23702:                       (#{sent := true} = _State) ->
23703:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("no action needed"),
23704:                            ok
23705:                    end},
23706: 
23707:          #{desc => "try recv - expect econnrefused",
23708:            cmd  => fun(#{asynch_tag := completion} = _State) ->
23709:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("already processed"),
23710:                            ok;
23711:                       (#{sock := Sock,
23712:                          recv := Recv} = _State) ->
23713:                            case Recv(Sock, infinity) of
23714:                                {error, econnrefused = Reason} ->
23715:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected failure: ~p",
23716:                                                [Reason]),
23717:                                    ok;
23718:                                {ok, _} ->
23719:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
23720:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
23721:                                {select, SelectInfo} ->
23722:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected select: ~p",
23723:                                                [SelectInfo]),
23724:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
23725:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23726:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected error: ~p",
23727:                                                [Reason]),
23728:                                    ERROR
23729:                            end
23730:                    end},
23731: 
23732:          #{desc => "send to self",
23733:            cmd  =>
23734:                fun(#{sock := Sock,
23735:                      send := Send,
23736:                      addr := Addr} = _State) ->
23737:                        case Send(Sock, <<"ring">>, Addr, infinity) of
23738:                            ok ->
23739:                                ?SEV_IPRINT("sent to self"),
23740:                                ok;
23741:                            {error, _} = Error ->
23742:                                Error
23743:                        end
23744:                end},
23745: 
23746:          #{desc => "try recv - expect data sent to self",
23747:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
23748:                          addr := Addr,
23749:                          recv := Recv} = _State) ->
23750:                            case Recv(Sock, infinity) of
23751:                                {ok, {Addr, <<"ring">>}} ->
23752:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("receive expected"),
23753:                                    ok;
23754: 
23755:                                {select, SelectInfo} ->
23756:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected select: ~p",
23757:                                                [SelectInfo]),
23758:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
23759: 
23760:                                {completion, CompletionInfo} ->
23761:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected completion: ~p",
23762:                                                [CompletionInfo]),
23763:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
23764: 
23765:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23766:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected error: ~p",
23767:                                                [Reason]),
23768:                                    ERROR
23769:                            end
23770:                    end},
23771: 
23772:          #{desc => "try recv error queue",
23773:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, sock := Sock} = State) ->
23774:                            %% Note that not all platforms that support
23775:                            %% recverr, actually supports "encoding" the data
23776:                            %% part, so we need to adjust for that.
23777: 			   Origin = 
23778: 			       if (Domain =:= inet)  -> icmp;
23779: 				  (Domain =:= inet6) -> icmp6
23780: 			       end,
23781: 			   Level =
23782: 			       if (Domain =:= inet)  -> ip;
23783: 				  (Domain =:= inet6) -> ipv6
23784: 			       end,
23785:                            case socket:recvmsg(Sock, [errqueue], 0) of
23786:                                {ok, #{addr  := #{family := Domain,
23787: 						 addr   := Addr},
23788:                                       flags := [errqueue],
23789:                                       iov   := [<<"ping">>],
23790:                                       ctrl  := [#{level := Level,
23791:                                                   type  := recverr,
23792:                                                   value :=
23793:                                                       #{code     := port_unreach,
23794:                                                         data     := 0,
23795:                                                         error    := econnrefused,
23796:                                                         info     := 0,
23797:                                                         offender := #{family := Domain,
23798: 								      addr   := Addr},
23799:                                                         origin   := Origin,
23800:                                                         type     := dest_unreach}
23801:                                                  }]} = Msg} ->
23802:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected error queue (decoded): "
23803:                                                "~n   ~p", [Msg]),
23804:                                    {ok, State#{asynch_tag => none}};
23805:                                {ok, #{addr  := #{family := Domain,
23806: 						 addr   := _Addr},
23807:                                       flags := [errqueue],
23808:                                       iov   := [<<"ping">>],
23809:                                       value := [#{level := Level,
23810:                                                   type  := recverr}]} = _Msg} ->
23811:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected error queue"),
23812:                                    {ok, State#{asynch_tag => none}};
23813: 
23814:                                {completion, CI} ->
23815:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("completion: "
23816:                                                "~n   ~p", [CI]),
23817:                                    {ok, State#{asynch_tag => completion,
23818:                                                completion => CI}};
23819: 
23820:                                {error, timeout = Reason} = ERROR ->
23821:                                    case os:type() of
23822:                                        {win32, nt} ->
23823:                                            ?SEV_IPRINT("failed reading "
23824:                                                        "error queue: "
23825:                                                        "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
23826:                                            {skip,
23827:                                             "Test case does not "
23828:                                             "work on Windows"};
23829:                                        _ ->
23830:                                            ?SEV_EPRINT("failed reading "
23831:                                                        "error queue: "
23832:                                                        "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
23833:                                            ERROR
23834:                                    end;
23835: 
23836:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
23837:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("failed reading error queue: "
23838:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
23839:                                    ERROR
23840:                            end
23841:                    end},
23842: 
23843:          #{desc => "await receive select message",
23844:            cmd  => fun(#{asynch_tag := completion,
23845:                          sock       := Sock,
23846:                          completion := {completion_info, _, Ref}} = _State) ->
23847:                            receive
23848:                                {'$socket', Sock, completion,
23849:                                 {Ref, {ok, Info}}} ->
23850:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("expected success: "
23851:                                                "~n   ~p", [Info]),
23852:                                    ok;
23853: 
23854:                                {'$socket', Sock, completion,
23855:                                 {Ref, {error, Reason} = ERROR}} ->
23856:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected failure: ~p",
23857:                                                [Reason]),
23858:                                    ERROR
23859: 
23860:                            end;
23861:                       (#{asynch_tag := none} = _State) ->
23862:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("no action needed"),
23863:                            ok
23864:                    end},
23865: 
23866:          #{desc => "close socket",
23867:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
23868:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
23869:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
23870:                    end},
23871: 
23872:          %% *** We are done ***
23873:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
23874:         ],
23875:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
23876:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
23877: 
23878: 
23879: 
23880: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
23881: 
23882: %% This intended to test "all" of the (currently) supported IPv4
23883: %% options that results in control message header(s).
23884: %% So, this is done on the receiving side:
23885: %%
23886: %%      socket:setopt(Sock, ip, Flag, boolean()).
23887: %%
23888: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, a control message header
23889: %% for each of the enabled options will be received with the message.
23890: %%
23891: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
23892: %% although we only test this with dgram.
23893: %%
23894: %% Currently we *try* to use the following opts:
23895: %%
23896: %%      pktinfo         => pktinfo
23897: %%      recvorigdstaddr => origdstaddr
23898: %%      recvtos         => tos
23899: %%      recvttl         => ttl
23900: %%
23901: %%
23902: %% Every time we add a test case for a new option (that results in
23903: %% a control message hedare), we should also add it here.
23904: %%
