23905: %% Even though this is a IPv4 test case, we add the 'socket' timestamp
23906: %% option (just to fill up), but in the test to see if we should run
23907: %% the test (since its a IPv4 test case).
23908: %%
23909: 
23910: api_opt_ip_mopts_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
23911:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
23912:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
23913:            fun() ->
23914:                    has_support_ipv4(),
23915:                    Opts =
23916:                        [{ip, pktinfo},
23917:                         {ip, recvorigdstaddr}] ++
23918:                        case os:type() of
23919:                            {win32, nt} ->
23920:                                [];
23921:                            _ ->
23922:                                [{ip, recvtos},
23923:                                 {ip, recvttl}]
23924:                        end,
23925: 		   case is_any_options_supported(Opts) of
23926: 		       true ->
23927: 			   ok;
23928: 		       false ->
23929: 			   skip("None of the needed options are supported")
23930: 		   end
23931:            end,
23932:            fun() ->
23933: 		   %% If we get this far, we *know* that at least one of the
23934: 		   %% options are available.
23935: 
23936: 		   %% This is list of all the options and there resulting
23937: 		   %% control message header type(s):
23938: 		   %%   [{level,
23939: 		   %%     'ipv6 socket option',
23940:                    %%     'control message header type',
23941: 		   %%     default | value()}]
23942: 		   Opts =
23943: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, socket, timestamp) of
23944: 			   true ->
23945: 			       [{socket, timestamp, timestamp, default}];
23946: 			   false ->
23947: 			       []
23948: 		       end ++
23949: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, ip, pktinfo) of
23950: 			   true ->
23951: 			       [{ip, pktinfo, pktinfo, default}];
23952: 			   false ->
23953: 			       []
23954: 		       end ++
23955: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, ip, recvorigdstaddr) of
23956: 			   true ->
23957: 			       [{ip, recvorigdstaddr, origdstaddr, default}];
23958: 			   false ->
23959: 			       []
23960: 		       end ++
23961:                        case os:type() of
23962:                            {win32, nt} ->
23963:                                [];
23964:                            _ ->
23965:                                case socket:is_supported(options, ip, recvtos) of
23966:                                    true ->
23967:                                        %% It seems that sending any of the
23968:                                        %% TOS or TTL values will fail on: 
23969:                                        %%    FreeBSD
23970:                                        %%    Linux when
23971:                                        %%      version =< 3.12.60 (at least)
23972:                                        %%      Don't know when this starts
23973:                                        %%      working, but it works on: 
23974:                                        %%         Ubunto 16.04.6 => 4.15.0-65
23975:                                        %%         SLES 12 SP2 => 4.4.120-92.70
23976:                                        %% so don't!
23977:                                        %%
23978:                                        %% The latest we know it not to work
23979:                                        %% was a SLES 12 (plain) at 3.12.50-52.54
23980:                                        %%
23981:                                        [{ip, recvtos, tos, 
23982:                                          case os:type() of
23983:                                              {unix, freebsd} ->
23984:                                                  default;
23985:                                              {unix, linux} ->
23986:                                                  case os:version() of
23987:                                                      Vsn when Vsn > {3,12,60} ->
23988:                                                          42;
23989:                                                      _ ->
23990:                                                          default
23991:                                                  end;
23992:                                              _ -> 
23993:                                                  42
23994:                                          end}];
23995:                                    false ->
23996:                                        []
23997:                                end
23998: 		       end ++
23999:                        case os:type() of
24000:                            {unix, darwin} ->
24001:                                [];
24002:                            {win32, nt} ->
24003:                                [];
24004:                            _ ->
24005:                                case socket:is_supported(options, ip, recvttl) of
24006:                                    true ->
24007: 				       %% It seems that sending any of the
24008: 				       %% TOS or TTL values will fail on: 
24009: 				       %%    FreeBSD and NetBSD
24010: 				       %%    Linux when
24011: 				       %%      version =< 3.12.60 (at least)
24012: 				       %% so don't!
24013:                                        %% See recvtos above for more info.
24014:                                        [{ip, recvttl, ttl,
24015:                                          case os:type() of
24016:                                              {unix, BSD} 
24017:                                                when (BSD =:= freebsd) orelse
24018:                                                     (BSD =:= netbsd) ->
24019:                                                  default;
24020:                                              {unix, netbsd} ->
24021:                                                  default;
24022: 					     {unix, linux} ->
24023: 						 case os:version() of
24024: 						     Vsn when Vsn > {3,12,60} ->
24025: 							 42;
24026: 						     _ ->
24027: 							 default
24028: 						 end;
24029:                                              _ -> 
24030:                                                  42
24031:                                          end}];
24032:                                    false ->
24033:                                        []
24034:                                end
24035: 		       end,
24036: 
24037:                    Enable = fun(Sock, Level, Opt) ->
24038: 				    ?SEV_IPRINT("try enable [~w] ~p",
24039:                                                 [Level, Opt]),
24040: 				    socket:setopt(Sock, Level, Opt, true)
24041:                             end,
24042:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, []) ->
24043:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
24044:                                           iov  => [Data]},
24045:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
24046: 			     (Sock, Data, Dest, Hdrs) when is_list(Hdrs) ->
24047: 				  CMsgs = [#{level => Level,
24048:                                              type  => Type,
24049:                                              value => Val} ||
24050:                                               {Level, Type, Val} <- Hdrs],
24051:                                   Msg   = #{addr => Dest,
24052:                                             ctrl => CMsgs,
24053:                                             iov  => [Data]},
24054:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
24055:                           end,
24056:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
24057:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
24058:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
24059:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
24060:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
24061:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
24062:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
24063:                                           ERROR
24064:                                   end
24065:                           end,
24066:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
24067:                                  proto  => udp,
24068: 				 opts   => Opts,
24069:                                  send   => Send,
24070:                                  recv   => Recv,
24071:                                  enable => Enable},
24072:                    ok = api_opt_ip_mopts_udp(InitState)
24073:            end).
24074: 
24075: 
24076: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24077: 
24078: api_opt_ip_mopts_udp(InitState) ->
24079:     Seq = 
24080:         [
24081:          #{desc => "local address",
24082:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24083:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24084:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
24085:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
24086:                    end},
24087: 
24088:          #{desc => "open src socket",
24089:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24090:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24091:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
24092:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
24093:                    end},
24094:          #{desc => "bind src",
24095:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
24096:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24097:                                ok ->
24098:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
24099:                                    ok;
24100:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24101:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
24102:                                    ERROR
24103:                            end
24104:                    end},
24105:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
24106:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
24107:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
24108:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
24109:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
24110:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
24111:                    end},
24112: 
24113:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
24114:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24115:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24116:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
24117:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
24118:                    end},
24119:          #{desc => "bind dst",
24120:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
24121:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24122:                                ok ->
24123:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
24124:                                    ok;
24125:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24126:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
24127:                                    ERROR
24128:                            end
24129:                    end},
24130:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
24131:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
24132:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
24133:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
24134:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
24135:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
24136:                    end},
24137: 
24138:          #{desc => "enable options on dst socket",
24139:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := DSock,
24140: 			 sock_src := SSock,
24141: 			 opts     := Opts,
24142: 			 enable   := Enable} = _State) ->
24143: 			   %% If we fail to enable *any* of the options,
24144: 			   %% we give up.
24145: 			   E = fun({Level, Opt, _, _}) -> 
24146:                                        case Enable(DSock, Level, Opt) of
24147:                                            ok ->
24148:                                                ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [~w] ~w enabled",
24149:                                                            [Level, Opt]),
24150:                                                ok;
24151:                                            {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
24152:                                                ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected "
24153:                                                            "Failure: "
24154:                                                            "~p => SKIP",
24155:                                                            [Reason]),
24156:                                                (catch socket:close(DSock)),
24157:                                                (catch socket:close(SSock)),
24158:                                                {skip, Reason};
24159:                                            {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24160:                                                ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed "
24161:                                                            "setting ~w:"
24162:                                                            "   ~p",
24163:                                                            [Opt, Reason]),
24164:                                                throw(ERROR)
24165:                                        end
24166: 			       end,
24167: 			   lists:foreach(E, Opts),
24168: 			   ok
24169:                    end},
24170: 
24171:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
24172:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock,
24173: 			 sa_dst   := Dst,
24174: 			 opts     := Opts,
24175: 			 send     := Send}) ->
24176: 			   Hdrs = [{Level, Type, Data} ||
24177: 				      {Level, _, Type, Data} <- 
24178: 					  Opts, (Data =/= default)],
24179:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, Hdrs)
24180:                    end},
24181:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
24182:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock,
24183: 			 sa_src   := Src,
24184: 			 recv     := Recv,
24185: 			 opts     := Opts}) ->
24186:                            case Recv(Sock) of
24187:                                {ok, {Src, CMsgs, ?BASIC_REQ}}
24188:                                  when length(CMsgs) =:= length(Opts)  ->
24189:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (expected) cmsg headers: "
24190: 					       "~n   ~p", [CMsgs]),
24191: 				   %% We should really verify the headers:
24192: 				   %% values, types and so on...
24193:                                    ok;
24194:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
24195:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24196:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24197:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
24198:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24199:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
24200:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24201:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
24202:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
24203:                                                 [{Level, Type} ||
24204:                                                     {Level, _, Type, _} <- Opts],
24205: 						BadCHdrs,
24206: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
24207:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24208:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
24209:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24210:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24211:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24212:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24213:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
24214:                                                [Src,
24215:                                                 [{Level, Type} ||
24216:                                                     {Level, _, Type, _} <- Opts],
24217: 						?BASIC_REQ,
24218:                                                 UnexpData]),
24219:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24220:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24221:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
24222:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
24223:                                    ERROR
24224:                            end
24225:                    end},
24226: 
24227:          #{desc => "close src socket",
24228:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
24229:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24230:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
24231:                    end},
24232:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
24233:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
24234:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24235:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
24236:                    end},
24237: 
24238:          %% *** We are done ***
24239:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24240:         ],
24241:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
24242:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
24243: 
24244: 
24245: 
24246: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24247: 
24248: %% Tests that the IPv6 pktinfo control message header is received on
24249: %% incoming datagrams (UDP and RAW) when setting the socket 'ipv6'
24250: %% option recvpktinfo is set to true when using.
24251: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
24252: %%
24253: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, recvpktinfo, boolean()).
24254: %%
24255: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the pktinfo control message
24256: %% header will be with the message.
24257: %%
24258: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
24259: %% although we only test this with dgram.
24260: %%
24261: 
24262: api_opt_ipv6_recvpktinfo_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24263:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24264:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_recvpktinfo_udp6,
24265:            fun() ->
24266:                    has_support_ipv6(),
24267:                    has_support_ipv6_recvpktinfo()
24268:            end,
24269:            fun() ->
24270:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
24271:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, recvpktinfo, Value)
24272:                           end,
24273:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24274:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, recvpktinfo)
24275:                           end,
24276:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
24277:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
24278:                                              iov  => [Data]},
24279:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
24280:                              (Sock, Data, Dest, Info) ->
24281:                                   %% We do not support this at the moment!!!
24282:                                   CMsg = #{level => ipv6,
24283:                                               type  => pktinfo,
24284:                                               data  => Info},
24285:                                   Msg  = #{addr => Dest,
24286:                                               ctrl => [CMsg],
24287:                                               iov  => [Data]},
24288:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
24289:                           end,
24290:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
24291:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
24292:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
24293:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
24294:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
24295:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
24296:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
24297:                                           ERROR
24298:                                   end
24299:                           end,
24300:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
24301:                                  proto  => udp,
24302:                                  send   => Send,
24303:                                  recv   => Recv,
24304:                                  set    => Set,
24305:                                  get    => Get},
24306:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_recvpktinfo_udp(InitState)
24307:            end).
24308: 
24309: 
24310: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24311: 
24312: api_opt_ipv6_recvpktinfo_udp(InitState) ->
24313:     Seq = 
24314:         [
24315:          #{desc => "local address",
24316:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24317:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24318:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
24319:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
24320:                    end},
24321: 
24322:          #{desc => "open src socket",
24323:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24324:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24325:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
24326:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
24327:                    end},
24328:          #{desc => "bind src",
24329:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
24330:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24331:                                ok ->
24332:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
24333:                                    ok;
24334:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24335:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
24336:                                    ERROR
24337:                            end
24338:                    end},
24339:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
24340:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
24341:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
24342:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
24343:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
24344:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
24345:                    end},
24346: 
24347:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
24348:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24349:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24350:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
24351:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
24352:                    end},
24353:          #{desc => "bind dst",
24354:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
24355:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24356:                                ok ->
24357:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
24358:                                    ok;
24359:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24360:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
24361:                                    ERROR
24362:                            end
24363:                    end},
24364:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
24365:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
24366:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
24367:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
24368:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
24369:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
24370:                    end},
24371:          #{desc => "default pktinfo for dst socket",
24372:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
24373:                            case Get(Sock) of
24374:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
24375:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst recvttl: ~p", [Value]),
24376:                                    ok;
24377:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
24378:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src recvtos: ~p",
24379:                                                [Unexpected]),
24380:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
24381:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24382:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) recvtos:"
24383:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
24384:                                    ERROR
24385:                            end
24386:                    end},
24387: 
24388:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo (explicit) pktinfo)",
24389:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
24390:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
24391:                    end},
24392:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
24393:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
24394:                            case Recv(Sock) of
24395:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
24396:                                    ok;
24397:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
24398:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24399:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24400:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
24401:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24402:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
24403:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24404:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
24405:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
24406:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
24407:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
24408:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24409:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
24410:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24411:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24412:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24413:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24414:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
24415:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
24416:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24417:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24418:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
24419:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
24420:                                    ERROR
24421:                            end
24422:                    end},
24423: 
24424:          #{desc => "enable pktinfo on dst socket",
24425:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
24426:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
24427:                                ok ->
24428:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst pktinfo enabled"),
24429:                                    ok;
24430:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24431:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting pktinfo:"
24432:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
24433:                                    ERROR
24434:                            end
24435:                    end},
24436: 
24437:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit pktinfo)",
24438:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
24439:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
24440:                    end},
24441:          #{desc => "recv req (from src) - w default pktinfo",
24442:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
24443:                            case Recv(Sock) of
24444:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
24445:                                              type  := pktinfo,
24446:                                              value := #{addr    := Addr,
24447:                                                         ifindex := IfIdx}}],
24448:                                      ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
24449:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (default) Pkt Info: "
24450:                                                "~n   Addr:      ~p"
24451:                                                "~n   If Index:  ~p",
24452:                                                [Addr, IfIdx]),
24453:                                    ok;
24454:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
24455:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24456:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24457:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
24458:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24459:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
24460:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24461:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
24462:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
24463:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
24464:                                                   type  => pktinfo,
24465:                                                   value => "something"} , BadCHdrs,
24466:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
24467:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24468:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
24469:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24470:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24471:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24472:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24473:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
24474:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
24475:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24476:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24477:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
24478:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
24479:                                    ERROR
24480:                            end
24481:                    end},
24482: 
24483: 
24484:          #{desc => "close src socket",
24485:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
24486:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24487:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
24488:                    end},
24489:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
24490:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
24491:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24492:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
24493:                    end},
24494: 
24495:          %% *** We are done ***
24496:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24497:         ],
24498:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
24499:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
24500: 
24501: 
24502: 
24503: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24504: 
24505: %% Tests that the 'flow info' control message header is received when
24506: %% setting the socket 'ipv6' option flowinfo  is set to true when using
24507: %% sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
24508: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
24509: %%
24510: %%               socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, flowinfo, boolean()).
24511: %%
24512: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the 'flow info' control message
24513: %% header will be with the message.
24514: %%
24515: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
24516: %% although we only test this with dgram.
24517: %%
24518: %% There seem to be some weirdness with the definition of this
24519: %% option, so its defined in an include file we don't include
24520: %% (directly or indirectly). And since some of the defines
24521: %% occur in a file we *do* include (via netinet/in.h), we
24522: %% leave it as is for now...
24523: %%
24524: 
24525: api_opt_ipv6_flowinfo_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24526:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24527:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_flowinfo_udp6,
24528:            fun() ->
24529:                    has_support_ipv6(),
24530:                    has_support_ipv6_flowinfo()
24531:            end,
24532:            fun() ->
24533:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
24534:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, flowinfo, Value)
24535:                           end,
24536:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24537:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, flowinfo)
24538:                           end,
24539:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest) ->
24540:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
24541:                                              iov  => [Data]},
24542:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
24543:                           end,
24544:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
24545:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
24546:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
24547:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
24548:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
24549:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
24550:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
24551:                                           ERROR
24552:                                   end
24553:                           end,
24554:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
24555:                                  proto  => udp,
24556:                                  send   => Send,
24557:                                  recv   => Recv,
24558:                                  set    => Set,
24559:                                  get    => Get},
24560:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_flowinfo_udp(InitState)
24561:            end).
24562: 
24563: 
24564: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24565: 
24566: api_opt_ipv6_flowinfo_udp(InitState) ->
24567:     Seq = 
24568:         [
24569:          #{desc => "local address",
24570:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24571:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24572:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
24573:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
24574:                    end},
24575: 
24576:          #{desc => "open src socket",
24577:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24578:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24579:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
24580:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
24581:                    end},
24582:          #{desc => "bind src",
24583:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
24584:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24585:                                ok ->
24586:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
24587:                                    ok;
24588:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24589:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
24590:                                    ERROR
24591:                            end
24592:                    end},
24593:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
24594:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
24595:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
24596:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
24597:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
24598:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
24599:                    end},
24600: 
24601:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
24602:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24603:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24604:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
24605:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
24606:                    end},
24607:          #{desc => "bind dst",
24608:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
24609:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24610:                                ok ->
24611:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
24612:                                    ok;
24613:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24614:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
24615:                                    ERROR
24616:                            end
24617:                    end},
24618:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
24619:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
24620:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
24621:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
24622:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
24623:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
24624:                    end},
24625:          #{desc => "default flowinfo for dst socket",
24626:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
24627:                            case Get(Sock) of
24628:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
24629:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst flowinfo: ~p", [Value]),
24630:                                    ok;
24631:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
24632:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src flowinfo: ~p",
24633:                                                [Unexpected]),
24634:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
24635:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24636:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) flowinfo:"
24637:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
24638:                                    ERROR
24639:                            end
24640:                    end},
24641: 
24642:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
24643:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
24644:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
24645:                    end},
24646:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
24647:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
24648:                            case Recv(Sock) of
24649:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
24650:                                    ok;
24651:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
24652:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24653:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24654:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
24655:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24656:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
24657:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24658:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
24659:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
24660:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
24661:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
24662:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24663:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
24664:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24665:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24666:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24667:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24668:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
24669:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
24670:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24671:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24672:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
24673:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
24674:                                    ERROR
24675:                            end
24676:                    end},
24677: 
24678:          #{desc => "enable flowinfo on dst socket",
24679:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
24680:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
24681:                                ok ->
24682:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst flowinfo enabled"),
24683:                                    ok;
24684:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24685:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting flowinfo:"
24686:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
24687:                                    ERROR
24688:                            end
24689:                    end},
24690: 
24691:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
24692:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
24693:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
24694:                    end},
24695:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
24696:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
24697:                            case Recv(Sock) of
24698:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
24699:                                              type  := flowinfo,
24700:                                              value := FlowID}], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
24701:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got flow info: "
24702: 					       "~n   Flow ID: ~p", [FlowID]),
24703:                                    ok;
24704:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
24705:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24706:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24707:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
24708:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24709:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
24710:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24711:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
24712:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
24713:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
24714: 						  type  => flowinfo,
24715: 						  value => "something"},
24716: 						BadCHdrs,
24717: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
24718:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24719:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
24720:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24721:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24722:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24723:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24724:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
24725:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
24726:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24727:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24728:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
24729:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
24730:                                    ERROR
24731:                            end
24732:                    end},
24733: 
24734:          #{desc => "close src socket",
24735:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
24736:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24737:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
24738:                    end},
24739:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
24740:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
24741:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
24742:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
24743:                    end},
24744: 
24745:          %% *** We are done ***
24746:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
24747:         ],
24748:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
24749:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
24750: 
24751: 
24752: 
24753: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24754: 
24755: %% Tests that the 'hop limit' control message header is received when
24756: %% setting the socket 'ipv6' hoplimit or recvhoplimit option is set to 
24757: %% true when using sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
24758: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
24759: %%
24760: %%      socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, recvhoplimit | hoplimit, boolean()).
24761: %%
24762: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the 'hop limit' control message
24763: %% header will be with the message.
24764: %% We make the assumption, that if 'recvhoplimit' is supported, then
24765: %% that option is used to order the hoplimit control message, otherwise
24766: %% hoplimit is used.
24767: %%
24768: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
24769: %% although we only test this with dgram.
24770: %%
24771: %% <Note>
24772: %%
24773: %% There is also an IPV6_RECVHOPLIMIT option defined in the header
24774: %% file (bits/in.h) with a different value. This is not mentioned
24775: %% in the man page. Deprecated? More testing needed...
24776: %%
24777: %% </Note>
24778: %%
24779: 
24780: api_opt_ipv6_hoplimit_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
24781:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
24782:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_hoplimit_udp6,
24783:            fun() ->
24784:                    has_support_ipv6(),
24785:                    has_support_ipv6_hoplimit_or_recvhoplimit(),
24786: 		   is_good_enough_darwin({9,8,0}),
24787:                    is_good_enough_montavista("4.0.1")
24788:            end,
24789:            fun() ->
24790: 		   %% Begin by choosing which of the options we shall use
24791: 		   Opt = case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvhoplimit) of
24792: 			     true  -> recvhoplimit;
24793: 			     false -> hoplimit
24794: 			 end,
24795:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
24796: 				  ?SEV_IPRINT("try set ~p: ~p", [Opt, Value]),
24797:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, Opt, Value)
24798:                           end,
24799:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
24800: 				  ?SEV_IPRINT("try get ~p", [Opt]),
24801:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, Opt)
24802:                           end,
24803:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest) ->
24804:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
24805:                                              iov  => [Data]},
24806:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
24807:                           end,
24808:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
24809:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
24810:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
24811:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
24812:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
24813:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
24814:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
24815:                                           ERROR
24816:                                   end
24817:                           end,
24818:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
24819:                                  proto  => udp,
24820:                                  send   => Send,
24821:                                  recv   => Recv,
24822:                                  set    => Set,
24823:                                  get    => Get},
24824:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_hoplimit_udp(InitState)
24825:            end).
24826: 
24827: 
24828: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
24829: 
24830: api_opt_ipv6_hoplimit_udp(InitState) ->
24831:     Seq = 
24832:         [
24833:          #{desc => "local address",
24834:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
24835:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
24836:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
24837:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
24838:                    end},
24839: 
24840:          #{desc => "open src socket",
24841:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24842:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24843:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
24844:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
24845:                    end},
24846:          #{desc => "bind src",
24847:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
24848:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24849:                                ok ->
24850:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
24851:                                    ok;
24852:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24853:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
24854:                                    ERROR
24855:                            end
24856:                    end},
24857:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
24858:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
24859:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
24860:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
24861:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
24862:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
24863:                    end},
24864: 
24865:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
24866:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
24867:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
24868:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
24869:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
24870:                    end},
24871:          #{desc => "bind dst",
24872:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
24873:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
24874:                                ok ->
24875:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
24876:                                    ok;
24877:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24878:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
24879:                                    ERROR
24880:                            end
24881:                    end},
24882:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
24883:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
24884:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
24885:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
24886:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
24887:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
24888:                    end},
24889:          #{desc => "default [recv]hoplimit for dst socket",
24890:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
24891:                            case Get(Sock) of
24892:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
24893:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [recv]hoplimit: ~p",
24894: 					       [Value]),
24895:                                    ok;
24896:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
24897:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src [recv]hoplimit: ~p",
24898:                                                [Unexpected]),
24899:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
24900:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
24901:                                    %% On some platforms this is not accepted
24902:                                    %% for UDP, so skip this part (UDP).
24903:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
24904:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
24905:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
24906:                                    (catch socket:close(maps:get_value(sock_src,
24907: 								      State))),
24908:                                    {skip, Reason};
24909:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24910:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) hoplimit:"
24911:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
24912:                                    ERROR
24913:                            end
24914:                    end},
24915: 
24916:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
24917:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
24918:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
24919:                    end},
24920:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
24921:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
24922:                            case Recv(Sock) of
24923:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
24924:                                    ok;
24925:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
24926:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24927:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24928:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
24929:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24930:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
24931:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24932:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
24933:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
24934:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
24935:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
24936:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24937:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
24938:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24939:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24940:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24941:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24942:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
24943:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
24944:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
24945:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
24946:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
24947:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
24948:                                    ERROR
24949:                            end
24950:                    end},
24951: 
24952:          #{desc => "enable [recv]hoplimit on dst socket",
24953:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = State) ->
24954:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
24955:                                ok ->
24956:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [recv]hoplimit enabled"),
24957:                                    ok;
24958:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
24959:                                    %% On some platforms this is not accepted
24960:                                    %% for UDP, so skip this part (UDP).
24961:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
24962:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
24963:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
24964:                                    (catch socket:close(maps:get_value(sock_src,
24965: 								      State))),
24966:                                    {skip, Reason};
24967:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
24968:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting hoplimit:"
24969:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
24970:                                    ERROR
24971:                            end
24972:                    end},
24973: 
24974:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit ttl)",
24975:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
24976:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst)
24977:                    end},
24978:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
24979:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
24980:                            case Recv(Sock) of
24981:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
24982:                                              type  := hoplimit,
24983:                                              value := HL}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
24984:                                  when is_integer(HL) ->
24985:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got hop limit: "
24986: 					       "~n   Hop Limit: ~p", [HL]),
24987:                                    ok;
24988:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
24989:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
24990:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
24991:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
24992:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
24993:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
24994:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
24995:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
24996:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
24997:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
24998: 						  type  => hoplimit,
24999: 						  value => "something"},
25000: 						BadCHdrs,
25001: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
25002:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25003:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
25004:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25005:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25006:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25007:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25008:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
25009:                                                [Src, #{level => ipv6,
25010: 						       type  => hoplimit,
25011: 						       value => "something"},
25012: 						?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
25013:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25014:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25015:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
25016:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
25017:                                    ERROR
25018:                            end
25019:                    end},
25020: 
25021:          #{desc => "close src socket",
25022:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
25023:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25024:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
25025:                    end},
25026:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
25027:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
25028:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25029:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
25030:                    end},
25031: 
25032:          %% *** We are done ***
25033:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25034:         ],
25035:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
25036:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
25037: 
25038: 
25039: 
25040: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25041: 
25042: %% Tests that the 'tclass' control message header is received when
25043: %% setting the socket 'ipv6' tclass or recvtclass option is set to 
25044: %% true when using sendmsg/recvmsg on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
25045: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
25046: %%
25047: %%      socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, recvtclass | tclass, boolean()).
25048: %%
25049: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, the 'tclass' control message
25050: %% header will be with the message.
25051: %% We make the assumption, that if 'recvtclass' is supported, then
25052: %% that option is used to order the tclass control message, otherwise
25053: %% tclass is used.
25054: %%
25055: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
25056: %% although we only test this with dgram.
25057: %%
25058: %% <Note>
25059: %%
25060: %% There is also an IPV6_RECVTCLASS option defined in the header
25061: %% file (bits/in.h) with a different value. This is not mentioned
25062: %% in the man page. Deprecated? More testing needed...
25063: %%
25064: %% </Note>
25065: %%
25066: 
25067: api_opt_ipv6_tclass_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
25068:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
25069:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_tclass_udp6,
25070:            fun() ->
25071:                    has_support_ipv6(),
25072:                    has_support_ipv6_tclass_or_recvtclass()
25073:            end,
25074:            fun() ->
25075: 		   %% Begin by choosing which of the options we shall use
25076: 		   Opt = case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvtclass) of
25077: 			     true  -> recvtclass;
25078: 			     false -> tclass
25079: 			 end,
25080:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) ->
25081: 				  ?SEV_IPRINT("try set ~p: ~p", [Opt, Value]),
25082:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, Opt, Value)
25083:                           end,
25084:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
25085: 				  ?SEV_IPRINT("try get ~p", [Opt]),
25086:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, ipv6, Opt)
25087:                           end,
25088:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, default) ->
25089:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
25090:                                              iov  => [Data]},
25091:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
25092: 			     (Sock, Data, Dest, TC) ->
25093:                                   TCHdr    = #{level => ipv6,
25094: 					       type  => tclass,
25095: 					       data  => TC},
25096: 				  CMsgs = [TCHdr],
25097:                                   Msg   = #{addr => Dest,
25098: 					       ctrl => CMsgs,
25099: 					       iov  => [Data]},
25100:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
25101:                           end,
25102:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
25103:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
25104:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
25105:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
25106:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
25107:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
25108:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
25109:                                           ERROR
25110:                                   end
25111:                           end,
25112:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
25113:                                  proto  => udp,
25114:                                  send   => Send,
25115:                                  recv   => Recv,
25116:                                  set    => Set,
25117:                                  get    => Get},
25118:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_tclass_udp(InitState)
25119:            end).
25120: 
25121: 
25122: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25123: 
25124: api_opt_ipv6_tclass_udp(InitState) ->
25125:     Seq = 
25126:         [
25127:          #{desc => "local address",
25128:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
25129:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
25130:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
25131:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
25132:                    end},
25133: 
25134:          #{desc => "open src socket",
25135:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
25136:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
25137:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
25138:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
25139:                    end},
25140:          #{desc => "bind src",
25141:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
25142:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
25143:                                ok ->
25144:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
25145:                                    ok;
25146:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
25147:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
25148:                                    ERROR
25149:                            end
25150:                    end},
25151:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
25152:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
25153:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
25154:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
25155:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
25156:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
25157:                    end},
25158: 
25159:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
25160:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
25161:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
25162:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
25163:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
25164:                    end},
25165:          #{desc => "bind dst",
25166:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
25167:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
25168:                                ok ->
25169:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
25170:                                    ok;
25171:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
25172:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
25173:                                    ERROR
25174:                            end
25175:                    end},
25176:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
25177:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
25178:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
25179:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
25180:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
25181:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
25182:                    end},
25183:          #{desc => "default [recv]tclass for dst socket",
25184:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
25185:                            case Get(Sock) of
25186:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
25187:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [recv]tclass: ~p",
25188: 					       [Value]),
25189:                                    ok;
25190:                                {ok, Unexpected} ->
25191:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected src [recv]tclass: ~p",
25192:                                                [Unexpected]),
25193:                                    {error, {unexpected, Unexpected}};
25194:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
25195:                                    %% On some platforms this is not accepted
25196:                                    %% for UDP, so skip this part (UDP).
25197:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
25198:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
25199:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
25200:                                    (catch socket:close(maps:get_value(sock_src,
25201: 								      State))),
25202:                                    {skip, Reason};
25203:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
25204:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed getting (default) tclass:"
25205:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
25206:                                    ERROR
25207:                            end
25208:                    end},
25209: 
25210:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
25211:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
25212:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
25213:                    end},
25214:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
25215:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
25216:                            case Recv(Sock) of
25217:                                {ok, {Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ}} ->
25218:                                    ok;
25219:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
25220:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25221:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25222:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
25223:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25224:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
25225:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25226:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
25227:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
25228:                                                 [], BadCHdrs,
25229:                                                 ?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
25230:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25231:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
25232:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25233:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25234:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25235:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25236:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
25237:                                                [Src, [], ?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
25238:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25239:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25240:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
25241:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
25242:                                    ERROR
25243:                            end
25244:                    end},
25245: 
25246:          #{desc => "enable [recv]tclass on dst socket",
25247:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, set := Set} = State) ->
25248:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
25249:                                ok ->
25250:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [recv]tclass enabled"),
25251:                                    ok;
25252:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
25253:                                    %% On some platforms this is not accepted
25254:                                    %% for UDP, so skip this part (UDP).
25255:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected Failure: "
25256:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Reason]),
25257:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
25258:                                    (catch socket:close(maps:get_value(sock_src,
25259: 								      State))),
25260:                                    {skip, Reason};
25261:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
25262:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed setting tclass:"
25263:                                                "   ~p", [Reason]),
25264:                                    ERROR
25265:                            end
25266:                    end},
25267: 
25268:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (wo explicit tc)",
25269:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
25270:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, default)
25271:                    end},
25272:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
25273:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
25274:                            case Recv(Sock) of
25275:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
25276:                                              type  := tclass,
25277:                                              value := TClass}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
25278: 			       when is_integer(TClass) ->
25279:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got tclass: "
25280: 					       "~n   TClass: ~p", [TClass]),
25281:                                    ok;
25282:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
25283:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25284:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25285:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
25286:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25287:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
25288:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25289:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
25290:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
25291:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
25292: 						  type  => tclass,
25293: 						  value => "something"},
25294: 						BadCHdrs,
25295: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
25296:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25297:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
25298:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25299:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25300:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25301:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25302:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
25303:                                                [Src, #{level => ipv6,
25304: 						       type  => tclass,
25305: 						       value => "something"},
25306: 						?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
25307:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25308:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25309:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
25310:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
25311:                                    ERROR
25312:                            end
25313:                    end},
25314: 
25315:          #{desc => "send req (to dst) (w explicit tc = 1)",
25316:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, sa_dst := Dst, send := Send}) ->
25317:                            case Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, 1) of
25318:                                {error,
25319:                                 {get_overlapped_result,
25320:                                  #{file     := File,
25321:                                    function := Function,
25322:                                    line     := Line,
25323:                                    raw_info := RawInfo,
25324:                                    info     := invalid_parameter = Info}}} ->
25325:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
25326:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TClass: "
25327:                                                "~p => SKIP: "
25328:                                                "~n   File:     ~s"
25329:                                                "~n   Function: ~s"
25330:                                                "~n   Line:     ~p"
25331:                                                "~n   Raw Info: ~p",
25332:                                                [Info,
25333:                                                 File, Function, Line,
25334:                                                 RawInfo]),
25335:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
25336:                                    {skip,
25337:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TClass: ~p", [Info])};
25338:                                {error, {get_overlapped_result,
25339:                                         invalid_parameter = Info}} ->
25340:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
25341:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TClass: "
25342:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Info]),
25343:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
25344:                                    {skip,
25345:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TClass: ~p", [Info])};
25346:
