25347:                                {error,
25348:                                 {completion_status,
25349:                                  #{file     := File,
25350:                                    function := Function,
25351:                                    line     := Line,
25352:                                    raw_info := RawInfo,
25353:                                    info     := invalid_parameter = Info}}} ->
25354:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
25355:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TClass: "
25356:                                                "~p => SKIP: "
25357:                                                "~n   File:     ~s"
25358:                                                "~n   Function: ~s"
25359:                                                "~n   Line:     ~p"
25360:                                                "~n   Raw Info: ~p",
25361:                                                [Info,
25362:                                                 File, Function, Line,
25363:                                                 RawInfo]),
25364:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
25365:                                    {skip,
25366:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TClass: ~p", [Info])};
25367:                                {error, {completion_status,
25368:                                         invalid_parameter = Info}} ->
25369:                                    %% IF we can't send it the test will not work
25370:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Cannot send TClass: "
25371:                                                "~p => SKIP", [Info]),
25372:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
25373:                                    {skip,
25374:                                     ?F("Cannot send with TClass: ~p", [Info])};
25375: 
25376:                                Other ->
25377:                                    Other
25378:                            end
25379:                    end},
25380:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
25381:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, sa_src := Src, recv := Recv}) ->
25382:                            case Recv(Sock) of
25383:                                {ok, {Src, [#{level := ipv6,
25384:                                              type  := tclass,
25385:                                              value := 1 = TClass}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
25386: 			       when is_integer(TClass) ->
25387:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (expected) tclass: "
25388: 					       "~n   TClass: ~p", [TClass]),
25389:                                    ok;
25390:                                {ok, {_Src, [#{level := ipv6,
25391: 					      type  := tclass,
25392: 					      value := TClass}], ?BASIC_REQ}}
25393: 			       when is_integer(TClass) ->
25394:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected tclass: "
25395:                                                "~n   Expect TClass: ~p"
25396:                                                "~n   Recv TClass:   ~p",
25397:                                                [1, TClass]),
25398:                                    {error, {unexpected_tclass, TClass}};
25399:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
25400:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25401:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25402:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
25403:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25404:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
25405:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25406:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
25407:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
25408:                                                 #{level => ipv6,
25409: 						  type  => tclass,
25410: 						  value => "something"},
25411: 						BadCHdrs,
25412: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
25413:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25414:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
25415:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25416:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25417:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25418:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25419:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
25420:                                                [Src, #{level => ipv6,
25421: 						       type  => tclass,
25422: 						       value => "something"},
25423: 						?BASIC_REQ, UnexpData]),
25424:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25425: 
25426:                                 {error, _} = ERROR ->
25427:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
25428:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
25429:                                    ERROR
25430:                            end
25431:                    end},
25432: 
25433:          #{desc => "close src socket",
25434:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
25435:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25436:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
25437:                    end},
25438:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
25439:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
25440:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25441:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
25442:                    end},
25443: 
25444:          %% *** We are done ***
25445:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25446:         ],
25447:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
25448:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
25449: 
25450: 
25451: 
25452: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25453: 
25454: %% This intended to test "all" of the (currently) supported IPv6
25455: %% options that results in control message header(s).
25456: %% So, this is done on the receiving side: 
25457: %%
25458: %%      socket:setopt(Sock, ipv6, Flag, boolean()).
25459: %%
25460: %% For all subsequent *received* messages, a control message header
25461: %% for each of the enabled options will be received with the message.
25462: %%
25463: %% Only allowed for dgram and raw,
25464: %% although we only test this with dgram.
25465: %%
25466: %% Currently we *try* to use the following opts:
25467: %%
25468: %%      recvpktinfo | pktinfo   => pktinfo
25469: %%      flowinfo                => flowinfo
25470: %%      recvhoplimit | hoplimit => hoplimit
25471: %%      recvtclass | tclass     => tclass
25472: %%
25473: %%
25474: %% Every time we add a test case for a new option (that results in
25475: %% a control message hedare), we should also add it here.
25476: %%
25477: %% Even though this is a IPv6 test case, we add the 'socket' timestamp
25478: %% option (just to fill up), but in the test to see if we should run
25479: %% the test (since its a IPv6 test case).
25480: %%
25481: 
25482: api_opt_ipv6_mopts_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
25483:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
25484:     tc_try(api_opt_ipv6_mopts_udp6,
25485:            fun() ->
25486:                    has_support_ipv6(),
25487:                    Opts =
25488:                        [{ipv6, recvpktinfo},
25489:                         {ipv6, flowinfo},
25490:                         {ipv6, recvhoplimit},
25491:                         {ipv6, hoplimit}] ++
25492:                        case os:type() of
25493:                            {win32, nt} ->
25494:                                [];
25495:                            _ ->
25496:                                [{ipv6, recvtclass},
25497:                                 {ipv6, tclass}]
25498:                        end,
25499: 		   case is_any_options_supported(Opts) of
25500: 		       true ->
25501: 			   ok;
25502: 		       false ->
25503: 			   skip("None of the needed options are supported")
25504: 		   end,
25505: 		   %% The problem here is hoplimit on darwin 9.8.0,
25506: 		   %% but I can't be bothered to adjust the test case,
25507: 		   %% just skip on that machine (there is only one)...
25508: 		   is_good_enough_darwin({9,8,0}),
25509:                    is_good_enough_montavista("4.0.1")
25510:            end,
25511:            fun() ->
25512: 		   %% If we get this far, we *know* that at least one of the
25513: 		   %% options are available.
25514: 
25515: 		   %% This is list of all the options and there resulting
25516: 		   %% control message header type(s):
25517: 		   %%   [{'ipv6 socket option', 'control message header type'}]
25518: 		   Opts =
25519: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, socket, timestamp) of
25520: 			   true ->
25521: 			       [{socket, timestamp, timestamp, default}];
25522: 			   false ->
25523: 			       []
25524: 		       end ++
25525: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvpktinfo) of
25526: 			   true ->
25527: 			       [{ipv6, recvpktinfo, pktinfo, default}];
25528: 			   false ->
25529: 			       []
25530: 		       end ++
25531: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, flowinfo) of
25532: 			   true ->
25533: 			       [{ipv6, flowinfo, flowinfo, default}];
25534: 			   false ->
25535: 			       []
25536: 		       end ++
25537: 		       case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, recvhoplimit) of
25538: 			   true ->
25539: 			       [{ipv6, recvhoplimit, hoplimit, default}];
25540: 			   false ->
25541: 			       case socket:is_supported(options, ipv6, hoplimit) of
25542: 				   true ->
25543: 				       [{ipv6, hoplimit, hoplimit, default}];
25544: 				   false ->
25545: 				       []
25546: 			       end
25547: 		       end ++
25548:                        case os:type() of
25549:                            {win32, nt} ->
25550:                                [];
25551:                            _ ->
25552:                                case socket:is_supported(options,
25553:                                                         ipv6, recvtclass) of
25554:                                    true ->
25555:                                        [{ipv6, recvtclass, tclass, 42}];
25556:                                    false ->
25557:                                        case socket:is_supported(options,
25558:                                                                 ipv6, tclass) of
25559:                                            true ->
25560:                                                [{ipv6, tclass, tclass, 42}];
25561:                                            false ->
25562:                                                []
25563:                                        end
25564:                                end
25565: 		       end,
25566: 
25567:                    Enable = fun(Sock, Level, Opt) ->
25568: 				    ?SEV_IPRINT("try enable [~w] ~p",
25569:                                                 [Level, Opt]),
25570: 				    socket:setopt(Sock, Level, Opt, true)
25571:                             end,
25572:                    Send = fun(Sock, Data, Dest, []) ->
25573:                                   Msg = #{addr => Dest,
25574:                                              iov  => [Data]},
25575:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
25576: 			     (Sock, Data, Dest, Hdrs) when is_list(Hdrs) ->
25577: 				  CMsgs = [#{level => Level,
25578:                                              type  => Type,
25579:                                              data  => Val} ||
25580:                                               {Level, Type, Val} <- Hdrs],
25581:                                   Msg   = #{addr => Dest,
25582:                                             ctrl => CMsgs,
25583:                                             iov  => [Data]},
25584:                                   socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
25585:                           end,
25586:                    Recv = fun(Sock) ->
25587:                                   case socket:recvmsg(Sock) of
25588:                                       {ok, #{addr := Source,
25589:                                              ctrl := CMsgs,
25590:                                              iov  := [Data]}} ->
25591:                                           {ok, {Source, CMsgs, Data}};
25592:                                       {error, _} = ERROR ->
25593:                                           ERROR
25594:                                   end
25595:                           end,
25596:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
25597:                                  proto  => udp,
25598: 				 opts   => Opts,
25599:                                  send   => Send,
25600:                                  recv   => Recv,
25601:                                  enable => Enable},
25602:                    ok = api_opt_ipv6_mopts_udp(InitState)
25603:            end).
25604: 
25605: 
25606: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25607: 
25608: api_opt_ipv6_mopts_udp(InitState) ->
25609:     Seq = 
25610:         [
25611:          #{desc => "local address",
25612:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
25613:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
25614:                            {ok, State#{lsa_src => LSA,
25615:                                        lsa_dst => LSA}}
25616:                    end},
25617: 
25618:          #{desc => "open src socket",
25619:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
25620:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
25621:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
25622:                            {ok, State#{sock_src => Sock}}
25623:                    end},
25624:          #{desc => "bind src",
25625:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock, lsa_src := LSA}) ->
25626:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
25627:                                ok ->
25628:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
25629:                                    ok;
25630:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
25631:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
25632:                                    ERROR
25633:                            end
25634:                    end},
25635:          #{desc => "sockname src socket",
25636:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
25637:                            SASrc = sock_sockname(Sock),
25638:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("src sockaddr: "
25639:                                        "~n   ~p", [SASrc]),
25640:                            {ok, State#{sa_src => SASrc}}
25641:                    end},
25642: 
25643:          #{desc => "open dst socket",
25644:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
25645:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
25646:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
25647:                            {ok, State#{sock_dst => Sock}}
25648:                    end},
25649:          #{desc => "bind dst",
25650:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock, lsa_dst := LSA}) ->
25651:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
25652:                                ok ->
25653:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
25654:                                    ok;
25655:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
25656:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
25657:                                    ERROR
25658:                            end
25659:                    end},
25660:          #{desc => "sockname dst socket",
25661:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
25662:                            SADst = sock_sockname(Sock),
25663:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("dst sockaddr: "
25664:                                        "~n   ~p", [SADst]),
25665:                            {ok, State#{sa_dst => SADst}}
25666:                    end},
25667: 
25668:          #{desc => "enable options on dst socket",
25669:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := DSock,
25670: 			 sock_src := SSock,
25671: 			 opts     := Opts,
25672: 			 enable   := Enable} = _State) ->
25673: 			   %% If we fail to enable *any* of the options,
25674: 			   %% we give up.
25675: 			   E = fun({Level, Opt, _, _}) -> 
25676:                                        case Enable(DSock, Level, Opt) of
25677:                                            ok ->
25678:                                                ?SEV_IPRINT("dst [~w] ~w enabled",
25679:                                                            [Level, Opt]),
25680:                                                ok;
25681:                                            {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
25682:                                                ?SEV_EPRINT("Expected "
25683:                                                            "Failure: "
25684:                                                            "~p => SKIP",
25685:                                                            [Reason]),
25686:                                                (catch socket:close(DSock)),
25687:                                                (catch socket:close(SSock)),
25688:                                                {skip, Reason};
25689:                                            {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
25690:                                                ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed "
25691:                                                            "setting ~w:"
25692:                                                            "   ~p",
25693:                                                            [Opt, Reason]),
25694:                                                throw(ERROR)
25695:                                        end
25696: 			       end,
25697: 			   lists:foreach(E, Opts),
25698: 			   ok
25699:                    end},
25700: 
25701:          #{desc => "send req (to dst)",
25702:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock,
25703: 			 sa_dst   := Dst,
25704: 			 opts     := Opts,
25705: 			 send     := Send}) ->
25706: 			   Hdrs = [{Level, Type, Data} ||
25707: 				      {Level, _, Type, Data} <- 
25708: 					  Opts, (Data =/= default)],
25709:                            Send(Sock, ?BASIC_REQ, Dst, Hdrs)
25710:                    end},
25711:          #{desc => "recv req (from src)",
25712:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock,
25713: 			 sa_src   := Src,
25714: 			 recv     := Recv,
25715: 			 opts     := Opts}) ->
25716:                            case Recv(Sock) of
25717:                                {ok, {Src, CMsgs, ?BASIC_REQ}}
25718:                                  when length(CMsgs) =:= length(Opts)  ->
25719:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Got (expected) cmsg headers: "
25720: 					       "~n   ~p", [CMsgs]),
25721: 				   %% We should really verify the headers:
25722: 				   %% values, types and so on...
25723:                                    ok;
25724:                                {ok, {BadSrc, BadCHdrs, BadReq} = UnexpData} ->
25725:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25726:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25727:                                                "~n   Recv Source:   ~p"
25728:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25729:                                                "~n   Recv CHdrs:    ~p"
25730:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25731:                                                "~n   Recv Msg:      ~p",
25732:                                                [Src, BadSrc,
25733:                                                 [{Level, Type} ||
25734:                                                     {Level, _, Type, _} <- Opts],
25735: 						BadCHdrs,
25736: 						?BASIC_REQ, BadReq]),
25737:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25738:                                {ok, UnexpData} ->
25739:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected msg: "
25740:                                                "~n   Expect Source: ~p"
25741:                                                "~n   Expect CHdrs:  ~p"
25742:                                                "~n   Expect Msg:    ~p"
25743:                                                "~n   Unexp Data:    ~p",
25744:                                                [Src,
25745:                                                 [{Level, Type} ||
25746:                                                     {Level, _, Type, _} <- Opts],
25747: 						?BASIC_REQ,
25748:                                                 UnexpData]),
25749:                                    {error, {unexpected_data, UnexpData}};
25750:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25751:                                    %% At the moment there is no way to get
25752:                                    %% status or state for the socket...
25753:                                    ERROR
25754:                            end
25755:                    end},
25756: 
25757:          #{desc => "close src socket",
25758:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_src := Sock} = State) ->
25759:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25760:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_src, State)}
25761:                    end},
25762:          #{desc => "close dst socket",
25763:            cmd  => fun(#{sock_dst := Sock} = State) ->
25764:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25765:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock_dst, State)}
25766:                    end},
25767: 
25768:          %% *** We are done ***
25769:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25770:         ],
25771:     Evaluator = ?SEV_START("tester", Seq, InitState),
25772:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Evaluator]).
25773: 
25774: 
25775: 
25776: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25777: 
25778: %% Tests that the congestion tcp socket option.
25779: %%
25780: %% According to the man page (on linux) for this option it *should* be
25781: %% possible to both get and set *allowed* algorithms. But when we attempt
25782: %% to set, we get 'enoent'.
25783: %% According to /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_allowed_congestion_control that
25784: %% allgorithm was allowed, so...
25785: %% For now, we only test that we can get (it could be a bug in our code)
25786: 
25787: api_opt_tcp_congestion_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
25788:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
25789:     tc_try(api_opt_tcp_congestion_tcp4,
25790:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_congestion() end,
25791:            fun() ->
25792:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_list(Value) ->
25793:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, congestion, Value)
25794:                           end,
25795:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
25796:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, congestion)
25797:                           end,
25798:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
25799:                                  proto  => tcp,
25800:                                  set    => Set,
25801:                                  get    => Get},
25802:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_congestion_tcp(InitState)
25803:            end).
25804: 
25805: 
25806: 
25807: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25808: 
25809: api_opt_tcp_congestion_tcp(InitState) ->
25810:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
25811:     ServerSeq =
25812:         [
25813:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
25814:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
25815:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
25816:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
25817:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
25818:                    end},
25819:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
25820:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25821:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
25822:                            ok
25823:                    end},
25824: 
25825:          %% *** Init part ***
25826:          #{desc => "which local address",
25827:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
25828:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
25829:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
25830:                    end},
25831:          #{desc => "create socket",
25832:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
25833:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
25834:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
25835:                                {ok, Sock} ->
25836:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
25837:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25838:                                    ERROR
25839:                            end
25840:                    end},
25841:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
25842:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
25843:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
25844:                                ok ->
25845:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
25846:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
25847:                                    ok;
25848:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25849:                                    ERROR
25850:                            end
25851:                    end},
25852:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
25853:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25854:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
25855:                            ok
25856:                    end},
25857: 
25858: 
25859:          %% The actual test
25860:          #{desc => "await continue (get congestion)",
25861:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25862:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_congestion)
25863:                    end},
25864:          #{desc => "get congestion",
25865:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
25866:                            case Get(Sock) of
25867:                                {ok, Algorithm} ->
25868:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("algorithm: ~s", [Algorithm]),
25869:                                    {ok, State#{alg => Algorithm}};
25870:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25871:                                    ERROR
25872:                            end
25873:                    end},
25874:          #{desc => "announce ready (get congestion)",
25875:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
25876:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_congestion),
25877:                            ok
25878:                    end},
25879: 
25880: 
25881:          %% *** Termination ***
25882:          #{desc => "await terminate",
25883:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
25884:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
25885:                                ok ->
25886:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
25887:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
25888:                                    ERROR
25889:                            end
25890:                    end},
25891:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
25892:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
25893:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
25894:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
25895:                    end},
25896: 
25897:          %% *** We are done ***
25898:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25899:         ],
25900: 
25901: 
25902:     TesterSeq =
25903:         [
25904:          %% *** Init part ***
25905:          #{desc => "monitor server",
25906:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25907:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
25908:                            ok
25909:                    end},
25910: 
25911:          %% Start the server
25912:          #{desc => "order server start",
25913:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25914:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
25915:                            ok
25916:                    end},
25917:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
25918:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
25919:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
25920:                            ok
25921:                    end},
25922: 
25923:          %% *** The actual test ***
25924:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-congestion)",
25925:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25926:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_congestion),
25927:                            ok
25928:                    end},
25929:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-congestion)",
25930:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25931:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_congestion)
25932:                    end},
25933: 
25934: 
25935:          %% *** Termination ***
25936:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
25937:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
25938:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
25939:                            ok
25940:                    end},
25941:          #{desc => "await server termination",
25942:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
25943:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
25944:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
25945:                            {ok, State1}
25946:                    end},
25947: 
25948:          %% *** We are done ***
25949:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
25950:         ],
25951: 
25952: 
25953:     i("start server evaluator"),
25954:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
25955: 
25956:     i("start tester evaluator"),
25957:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid},
25958:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
25959: 
25960:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Tester]).
25961: 
25962: 
25963: 
25964: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25965: 
25966: %% Tests that the cork tcp socket option.
25967: %%
25968: %% This is a very simple test. We simple set and get the value.
25969: %% To test that it has an effect is just "to much work"...
25970: %%
25971: %% Reading the man page it seems like (on linux) that the
25972: %% value resets itself after some (short) time...
25973: 
25974: api_opt_tcp_cork_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
25975:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
25976:     tc_try(api_opt_tcp_cork_tcp4,
25977:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_cork() end,
25978:            fun() ->
25979:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_boolean(Value) ->
25980:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, cork, Value)
25981:                           end,
25982:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
25983:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, cork)
25984:                           end,
25985:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
25986:                                  proto  => tcp,
25987:                                  set    => Set,
25988:                                  get    => Get},
25989:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_cork_tcp(InitState)
25990:            end).
25991: 
25992: 
25993: 
25994: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
25995: 
25996: api_opt_tcp_cork_tcp(InitState) ->
25997:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
25998:     TesterSeq =
25999:         [
26000:          %% *** Init part ***
26001:          #{desc => "which local address",
26002:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
26003:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
26004:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
26005:                    end},
26006:          #{desc => "create socket",
26007:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
26008:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
26009:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
26010:                                {ok, Sock} ->
26011:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
26012:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26013:                                    ERROR
26014:                            end
26015:                    end},
26016:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
26017:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
26018:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
26019:                                ok ->
26020:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
26021:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
26022:                                    ok;
26023:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26024:                                    ERROR
26025:                            end
26026:                    end},
26027: 
26028: 
26029:          %% The actual test
26030:          #{desc => "get (default) cork (= false)",
26031:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
26032:                            case Get(Sock) of
26033:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
26034:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork default: ~p", [Value]),
26035:                                    ok;
26036:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26037:                                    ERROR
26038:                            end
26039:                    end},
26040:          #{desc => "enable cork (=> true)",
26041:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
26042:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
26043:                                ok ->
26044:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork enabled"),
26045:                                    ok;
26046:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26047:                                    ERROR
26048:                            end
26049:                    end},
26050:          #{desc => "get cork (= true)",
26051:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
26052:                            case Get(Sock) of
26053:                                {ok, true = Value} ->
26054:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork: ~p", [Value]),
26055:                                    ok;
26056:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26057:                                    ERROR
26058:                            end
26059:                    end},
26060: 
26061: 
26062:          %% *** Termination ***
26063:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
26064:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
26065:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
26066:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
26067:                    end},
26068: 
26069:          %% *** We are done ***
26070:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
26071:         ],
26072: 
26073:     i("start tester evaluator"),
26074:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
26075: 
26076:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
26077: 
26078: 
26079: 
26080: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26081: 
26082: %% Tests that the maxseg tcp socket option.
26083: %%
26084: %% This is a very simple test. We simple set and get the value.
26085: %% To test that it has an effect is just "to much work"...
26086: %%
26087: %% Note that there is no point in reading this value back,
26088: %% since the kernel imposes its own rules with regard
26089: %% to what is an acceptable value.
26090: %%
26091: 
26092: api_opt_tcp_maxseg_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
26093:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
26094:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
26095:            fun() ->
26096:                    has_support_ipv4(),
26097:                    has_support_tcp_maxseg()
26098:            end,
26099:            fun() ->
26100:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_integer(Value) ->
26101:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, maxseg, Value)
26102:                           end,
26103:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
26104:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, maxseg)
26105:                           end,
26106:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
26107:                                  proto  => tcp,
26108:                                  set    => Set,
26109:                                  get    => Get},
26110:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_maxseg_tcp(InitState)
26111:            end).
26112: 
26113: 
26114: 
26115: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26116: 
26117: api_opt_tcp_maxseg_tcp(InitState) ->
26118:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
26119:     TesterSeq =
26120:         [
26121:          %% *** Init part ***
26122:          #{desc => "which local address",
26123:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
26124:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
26125:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
26126:                    end},
26127:          #{desc => "create socket",
26128:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
26129:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
26130:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
26131:                                {ok, Sock} ->
26132:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
26133:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26134:                                    ERROR
26135:                            end
26136:                    end},
26137:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
26138:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
26139:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
26140:                                ok ->
26141:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
26142:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
26143:                                    ok;
26144:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26145:                                    ERROR
26146:                            end
26147:                    end},
26148: 
26149: 
26150:          %% The actual test
26151:          #{desc => "get (default) maxseg",
26152:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
26153:                            case Get(Sock) of
26154:                                {ok, DefMaxSeg} ->
26155:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("maxseg default: ~p", [DefMaxSeg]),
26156:                                    {ok, State#{def_maxseg => DefMaxSeg}};
26157:                                {error, enoprotoopt = Reason} ->
26158:                                    {skip, Reason};
26159:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26160:                                    ERROR
26161:                            end
26162:                    end},
26163:          
26164:          %% Note that there is no point in reading this value back,
26165:          %% since the kernel imposes its own rules with regard
26166:          %% to what is an acceptable value.
26167:          %% So, even if the set operation is a success, the value
26168:          %% still might not have changed.
26169:          %%
26170:          %% Note that not all platforms allow this to be set!
26171:          %% Since this is the *last* operation in the test sequence
26172:          %% (before termination) we also accept error reason = einval
26173:          %% as success (rather then skip).
26174:          %% The same goes for the error reason = enoprotoopt (Solaris).
26175:          #{desc => "(maybe) change maxseg (default + 16)",
26176:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
26177:                          set        := Set,
26178:                          def_maxseg := DefMaxSeg} = _State) ->
26179:                            NewMaxSeg = DefMaxSeg + 16,
26180:                            case Set(Sock, NewMaxSeg) of
26181:                                ok ->
26182:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("maxseg (maybe) changed (to ~w)",
26183:                                                [NewMaxSeg]),
26184:                                    ok;
26185:                                {error, Reason} when (Reason =:= einval) orelse
26186:                                                     (Reason =:= enoprotoopt) ->
26187:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("change not allowed (~w)",
26188:                                                [Reason]),
26189:                                    ok;
26190:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26191:                                    ERROR
26192:                            end
26193:                    end},
26194: 
26195:          %% *** Termination ***
26196:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
26197:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
26198:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
26199:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
26200:                    end},
26201: 
26202:          %% *** We are done ***
26203:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
26204:         ],
26205: 
26206:     i("start tester evaluator"),
26207:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
26208: 
26209:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
26210: 
26211: 
26212: 
26213: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26214: 
26215: %% Tests that the nodelay tcp socket option.
26216: %%
26217: %% This is a very simple test. We simple set and get the value.
26218: %% To test that it has an effect is just "to much work"...
26219: 
26220: api_opt_tcp_nodelay_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
26221:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
26222:     tc_try(api_opt_tcp_nodelay_tcp4,
26223:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_nodelay() end,
26224:            fun() ->
26225:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_boolean(Value) ->
26226:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, nodelay, Value)
26227:                           end,
26228:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
26229:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, nodelay)
26230:                           end,
26231:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
26232:                                  proto  => tcp,
26233:                                  set    => Set,
26234:                                  get    => Get},
26235:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_nodelay_tcp(InitState)
26236:            end).
26237: 
26238: 
26239: 
26240: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26241: 
26242: api_opt_tcp_nodelay_tcp(InitState) ->
26243:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
26244:     TesterSeq =
26245:         [
26246:          %% *** Init part ***
26247:          #{desc => "which local address",
26248:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
26249:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
26250:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
26251:                    end},
26252:          #{desc => "create socket",
26253:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
26254:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
26255:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
26256:                                {ok, Sock} ->
26257:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
26258:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26259:                                    ERROR
26260:                            end
26261:                    end},
26262:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
26263:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
26264:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
26265:                                ok ->
26266:                                    Port = sock_port(Sock),
26267:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
26268:                                    ok;
26269:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26270:                                    ERROR
26271:                            end
26272:                    end},
26273: 
26274: 
26275:          %% The actual test
26276:          #{desc => "get (default) nodelay (= false)",
26277:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
26278:                            case Get(Sock) of
26279:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
26280:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodelay default: ~p", [Value]),
26281:                                    ok;
26282:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26283:                                    ERROR
26284:                            end
26285:                    end},
26286:          #{desc => "enable nodelay (=> true)",
26287:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
26288:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
26289:                                ok ->
26290:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodelay enabled"),
26291:                                    ok;
26292:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26293:                                    ERROR
26294:                            end
26295:                    end},
26296:          #{desc => "get nodelay (= true)",
26297:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
26298:                            case Get(Sock) of
26299:                                {ok, true = Value} ->
26300:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodelay: ~p", [Value]),
26301:                                    ok;
26302:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26303:                                    ERROR
26304:                            end
26305:                    end},
26306: 
26307: 
26308:          %% *** Termination ***
26309:          #{desc => "close socket",
26310:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
26311:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
26312:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
26313:                    end},
26314: 
26315:          %% *** We are done ***
26316:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
26317:         ],
26318: 
26319:     i("start tester evaluator"),
26320:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
26321: 
26322:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
26323: 
26324: 
26325: 
26326: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26327: 
26328: %% Tests that the keepcnt tcp socket option.
26329: %%
26330: %% "The maximum number of keepalive probes TCP should send before
26331: %%  dropping the connection"
26332: %%
26333: 
26334: api_opt_tcp_keepcnt_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
26335:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
26336:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
26337:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_keepcnt() end,
26338:            fun() ->
26339:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_integer(Value) ->
26340:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, keepcnt, Value)
26341:                           end,
26342:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
26343:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, keepcnt)
26344:                           end,
26345:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
26346:                                  proto  => tcp,
26347:                                  set    => Set,
26348:                                  get    => Get},
26349:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_keepcnt_tcp(InitState)
26350:            end).
26351: 
26352: 
26353: 
26354: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26355: 
26356: api_opt_tcp_keepcnt_tcp(InitState) ->
26357:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
26358:     ServerSeq =
26359:         [
26360:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
26361:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
26362:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
26363:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
26364:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
26365:                    end},
26366:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
26367:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26368:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
26369:                            ok
26370:                    end},
26371: 
26372:          %% *** Init part ***
26373:          #{desc => "which local address",
26374:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
26375:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
26376:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
26377:                    end},
26378:          #{desc => "create socket",
26379:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
26380:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
26381:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
26382:                                {ok, Sock} ->
26383:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
26384:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26385:                                    ERROR
26386:                            end
26387:                    end},
26388:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
26389:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
26390:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
26391:                                ok ->
26392:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
26393:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
26394:                                    ok;
26395:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26396:                                    ERROR
26397:                            end
26398:                    end},
26399:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
26400:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26401:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
26402:                            ok
26403:                    end},
26404: 
26405: 
26406:          %% The actual test
26407:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepcnt(1))",
26408:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26409:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepcnt)
26410:                    end},
26411:          #{desc => "get keepcnt",
26412:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
26413:                            case Get(Sock) of
26414:                                {ok, KeepCnt} ->
26415:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepcnt: ~p", [KeepCnt]),
26416:                                    {ok, State#{keepcnt => KeepCnt}};
26417:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26418:                                    ERROR
26419:                            end
26420:                    end},
26421:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepcnt(1))",
26422:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26423:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepcnt),
26424:                            ok
26425:                    end},
26426: 
26427: 
26428:          #{desc => "await continue (set keepcnt)",
26429:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26430:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, set_keepcnt)
26431:                    end},
26432:          #{desc => "set keepcnt",
26433:            cmd  => fun(#{sock    := Sock,
26434:                          set     := Set,
26435:                          keepcnt := KeepCnt} = State) ->
26436:                            NewKeepCnt =
26437:                                if
26438:                                    (KeepCnt >= 255) ->
26439:                                        KeepCnt - 1;
26440:                                    true ->
26441:                                        KeepCnt + 1
26442:                                end,
26443:                            case Set(Sock, NewKeepCnt) of
26444:                                ok ->
26445:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepcnt updated (to ~p)",
26446:                                                [NewKeepCnt]),
26447:                                    {ok, State#{keepcnt => NewKeepCnt}};
26448:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26449:                                    ERROR
26450:                            end
26451:                    end},
26452:          #{desc => "announce ready (set keepcnt)",
26453:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26454:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, set_keepcnt),
26455:                            ok
26456:                    end},
26457: 
26458: 
26459:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepcnt(2))",
26460:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26461:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepcnt)
26462:                    end},
26463:          #{desc => "get keepcnt(2)",
26464:            cmd  => fun(#{sock    := Sock,
26465:                          get     := Get,
26466:                          keepcnt := ExpKeepCnt} = _State) ->
26467:                            case Get(Sock) of
26468:                                {ok, KeepCnt} when (ExpKeepCnt =:= KeepCnt) ->
26469:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected keepcnt (~p)",
26470:                                                [ExpKeepCnt]),
26471:                                    ok;
26472:                                {ok, KeepCnt} ->
26473:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected keepcnt:"
26474:                                                "~n   Expected KeepCnt: ~p"
26475:                                                "~n   Actual KeepCnt:   ~p",
26476:                                                [ExpKeepCnt, KeepCnt]),
26477:                                    {error,
26478:                                     {unexpected_keepcnt, ExpKeepCnt, KeepCnt}};
26479:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
26480:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("failed get keepcnt: "
26481:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
26482:                                    ERROR
26483:                            end
26484:                    end},
26485:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepcnt)",
26486:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26487:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepcnt),
26488:                            ok
26489:                    end},
26490: 
26491: 
26492:          %% *** Termination ***
26493:          #{desc => "await terminate",
26494:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
26495:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
26496:                                ok ->
26497:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
26498:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26499:                                    ERROR
26500:                            end
26501:                    end},
26502:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
26503:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
26504:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
26505:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
26506:                    end},
26507: 
26508:          %% *** We are done ***
26509:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
26510:         ],
26511: 
26512: 
26513:     TesterSeq =
26514:         [
26515:          %% *** Init part ***
26516:          #{desc => "monitor server",
26517:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
26518:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
26519:                            ok
26520:                    end},
26521: 
26522:          %% Start the server
26523:          #{desc => "order server start",
26524:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
26525:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
26526:                            ok
26527:                    end},
26528:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
26529:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
26530:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
26531:                            ok
26532:                    end},
26533: 
26534:          %% *** The actual test ***
26535:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepcnt(1))",
26536:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26537:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepcnt),
26538:                            ok
26539:                    end},
26540:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepcnt(1))",
26541:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26542:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepcnt)
26543:                    end},
26544: 
26545:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with set-keepcnt)",
26546:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26547:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, set_keepcnt),
26548:                            ok
26549:                    end},
26550:          #{desc => "await server ready (set-keepcnt)",
26551:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26552:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, set_keepcnt)
26553:                    end},
26554: 
26555:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepcnt(2))",
26556:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26557:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepcnt),
26558:                            ok
26559:                    end},
26560:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepcnt(2))",
26561:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26562:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepcnt)
26563:                    end},
26564: 
26565: 
26566:          %% *** Termination ***
26567:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
26568:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26569:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
26570:                            ok
26571:                    end},
26572:          #{desc => "await server termination",
26573:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
26574:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
26575:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
26576:                            {ok, State1}
26577:                    end},
26578: 
26579:          %% *** We are done ***
26580:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
26581:         ],
26582: 
26583: 
26584:     i("start server evaluator"),
26585:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
26586: 
26587:     i("start tester evaluator"),
26588:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid},
26589:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
26590: 
26591:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Tester]).
26592: 
26593: 
26594: 
26595: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26596: 
26597: %% Tests that the keepidle tcp socket option.
26598: %%
26599: %% "Gets or sets the number of seconds a TCP connection will remain
26600: %%  idle before keepalive probes are sent to the remote."
26601: %%
26602: 
26603: api_opt_tcp_keepidle_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
26604:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
26605:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
26606:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_keepidle() end,
26607:            fun() ->
26608:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_integer(Value) ->
26609:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, keepidle, Value)
26610:                           end,
26611:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
26612:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, keepidle)
26613:                           end,
26614:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
26615:                                  proto  => tcp,
26616:                                  set    => Set,
26617:                                  get    => Get},
26618:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_keepidle_tcp(InitState)
26619:            end).
26620: 
26621: 
26622: 
26623: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26624: 
26625: api_opt_tcp_keepidle_tcp(InitState) ->
26626:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
26627:     ServerSeq =
26628:         [
26629:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
26630:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
26631:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
26632:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
26633:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
26634:                    end},
26635:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
26636:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26637:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
26638:                            ok
26639:                    end},
26640: 
26641:          %% *** Init part ***
26642:          #{desc => "which local address",
26643:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
26644:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
26645:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
26646:                    end},
26647:          #{desc => "create socket",
26648:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
26649:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
26650:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
26651:                                {ok, Sock} ->
26652:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
26653:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26654:                                    ERROR
26655:                            end
26656:                    end},
26657:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
26658:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
26659:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
26660:                                ok ->
26661:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
26662:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
26663:                                    ok;
26664:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26665:                                    ERROR
26666:                            end
26667:                    end},
26668:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
26669:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26670:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
26671:                            ok
26672:                    end},
26673: 
26674: 
26675:          %% The actual test
26676:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepidle(1))",
26677:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26678:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepidle)
26679:                    end},
26680:          #{desc => "get keepidle",
26681:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
26682:                            case Get(Sock) of
26683:                                {ok, KeepIdle} ->
26684:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepidle: ~p", [KeepIdle]),
26685:                                    {ok, State#{keepidle => KeepIdle}};
26686:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26687:                                    ERROR
26688:                            end
26689:                    end},
26690:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepidle(1))",
26691:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26692:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepidle),
26693:                            ok
26694:                    end},
26695: 
26696: 
26697:          #{desc => "await continue (set keepidle)",
26698:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26699:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, set_keepidle)
26700:                    end},
26701:          #{desc => "set keepidle",
26702:            cmd  => fun(#{sock     := Sock,
26703:                          set      := Set,
26704:                          keepidle := KeepIdle} = State) ->
26705:                            NewKeepIdle = KeepIdle + 1,
26706:                            case Set(Sock, NewKeepIdle) of
26707:                                ok ->
26708:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepidle updated (to ~p)",
26709:                                                [NewKeepIdle]),
26710:                                    {ok, State#{keepidle => NewKeepIdle}};
26711:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26712:                                    ERROR
26713:                            end
26714:                    end},
26715:          #{desc => "announce ready (set keepidle)",
26716:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26717:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, set_keepidle),
26718:                            ok
26719:                    end},
26720: 
26721: 
26722:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepidle(2))",
26723:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26724:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepidle)
26725:                    end},
26726:          #{desc => "get keepidle(2)",
26727:            cmd  => fun(#{sock     := Sock,
26728:                          get      := Get,
26729:                          keepidle := ExpKeepIdle} = _State) ->
26730:                            case Get(Sock) of
26731:                                {ok, KeepIdle} when (ExpKeepIdle =:= KeepIdle) ->
26732:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected keepidle (~p)",
26733:                                                [ExpKeepIdle]),
26734:                                    ok;
26735:                                {ok, KeepIdle} ->
26736:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected keepidle:"
26737:                                                "~n   Expected KeepIdle: ~p"
26738:                                                "~n   Actual KeepIdle:   ~p",
26739:                                                [ExpKeepIdle, KeepIdle]),
26740:                                    {error,
26741:                                     {unexpected_keepidle,
26742:                                      ExpKeepIdle, KeepIdle}};
26743:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
26744:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("failed get keepidle: "
26745:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
26746:                                    ERROR
26747:                            end
26748:                    end},
26749:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepidle(2))",
26750:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26751:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepidle),
26752:                            ok
26753:                    end},
26754: 
26755: 
26756:          %% *** Termination ***
26757:          #{desc => "await terminate",
26758:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
26759:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
26760:                                ok ->
26761:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
26762:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26763:                                    ERROR
26764:                            end
26765:                    end},
26766:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
26767:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
26768:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
26769:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
26770:                    end},
26771: 
26772:          %% *** We are done ***
26773:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
26774:         ],
26775: 
26776: 
26777:     TesterSeq =
26778:         [
26779:          %% *** Init part ***
26780:          #{desc => "monitor server",
26781:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
26782:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
26783:                            ok
26784:                    end},
26785: 
26786:          %% Start the server
26787:          #{desc => "order server start",
26788:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
26789:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
26790:                            ok
26791:                    end},
26792:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
26793:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
26794:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
26795:                            ok
26796:                    end},
26797: 
26798:          %% *** The actual test ***
26799:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepidle(1))",
26800:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26801:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepidle),
26802:                            ok
26803:                    end},
26804:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepidle(1))",
26805:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26806:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepidle)
26807:                    end},
26808: 
26809:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with set-keepidle)",
26810:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26811:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, set_keepidle),
26812:                            ok
26813:                    end},
26814:          #{desc => "await server ready (set-keepidle)",
26815:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26816:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, set_keepidle)
26817:                    end},
26818: 
26819:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepidle(2))",
26820:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26821:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepidle),
26822:                            ok
26823:                    end},
26824:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepidle(2))",
26825:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26826:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepidle)
26827:                    end},
26828: 
26829: 
26830:          %% *** Termination ***
26831:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
26832:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
26833:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
26834:                            ok
26835:                    end},
26836:          #{desc => "await server termination",
26837:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
26838:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
26839:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
26840:                            {ok, State1}
26841:                    end},
26842: 
26843:          %% *** We are done ***
26844:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
26845:         ],
26846: 
26847: 
26848:     i("start server evaluator"),
26849:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
26850: 
26851:     i("start tester evaluator"),
26852:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid},
26853:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
26854: 
26855:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Tester]).
26856: 
26857: 
26858: 
26859: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26860: 
26861: %% Tests that the keepintvl tcp socket option.
26862: %%
26863: %% "Gets or sets the number of seconds a TCP connection will wait for
26864: %%  a keepalive response before sending another keepalive probe."
26865: %%
26866: 
26867: api_opt_tcp_keepintvl_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
26868:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
26869:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
26870:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_tcp_keepintvl() end,
26871:            fun() ->
26872:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_integer(Value) ->
26873:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, tcp, keepintvl, Value)
26874:                           end,
26875:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
26876:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, tcp, keepintvl)
26877:                           end,
26878:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
26879:                                  proto  => tcp,
26880:                                  set    => Set,
26881:                                  get    => Get},
26882:                    ok = api_opt_tcp_keepintvl_tcp(InitState)
26883:            end).
26884: 
26885: 
26886: 
26887: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
26888: 
26889: api_opt_tcp_keepintvl_tcp(InitState) ->
26890:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
26891:     ServerSeq =
26892:         [
26893:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
26894:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
26895:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
26896:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
26897:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
26898:                    end},
26899:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
26900:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26901:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
26902:                            ok
26903:                    end},
26904: 
26905:          %% *** Init part ***
26906:          #{desc => "which local address",
26907:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
26908:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
26909:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
26910:                    end},
26911:          #{desc => "create socket",
26912:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
26913:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
26914:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
26915:                                {ok, Sock} ->
26916:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
26917:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26918:                                    ERROR
26919:                            end
26920:                    end},
26921:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
26922:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
26923:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
26924:                                ok ->
26925:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
26926:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
26927:                                    ok;
26928:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26929:                                    ERROR
26930:                            end
26931:                    end},
26932:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
26933:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26934:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
26935:                            ok
26936:                    end},
26937: 
26938: 
26939:          %% The actual test
26940:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepintvl(1))",
26941:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26942:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepintvl)
26943:                    end},
26944:          #{desc => "get keepintvl",
26945:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = State) ->
26946:                            case Get(Sock) of
26947:                                {ok, KeepIntVl} ->
26948:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepintvl: ~p", [KeepIntVl]),
26949:                                    {ok, State#{keepintvl => KeepIntVl}};
26950:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26951:                                    ERROR
26952:                            end
26953:                    end},
26954:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepintvl(1))",
26955:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26956:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepintvl),
26957:                            ok
26958:                    end},
26959: 
26960: 
26961:          #{desc => "await continue (set keepintvl)",
26962:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26963:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, set_keepintvl)
26964:                    end},
26965:          #{desc => "set keepintvl",
26966:            cmd  => fun(#{sock     := Sock,
26967:                          set      := Set,
26968:                          keepintvl := KeepIntVl} = State) ->
26969:                            NewKeepIntVl = KeepIntVl + 1,
26970:                            case Set(Sock, NewKeepIntVl) of
26971:                                ok ->
26972:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("keepIntVl updated (to ~p)",
26973:                                                [NewKeepIntVl]),
26974:                                    {ok, State#{keepintvl => NewKeepIntVl}};
26975:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
26976:                                    ERROR
26977:                            end
26978:                    end},
26979:          #{desc => "announce ready (set keepintvl)",
26980:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26981:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, set_keepintvl),
26982:                            ok
26983:                    end},
26984: 
26985: 
26986:          #{desc => "await continue (get keepintvl(2))",
26987:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
26988:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, get_keepintvl)
26989:                    end},
26990:          #{desc => "get keepintvl(2)",
26991:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
26992:                          get       := Get,
26993:                          keepintvl := ExpKeepIntVl} = _State) ->
26994:                            case Get(Sock) of
