26995:                                {ok, KeepIntVl}
26996:                                  when (ExpKeepIntVl =:= KeepIntVl) ->
26997:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected keepintvl (~p)",
26998:                                                [ExpKeepIntVl]),
26999:                                    ok;
27000:                                {ok, KeepIntVl} ->
27001:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected keepintvl:"
27002:                                                "~n   Expected KeepIntVl: ~p"
27003:                                                "~n   Actual KeepIntVl:   ~p",
27004:                                                [ExpKeepIntVl, KeepIntVl]),
27005:                                    {error,
27006:                                     {unexpected_keepintvl,
27007:                                      ExpKeepIntVl, KeepIntVl}};
27008:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
27009:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("failed get keepintvl: "
27010:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
27011:                                    ERROR
27012:                            end
27013:                    end},
27014:          #{desc => "announce ready (get keepintvl(2))",
27015:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
27016:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, get_keepintvl),
27017:                            ok
27018:                    end},
27019: 
27020: 
27021:          %% *** Termination ***
27022:          #{desc => "await terminate",
27023:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
27024:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
27025:                                ok ->
27026:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
27027:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27028:                                    ERROR
27029:                            end
27030:                    end},
27031:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
27032:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
27033:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
27034:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
27035:                    end},
27036: 
27037:          %% *** We are done ***
27038:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
27039:         ],
27040: 
27041: 
27042:     TesterSeq =
27043:         [
27044:          %% *** Init part ***
27045:          #{desc => "monitor server",
27046:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
27047:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
27048:                            ok
27049:                    end},
27050: 
27051:          %% Start the server
27052:          #{desc => "order server start",
27053:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
27054:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
27055:                            ok
27056:                    end},
27057:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
27058:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
27059:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
27060:                            ok
27061:                    end},
27062: 
27063:          %% *** The actual test ***
27064:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepintvl(1))",
27065:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27066:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepintvl),
27067:                            ok
27068:                    end},
27069:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepintvl(1))",
27070:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27071:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepintvl)
27072:                    end},
27073: 
27074:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with set-keepintvl)",
27075:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27076:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, set_keepintvl),
27077:                            ok
27078:                    end},
27079:          #{desc => "await server ready (set-keepintvl)",
27080:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27081:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, set_keepintvl)
27082:                    end},
27083: 
27084:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with get-keepintvl(2))",
27085:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27086:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, get_keepintvl),
27087:                            ok
27088:                    end},
27089:          #{desc => "await server ready (get-keepintvl(2))",
27090:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27091:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, get_keepintvl)
27092:                    end},
27093: 
27094: 
27095:          %% *** Termination ***
27096:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
27097:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27098:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
27099:                            ok
27100:                    end},
27101:          #{desc => "await server termination",
27102:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
27103:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
27104:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
27105:                            {ok, State1}
27106:                    end},
27107: 
27108:          %% *** We are done ***
27109:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
27110:         ],
27111: 
27112: 
27113:     i("start server evaluator"),
27114:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, InitState),
27115: 
27116:     i("start tester evaluator"),
27117:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid},
27118:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
27119: 
27120:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Tester]).
27121: 
27122: 
27123: 
27124: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27125: 
27126: %% Tests that the cork udp socket option.
27127: %%
27128: %% This is a very simple test. We simple set and get the value.
27129: %% To test that it has an effect is just "to much work"...
27130: %%
27131: 
27132: api_opt_udp_cork_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27133:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
27134:     tc_try(api_opt_udp_cork_udp4,
27135:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), has_support_udp_cork() end,
27136:            fun() ->
27137:                    Set  = fun(Sock, Value) when is_boolean(Value) ->
27138:                                   socket:setopt(Sock, udp, cork, Value)
27139:                           end,
27140:                    Get  = fun(Sock) ->
27141:                                   socket:getopt(Sock, udp, cork)
27142:                           end,
27143:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
27144:                                  proto  => udp,
27145:                                  set    => Set,
27146:                                  get    => Get},
27147:                    ok = api_opt_udp_cork_udp(InitState)
27148:            end).
27149: 
27150: 
27151: 
27152: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27153: 
27154: api_opt_udp_cork_udp(InitState) ->
27155:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
27156:     TesterSeq =
27157:         [
27158:          %% *** Init part ***
27159:          #{desc => "which local address",
27160:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27161:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
27162:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
27163:                    end},
27164:          #{desc => "create socket",
27165:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
27166:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
27167:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
27168:                                {ok, Sock} ->
27169:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
27170:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27171:                                    ERROR
27172:                            end
27173:                    end},
27174:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
27175:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
27176:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
27177:                                ok ->
27178:                                    Port = sock_port(Sock),
27179:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
27180:                                    ok;
27181:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27182:                                    ERROR
27183:                            end
27184:                    end},
27185: 
27186: 
27187:          %% The actual test
27188:          #{desc => "get (default) cork (= false)",
27189:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
27190:                            case Get(Sock) of
27191:                                {ok, false = Value} ->
27192:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork default: ~p", [Value]),
27193:                                    ok;
27194:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27195:                                    ERROR
27196:                            end
27197:                    end},
27198:          #{desc => "enable cork (=> true)",
27199:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, set := Set} = _State) ->
27200:                            case Set(Sock, true) of
27201:                                ok ->
27202:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork enabled"),
27203:                                    ok;
27204:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27205:                                    ERROR
27206:                            end
27207:                    end},
27208:          #{desc => "get cork (= true)",
27209:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, get := Get} = _State) ->
27210:                            case Get(Sock) of
27211:                                {ok, true = Value} ->
27212:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("cork: ~p", [Value]),
27213:                                    ok;
27214:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27215:                                    ERROR
27216:                            end
27217:                    end},
27218: 
27219: 
27220:          %% *** Termination ***
27221:          #{desc => "close socket",
27222:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
27223:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
27224:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
27225:                    end},
27226: 
27227:          %% *** We are done ***
27228:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
27229:         ],
27230: 
27231:     i("start tester evaluator"),
27232:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
27233: 
27234:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
27235: 
27236: 
27237: 
27238: 
27239: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27240: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27241: %%                                                                     %%
27242: %%                  API OPERATIONS WITH TIMEOUT                        %%
27243: %%                                                                     %%
27244: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27245: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27246: 
27247: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27248: 
27249: %% This test case is intended to test the connect timeout option
27250: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
27251: api_to_connect_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27252:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
27253:     Cond = fun() -> has_support_ipv4(), api_to_connect_cond() end,
27254:     tc_try(api_to_connect_tcp4,
27255:            Cond,
27256:            fun() ->
27257:                    InitState = #{domain        => inet,
27258:                                  backlog       => 1,
27259:                                  timeout       => 5000,
27260:                                  connect_limit => 3},
27261:                    ok = api_to_connect_tcp(InitState)
27262:            end).
27263: 
27264: api_to_connect_cond() ->
27265:     api_to_connect_cond(os:type(), os:version()).
27266: 
27267: %% I don't know exactly at which version this starts to work.
27268: %% I know it does not work for 4.4.*, but is does for 4.15.
27269: %% So, just to simplify, we require at least 4.15
27270: api_to_connect_cond({unix, linux}, {Maj, Min, _Rev}) ->
27271:     if
27272:         (Maj > 4) ->
27273:             ok;
27274:         ((Maj =:= 4) andalso (Min >= 15)) ->
27275:             ok;
27276:         true ->
27277:             skip("TC does not work")
27278:     end;
27279: %% Only test on one machine, which has version 6.3, and there it does
27280: %% not work, so disable for all.
27281: api_to_connect_cond({unix, openbsd}, _) ->
27282:     skip("TC does not work");
27283: api_to_connect_cond({unix, freebsd}, {Maj, Min, _Rev}) ->
27284:     if
27285:         ((Maj >= 10) andalso (Min >= 4)) ->
27286:             ok;
27287:         true ->
27288:             skip("TC may not work")
27289:     end;
27290: api_to_connect_cond({unix, sunos}, {Maj, Min, _Rev}) ->
27291:     if
27292:         ((Maj >= 5) andalso (Min >= 10)) ->
27293:             ok;
27294:         true ->
27295:             skip("TC may not work")
27296:     end;
27297: api_to_connect_cond(_, _) ->
27298:     skip("TC may not work").
27299: 
27300: 
27301: 
27302: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27303: 
27304: %% This test case is intended to test the connect timeout option
27305: %% on an IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
27306: api_to_connect_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27307:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
27308:     tc_try(api_to_connect_tcp6,
27309:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6(), api_to_connect_cond() end,
27310:            fun() ->
27311:                    InitState = #{domain        => inet6,
27312:                                  backlog       => 1,
27313:                                  timeout       => 5000,
27314:                                  connect_limit => 3},
27315:                    ok = api_to_connect_tcp(InitState)
27316:            end).
27317: 
27318: 
27319: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27320: %% We use the backlog (listen) argument to test this.
27321: %% Note that the behaviour of the TCP "server side" can vary when 
27322: %% a client connect to a "busy" server (full backlog).
27323: %% For instance, on FreeBSD (11.2) the response when the backlog is full
27324: %% is a econreset.
27325: 
27326: api_to_connect_tcp(InitState) ->
27327:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
27328: 
27329:     ServerSeq = 
27330:         [
27331:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
27332:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
27333:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
27334:                            {Tester, Backlog} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
27335:                            {ok, State#{tester  => Tester,
27336:                                        backlog => Backlog}}
27337:                    end},
27338:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
27339:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
27340:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
27341:                            ok
27342:                    end},
27343: 
27344:          %% *** Init part ***
27345:          #{desc => "which local address",
27346:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27347:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
27348:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
27349:                    end},
27350:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
27351:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27352:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, tcp) of
27353:                                {ok, Sock} ->
27354:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
27355:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27356:                                    ERROR
27357:                            end
27358:                    end},
27359:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
27360:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
27361:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
27362:                                ok ->
27363:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
27364:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
27365:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27366:                                    ERROR
27367:                            end
27368:                    end},
27369:          #{desc => "make listen socket (with backlog = 1)",
27370:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, backlog := Backlog}) ->
27371:                            socket:listen(LSock, Backlog)
27372:                    end},
27373:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
27374:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, lport := Port}) ->
27375:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
27376:                            ok
27377:                    end},
27378: 
27379:          %% Termination
27380:          #{desc => "await terminate",
27381:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
27382:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
27383:                                ok ->
27384:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
27385:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27386:                                    ERROR
27387:                            end
27388:                    end},
27389:          #{desc => "close socket",
27390:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := Sock} = State) ->
27391:                            sock_close(Sock),
27392:                            State1 = maps:remove(lport, State),
27393:                            State2 = maps:remove(sock,  State1),
27394:                            {ok, State2}
27395:                    end},
27396: 
27397:          %% *** We are done ***
27398:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
27399:         ],
27400: 
27401:     ClientSeq =
27402:         [
27403:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
27404:          #{desc => "await start",
27405:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
27406:                            {Tester, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
27407:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester,
27408:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
27409:                    end},
27410:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
27411:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
27412:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
27413:                            ok
27414:                    end},
27415: 
27416:          %% *** Init part ***
27417:          #{desc => "which local address",
27418:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27419:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
27420:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
27421:                    end},
27422:          #{desc => "create node",
27423:            cmd  => fun(#{host := _Host} = State) ->
27424:                            {Peer, Node} = ?START_NODE("client"),
27425:                            {ok, State#{node => Node, peer => Peer}}
27426:                    end},
27427:          #{desc => "monitor client node",
27428:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
27429:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
27430:                            ok
27431:                    end},
27432:          #{desc => "start remote client on client node",
27433:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
27434:                            Pid = api_toc_tcp_client_start(Node),
27435:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client ~p started", [Pid]),
27436:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
27437:                    end},
27438:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
27439:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
27440:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
27441:                            ok
27442:                    end},
27443:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
27444:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
27445:                          server_sa := ServerSA}) ->
27446:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, ServerSA),
27447:                            ok
27448:                    end},
27449:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
27450:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
27451:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
27452:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init,
27453:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
27454:                    end},
27455:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
27456:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
27457:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
27458:                            ok
27459:                    end},
27460: 
27461:          %% The actual test
27462:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
27463:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
27464:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
27465:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect,
27466:                                                     [{rclient, Client}]) of
27467:                                {ok, {ConTimeout, ConLimit}} ->
27468:                                    {ok, State#{connect_timeout => ConTimeout,
27469:                                                connect_limit   => ConLimit}};
27470:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27471:                                    ERROR
27472:                            end
27473:                    end},
27474:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
27475:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient         := RClient,
27476:                          connect_timeout := ConTimeout,
27477:                          connect_limit   := ConLimit}) ->
27478:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(RClient, connect,
27479:                                                   {ConTimeout, ConLimit}),
27480:                            ok
27481:                    end},
27482:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (connect)",
27483:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
27484:                          rclient := RClient} = State) ->
27485:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(RClient, rclient, connect,
27486:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
27487:                                {ok, ok = _Result} ->
27488:                                    {ok, maps:remove(connect_limit, State)};
27489:                                {ok, {error, {connect_limit_reached,R,L}}} ->
27490:                                    {skip,
27491:                                     ?LIB:f("Connect limit reached ~w: ~w",
27492:                                            [L, R])};
27493:                                {ok, Result} ->
27494:                                    Result;
27495:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27496:                                    ERROR
27497:                            end
27498:                    end},
27499: 
27500:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
27501:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
27502:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
27503:                            ok
27504:                    end},
27505: 
27506:          %% Termination
27507:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
27508:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
27509:                          rclient := RClient} = State) ->
27510:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
27511:                                                      [{rclient, RClient}]) of
27512:                                ok ->
27513:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
27514:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27515:                                    ERROR
27516:                            end
27517:                    end},
27518:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
27519:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
27520:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
27521:                            ok
27522:                    end},
27523:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
27524:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client} = State) ->
27525:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
27526:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
27527:                            {ok, State1}
27528:                    end},
27529:          #{desc => "stop client node",
27530:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
27531:                            {ok,
27532:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
27533:                                 ok ->
27534:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
27535:                                 {error, Reason} ->
27536:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
27537:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
27538:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
27539:                             catch
27540:                                 C:E:S ->
27541:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
27542:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
27543:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
27544:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
27545:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
27546:                             end}
27547:                    end},
27548:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
27549:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
27550:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown"),
27551:                            receive
27552:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
27553:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
27554:                                    State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
27555:                                    State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
27556:                                    {ok, State2}
27557:                            end;
27558:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
27559:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
27560:                            State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
27561:                            State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
27562:                            {ok, State2}
27563:                    end},
27564: 
27565:          %% *** We are done ***
27566:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
27567:         ],
27568: 
27569:     TesterSeq =
27570:         [
27571:          %% *** Init part ***
27572:          #{desc => "monitor server",
27573:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27574:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
27575:                            ok
27576:                    end},
27577:          #{desc => "monitor client",
27578:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
27579:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Client),
27580:                            ok
27581:                    end},
27582:          #{desc => "which local address",
27583:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27584:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
27585:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
27586:                    end},
27587:          #{desc => "order server start",
27588:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
27589:                          backlog := Backlog}) ->
27590:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Server, Backlog),
27591:                            ok
27592:                    end},
27593:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
27594:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
27595:                            {ok, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, init),
27596:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
27597:                            {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}}
27598:                    end},
27599:          #{desc => "order client start",
27600:            cmd  => fun(#{client    := Client,
27601:                          server_sa := ServerSA}) ->
27602:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, ServerSA),
27603:                            ok
27604:                    end},
27605:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
27606:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
27607:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, init),
27608:                            ok
27609:                    end},
27610: 
27611:          %% The actual test
27612:          %% The server does nothing (this is the point), no accept,
27613:          %% the client tries to connect.
27614:          #{desc => "order client continue (connect)",
27615:            cmd  => fun(#{client        := Client,
27616:                          timeout       := Timeout,
27617:                          connect_limit := ConLimit} = _State) ->
27618:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect,
27619:                                                   {Timeout, ConLimit}),
27620:                            ok
27621:                    end},
27622:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
27623:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
27624:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
27625:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, connect,
27626:                                                  [{server, Server}]) of
27627:                                ok ->
27628:                                    ok;
27629:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27630:                                    ERROR
27631:                            end
27632:                    end},
27633: 
27634: 
27635:          %% *** Terminate server ***
27636:          #{desc => "order client terminate",
27637:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
27638:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
27639:                            ok
27640:                    end},
27641:          #{desc => "await client down",
27642:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
27643:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
27644:                            State1 = maps:remove(client,    State),
27645:                            {ok, State1}
27646:                    end},
27647:          #{desc => "order server terminate",
27648:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
27649:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
27650:                            ok
27651:                    end},
27652:          #{desc => "await server down",
27653:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
27654:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
27655:                            State1 = maps:remove(server,    State),
27656:                            State2 = maps:remove(server_sa, State1),
27657:                            {ok, State2}
27658:                    end},
27659: 
27660:          %% *** We are done ***
27661:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
27662:         ],
27663: 
27664:     i("create server evaluator"),
27665:     ServerInitState = #{domain => maps:get(domain, InitState)},
27666:     Server          = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
27667: 
27668:     i("create client evaluator"),
27669:     ClientInitState = #{host   => local_host(),
27670:                         domain => maps:get(domain, InitState)},
27671:     Client          = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
27672: 
27673:     i("create tester evaluator"),
27674:     TesterInitState = InitState#{server => Server#ev.pid,
27675:                                  client => Client#ev.pid},
27676:     Tester          = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
27677: 
27678:     i("await evaluator(s)"),
27679:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
27680: 
27681: 
27682: api_toc_tcp_client_start(Node) ->
27683:     Self = self(),
27684:     Fun  = fun() -> api_toc_tcp_client(Self) end,
27685:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
27686: 
27687: api_toc_tcp_client(Parent) ->
27688:     api_toc_tcp_client_init(Parent),
27689:     ServerSA = api_toc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
27690:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
27691:     api_toc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
27692:     {To, ConLimit} = api_toc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
27693:     Result = api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout(To, ServerSA, Domain, ConLimit),
27694:     ?SEV_IPRINT("result: ~p", [Result]),
27695:     api_toc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect, Result),
27696:     Reason = api_toc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
27697:     exit(Reason).
27698: 
27699: api_toc_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
27700:     put(sname, "rclient"),
27701:     %% i("api_toc_tcp_client_init -> entry"),
27702:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
27703:     ok.
27704: 
27705: api_toc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
27706:     %% i("api_toc_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
27707:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
27708: 
27709: api_toc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
27710:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
27711: api_toc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Result) ->
27712:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Result).
27713: 
27714: api_toc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
27715:     %% i("api_toc_tcp_client_await_continue -> entry"),
27716:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan) of
27717:         ok ->
27718:             ok;
27719:         {ok, Extra} ->
27720:             Extra;
27721:         {error, Reason} ->
27722:             exit({await_continue, Slogan, Reason})
27723:     end.
27724: 
27725: api_toc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
27726:     %% i("api_toc_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
27727:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
27728:         ok ->
27729:             ok;
27730:         {error, Reason} ->
27731:             Reason
27732:     end.
27733: 
27734: api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout(To, ServerSA, Domain, ConLimit) ->
27735:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
27736:     NewSock = fun() ->
27737:                       S = case socket:open(Domain, stream, tcp) of
27738:                               {ok, Sock} ->
27739:                                   Sock;
27740:                               {error, OReason} ->
27741:                                   ?FAIL({open, OReason})
27742:                           end,
27743:                       case socket:bind(S, LSA) of
27744:                           ok ->
27745:                               S;
27746:                           {error, BReason} ->
27747:                               ?FAIL({bind, BReason})
27748:                       end
27749:               end,
27750:     api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout(1, ConLimit, To, ServerSA, NewSock, []).
27751: 
27752: api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout(ID, ConLimit, _To, _ServerSA, _NewSock, Acc)
27753:   when (ID > ConLimit) ->
27754:     api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout3(Acc),
27755:     {error, {connect_limit_reached, ID, ConLimit}};
27756: api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout(ID, ConLimit, To, ServerSA, NewSock, Acc) ->
27757:     case api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout2(ID, To, ServerSA, NewSock) of
27758:         ok ->
27759:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("success when number of socks: ~w", [length(Acc)]),
27760:             api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout3(Acc),
27761:             ok;
27762:         {ok, Sock} ->
27763:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("~w: unexpected success (connect)", [ID]),
27764:             api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout(ID+1, ConLimit,
27765:                                              To, ServerSA, NewSock,
27766:                                              [Sock|Acc]);
27767:         {error, _} = ERROR ->
27768:             ERROR
27769:     end.
27770: 
27771: api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout2(_ID, To, ServerSA, NewSock) ->
27772:     Sock = NewSock(),
27773:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("~w: try connect", [ID]),
27774:     Start = t(),
27775:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA, To) of
27776:         {error, timeout} ->
27777:             Stop  = t(),
27778:             TDiff = Stop - Start,
27779:             if
27780:                 (TDiff >= To) ->
27781:                     (catch socket:close(Sock)),
27782:                     ok;
27783:                 true ->
27784:                     (catch socket:close(Sock)),
27785:                     ?FAIL({unexpected_timeout, TDiff, To})
27786:             end;
27787:         {error, econnreset = _Reason} ->
27788:             (catch socket:close(Sock)),
27789:             ok;
27790:         {error, Reason} ->
27791:             (catch socket:close(Sock)),
27792:             ?FAIL({connect, Reason});
27793:         ok ->
27794:             {ok, Sock}
27795:     end.
27796: 
27797: api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout3([]) ->
27798:     ok;
27799: api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout3([Sock|Socka]) ->
27800:     (catch socket:close(Sock)),
27801:     api_to_connect_tcp_await_timeout3(Socka).
27802: 
27803: 
27804: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27805: 
27806: %% This test case is intended to test the accept timeout option
27807: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
27808: api_to_accept_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27809:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
27810:     tc_try(api_to_accept_tcp4,
27811:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
27812:            fun() ->
27813:                    InitState = #{domain => inet, timeout => 5000},
27814:                    ok = api_to_accept_tcp(InitState)
27815:            end).
27816: 
27817: 
27818: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27819: 
27820: %% This test case is intended to test the accept timeout option
27821: %% on an IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
27822: api_to_accept_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27823:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
27824:     tc_try(api_to_accept_tcp6,
27825:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
27826:            fun() ->
27827:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6, timeout => 5000},
27828:                    ok = api_to_accept_tcp(InitState)
27829:            end).
27830: 
27831: 
27832: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27833: 
27834: api_to_accept_tcp(InitState) ->
27835:     TesterSeq =
27836:         [
27837:          %% *** Init part ***
27838:          #{desc => "which local address",
27839:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27840:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
27841:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
27842:                    end},
27843:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
27844:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27845:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, tcp) of
27846:                                {ok, Sock} ->
27847:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
27848:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27849:                                    ERROR
27850:                            end
27851:                    end},
27852:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
27853:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
27854:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
27855:                                ok ->
27856:                                    ok;
27857:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27858:                                    ERROR
27859:                            end
27860:                    end},
27861:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
27862:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
27863:                            socket:listen(LSock)
27864:                    end},
27865: 
27866:          %% *** The actual test part ***
27867:          #{desc => "attempt to accept (without success)",
27868:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, timeout := To} = State) ->
27869:                            Start = t(),
27870:                            case socket:accept(LSock, To) of
27871:                                {error, timeout} ->
27872:                                    {ok, State#{start => Start, stop => t()}};
27873:                                {ok, Sock} ->
27874:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
27875:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
27876:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27877:                                    ERROR
27878:                            end
27879:                    end},
27880:          #{desc => "validate timeout time",
27881:            cmd  => fun(#{start := Start, stop := Stop, timeout := To} = _State) ->
27882:                            TDiff  = Stop - Start,
27883:                            if
27884:                                (TDiff >= To) ->
27885:                                    ok;
27886:                                true ->
27887:                                    {error, {unexpected_timeout, TDiff, To}}
27888:                            end
27889:                    end},
27890: 
27891:          %% *** Close (listen) socket ***
27892:          #{desc => "close (listen) socket",
27893:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
27894:                            sock_close(LSock),
27895:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
27896:                    end},
27897: 
27898:          %% *** We are done ***
27899:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
27900:         ],
27901: 
27902:     i("create tester evaluator"),
27903:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
27904: 
27905:     i("await evaluator"),
27906:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
27907: 
27908: 
27909: 
27910: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27911: 
27912: %% This test case is intended to test the multi accept timeout option
27913: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket with multiple acceptor processes 
27914: %% (three in this case).
27915: api_to_maccept_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27916:     ?TT(?SECS(20)),
27917:     tc_try(api_to_maccept_tcp4,
27918:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
27919:            fun() ->
27920:                    InitState = #{domain => inet, timeout => 5000},
27921:                    ok = api_to_maccept_tcp(InitState)
27922:            end).
27923: 
27924: 
27925: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27926: 
27927: %% This test case is intended to test the accept timeout option
27928: %% on an IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
27929: api_to_maccept_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
27930:     ?TT(?SECS(20)),
27931:     tc_try(api_to_maccept_tcp6,
27932:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
27933:            fun() ->
27934:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6, timeout => 5000},
27935:                    ok = api_to_maccept_tcp(InitState)
27936:            end).
27937: 
27938: 
27939: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
27940: 
27941: api_to_maccept_tcp(InitState) ->
27942:     PrimAcceptorSeq =
27943:         [
27944:          %% *** Init part ***
27945:          #{desc => "await start",
27946:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
27947:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
27948:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
27949:                    end},
27950:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
27951:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Pid} = _State) ->
27952:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
27953:                            ok
27954:                    end},
27955:          #{desc => "which local address",
27956:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27957:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
27958:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
27959:                    end},
27960:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
27961:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
27962:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, tcp) of
27963:                                {ok, Sock} ->
27964:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
27965:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27966:                                    ERROR
27967:                            end
27968:                    end},
27969:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
27970:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
27971:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
27972:                                ok ->
27973:                                    ok;
27974:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
27975:                                    ERROR
27976:                            end
27977:                    end},
27978:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
27979:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
27980:                            socket:listen(LSock)
27981:                    end},
27982:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
27983:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, tester := Tester}) ->
27984:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSock),
27985:                            ok
27986:                    end},
27987: 
27988:          %% *** The actual test ***
27989:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
27990:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
27991:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
27992:                    end},
27993:          #{desc => "attempt to accept (without success)",
27994:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, timeout := To} = State) ->
27995:                            Start = t(),
27996:                            case socket:accept(LSock, To) of
27997:                                {error, timeout} ->
27998:                                    {ok, State#{start => Start, stop => t()}};
27999:                                {ok, Sock} ->
28000:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected accept success: "
28001:                                                "~n   ~p", [Sock]),
28002:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
28003:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
28004:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28005:                                    ERROR
28006:                            end
28007:                    end},
28008:          #{desc => "validate timeout time",
28009:            cmd  => fun(#{start := Start, stop := Stop, timeout := To} = _State) ->
28010:                            TDiff  = Stop - Start,
28011:                            if
28012:                                (TDiff >= To) ->
28013:                                    ok;
28014:                                true ->
28015:                                    {error, {unexpected_timeout, TDiff, To}}
28016:                            end
28017:                    end},
28018:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
28019:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
28020:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
28021:                            ok
28022:                    end},
28023: 
28024:          %% *** Terminate ***
28025:          #{desc => "await terminate",
28026:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
28027:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester),
28028:                            ok
28029:                    end},
28030:          %% *** Close (listen) socket ***
28031:          #{desc => "close (listen) socket",
28032:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
28033:                            sock_close(LSock),
28034:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)}
28035:                    end},
28036: 
28037:          %% *** We are done ***
28038:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
28039:         ],
28040: 
28041: 
28042:     SecAcceptorSeq =
28043:         [
28044:          %% *** Init part ***
28045:          #{desc => "await start",
28046:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
28047:                            {Tester, LSock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
28048:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester,
28049:                                        lsock  => LSock}}
28050:                            
28051:                    end},
28052:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
28053:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Pid} = _State) ->
28054:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
28055:                            ok
28056:                    end},
28057:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
28058:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
28059:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
28060:                            ok
28061:                    end},
28062: 
28063:          %% *** The actual test part ***
28064:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
28065:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
28066:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
28067:                    end},
28068:          #{desc => "attempt to accept (without success)",
28069:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, timeout := To} = State) ->
28070:                            Start = t(),
28071:                            case socket:accept(LSock, To) of
28072:                                {error, timeout} ->
28073:                                    {ok, State#{start => Start, stop => t()}};
28074:                                {ok, Sock} ->
28075:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
28076:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
28077:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28078:                                    ERROR
28079:                            end
28080:                    end},
28081:          #{desc => "validate timeout time",
28082:            cmd  => fun(#{start := Start, stop := Stop, timeout := To} = State) ->
28083:                            TDiff  = Stop - Start,
28084:                            if
28085:                                (TDiff >= To) ->
28086:                                    State1 = maps:remove(start, State),
28087:                                    State2 = maps:remove(stop,  State1),
28088:                                    {ok, State2};
28089:                                true ->
28090:                                    {error, {unexpected_timeout, TDiff, To}}
28091:                            end
28092:                    end},
28093:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
28094:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
28095:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
28096:                            ok
28097:                    end},
28098: 
28099:          %% *** Terminate ***
28100:          #{desc => "await terminate",
28101:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
28102:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
28103:                                ok ->
28104:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
28105:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28106:                                    ERROR
28107:                            end
28108:                    end},
28109: 
28110:          %% *** We are done ***
28111:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
28112:         ],
28113: 
28114: 
28115:     TesterSeq =
28116:         [
28117:          %% Init part
28118:          #{desc => "monitor prim-acceptor",
28119:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
28120:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
28121:                            ok
28122:                    end},
28123:          #{desc => "monitor sec-acceptor 1",
28124:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor1 := Pid} = _State) ->
28125:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
28126:                            ok
28127:                    end},
28128:          #{desc => "monitor sec-acceptor 2",
28129:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor2 := Pid} = _State) ->
28130:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
28131:                            ok
28132:                    end},
28133: 
28134: 
28135:          %% Start the prim-acceptor
28136:          #{desc => "start prim-acceptor",
28137:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
28138:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
28139:                            ok
28140:                    end},
28141:          #{desc => "await prim-acceptor ready (init)",
28142:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
28143:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acceptor, init),
28144:                            {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}}
28145:                    end},
28146: 
28147:          %% Start sec-acceptor-1
28148:          #{desc => "start sec-acceptor 1",
28149:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor1 := Pid, lsock := LSock} = _State) ->
28150:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, LSock),
28151:                            ok
28152:                    end},
28153:          #{desc => "await sec-acceptor 1 ready (init)",
28154:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor1 := Pid} = _State) ->
28155:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acceptor1, init)
28156:                    end},
28157: 
28158:          %% Start sec-acceptor-2
28159:          #{desc => "start sec-acceptor 2",
28160:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor2 := Pid, lsock := LSock} = _State) ->
28161:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, LSock),
28162:                            ok
28163:                    end},
28164:          #{desc => "await sec-acceptor 2 ready (init)",
28165:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor2 := Pid} = _State) ->
28166:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acceptor2, init)
28167:                    end},
28168: 
28169:          %% Activate the acceptor(s)
28170:          #{desc => "active prim-acceptor",
28171:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
28172:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
28173:                            ok
28174:                    end},
28175:          #{desc => "active sec-acceptor 1",
28176:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor1 := Pid} = _State) ->
28177:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
28178:                            ok
28179:                    end},
28180:          #{desc => "active sec-acceptor 2",
28181:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor2 := Pid} = _State) ->
28182:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
28183:                            ok
28184:                    end},
28185: 
28186:          %% Await acceptor(s) completions
28187:          #{desc => "await prim-acceptor ready (accept)",
28188:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
28189:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acceptor, accept)
28190:                    end},
28191:          #{desc => "await sec-acceptor 1 ready (accept)",
28192:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor1 := Pid} = _State) ->
28193:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acceptor1, accept)
28194:                    end},
28195:          #{desc => "await sec-acceptor 2 ready (accept)",
28196:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor2 := Pid} = _State) ->
28197:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acceptor2, accept)
28198:                    end},
28199: 
28200:          %% Terminate
28201:          #{desc => "order prim-acceptor to terminate",
28202:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
28203:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
28204:                            ok
28205:                    end},
28206:          #{desc => "await prim-acceptor termination",
28207:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
28208:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
28209:                                ok ->
28210:                                    State1 = maps:remove(prim_acceptor, State),
28211:                                    {ok, State1};
28212:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28213:                                    ERROR
28214:                            end
28215:                    end},
28216:          #{desc => "order sec-acceptor 1 to terminate",
28217:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor1 := Pid} = _State) ->
28218:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
28219:                            ok
28220:                    end},
28221:          #{desc => "await sec-acceptor 1 termination",
28222:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor1 := Pid} = State) ->
28223:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
28224:                                ok ->
28225:                                    State1 = maps:remove(sec_acceptor1, State),
28226:                                    {ok, State1};
28227:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28228:                                    ERROR
28229:                            end
28230:                    end},
28231:          #{desc => "order sec-acceptor 2 to terminate",
28232:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor2 := Pid} = _State) ->
28233:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
28234:                            ok
28235:                    end},
28236:          #{desc => "await sec-acceptor 2 termination",
28237:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acceptor2 := Pid} = State) ->
28238:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
28239:                                ok ->
28240:                                    State1 = maps:remove(sec_acceptor2, State),
28241:                                    {ok, State1};
28242:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28243:                                    ERROR
28244:                            end
28245:                    end},
28246:          
28247:          %% *** We are done ***
28248:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
28249:         ],
28250: 
28251:     i("create prim-acceptor evaluator"),
28252:     PrimAInitState = InitState,
28253:     PrimAcceptor = ?SEV_START("prim-acceptor", PrimAcceptorSeq, PrimAInitState),
28254: 
28255:     i("create sec-acceptor 1 evaluator"),
28256:     SecAInitState1 = maps:remove(domain, InitState),
28257:     SecAcceptor1 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-1", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAInitState1),
28258:     
28259:     i("create sec-acceptor 2 evaluator"),
28260:     SecAInitState2 = SecAInitState1,
28261:     SecAcceptor2 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-2", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAInitState2),
28262: 
28263:     i("create tester evaluator"),
28264:     TesterInitState = #{prim_acceptor => PrimAcceptor#ev.pid,
28265:                         sec_acceptor1 => SecAcceptor1#ev.pid,
28266:                         sec_acceptor2 => SecAcceptor2#ev.pid},
28267:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
28268: 
28269:     i("await evaluator(s)"),
28270:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimAcceptor, SecAcceptor1, SecAcceptor2, Tester]).
28271: 
28272: 
28273: 
28274: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28275: 
28276: %% This test case is intended to test the send timeout option
28277: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
28278: api_to_send_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28279:     tc_try(api_to_send_tcp4,
28280:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
28281:            fun() ->
28282:                    not_yet_implemented()%% ,
28283:                    %% ok = api_to_send_tcp(inet)
28284:            end).
28285: 
28286: 
28287: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28288: 
28289: %% This test case is intended to test the send timeout option
28290: %% on an IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
28291: api_to_send_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28292:     tc_try(api_to_send_tcp6,
28293:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
28294:            fun() ->
28295:                    not_yet_implemented()%% ,
28296:                    %% ok = api_to_send_tcp(inet6)
28297:            end).
28298: 
28299: 
28300: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28301: 
28302: %% This test case is intended to test the sendto timeout option
28303: %% on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
28304: api_to_sendto_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28305:     tc_try(api_to_sendto_udp4,
28306:            fun () -> has_support_ipv4() end,
28307:            fun() ->
28308:                    not_yet_implemented()%% ,
28309:                    %% ok = api_to_sendto_to_udp(inet)
28310:            end).
28311: 
28312: 
28313: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28314: 
28315: %% This test case is intended to test the sendto timeout option
28316: %% on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
28317: api_to_sendto_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28318:     tc_try(api_to_sendto_udp6,
28319:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
28320:            fun() ->
28321:                    not_yet_implemented()%% ,
28322:                    %% ok = api_to_sendto_to_udp(inet6)
28323:            end).
28324: 
28325: 
28326: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28327: 
28328: %% This test case is intended to test the sendmsg timeout option
28329: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
28330: api_to_sendmsg_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28331:     tc_try(api_to_sendmsg_tcp4,
28332:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
28333:            fun() ->
28334:                    not_yet_implemented()%% ,
28335:                    %% ok = api_to_sendmsg_tcp(inet)
28336:            end).
28337: 
28338: 
28339: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28340: 
28341: %% This test case is intended to test the sendmsg timeout option
28342: %% on an IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
28343: api_to_sendmsg_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28344:     tc_try(api_to_sendmsg_tcp6,
28345:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
28346:            fun() ->
28347:                    not_yet_implemented()%% ,
28348:                    %% ok = api_to_sendmsg_tcp(inet6)
28349:            end).
28350: 
28351: 
28352: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28353: 
28354: %% This test case is intended to test the recv timeout option
28355: %% on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket. To test this we must connect
28356: %% the socket.
28357: api_to_recv_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28358:     tc_try(api_to_recv_udp4,
28359:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
28360:            fun() ->
28361:                    not_yet_implemented()%%,
28362:                    %%ok = api_to_recv_udp(inet)
28363:            end).
28364: 
28365: 
28366: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28367: 
28368: %% This test case is intended to test the recv timeout option
28369: %% on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket. To test this we must connect
28370: %% the socket.
28371: api_to_recv_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28372:     tc_try(api_to_recv_udp6,
28373:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
28374:            fun() ->
28375:                    not_yet_implemented()%% ,
28376:                    %% ok = api_to_recv_udp(inet6)
28377:            end).
28378: 
28379: 
28380: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28381: 
28382: %% This test case is intended to test the recv timeout option
28383: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
28384: api_to_recv_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28385:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28386:     tc_try(api_to_recv_tcp4,
28387:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
28388:            fun() ->
28389:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recv(Sock, 0, To) end,
28390:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet,
28391:                                  recv    => Recv,
28392:                                  timeout => 2000},
28393:                    ok = api_to_receive_tcp(InitState)
28394:            end).
28395: 
28396: 
28397: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28398: 
28399: %% This test case is intended to test the recv timeout option
28400: %% on an IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
28401: api_to_recv_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28402:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28403:     tc_try(api_to_recv_tcp6,
28404:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
28405:            fun() ->
28406:                    case socket:is_supported(ipv6) of
28407:                        true ->
28408:                            Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> 
28409:                                           socket:recv(Sock, 0, To)
28410:                                   end,
28411:                            InitState = #{domain  => inet6,
28412:                                          recv    => Recv,
28413:                                          timeout => 2000},
28414:                            ok = api_to_receive_tcp(InitState);
28415:                        false ->
28416:                            skip("ipv6 not supported")
28417:                    end
28418:            end).
28419: 
28420: 
28421: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28422: 
28423: api_to_receive_tcp(InitState) ->
28424:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
28425: 
28426:     ServerSeq = 
28427:         [
28428:          %% *** Wait for start order ***
28429:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
28430:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
28431:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
28432:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
28433:                    end},
28434:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
28435:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
28436:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
28437:                            ok
28438:                    end},
28439: 
28440:          %% *** Init part ***
28441:          #{desc => "which local address",
28442:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
28443:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
28444:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
28445:                    end},
28446:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
28447:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
28448:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, tcp) of
28449:                                {ok, Sock} ->
28450:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
28451:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28452:                                    ERROR
28453:                            end
28454:                    end},
28455:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
28456:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
28457:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
28458:                                ok ->
28459:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
28460:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
28461:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28462:                                    ERROR
28463:                            end
28464:                    end},
28465:          #{desc => "make listen socket (with backlog = 1)",
28466:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
28467:                            socket:listen(LSock, 1)
28468:                    end},
28469:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
28470:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, lport := Port}) ->
28471:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
28472:                            ok
28473:                    end},
28474: 
28475:          %% *** The actual test ***
28476:          #{desc => "await continue (accept and recv)",
28477:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
28478:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept_recv)
28479:                    end},
28480:          #{desc => "attempt accept",
28481:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
28482:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
28483:                                {ok, Sock} ->
28484:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
28485:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28486:                                    ERROR
28487:                            end
28488:                    end},
28489:          #{desc => "attempt to recv (without success)",
28490:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv, timeout := To} = State) ->
28491:                            Start = t(),
28492:                            case Recv(Sock, To) of
28493:                                {error, timeout} ->
28494:                                    {ok, State#{start => Start, stop => t()}};
28495:                                {ok, _Data} ->
28496:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
28497:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28498:                                    ERROR
28499:                            end
28500:                    end},
28501:          #{desc => "validate timeout time",
28502:            cmd  => fun(#{start := Start, stop := Stop, timeout := To} = State) ->
28503:                            TDiff  = Stop - Start,
28504:                            if
28505:                                (TDiff >= To) ->
28506:                                    State1 = maps:remove(start, State),
28507:                                    State2 = maps:remove(stop,  State1),
28508:                                    {ok, State2};
28509:                                true ->
28510:                                    {error, {unexpected_timeout, TDiff, To}}
28511:                            end
28512:                    end},
28513:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv timeout success)",
28514:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
28515:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_recv),
28516:                            ok
28517:                    end},
28518: 
28519:          %% *** Termination ***
28520:          #{desc => "await terminate",
28521:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
28522:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
28523:                                ok ->
28524:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
28525:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28526:                                    ERROR
28527:                            end
28528:                    end},
28529:          #{desc => "close (traffic) socket",
28530:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
28531:                            sock_close(Sock),
28532:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
28533:                    end},
28534:          #{desc => "close (listen) socket",
28535:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
28536:                            sock_close(LSock),
28537:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)}
28538:                    end},
28539: 
28540:          %% *** We are done ***
28541:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
28542:         ],
28543: 
28544:     ClientSeq =
28545:         [
28546:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
28547:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
28548:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
28549:                            {Tester, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
28550:                            {ok, State#{tester      => Tester,
28551:                                        server_port => Port}}
28552:                    end},
28553:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
28554:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
28555:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
28556:                            ok
28557:                    end},
28558: 
28559:          %% *** Init part ***
28560:          #{desc => "which local address",
28561:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, server_port := Port} = State) ->
28562:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
28563:                            SSA = LSA#{port => Port},
28564:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA, server_sa => SSA}}
28565:                    end},
28566:          #{desc => "create socket",
28567:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
28568:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, tcp) of
28569:                                {ok, Sock} ->
28570:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
28571:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28572:                                    ERROR
28573:                            end
28574:                    end},
28575:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
28576:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
28577:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
28578:                                ok ->
28579:                                    ok;
28580:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28581:                                    ERROR
28582:                            end
28583:                    end},
28584:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
28585:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
28586:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
28587:                            ok
28588:                    end},
28589: 
28590:          %% *** The actual test ***
28591:          #{desc => "await continue (with connect)",
28592:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
28593:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect)
28594:                    end},
28595:          #{desc => "connect",
28596:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, server_sa := SSA}) ->
28597:                            sock_connect(Sock, SSA),
28598:                            ok
28599:                    end},
28600: 
28601:          %% *** Termination ***
28602:          #{desc => "await terminate",
28603:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
28604:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
28605:                                ok ->
28606:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
28607:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28608:                                    ERROR
28609:                            end
28610:                    end},
28611:          #{desc => "close socket",
28612:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
28613:                            sock_close(Sock),
28614:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
28615:                    end},
28616: 
28617:          %% *** We are done ***
28618:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
28619:         ],
28620: 
28621:     TesterSeq =
28622:         [
28623:          %% *** Init part ***
28624:          #{desc => "monitor server",
28625:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
28626:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
28627:                            ok
28628:                    end},
28629:          #{desc => "monitor client",
28630:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
28631:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Client),
28632:                            ok
28633:                    end},
28634: 
28635:          %% *** Activate server ***
28636:          #{desc => "start server",
28637:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
28638:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Server),
28639:                            ok
28640:                    end},
28641:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
28642:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
28643:                            {ok, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, init),
28644:                            {ok, State#{server_port => Port}}
28645:                    end},
28646:          #{desc => "order server to continue (with accept)",
28647:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
28648:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, accept_recv),
28649:                            ok
28650:                    end},
28651: 
28652:          %% *** Activate client ***
28653:          #{desc => "start client",
28654:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client, server_port := Port} = _State) ->
28655:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, Port),
28656:                            ok
28657:                    end},
28658:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
28659:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
28660:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, init)
28661:                    end},
28662: 
28663:          %% *** The actual test ***
28664:          #{desc => "order client to continue (with connect)",
28665:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
28666:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
28667:                            ok
28668:                    end},
28669:          #{desc => "await server ready (accept/recv)",
28670:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
28671:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, accept_recv)
28672:                    end},
28673: 
28674:          %% *** Termination ***
28675:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
28676:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
