28677:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
28678:                            ok
28679:                    end},
28680:          #{desc => "await client termination",
28681:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
28682:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client) of
28683:                                ok ->
28684:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
28685:                                    {ok, State1};
28686:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28687:                                    ERROR
28688:                            end
28689:                    end},
28690:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
28691:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
28692:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
28693:                            ok
28694:                    end},
28695:          #{desc => "await server termination",
28696:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
28697:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server) of
28698:                                ok ->
28699:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
28700:                                    State2 = maps:remove(server_port, State1),
28701:                                    {ok, State2};
28702:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28703:                                    ERROR
28704:                            end
28705:                    end},
28706: 
28707:          %% *** We are done ***
28708:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
28709:         ],
28710: 
28711:     
28712:     i("start server evaluator"),
28713:     ServerInitState = InitState,
28714:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
28715: 
28716:     i("start client evaluator"),
28717:     ClientInitState = InitState,
28718:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
28719: 
28720:     i("start tester evaluator"),
28721:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid, 
28722:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
28723:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
28724: 
28725:     i("await evaluator(s)"),
28726:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
28727: 
28728: 
28729: 
28730: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28731: 
28732: %% This test case is intended to test the recvfrom timeout option
28733: %% on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
28734: api_to_recvfrom_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28735:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28736:     tc_try(api_to_recvfrom_udp4,
28737:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
28738:            fun() ->
28739:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvfrom(Sock, 0, To) end,
28740:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet,
28741:                                  recv    => Recv,
28742:                                  timeout => 2000},
28743:                    ok = api_to_receive_udp(InitState)
28744:            end).
28745: 
28746: 
28747: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28748: 
28749: %% This test case is intended to test the recvfrom timeout option
28750: %% on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
28751: api_to_recvfrom_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28752:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28753:     tc_try(api_to_recvfrom_udp6,
28754:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
28755:            fun() ->
28756:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvfrom(Sock, 0, To) end,
28757:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet6,
28758:                                  recv    => Recv,
28759:                                  timeout => 2000},
28760:                    ok = api_to_receive_udp(InitState)
28761:            end).
28762: 
28763: 
28764: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28765: 
28766: api_to_receive_udp(InitState) ->
28767:     TesterSeq =
28768:         [
28769:          %% *** Init part ***
28770:          #{desc => "which local address",
28771:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
28772:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
28773:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
28774:                    end},
28775:          #{desc => "create socket",
28776:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
28777:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, udp) of
28778:                                {ok, Sock} ->
28779:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
28780:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28781:                                    ERROR
28782:                            end
28783:                    end},
28784:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
28785:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
28786:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
28787:                                ok ->
28788:                                    ok;
28789:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28790:                                    ERROR
28791:                            end
28792:                    end},
28793: 
28794:          %% *** The actual test ***
28795:          #{desc => "attempt to read (without success)",
28796:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv, timeout := To} = State) ->
28797:                            Start = t(),
28798:                            case Recv(Sock, To) of
28799:                                {error, timeout} ->
28800:                                    {ok, State#{start => Start,
28801:                                                stop => t()}};
28802:                                {ok, _} ->
28803:                                    {error, unexpected_sucsess};
28804:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
28805:                                    ERROR
28806:                            end
28807:                    end},
28808:          #{desc => "validate timeout time",
28809:            cmd  => fun(#{start := Start, stop := Stop, timeout := To} = _State) ->
28810:                            TDiff  = Stop - Start,
28811:                            if
28812:                                (TDiff >= To) ->
28813:                                    ok;
28814:                                true ->
28815:                                    {error, {unexpected_timeout, TDiff, To}}
28816:                            end
28817:                    end},
28818:          
28819:          %% *** Termination ***
28820:          #{desc => "close socket",
28821:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
28822:                            %% socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
28823:                            sock_close(Sock),
28824:                            ok
28825:                    end},
28826: 
28827:          %% *** We are done ***
28828:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
28829:         ],
28830: 
28831:     i("start tester evaluator"),
28832:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, InitState),
28833:     
28834:     i("await evaluator"),
28835:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Tester]).
28836: 
28837: 
28838: 
28839: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28840: 
28841: %% This test case is intended to test the recvmsg timeout option
28842: %% on an IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
28843: api_to_recvmsg_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28844:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28845:     tc_try(api_to_recvmsg_udp4,
28846:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
28847:            fun() ->
28848:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
28849:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet,
28850:                                  recv    => Recv,
28851:                                  timeout => 2000},
28852:                    ok = api_to_receive_udp(InitState)
28853:            end).
28854: 
28855: 
28856: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28857: 
28858: %% This test case is intended to test the recvmsg timeout option
28859: %% on an IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
28860: api_to_recvmsg_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28861:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28862:     tc_try(api_to_recvmsg_udp6,
28863:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
28864:            fun() ->
28865:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
28866:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet6,
28867:                                  recv    => Recv,
28868:                                  timeout => 2000},
28869:                    ok = api_to_receive_udp(InitState)
28870:            end).
28871: 
28872: 
28873: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28874: 
28875: %% This test case is intended to test the recvmsg timeout option
28876: %% on an IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
28877: api_to_recvmsg_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28878:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28879:     tc_try(api_to_recvmsg_tcp4,
28880:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
28881:            fun() ->
28882:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
28883:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet,
28884:                                  recv    => Recv,
28885:                                  timeout => 2000},
28886:                    ok = api_to_receive_tcp(InitState)
28887:            end).
28888: 
28889: 
28890: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28891: 
28892: %% This test case is intended to test the recvmsg timeout option
28893: %% on an IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
28894: api_to_recvmsg_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28895:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28896:     tc_try(api_to_recvmsg_tcp6,
28897:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
28898:            fun() ->
28899:                    Recv = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
28900:                    InitState = #{domain  => inet6,
28901:                                  recv    => Recv,
28902:                                  timeout => 2000},
28903:                    ok = api_to_receive_tcp(InitState)
28904:            end).
28905: 
28906: 
28907: 
28908: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28909: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28910: %%                                                                     %%
28911: %%                             REGISTRY                                %%
28912: %%                                                                     %%
28913: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28914: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28915: 
28916: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
28917: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
28918: %% has the correct info.
28919: 
28920: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
28921:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
28922:     tc_try(reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count,
28923:            fun() ->
28924:                    ok = reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count()
28925:            end).
28926: 
28927: 
28928: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count() ->
28929:     socket:use_registry(true),
28930: 
28931:     {OS, _} = os:type(),
28932: 
28933:     %% We may have some sockets already existing.
28934:     %% Make sure we dont count them when we test.
28935:     Existing = socket:which_sockets(),
28936:     N = length(Existing),
28937:     SupportsIPV6 =
28938:         case (catch has_support_ipv6()) of
28939:             ok ->
28940:                 true;
28941:             _ ->
28942:                 false
28943:         end,
28944:     SupportsLOCAL =
28945:         case (catch has_support_unix_domain_socket()) of
28946:             ok ->
28947:                 true;
28948:             _ ->
28949:                 false
28950:         end,
28951:     SupportsSCTP =
28952:         case (catch has_support_sctp()) of
28953:             ok ->
28954:                 true;
28955:             _ ->
28956:                 false
28957:         end,
28958:     InitSockInfos =
28959:         [
28960:          {inet, stream, tcp},
28961:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
28962:         ] ++
28963:         case SupportsIPV6 of
28964:             true ->
28965:                 [
28966:                  {inet6, stream, tcp},
28967:                  {inet6, dgram,  udp}
28968:                 ];
28969:             false ->
28970:                 []
28971:         end ++
28972:         case SupportsLOCAL of
28973:             true when (OS =/= win32) ->
28974:                 [
28975:                  {local, stream, default},
28976:                  {local, dgram,  default}
28977:                 ];
28978:             true ->
28979:                 [
28980:                  {local, stream, default}
28981:                 ];
28982:             false ->
28983:                 []
28984:         end ++
28985:         [
28986:          {inet, stream, tcp},
28987:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
28988:         ] ++
28989:         case SupportsSCTP of
28990:             true ->
28991:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
28992:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
28993:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
28994:                 case socket:open(inet,
28995:                                  seqpacket,
28996:                                  sctp,
28997:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
28998:                     {ok, S} ->
28999:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
29000:                         (catch socket:close(S)),
29001:                         [
29002:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp},
29003:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp}
29004:                         ];
29005:                     {error, _} ->
29006:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
29007:                         []
29008:                 end;
29009:             false ->
29010:                 []
29011:         end ++
29012:         [
29013:          {inet, stream, tcp},
29014:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
29015:         ] ++
29016:         case SupportsSCTP andalso SupportsIPV6 of
29017:             true ->
29018:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
29019:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
29020:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
29021:                 case socket:open(inet6,
29022:                                  seqpacket,
29023:                                  sctp,
29024:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
29025:                     {ok, S6} ->
29026:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
29027:                         (catch socket:close(S6)),
29028:                         [
29029:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp},
29030:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp}
29031:                         ];
29032:                     {error, _} ->
29033:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
29034:                         []
29035:                 end;
29036:             false ->
29037:                 []
29038:         end,
29039: 
29040:     i("open sockets"),
29041:     Socks =
29042:         [fun({Domain, Type, Proto}) ->
29043:                  i("open socket: ~w, ~w, ~w", [Domain, Type, Proto]),
29044:                  {ok, Sock} = socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto),
29045:                  Sock
29046:          end(InitSockInfo) || InitSockInfo <- InitSockInfos],
29047: 
29048:     ?SLEEP(1000),
29049: 
29050: 
29051:     %% **** Total Number Of Sockets ****
29052: 
29053:     NumSocks1 = N + length(Socks),
29054:     NumberOf1 = socket:number_of(),
29055: 
29056:     i("verify (total) number of sockets(1): ~w, ~w",
29057:       [NumSocks1, NumberOf1]),
29058:     case (NumSocks1 =:= NumberOf1) of
29059:         true ->
29060:             ok;
29061:         false ->
29062:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets1, {NumSocks1, NumberOf1})
29063:     end,
29064: 
29065: 
29066:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 TCP Sockets ****
29067: 
29068:     %% inet, stream, tcp
29069:     SiNumTCP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, stream, tcp),
29070:     SrNumTCP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, stream, tcp),
29071: 
29072:     i("verify number of IPv4 TCP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP]),
29073:     case (SiNumTCP =:= SrNumTCP) of
29074:         true ->
29075:             ok;
29076:         false ->
29077:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_tcp_sockets, {SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP})
29078:     end,
29079: 
29080: 
29081:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 UDP Sockets ****
29082: 
29083:     %% inet, dgram, udp
29084:     SiNumUDP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, dgram, udp),
29085:     SrNumUDP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, dgram, udp),
29086: 
29087:     i("verify number of IPv4 UDP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP]),
29088:     case (SiNumUDP =:= SrNumUDP) of
29089:         true ->
29090:             ok;
29091:         false ->
29092:             exit({wrong_number_of_ipv4_udp_sockets, SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP})
29093:     end,
29094: 
29095: 
29096:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 SCTP Sockets ****
29097: 
29098:     %% inet, seqpacket, sctp
29099:     SiNumSCTP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
29100:     SrNumSCTP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
29101: 
29102:     i("verify number of IPv4 SCTP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP]),
29103:     case (SiNumSCTP =:= SrNumSCTP) of
29104:         true ->
29105:             ok;
29106:         false ->
29107:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sctp_sockets, {SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP})
29108:     end,
29109: 
29110: 
29111:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 Sockets ****
29112: 
29113:     %% inet
29114:     SiNumINET = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet),
29115:     SrNumINET = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet),
29116: 
29117:     i("verify number of IPv4 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET, SrNumINET]),
29118:     case (SiNumINET =:= SrNumINET) of
29119:         true ->
29120:             ok;
29121:         false ->
29122:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_sockets, {SiNumINET, SrNumINET})
29123:     end,
29124: 
29125: 
29126:     %% **** Number Of IPv6 Sockets ****
29127: 
29128:     %% inet6
29129:     SiNumINET6 = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet6),
29130:     SrNumINET6 = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet6),
29131: 
29132:     i("verify number of IPv6 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6]),
29133:     case (SiNumINET6 =:= SrNumINET6) of
29134:         true ->
29135:             ok;
29136:         false ->
29137:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv6_sockets, {SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6})
29138:     end,
29139: 
29140: 
29141:     %% **** Number Of Unix Domain Sockets Sockets ****
29142: 
29143:     %% local
29144:     SiNumLOCAL = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, local),
29145:     SrNumLOCAL = reg_sr_num(Existing, local),
29146: 
29147:     i("verify number of Unix Domain Sockets sockets: ~w, ~w",
29148:       [SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL]),
29149:     case (SiNumLOCAL =:= SrNumLOCAL) of
29150:         true ->
29151:             ok;
29152:         false ->
29153:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_local_sockets, {SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL})
29154:     end,
29155: 
29156: 
29157:     %% **** Close *all* Sockets then verify Number Of Sockets ****
29158: 
29159:     i("close sockets"),
29160:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
29161:                           i("close socket"),                          
29162:                           ok = socket:close(S)
29163:                   end, Socks),
29164: 
29165:     ?SLEEP(1000),
29166: 
29167:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
29168: 
29169:     i("verify number of sockets(2): ~w, ~w", [N, NumberOf2]),
29170:     case (N =:= NumberOf2) of
29171:         true ->
29172:             ok;
29173:         false ->
29174:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets2, {N, NumberOf2})
29175:     end,
29176: 
29177: 
29178:     i("verify owner sockets (none)", []),
29179:     Expected1 = [],
29180:     case socket:which_sockets(self()) of
29181:         Expected1 ->
29182:             ok;
29183:         Unexpected1 ->
29184:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own1, {Expected1, Unexpected1})
29185:     end,
29186: 
29187:     i("create some sockets", []),
29188:     OwnSockets = lists:sort(
29189:                    [fun({D, T})->
29190:                             i("create ~w:~w socket", [D, T]),
29191:                             {ok, OSocks} = socket:open(D, T, default),
29192:                             OSocks
29193:                     end(SockInfo) || SockInfo <-
29194:                                          [{inet, dgram},
29195:                                           {inet, dgram},
29196:                                           {inet, stream},
29197:                                           {inet, stream}]]),
29198: 
29199:     i("verify owner sockets (~w)", [length(OwnSockets)]),
29200:     case lists:sort(socket:which_sockets(self())) of
29201:         OwnSockets ->
29202:             ok;
29203:         Unexpected2 ->
29204:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own2, {OwnSockets, Unexpected2})
29205:     end,
29206: 
29207:     i("close (own) sockets"),
29208:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
29209:                           i("close socket"),                          
29210:                           ok = socket:close(S)
29211:                   end, OwnSockets),
29212:     ?SLEEP(1000),
29213: 
29214:     i("verify number of sockets(2) (again)"),
29215:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
29216: 
29217:     i("verify pre-existing sockets(2)", []),
29218:     case socket:which_sockets() of
29219:         Existing ->
29220:             ok;
29221:         OtherSockets ->
29222:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets2, {Existing, OtherSockets})
29223:     end,
29224: 
29225:     socket:use_registry(false),
29226:     ok.
29227: 
29228: 
29229: reg_si_fail(Reason, Extra) ->
29230:     socket:use_registry(false),
29231:     exit({Reason, Extra}).
29232: 
29233: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain)
29234:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6) orelse (Domain =:= local)) ->
29235:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined);
29236: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Type)
29237:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
29238:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined);
29239: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Proto)
29240:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
29241:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto).
29242: 
29243: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
29244:     F = fun({D, _T, _P}) when (D =:= Domain) -> true;
29245:            (_) -> false
29246:         end,
29247:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
29248: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined) ->
29249:     F = fun({_D, T, _P}) when (T =:= Type) -> true;
29250:            (_) -> false
29251:         end,
29252:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
29253: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto) ->
29254:     F = fun({_D, _T, P}) when (P =:= Proto) -> true;
29255:            (_) -> false
29256:         end,
29257:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
29258: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
29259:     F = fun({D, T, P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
29260:                             (T =:= Type) andalso
29261:                             (P =:= Proto) ->
29262:                 true;
29263:            (_) ->
29264:                 false
29265:         end,
29266:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo).
29267: 
29268: reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo) ->
29269:     length(lists:filter(F, SocksInfo)).
29270: 
29271: 
29272: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
29273:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6)) ->
29274:     length(socket:which_sockets(Domain) -- Existing);
29275: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
29276:   when (Domain =:= local) ->
29277:     reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined);
29278: reg_sr_num(Existing, Type)
29279:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
29280:     length(socket:which_sockets(Type) -- Existing);
29281: reg_sr_num(Existing, Proto)
29282:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
29283:     length(socket:which_sockets(Proto) -- Existing).
29284: 
29285: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
29286:     F = fun(#{domain := D}) when (D =:= Domain) ->
29287:                 true;
29288:            (_X) ->
29289:                 false
29290:         end,
29291:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F);
29292: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
29293:     F = fun(#{domain   := D,
29294:               type     := T,
29295:               protocol := P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
29296:                                    (T =:= Type) andalso
29297:                                    (P =:= Proto) ->
29298:                 true;
29299:            (_X) ->
29300:                 %% i("reg_sr_num -> not counting: "
29301:                 %%   "~n   ~p", [_X]),
29302:                 false
29303:         end,
29304:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F).
29305: 
29306: reg_sr_num2(Existing, F) ->
29307:     length(socket:which_sockets(F) -- Existing).
29308: 
29309: 
29310: 
29311: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
29312: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
29313: %% has the correct info.
29314: 
29315: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
29316:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
29317:     tc_try(reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count,
29318:            fun() ->
29319:                    ok = reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count()
29320:            end).
29321: 
29322: 
29323: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count() ->
29324:     i("Make sure use of socket registry is enabled (regardless of default)"),
29325:     socket:use_registry(true),
29326:     #{use_registry := true} = socket:info(),
29327: 
29328:     i("get current socket base count"),
29329:     Base = socket:number_of(),
29330: 
29331:     i("create a socket and ensure its counted"),
29332:     {ok, S1} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
29333:     Base1 = Base + 1,
29334:     case socket:number_of() of
29335:         Base1 ->
29336:             ok;
29337:         Invalid1 -> 
29338:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets1, Invalid1, Base + 1})
29339:     end,
29340:     i("close the socket and ensure its counted (back to base)"),
29341:     ok = socket:close(S1),
29342:     case socket:number_of() of
29343:         Base ->
29344:             ok;
29345:         Invalid2 -> 
29346:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets2, Invalid2, Base})
29347:     end,
29348: 
29349:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly off "
29350:       "and ensure its not counted"),
29351:     {ok, S2} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => false}),
29352:     case socket:number_of() of
29353:         Base ->
29354:             ok;
29355:         Invalid3 -> 
29356:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets3, Invalid3, Base})
29357:     end,
29358:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
29359:     ok = socket:close(S2),
29360:     case socket:number_of() of
29361:         Base ->
29362:             ok;
29363:         Invalid4 -> 
29364:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets4, Invalid4, Base})
29365:     end,
29366: 
29367:     i("Globally disable use of registry"),
29368:     socket:use_registry(false),
29369:     #{use_registry := false} = socket:info(),
29370:     i("create a socket and ensure its not counted"),
29371:     {ok, S3} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
29372:     case socket:number_of() of
29373:         Base ->
29374:             ok;
29375:         Invalid5 -> 
29376:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets5, Invalid5, Base})
29377:     end,
29378:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
29379:     ok = socket:close(S3),
29380:     case socket:number_of() of
29381:         Base ->
29382:             ok;
29383:         Invalid6 -> 
29384:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets6, Invalid6, Base})
29385:     end,
29386: 
29387:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly on "
29388:       "and ensure its counted"),
29389:     {ok, S4} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => true}),
29390:     case socket:number_of() of
29391:         Base1 ->
29392:             ok;
29393:         Invalid7 -> 
29394:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets7, Invalid7, Base + 1})
29395:     end,
29396:     i("close the socket and ensure counted (back to base)"),
29397:     ok = socket:close(S4),
29398:     case socket:number_of() of
29399:         Base ->
29400:             ok;
29401:         Invalid8 -> 
29402:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets8, Invalid8, Base})
29403:     end,
29404: 
29405:     socket:use_registry(false),
29406:     i("done"),
29407:     ok.
29408: 
29409: 
29410: 
29411: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
29412: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
29413: %%                                                                     %%
29414: %%                       SOCKET MONITOR                                %%
29415: %%                                                                     %%
29416: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
29417: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
29418: 
29419: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
29420: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then close socket.
29421: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
29422: 
29423: monitor_simple_open_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
29424:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
29425:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_close,
29426:            fun() ->
29427: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
29428:                                  type     => stream,
29429:                                  protocol => tcp},
29430:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState)
29431:            end).
29432: 
29433: 
29434: mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState) ->
29435:     OwnerSeq =
29436:         [
29437:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
29438:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
29439:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
29440:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
29441:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
29442:                    end},
29443:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
29444:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
29445:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
29446:                            ok
29447:                    end},
29448: 
29449:          %% *** Init part ***
29450:          #{desc => "create socket",
29451:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
29452:                          type     := Type, 
29453:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
29454:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
29455:                                {ok, Sock} ->
29456:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
29457:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
29458:                                    ERROR
29459:                            end
29460:                    end},
29461:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
29462:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29463:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
29464:                            ok
29465:                    end},
29466: 
29467:          %% The actual test
29468:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
29469:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
29470:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
29471:                    end},
29472: 
29473:          #{desc => "close socket",
29474:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
29475:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
29476: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
29477:                    end},
29478: 
29479:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
29480:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
29481:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
29482:                                ok ->
29483:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
29484:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
29485:                                    ERROR
29486:                            end
29487:                    end},
29488: 
29489:          %% *** We are done ***
29490:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
29491:         ],
29492: 
29493:     TesterSeq =
29494:         [
29495:          %% *** Init part ***
29496:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
29497:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
29498:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
29499:                            ok
29500:                    end},
29501:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
29502:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
29503:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
29504:                            ok
29505:                    end},
29506:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
29507:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
29508:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
29509:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
29510:                    end},
29511:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
29512:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29513: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29514: 			   ok
29515:                    end},
29516:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
29517:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29518: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
29519: 			   ok
29520:                    end},
29521:          #{desc => "monitor socket - create two",
29522:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
29523:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock),
29524:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock),
29525: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor(s): "
29526: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
29527: 				       "~n   2: ~p", [MRef1, MRef2]),
29528: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1, mon2 => MRef2}}
29529:                    end},
29530:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
29531:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29532: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29533: 			   ok
29534:                    end},
29535:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
29536:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29537: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
29538: 			   ok
29539:                    end},
29540:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (self) two",
29541:            cmd  => fun(#{mon1 := MRef1,
29542: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
29543: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
29544: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(self())) of
29545: 			       Mons ->
29546: 				   ok;
29547: 			       SMons ->
29548: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (self) monitors: "
29549: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
29550: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
29551: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
29552: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
29553: 			   end
29554:                    end},
29555:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (sock) two",
29556:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
29557: 			 mon1 := MRef1,
29558: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
29559: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
29560: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(Sock)) of
29561: 			       Mons ->
29562: 				   ok;
29563: 			       SMons ->
29564: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (sock) monitors: "
29565: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
29566: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
29567: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
29568: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
29569: 			   end
29570:                    end},
29571:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
29572:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29573: 			   Self   = self(),
29574: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
29575: 			   ok
29576:                    end},
29577: 
29578:          %% The actual test
29579:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
29580:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
29581:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
29582:                            ok
29583:                    end},
29584:          #{desc => "await socket down 1",
29585:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
29586: 			 mon1 := MRef} = State) ->
29587: 			   receive
29588: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
29589: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
29590: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
29591: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
29592: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
29593: 					       [MRef,
29594: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
29595: 						Info]),
29596: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon1, State)}
29597: 			   after 5000 ->
29598: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
29599: 				   {error, timeout}
29600: 			   end
29601:                    end},
29602:          #{desc => "await socket down 2",
29603:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
29604: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
29605: 			   receive
29606: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
29607: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
29608: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
29609: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
29610: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
29611: 					       [MRef,
29612: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
29613: 						Info]),
29614: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon2, State)}
29615: 			   after 5000 ->
29616: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
29617: 				   {error, timeout}
29618: 			   end
29619:                    end},
29620:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
29621:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29622: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29623: 			   ok
29624:                    end},
29625:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
29626:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29627: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
29628: 			   ok
29629:                    end},
29630:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
29631:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29632: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
29633: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
29634: 			   ok
29635:                    end},
29636:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
29637:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29638: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
29639: 			   ok
29640:                    end},
29641: 
29642:          %% Cleanup
29643:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
29644:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
29645:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
29646:                            ok
29647:                    end},
29648: 
29649:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
29650:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
29651:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
29652:                                ok ->
29653:                                    ok;
29654:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
29655:                                    ERROR
29656:                            end
29657:                    end},
29658: 
29659:          %% *** We are done ***
29660:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
29661:         ],
29662: 
29663:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
29664:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
29665: 
29666:     i("start tester evaluator"),
29667:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
29668:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
29669: 
29670:     i("await evaluator"),
29671:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
29672: 
29673: 
29674: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
29675: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then stop the
29676: %% owner process.
29677: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
29678: 
29679: monitor_simple_open_and_exit(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
29680:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
29681:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_exit,
29682:            fun() ->
29683: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
29684:                                  type     => stream,
29685:                                  protocol => tcp},
29686:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState)
29687:            end).
29688: 
29689: 
29690: mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState) ->
29691:     OwnerSeq =
29692:         [
29693:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
29694:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
29695:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
29696:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
29697:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
29698:                    end},
29699:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
29700:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
29701:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
29702:                            ok
29703:                    end},
29704: 
29705:          %% *** Init part ***
29706:          #{desc => "create socket",
29707:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
29708:                          type     := Type, 
29709:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
29710:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
29711:                                {ok, Sock} ->
29712:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
29713:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
29714:                                    ERROR
29715:                            end
29716:                    end},
29717:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
29718:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29719:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
29720:                            ok
29721:                    end},
29722: 
29723:          %% The actual test
29724:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
29725:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
29726:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
29727:                                ok ->
29728:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
29729:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
29730:                                    ERROR
29731:                            end
29732:                    end},
29733: 
29734:          %% *** We are done ***
29735:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
29736:         ],
29737: 
29738:     TesterSeq =
29739:         [
29740:          %% *** Init part ***
29741:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
29742:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
29743:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
29744:                            ok
29745:                    end},
29746:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
29747:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
29748:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
29749:                            ok
29750:                    end},
29751:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
29752:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
29753:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
29754:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
29755:                    end},
29756:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
29757:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29758: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29759: 			   ok
29760:                    end},
29761:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
29762:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29763: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
29764: 			   ok
29765:                    end},
29766:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
29767:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
29768:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
29769: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
29770: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
29771:                    end},
29772:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
29773:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29774: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29775: 			   ok
29776:                    end},
29777:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
29778:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29779: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
29780: 			   ok
29781:                    end},
29782:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
29783:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
29784: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
29785: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
29786: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
29787: 			   ok
29788:                    end},
29789:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
29790:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29791: 			   Self   = self(),
29792: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
29793: 			   ok
29794:                    end},
29795: 
29796:          %% The actual test
29797:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
29798:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
29799:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
29800:                            ok
29801:                    end},
29802:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
29803:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
29804:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
29805:                                ok ->
29806:                                    ok;
29807:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
29808:                                    ERROR
29809:                            end
29810:                    end},
29811: 
29812:          #{desc => "await socket down",
29813:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
29814: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
29815: 			   receive
29816: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
29817: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
29818: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
29819: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
29820: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
29821: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
29822: 				   ok
29823: 			   after 5000 ->
29824: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
29825: 				   {error, timeout}
29826: 			   end
29827:                    end},
29828:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
29829:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29830: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29831: 			   ok
29832:                    end},
29833:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
29834:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29835: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
29836: 			   ok
29837:                    end},
29838:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
29839:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29840: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
29841: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
29842: 			   ok
29843:                    end},
29844:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
29845:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29846: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
29847: 			   ok
29848:                    end},
29849: 
29850:          %% *** We are done ***
29851:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
29852:         ],
29853: 
29854:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
29855:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
29856: 
29857:     i("start tester evaluator"),
29858:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
29859:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
29860: 
29861:     i("await evaluator"),
29862:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
29863: 
29864: 
29865: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
29866: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process, cancel_montor
29867: %% (demonitor) and then close socket.
29868: %% The process that did the monitor shall *not* receive a socket DOWN.
29869: 
29870: monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
29871:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
29872:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close,
29873:            fun() ->
29874: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
29875:                                  type     => stream,
29876:                                  protocol => tcp},
29877:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState)
29878:            end).
29879: 
29880: 
29881: mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState) ->
29882:     OwnerSeq =
29883:         [
29884:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
29885:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
29886:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
29887:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
29888:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
29889:                    end},
29890:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
29891:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
29892:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
29893:                            ok
29894:                    end},
29895: 
29896:          %% *** Init part ***
29897:          #{desc => "create socket",
29898:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
29899:                          type     := Type, 
29900:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
29901:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
29902:                                {ok, Sock} ->
29903:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
29904:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
29905:                                    ERROR
29906:                            end
29907:                    end},
29908:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
29909:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
29910:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
29911:                            ok
29912:                    end},
29913: 
29914:          %% The actual test
29915:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
29916:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
29917:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
29918:                    end},
29919: 
29920:          #{desc => "close socket",
29921:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
29922:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
29923: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
29924:                    end},
29925: 
29926:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
29927:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
29928:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
29929:                                ok ->
29930:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
29931:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
29932:                                    ERROR
29933:                            end
29934:                    end},
29935: 
29936:          %% *** We are done ***
29937:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
29938:         ],
29939: 
29940:     TesterSeq =
29941:         [
29942:          %% *** Init part ***
29943:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
29944:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
29945:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
29946:                            ok
29947:                    end},
29948:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
29949:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
29950:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
29951:                            ok
29952:                    end},
29953:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
29954:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
29955:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
29956:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
29957:                    end},
29958:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
29959:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29960: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29961: 			   ok
29962:                    end},
29963:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
29964:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29965: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
29966: 			   ok
29967:                    end},
29968:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
29969:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
29970:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
29971: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
29972: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
29973:                    end},
29974:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
29975:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29976: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29977: 			   ok
29978:                    end},
29979:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
29980:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29981: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
29982: 			   ok
29983:                    end},
29984: 
29985:          %% The actual test
29986:          #{desc => "demonitor socket",
29987:            cmd  => fun(#{mon := MRef} = State) ->
29988:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef),
29989: 			   {ok, maps:remove(mon, State)}
29990:                    end},
29991: 
29992: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
29993: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29994: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
29995: 			   ok
29996: 		   end},
29997: 	 #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
29998: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
29999: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
30000: 			   ok
30001: 		   end},
30002: 
30003:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
30004:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30005:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
30006:                            ok
30007:                    end},
30008: 
30009:          #{desc => "await socket down",
30010:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
30011: 			   receive
30012: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
30013: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("received UNEXPECTED down: "
30014: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
30015: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
30016: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
30017: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
30018: 				   {error, unexpected_down}
30019: 			   after 5000 ->
30020: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("expected socket down timeout"),
30021: 				   ok
30022: 			   end
30023:                    end},
30024: 
30025:          %% Cleanup
30026:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
30027:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30028:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
30029:                            ok
30030:                    end},
30031: 
30032:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
30033:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30034:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
30035:                                ok ->
30036:                                    ok;
30037:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30038:                                    ERROR
30039:                            end
30040:                    end},
30041: 
30042:          %% *** We are done ***
30043:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
30044:         ],
30045: 
30046:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
30047:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
30048: 
30049:     i("start tester evaluator"),
30050:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
30051:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
30052: 
30053:     i("await evaluator"),
30054:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
30055: 
30056: 
30057: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
30058: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then close
30059: %% socket. The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
30060: 
30061: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
30062:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
30063:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks,
30064:            fun() ->
30065: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
30066:                                  type     => stream,
30067:                                  protocol => tcp},
30068:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
30069:            end).
30070: 
30071: 
30072: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
30073:     OwnerSeq =
30074:         [
30075:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
30076:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
30077:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
30078:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
30079:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
30080:                    end},
30081:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
30082:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
30083:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
30084:                            ok
30085:                    end},
30086: 
30087:          %% *** Init part ***
30088:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
30089:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30090:                          type     := Type, 
30091:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30092:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30093:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30094:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
30095:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30096:                                    ERROR
30097:                            end
30098:                    end},
30099:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
30100:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30101:                          type     := Type, 
30102:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30103:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30104:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30105:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
30106:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30107:                                    ERROR
30108:                            end
30109:                    end},
30110:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
30111:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30112:                          type     := Type, 
30113:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30114:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30115:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30116:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
30117:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30118:                                    ERROR
30119:                            end
30120:                    end},
30121:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
30122:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30123:                          type     := Type, 
30124:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30125:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30126:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30127:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
30128:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30129:                                    ERROR
30130:                            end
30131:                    end},
30132:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
30133:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30134:                          type     := Type, 
30135:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30136:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30137:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30138:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
30139:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30140:                                    ERROR
30141:                            end
30142:                    end},
30143:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
30144:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
30145: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
30146: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
30147: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
30148: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
30149: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
30150: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
30151:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
30152:                            ok
30153:                    end},
30154: 
30155:          %% The actual test
30156:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
30157:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
30158:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
30159:                    end},
30160:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
30161:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
30162:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
30163: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
30164:                    end},
30165: 
30166:          #{desc => "await continue (close2)",
30167:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
30168:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close2)
30169:                    end},
30170:          #{desc => "close socket 2",
30171:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock} = State) ->
30172:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
30173: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock2, State)}
30174:                    end},
30175: 
30176:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
30177:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
30178:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
30179:                    end},
30180:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
30181:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
30182:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
30183: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
30184:                    end},
30185: 
30186:          #{desc => "await continue (close4)",
30187:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
30188:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close4)
30189:                    end},
30190:          #{desc => "close socket 4",
30191:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock} = State) ->
30192:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
30193: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock4, State)}
30194:                    end},
30195: 
30196:          #{desc => "await continue (close5)",
30197:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
30198:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
30199:                    end},
30200:          #{desc => "close socket 5",
30201:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
30202:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
30203: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
30204:                    end},
30205: 
30206:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
30207:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
30208:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
30209:                                ok ->
30210:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
30211:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30212:                                    ERROR
30213:                            end
30214:                    end},
30215: 
30216:          %% *** We are done ***
30217:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
30218:         ],
30219: 
30220:     TesterSeq =
30221:         [
30222:          %% *** Init part ***
30223:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
30224:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
30225:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
30226:                            ok
30227:                    end},
30228:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
30229:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30230:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
30231:                            ok
30232:                    end},
30233:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
30234:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
30235:                            {ok, [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5]} =
30236: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
30237:                            {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock1,
30238: 				       sock2 => Sock2,
30239: 				       sock3 => Sock3,
30240: 				       sock4 => Sock4,
30241: 				       sock5 => Sock5}}
30242:                    end},
30243:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
30244:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30245: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
30246: 			   ok
30247:                    end},
30248:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
30249:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30250: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
30251: 			   ok
30252:                    end},
30253:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
30254:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock1,
30255: 			 sock2 := Sock2,
30256: 			 sock3 := Sock3,
30257: 			 sock4 := Sock4,
30258: 			 sock5 := Sock5} = State) ->
30259:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock1),
30260:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock2),
30261:                            MRef3 = socket:monitor(Sock3),
30262:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
30263:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
30264: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors:"
30265: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
30266: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
30267: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
30268: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
30269: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
30270: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
30271: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
30272: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
30273: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
30274: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
30275: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
30276:                    end},
30277:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=5)",
30278:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30279: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
30280: 			   ok
30281:                    end},
30282:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=5)",
30283:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30284: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
30285: 			   ok
30286:                    end},
30287: 
30288:          %% The actual test
30289:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 1",
30290:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30291:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close1),
30292:                            ok
30293:                    end},
30294:          #{desc => "await socket 1 down",
30295:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock,
30296: 			 mon1  := MRef} = State) ->
30297: 			   receive
30298: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
30299: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
30300: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
30301: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
30302: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
30303: 					       [MRef,
30304: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
30305: 						Info]),
30306: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
30307: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
30308: 				   {ok, State3}
30309: 			   after 5000 ->
30310: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
30311: 				   {error, timeout}
30312: 			   end
30313:                    end},
30314:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=4)",
30315:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30316: 			   4 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
30317: 			   ok
30318:                    end},
30319:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=4)",
30320:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30321: 			   4 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
30322: 			   ok
30323:                    end},
30324: 
30325:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 2",
30326:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30327:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close2),
30328:                            ok
30329:                    end},
30330:          #{desc => "await socket 2 down",
30331:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock,
30332: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
30333: 			   receive
30334: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
30335: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
30336: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
30337: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
30338: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
30339: 					       [MRef,
30340: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
30341: 						Info]),
30342: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock2, State),
30343: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon2,  State2),
30344: 				   {ok, State3}
30345: 			   after 5000 ->
30346: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
30347: 				   {error, timeout}
30348: 			   end
30349:                    end},
30350:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=3)",
30351:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30352: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
30353: 			   ok
30354:                    end},
30355:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=3)",
30356:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30357: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
30358: 			   ok
30359:                    end},
30360: 
30361:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 3",
30362:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30363:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close3),
30364:                            ok
30365:                    end},
30366:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
30367:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
30368: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
30369: 			   receive
30370: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
30371: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
30372: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
30373: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
30374: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
30375: 					       [MRef,
30376: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
30377: 						Info]),
30378: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
30379: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
30380: 				   {ok, State3}
30381: 			   after 5000 ->
30382: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
30383: 				   {error, timeout}
30384: 			   end
30385:                    end},
30386:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
30387:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30388: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
30389: 			   ok
30390:                    end},
30391:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
30392:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30393: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
30394: 			   ok
30395:                    end},
30396: 
30397:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 4",
30398:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30399:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close4),
30400:                            ok
30401:                    end},
30402:          #{desc => "await socket 4 down",
30403:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock,
30404: 			 mon4  := MRef} = State) ->
30405: 			   receive
30406: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
30407: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
30408: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
30409: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
30410: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
30411: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
30412: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock4, State),
30413: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon4,  State2),
30414: 				   {ok, State3}
30415: 			   after 5000 ->
30416: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
30417: 				   {error, timeout}
30418: 			   end
30419:                    end},
30420:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
30421:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30422: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
30423: 			   ok
30424:                    end},
30425:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
30426:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30427: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
30428: 			   ok
30429:                    end},
30430: 
30431:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 5",
30432:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30433:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close5),
30434:                            ok
30435:                    end},
30436:          #{desc => "await socket 5 down",
30437:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock,
30438: 			 mon5  := MRef} = State) ->
30439: 			   receive
30440: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
30441: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
30442: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
30443: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
30444: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
30445: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
30446: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock5, State),
30447: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon5,  State2),
30448: 				   {ok, State3}
30449: 			   after 5000 ->
30450: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
30451: 				   {error, timeout}
30452: 			   end
30453:                    end},
30454:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
30455:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30456: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
30457: 			   ok
30458:                    end},
30459:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
30460:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
30461: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
30462: 			   ok
30463:                    end},
30464: 
30465:          %% Cleanup
30466:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
30467:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30468:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
30469:                            ok
30470:                    end},
30471: 
30472:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
30473:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
30474:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
30475:                                ok ->
30476:                                    ok;
30477:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30478:                                    ERROR
30479:                            end
30480:                    end},
30481: 
30482:          %% *** We are done ***
30483:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
30484:         ],
30485: 
30486:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
30487:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
30488: 
30489:     i("start tester evaluator"),
30490:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
30491:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
30492: 
30493:     i("await evaluator"),
30494:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
30495: 
30496: 
30497: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
30498: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then exit
30499: %% the owner process.
30500: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
30501: 
30502: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
30503:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
30504:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks,
30505:            fun() ->
30506: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
30507:                                  type     => stream,
30508:                                  protocol => tcp},
30509:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState)
30510:            end).
30511: 
30512: 
30513: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState) ->
30514:     OwnerSeq =
30515:         [
30516:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
30517:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
30518:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
30519:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
30520:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
30521:                    end},
30522:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
30523:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
30524:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
30525:                            ok
30526:                    end},
30527: 
30528:          %% *** Init part ***
30529:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
30530:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30531:                          type     := Type, 
30532:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30533:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30534:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30535:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
30536:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30537:                                    ERROR
30538:                            end
30539:                    end},
30540:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
30541:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30542:                          type     := Type, 
30543:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30544:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30545:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30546:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
30547:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30548:                                    ERROR
30549:                            end
30550:                    end},
30551:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
30552:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30553:                          type     := Type, 
30554:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30555:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30556:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30557:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
30558:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30559:                                    ERROR
30560:                            end
30561:                    end},
30562:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
30563:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30564:                          type     := Type, 
30565:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30566:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30567:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30568:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
30569:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
30570:                                    ERROR
30571:                            end
30572:                    end},
30573:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
30574:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
30575:                          type     := Type, 
30576:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
30577:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
30578:                                {ok, Sock} ->
30579:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
