34159: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon,  State),
34160: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
34161: 				   {ok, State3}
34162: 			   after 1000 ->
34163: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
34164: 				   {error, timeout}
34165: 			   end
34166:                    end},
34167: 
34168:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
34169:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
34170:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
34171:                            ok
34172:                    end},
34173: 
34174: 
34175:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
34176:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
34177:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
34178:                                ok ->
34179:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
34180:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34181:                                    ERROR
34182:                            end
34183:                    end},
34184: 
34185:          %% *** We are done ***
34186:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
34187:         ],
34188: 
34189:     TesterSeq =
34190:         [
34191:          %% *** Init part ***
34192:          #{desc => "monitor 'owner'",
34193:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
34194:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
34195:                            ok
34196:                    end},
34197:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
34198:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
34199:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
34200:                            ok
34201:                    end},
34202:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
34203:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
34204:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
34205:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
34206:                    end},
34207: 
34208:          #{desc => "monitor client",
34209:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
34210:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
34211:                            ok
34212:                    end},
34213:          #{desc => "order client start",
34214:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
34215:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
34216:                            ok
34217:                    end},
34218:          #{desc => "await client ready",
34219:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
34220:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
34221:                    end},
34222:          #{desc => "send socket to client",
34223:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid,
34224: 			 sock   := Sock} = _State) ->
34225:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, socket, Sock),
34226:                            ok
34227:                    end},
34228: 
34229:          %% The actual test
34230:          %% There is no way we can actually know that the "system"
34231:          %% does not create *any* sockets...
34232:          #{desc => "order client to monitor",
34233:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
34234:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, monitor),
34235:                            ok
34236:                    end},
34237:          #{desc => "await client ready",
34238:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
34239:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, monitor)
34240:                    end},
34241: 
34242:          #{desc => "order client to await down",
34243:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
34244:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, down),
34245:                            ok
34246:                    end},
34247: 
34248: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
34249: 
34250:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
34251:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
34252:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
34253:                            ok
34254:                    end},
34255:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
34256:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
34257:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
34258:                                ok ->
34259:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
34260:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34261:                                    ERROR
34262:                            end
34263:                    end},
34264: 
34265:          #{desc => "await client ready",
34266:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
34267:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, down)
34268:                    end},
34269: 
34270: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
34271:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
34272: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
34273: 			   ok
34274:                    end},
34275: 
34276: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
34277: 
34278:          %% Cleanup
34279:          #{desc => "order client terminate",
34280:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
34281:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
34282:                            ok
34283:                    end},
34284:          #{desc => "await client termination",
34285:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
34286:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
34287:                                ok ->
34288:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
34289:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34290:                                    ERROR
34291:                            end
34292:                    end},
34293: 
34294:          %% *** We are done ***
34295:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
34296:         ],
34297: 
34298:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
34299:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
34300: 
34301:     i("start client  evaluator"),
34302:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, InitState),
34303: 
34304:     i("start tester evaluator"),
34305:     TesterInitState = #{owner  => Owner#ev.pid,
34306: 			client => Client#ev.pid},
34307:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
34308: 
34309:     i("await evaluator"),
34310:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Client, Tester]).
34311: 
34312: 
34313: 
34314: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34315: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34316: %%                                                                     %%
34317: %%                         SOCKET CLOSURE                              %%
34318: %%                                                                     %%
34319: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34320: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34321: 
34322: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34323: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
34324: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
34325: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
34326: 
34327: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34328:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
34329:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4,
34330:            fun() ->
34331:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
34332:                                  type     => stream,
34333:                                  protocol => tcp},
34334:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
34335:            end).
34336: 
34337: 
34338: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34339: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
34340: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
34341: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
34342: 
34343: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34344:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
34345:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6,
34346:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
34347:            fun() ->
34348:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
34349:                                  type     => stream,
34350:                                  protocol => tcp},
34351:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
34352:            end).
34353: 
34354: 
34355: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34356: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
34357: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
34358: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (stream) socket (TCP).
34359: 
34360: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34361:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
34362:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL,
34363:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
34364:            fun() ->
34365:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
34366:                                  type     => stream,
34367:                                  protocol => default},
34368:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
34369:            end).
34370: 
34371: 
34372: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34373: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
34374: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
34375: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
34376: 
34377: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34378:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
34379:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4,
34380:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
34381:            fun() ->
34382:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
34383:                                  type     => dgram,
34384:                                  protocol => udp},
34385:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
34386:            end).
34387: 
34388: 
34389: 
34390: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34391: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
34392: %% (removed) when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
34393: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
34394: 
34395: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34396:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
34397:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6,
34398:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
34399:            fun() ->
34400:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
34401:                                  type     => dgram,
34402:                                  protocol => udp},
34403:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
34404:            end).
34405: 
34406: 
34407: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34408: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
34409: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
34410: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (dgram) socket (UDP).
34411: 
34412: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34413:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
34414:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL,
34415:            fun() ->
34416: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
34417: 		   is_not_windows()
34418: 	   end,
34419:            fun() ->
34420:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
34421:                                  type     => dgram,
34422:                                  protocol => default},
34423:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
34424:            end).
34425: 
34426: 
34427: 
34428: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34429: 
34430: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState) ->
34431:     OwnerSeq =
34432:         [
34433:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
34434:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
34435:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
34436:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
34437:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
34438:                    end},
34439:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
34440:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
34441:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
34442:                            ok
34443:                    end},
34444: 
34445:          %% *** Init part ***
34446:          #{desc => "create socket",
34447:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
34448:                          type     := Type, 
34449:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
34450:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
34451:                                {ok, Sock} ->
34452:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
34453:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34454:                                    ERROR
34455:                            end
34456:                    end},
34457:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
34458:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
34459:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
34460:                            ok
34461:                    end},
34462: 
34463:          %% *** The actual test ***
34464:          %% We *intentionally* leave the socket "as is", no explicit close
34465:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
34466:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
34467:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
34468:                                ok ->
34469:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
34470:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34471:                                    ERROR
34472:                            end
34473:                    end},
34474: 
34475:          %% *** We are done ***
34476:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
34477:         ],
34478: 
34479:     TesterSeq =
34480:         [
34481:          %% *** Init part ***
34482:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
34483:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
34484:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
34485:                            ok
34486:                    end},
34487:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
34488:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
34489:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
34490:                            ok
34491:                    end},
34492:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
34493:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
34494:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
34495:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
34496:                    end},
34497:          #{desc => "verify owner as controlling-process",
34498:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
34499:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
34500:                                {ok, Pid} ->
34501:                                    ok;
34502:                                {ok, Other} ->
34503:                                    {error, {unexpected_owner, Other}};
34504:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34505:                                    ERROR
34506:                            end
34507:                    end},
34508:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
34509:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
34510:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
34511:                            ok
34512:                    end},
34513:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
34514:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
34515:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
34516:                                ok ->
34517:                                    ok;
34518:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34519:                                    ERROR
34520:                            end
34521:                    end},
34522: 
34523:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(5)),
34524: 
34525:          %% The reason we get closed, is that as long as there is a ref to 
34526:          %% the resource (socket), then it will not be garbage collected.
34527:          %% Note that its still a race that the nif has processed that the
34528:          %% "controlling process" has terminated. There really is no 
34529:          %% proper timeout for this, but the 5 seconds "should" be enough...
34530:          %% We should really have some way to subscribe to socket events...
34531:          #{desc => "verify no socket (closed)",
34532:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
34533:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
34534:                                {ok, OtherPid} ->
34535:                                    {error, {unexpected_success, Pid, OtherPid}};
34536:                                {error, closed} ->
34537:                                    ok;
34538:                                {error, Reason} ->
34539:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected failure: ~p", [Reason]),
34540:                                    {error, {unexpected_failure, Reason}}
34541:                            end
34542:                    end},
34543: 
34544:          %% *** We are done ***
34545:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
34546:         ],
34547: 
34548:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
34549:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
34550: 
34551:     i("start tester evaluator"),
34552:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
34553:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
34554: 
34555:     i("await evaluator"),
34556:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
34557: 
34558: 
34559: 
34560: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34561: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
34562: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recv function.
34563: %% Socket is IPv4.
34564: %% 
34565: %% <KOLLA>
34566: %% 
34567: %% We should really have a similar test cases for when the controlling
34568: %% process exits and there are other processes in recv, accept, and 
34569: %% all the other functions.
34570: %% 
34571: %% </KOLLA>
34572: 
34573: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34574:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
34575:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4,
34576:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
34577:            fun() ->
34578:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
34579:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
34580:                                  protocol => tcp,
34581:                                  recv     => Recv},
34582:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
34583:            end).
34584: 
34585: 
34586: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34587: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
34588: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
34589: %% Socket is IPv6.
34590: 
34591: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34592:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
34593:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6,
34594:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
34595:            fun() ->
34596:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
34597:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
34598:                                  protocol => tcp,
34599:                                  recv     => Recv},
34600:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
34601:            end).
34602: 
34603: 
34604: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34605: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
34606: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
34607: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
34608: 
34609: sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
34610:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
34611:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL,
34612:            fun() ->
34613: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket()
34614: 	   end,
34615:            fun() ->
34616:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
34617:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
34618:                                  protocol => default,
34619:                                  recv     => Recv},
34620:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
34621:            end).
34622: 
34623: 
34624: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
34625: 
34626: sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
34627:     %% This (acceptor) is the server that accepts connections.
34628:     %% But it is also suppose to close the connection socket, 
34629:     %% and trigger the read failure (=closed) for the handler process.
34630:     AcceptorSeq =
34631:         [
34632:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
34633:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
34634:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
34635:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
34636:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
34637:                    end},
34638:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
34639:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
34640:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
34641:                            ok
34642:                    end},
34643: 
34644:          %% *** Init part ***
34645:          #{desc => "which local address",
34646:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
34647:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
34648:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
34649:                    end},
34650:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
34651:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
34652:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
34653:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
34654:                                {ok, Sock} ->
34655:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
34656:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34657:                                    ERROR
34658:                            end
34659:                    end},
34660:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
34661:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
34662:                          lsock  := LSock,
34663:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
34664:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("bind to LSA: "
34665:                                        "~n   ~p", [LSA]),
34666:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
34667:                                ok ->
34668:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
34669:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34670:                                    ERROR
34671:                            end;
34672:                       (#{lsock := LSock,
34673:                          lsa   := LSA} = State) ->
34674:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
34675:                                ok ->
34676:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
34677:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
34678:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
34679:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34680:                                    ERROR
34681:                            end
34682:                    end},
34683:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
34684:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
34685:                            socket:listen(LSock)
34686:                    end},
34687:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
34688:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
34689:                          tester := Tester,
34690:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}}) ->
34691:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
34692:                            ok;
34693:                       (#{tester := Tester, lport := Port}) ->
34694:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
34695:                            ok
34696:                    end},
34697:                            
34698:          %% The actual test
34699:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
34700:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
34701:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
34702:                                {ok, {H1, H2, H3}} ->
34703:                                    {ok, State#{handler1 => H1,
34704:                                                handler2 => H2,
34705:                                                handler3 => H3}};
34706:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34707:                                    ERROR
34708:                            end
34709:                    end},
34710:          #{desc => "await accept",
34711:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
34712:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
34713:                                {ok, Sock} ->
34714:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("connection accepted: "
34715:                                                "~n   ~p", [socket:sockname(Sock)]),
34716:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
34717:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34718:                                    ERROR
34719:                            end
34720:                    end},
34721:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
34722:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
34723:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
34724:                            ok
34725:                    end},
34726:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 1",
34727:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
34728:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
34729:                            ok
34730:                    end},
34731:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 2",
34732:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
34733:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
34734:                            ok
34735:                    end},
34736:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 3",
34737:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
34738:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
34739:                            ok
34740:                    end},
34741:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
34742:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
34743:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close),
34744:                            ok
34745:                    end},
34746:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
34747:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
34748:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
34749:                                ok ->
34750:                                    {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)};
34751:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34752:                                    ERROR
34753:                            end
34754:                    end},
34755:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
34756:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
34757:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
34758:                            ok
34759:                    end},
34760: 
34761:          %% *** Terminate ***
34762:          #{desc => "await terminate",
34763:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
34764:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
34765:                                ok ->
34766:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
34767:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34768:                                    ERROR
34769:                            end
34770:                    end},
34771:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
34772:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
34773:                          lsock  := Sock,
34774:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
34775:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
34776:                            State1 =
34777:                                unlink_path(Path,
34778:                                            fun() ->maps:remove(lsa, State) end,
34779:                                            fun() -> State end),
34780:                            State2 = maps:remove(lsock, State1),
34781:                            State3 = maps:remove(lport, State2),
34782:                            {ok, State3};
34783:                       (#{lsock := Sock} = State) ->
34784:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
34785:                                ok ->
34786:                                    State1 = maps:remove(lsock, State),
34787:                                    State2 = maps:remove(lport, State1),
34788:                                    {ok, State2};
34789:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34790:                                    ERROR
34791:                            end
34792:                    end},
34793: 
34794:          %% *** We are done ***
34795:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
34796:         ],
34797: 
34798:     %% The point of this is to perform the recv for which
34799:     %% we are testing the response.
34800:     HandlerSeq =
34801:         [
34802:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
34803:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
34804:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
34805:                            {Tester, Acceptor} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
34806:                            {ok, State#{tester  => Tester, 
34807:                                       acceptor => Acceptor}}
34808:                    end},
34809:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
34810:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
34811:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
34812:                            ok
34813:                    end},
34814:          #{desc => "monitor acceptor",
34815:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor} = _State) ->
34816:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Acceptor),
34817:                            ok
34818:                    end},
34819:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
34820:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
34821:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
34822:                            ok
34823:                    end},
34824: 
34825:          %% The actual test
34826:          #{desc => "await continue (transfer)",
34827:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
34828:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Pid, acceptor, transfer) of
34829:                                {ok, Sock} ->
34830:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
34831:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34832:                                    ERROR
34833:                            end
34834:                    end},
34835:          #{desc => "announce ready (transfer)",
34836:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
34837:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, transfer),
34838:                            ok
34839:                    end},
34840:          #{desc => "attempt recv (=> closed)",
34841:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
34842:                            %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
34843:                            case Recv(Sock) of
34844:                                {ok, _Data} ->
34845:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected data received"),
34846:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
34847:                                {error, closed} ->
34848:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected 'closed' "
34849:                                                "result"),
34850:                                    State1 = maps:remove(sock, State),
34851:                                    {ok, State1};
34852:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
34853:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected read failure: "
34854:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
34855:                                    ERROR
34856:                            end
34857:                    end},
34858:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed)",
34859:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
34860:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
34861:                            ok
34862:                    end},
34863: 
34864:          %% *** Terminate ***
34865:          #{desc => "await terminate",
34866:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
34867:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
34868:                                ok ->
34869:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
34870:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34871:                                    ERROR
34872:                            end
34873:                    end},
34874: 
34875: 
34876:          %% *** We are done ***
34877:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
34878:         ],
34879: 
34880:     %% The point of this is basically just to create the connection.
34881:     ClientSeq =
34882:         [
34883:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
34884:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
34885:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
34886:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
34887:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
34888:                    end},
34889:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
34890:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
34891:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
34892:                            ok
34893:                    end},
34894: 
34895:          %% *** Init part ***
34896:          #{desc => "which local address",
34897:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
34898:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
34899:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
34900:                    end},
34901:          #{desc => "create socket",
34902:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
34903:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
34904:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
34905:                                {ok, Sock} ->
34906:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
34907:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34908:                                    ERROR
34909:                            end
34910:                    end},
34911:          #{desc => "bind socket to local address",
34912:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
34913:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("bind to LSA: "
34914:                                        "~n   ~p", [LSA]),
34915:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
34916:                                ok ->
34917:                                    ok;
34918:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34919:                                    ERROR
34920:                            end
34921:                    end},
34922:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
34923:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
34924:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
34925:                            ok
34926:                    end},
34927: 
34928:          %% The actual test
34929:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
34930:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain,
34931:                          tester := Tester} = State) ->
34932:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect) of
34933:                                {ok, ServerPath} ->
34934:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Server Path: "
34935:                                                "~n   ~s", [ServerPath]),
34936:                                    ServerSA = #{family => Domain,
34937:                                                 path   => ServerPath},
34938:                                    {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}};
34939:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34940:                                    ERROR
34941:                            end;
34942:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
34943:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect) of
34944:                                {ok, Port} ->
34945:                                    ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
34946:                                    {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}};
34947:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34948:                                    ERROR
34949:                            end
34950:                    end},
34951:          #{desc => "connect to server",
34952:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, server_sa := ServerSA}) ->
34953:                            socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA)
34954:                    end},
34955:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
34956:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
34957:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
34958:                            ok
34959:                    end},
34960: 
34961:          %% *** Terminate ***
34962:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
34963:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
34964:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
34965:                                ok ->
34966:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
34967:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
34968:                                    ERROR
34969:                            end                           
34970:                    end},
34971:          #{desc => "close socket",
34972:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
34973:                          sock     := Sock,
34974:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
34975:                            sock_close(Sock),
34976:                            State1 =
34977:                                unlink_path(Path,
34978:                                            fun() ->
34979:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
34980:                                            end,
34981:                                            fun() -> State end),
34982:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
34983:                        (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
34984:                            sock_close(Sock),
34985:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
34986:                    end},
34987: 
34988:          %% *** We are done ***
34989:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
34990:         ],
34991: 
34992:     TesterSeq =
34993:         [
34994:          %% *** Init part ***
34995:          #{desc => "monitor acceptor",
34996:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
34997:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
34998:                            ok
34999:                    end},
35000:          #{desc => "monitor handler 1",
35001:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35002:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
35003:                            ok
35004:                    end},
35005:          #{desc => "monitor handler 2",
35006:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35007:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
35008:                            ok
35009:                    end},
35010:          #{desc => "monitor handler 3",
35011:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35012:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
35013:                            ok
35014:                    end},
35015:          #{desc => "monitor client",
35016:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
35017:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
35018:                            ok
35019:                    end},
35020: 
35021:          %% Start the acceptor
35022:          #{desc => "order acceptor start",
35023:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
35024:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
35025:                            ok
35026:                    end},
35027:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (init)",
35028:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
35029:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, init) of
35030:                                {ok, PortOrPath} ->
35031:                                    {ok, State#{server_info => PortOrPath}};
35032:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35033:                                    ERROR
35034:                            end
35035:                    end},
35036: 
35037:          %% Start the handler(s)
35038:          #{desc => "order handler 1 start",
35039:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35040:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
35041:                            ok
35042:                    end},
35043:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
35044:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35045:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, init)
35046:                    end},
35047:          #{desc => "order handler 2 start",
35048:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35049:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
35050:                            ok
35051:                    end},
35052:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
35053:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35054:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, init)
35055:                    end},
35056:          #{desc => "order handler 3 start",
35057:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35058:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
35059:                            ok
35060:                    end},
35061:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
35062:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35063:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, init)
35064:                    end},
35065: 
35066:          %% Start the client
35067:          #{desc => "order client start",
35068:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
35069:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
35070:                            ok
35071:                    end},
35072:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
35073:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
35074:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
35075:                    end},
35076: 
35077:          %% The actual test
35078:          #{desc => "order acceptor to continue (accept)",
35079:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid, 
35080:                          handler1 := H1, 
35081:                          handler2 := H2, 
35082:                          handler3 := H3} = _State) ->
35083:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, {H1, H2, H3}),
35084:                            ok
35085:                    end},
35086:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
35087:          #{desc => "order client to continue (connect)",
35088:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid, server_info := Info} = _State) ->
35089:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect, Info),
35090:                            ok
35091:                    end},
35092:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (accept)",
35093:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
35094:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, accept)
35095:                    end},
35096:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
35097:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
35098:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, connect)
35099:                    end},
35100:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (transfer)",
35101:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35102:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, transfer)
35103:                    end},
35104:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (transfer)",
35105:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35106:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, transfer)
35107:                    end},
35108:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (transfer)",
35109:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35110:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, transfer)
35111:                    end},
35112:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
35113:          #{desc => "order acceptor to continue (close connection socket)",
35114:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
35115:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
35116:                            ok
35117:                    end},
35118:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (close)",
35119:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
35120:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, close)
35121:                    end},
35122:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (recv closed)",
35123:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35124:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, recv_closed)
35125:                    end},
35126:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (recv closed)",
35127:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35128:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, recv_closed)
35129:                    end},
35130:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (recv closed)",
35131:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35132:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, recv_closed)
35133:                    end},
35134: 
35135:          %% Terminations
35136:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
35137:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
35138:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35139:                            ok
35140:                    end},
35141:          #{desc => "await client termination",
35142:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
35143:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35144:                                ok ->
35145:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
35146:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35147:                                    ERROR
35148:                            end
35149:                    end},
35150:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
35151:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35152:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35153:                            ok
35154:                    end},
35155:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
35156:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
35157:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35158:                                ok ->
35159:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler1, State)};
35160:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35161:                                    ERROR
35162:                            end
35163:                    end},
35164:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
35165:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35166:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35167:                            ok
35168:                    end},
35169:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
35170:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
35171:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35172:                                ok ->
35173:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler2, State)};
35174:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35175:                                    ERROR
35176:                            end
35177:                    end},
35178:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
35179:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35180:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35181:                            ok
35182:                    end},
35183:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
35184:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
35185:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35186:                                ok ->
35187:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler3, State)};
35188:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35189:                                    ERROR
35190:                            end
35191:                    end},
35192:          #{desc => "order acceptor to terminate",
35193:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
35194:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35195:                            ok
35196:                    end},
35197:          #{desc => "await acceptor termination",
35198:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
35199:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35200:                                ok ->
35201:                                    {ok, maps:remove(acceptor, State)};
35202:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35203:                                    ERROR
35204:                            end
35205:                    end},
35206: 
35207: 
35208:          %% *** We are done ***
35209:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
35210:         ],
35211: 
35212:     i("start acceptor evaluator"),
35213:     AccInitState = InitState,
35214:     Acceptor = ?SEV_START("acceptor", AcceptorSeq, AccInitState),
35215: 
35216:     i("start handler 1 evaluator"),
35217:     HandlerInitState = #{recv => maps:get(recv, InitState)},
35218:     Handler1 = ?SEV_START("handler-1", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
35219: 
35220:     i("start handler 2 evaluator"),
35221:     Handler2 = ?SEV_START("handler-2", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
35222: 
35223:     i("start handler 3 evaluator"),
35224:     Handler3 = ?SEV_START("handler-3", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
35225: 
35226:     i("start client evaluator"),
35227:     ClientInitState = InitState,
35228:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
35229: 
35230:     i("start tester evaluator"),
35231:     TesterInitState = #{acceptor => Acceptor#ev.pid,
35232:                         handler1 => Handler1#ev.pid,
35233:                         handler2 => Handler2#ev.pid,
35234:                         handler3 => Handler3#ev.pid,
35235:                         client   => Client#ev.pid},
35236:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
35237: 
35238:     i("await evaluator"),
35239:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Acceptor, 
35240:                             Handler1, Handler2, Handler3, 
35241:                             Client, Tester]).
35242: 
35243: 
35244: 
35245: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35246: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35247: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recvfrom function.
35248: %% Socket is IPv4.
35249: %% 
35250: 
35251: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35252:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
35253:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
35254:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
35255:            fun() ->
35256:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
35257:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
35258:                                end,
35259:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
35260:                                  protocol => udp,
35261:                                  recv     => Recv},
35262:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
35263:            end).
35264: 
35265: 
35266: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35267: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35268: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
35269: %% Socket is IPv6.
35270: 
35271: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35272:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
35273:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
35274:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
35275:            fun() ->
35276:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
35277:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
35278:                                end,
35279:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
35280:                                  protocol => udp,
35281:                                  recv     => Recv},
35282:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
35283:            end).
35284: 
35285: 
35286: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35287: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35288: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
35289: %% Socket is Unix Domainm (dgram) socket.
35290: 
35291: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35292:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
35293:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
35294:            fun() ->
35295: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
35296: 		   is_not_windows()
35297: 	   end,
35298:            fun() ->
35299:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
35300:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
35301:                                end,
35302:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
35303:                                  protocol => default,
35304:                                  recv     => Recv},
35305:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
35306:            end).
35307: 
35308: 
35309: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35310: 
35311: sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState) ->
35312:     PrimServerSeq =
35313:         [
35314:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
35315:          #{desc => "await start",
35316:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
35317:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
35318:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
35319:                    end},
35320:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
35321:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
35322:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
35323:                            ok
35324:                    end},
35325: 
35326:          %% *** Init part ***
35327:          #{desc => "local address",
35328:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
35329:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
35330:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
35331:                    end},
35332:          #{desc => "open socket",
35333:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
35334:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
35335:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
35336:                    end},
35337:          #{desc => "bind socket",
35338:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA}) ->
35339:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
35340:                                ok ->
35341:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
35342:                                    ok;
35343:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
35344:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
35345:                                    ERROR
35346:                            end
35347:                    end},
35348:          #{desc => "socket name",
35349:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
35350:                            case socket:sockname(Sock) of
35351:                                {ok, SA} ->
35352:                                    {ok, State#{sa => SA}};
35353:                                {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
35354:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed get socket name: "
35355:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
35356:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
35357:                                    {skip, Reason};
35358:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
35359:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket name: "
35360:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
35361:                                    ERROR
35362:                            end
35363:                    end},
35364:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
35365:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock}) ->
35366:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
35367:                            ok
35368:                    end},
35369: 
35370:          %% The actual test
35371:          #{desc => "await continue (recv, with timeout)",
35372:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
35373:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv) of
35374:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
35375:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
35376:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35377:                                    ERROR
35378:                            end
35379:                    end},
35380:          #{desc => "receive, with timeout",
35381:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv, timeout := Timeout}) ->
35382:                            case Recv(Sock, Timeout) of
35383:                                {error, timeout} ->
35384:                                    ok;
35385:                                {ok, _} ->
35386:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
35387:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35388:                                    ERROR
35389:                            end
35390:                    end},
35391:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv, with timeout)",
35392:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
35393:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv),
35394:                            ok
35395:                    end},
35396:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
35397:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
35398:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
35399:                    end},
35400:          #{desc => "close socket",
35401:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
35402:                          sock     := Sock,
35403:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
35404:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
35405:                            State1 =
35406:                                unlink_path(Path,
35407:                                            fun() ->
35408:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
35409:                                            end,
35410:                                            fun() -> State end),
35411:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
35412:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
35413:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
35414:                                ok ->
35415:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
35416:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35417:                                    ERROR
35418:                            end
35419:                    end},
35420:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
35421:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
35422:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
35423:                            ok
35424:                    end},
35425: 
35426:          %% Termination
35427:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
35428:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
35429:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, terminate) of
35430:                                ok ->
35431:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
35432:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35433:                                    ERROR
35434:                            end
35435:                    end},
35436: 
35437:          %% *** We are done ***
35438:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
35439:         ],
35440: 
35441:     SecServerSeq =
35442:         [
35443:          %% *** Init part ***
35444:          #{desc => "await start",
35445:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
35446:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
35447:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
35448:                    end},
35449:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
35450:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
35451:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
35452:                            ok
35453:                    end},
35454:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
35455:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
35456:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
35457:                            ok
35458:                    end},
35459: 
35460:          %% The actual test
35461:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
35462:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
35463:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
35464:                            
35465:                    end},
35466:          #{desc => "receive",
35467:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
35468:                            case Recv(Sock, infinity) of
35469:                                {error, closed} ->
35470:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
35471:                                {ok, _} ->
35472:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
35473:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35474:                                    ERROR
35475:                            end
35476:                    end},
35477:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed)",
35478:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
35479:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
35480:                            ok
35481:                    end},
35482: 
35483:          %% Termination
35484:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
35485:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
35486:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
35487:                                ok ->
35488:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
35489:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35490:                                    ERROR
35491:                            end
35492:                    end},
35493: 
35494:          %% *** We are done ***
35495:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
35496:         ],
35497: 
35498: 
35499:     TesterSeq =
35500:         [
35501:          %% *** Init part ***
35502:          #{desc => "monitor primary server",
35503:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
35504:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
35505:                            ok
35506:                    end},
35507:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 1",
35508:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35509:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
35510:                            ok
35511:                    end},
35512:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 2",
35513:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35514:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
35515:                            ok
35516:                    end},
35517:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 3",
35518:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35519:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
35520:                            ok
35521:                    end},
35522: 
35523:          %% Start the primary server
35524:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' start",
35525:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
35526:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
35527:                            ok
35528:                    end},
35529:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (init)",
35530:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = State) ->
35531:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, init),
35532:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
35533:                    end},
35534: 
35535:          %% Start the secondary server 1
35536:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' start",
35537:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
35538:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
35539:                            ok
35540:                    end},
35541:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' ready (init)",
35542:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35543:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server1, init)
35544:                    end},
35545: 
35546:          %% Start the secondary server 2
35547:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' start",
35548:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
35549:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
35550:                            ok
35551:                    end},
35552:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' ready (init)",
35553:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35554:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server2, init)
35555:                    end},
35556: 
35557:          %% Start the secondary server 3
35558:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' start",
35559:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
35560:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
35561:                            ok
35562:                    end},
35563:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' ready (init)",
35564:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35565:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server3, init)
35566:                    end},
35567: 
35568: 
35569:          %% The actual test
35570:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
35571:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
35572:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
35573:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
35574:          %% server to return with error-closed.
35575: 
35576:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' to continue (recv)",
35577:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35578:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
35579:                            ok
35580:                    end},
35581:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
35582:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' to continue (recv)",
35583:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35584:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
35585:                            ok
35586:                    end},
35587:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
35588:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' to continue (recv)",
35589:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35590:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
35591:                            ok
35592:                    end},
35593:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
35594:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to continue (recv, with timeout)",
35595:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
35596:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv, ?SECS(5)),
35597:                            ok
35598:                    end},
35599:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (recv, with timeout)",
35600:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
35601:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, recv)
35602:                    end},
35603:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to continue (close)",
35604:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
35605:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
35606:                            ok
35607:                    end},
35608:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (close)",
35609:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
35610:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, close)
35611:                    end},
35612:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' ready (closed)",
35613:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35614:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server1, recv_closed)
35615:                    end},
35616:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' ready (closed)",
35617:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35618:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server2, recv_closed)
35619:                    end},
35620:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' ready (closed)",
35621:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35622:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server3, recv_closed)
35623:                    end},
35624: 
35625:          %% Terminations
35626:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' to terminate",
35627:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
35628:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35629:                            ok
35630:                    end},
35631:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' termination",
35632:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = State) ->
35633:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35634:                                ok ->
35635:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server3, State)};
35636:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35637:                                    ERROR
35638:                            end
35639:                    end},
35640:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' to terminate",
35641:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
35642:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35643:                            ok
35644:                    end},
35645:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' termination",
35646:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = State) ->
35647:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35648:                                ok ->
35649:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server2, State)};
35650:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35651:                                    ERROR
35652:                            end
35653:                    end},
35654:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' to terminate",
35655:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
35656:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35657:                            ok
35658:                    end},
35659:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' termination",
35660:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = State) ->
35661:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35662:                                ok ->
35663:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server1, State)};
35664:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35665:                                    ERROR
35666:                            end
35667:                    end},
35668:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to terminate",
35669:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
35670:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
35671:                            ok
35672:                    end},
35673:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' termination",
35674:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = State) ->
35675:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
35676:                                ok ->
35677:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_server, State)};
35678:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35679:                                    ERROR
35680:                            end
35681:                    end},
35682: 
35683: 
35684:          %% *** We are done ***
35685:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
35686:         ],
35687:     
35688: 
35689:     i("start 'primary server' evaluator"),
35690:     PrimSrvInitState = InitState,
35691:     PrimServer = ?SEV_START("prim-server", PrimServerSeq, PrimSrvInitState),
35692: 
35693:     i("start 'secondary server 1' evaluator"),
35694:     SecSrvInitState = #{recv => maps:get(recv, InitState)},
35695:     SecServer1 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-1", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
35696: 
35697:     i("start 'secondary server 2' evaluator"),
35698:     SecServer2 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-2", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
35699: 
35700:     i("start 'secondary server 3' evaluator"),
35701:     SecServer3 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-3", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
35702: 
35703:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
35704:     TesterInitState = #{prim_server => PrimServer#ev.pid,
35705:                         sec_server1 => SecServer1#ev.pid,
35706:                         sec_server2 => SecServer2#ev.pid,
35707:                         sec_server3 => SecServer3#ev.pid},
35708:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
35709: 
35710:     i("await evaluator"),
35711:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimServer, 
35712:                             SecServer1, SecServer2, SecServer3,
35713:                             Tester]).
35714: 
35715: 
35716: 
35717: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35718: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35719: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
35720: %% Socket is IPv4.
35721: 
35722: sc_lc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35723:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35724:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
35725:            fun() ->
35726:                    is_not_windows(), % recvmsg does not work on Windows
35727:                    has_support_ipv4()
35728:            end,
35729:            fun() ->
35730:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
35731:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
35732:                                  protocol => tcp,
35733:                                  recv     => Recv},
35734:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
35735:            end).
35736: 
35737: 
35738: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35739: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35740: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
35741: %% Socket is IPv6.
35742: 
35743: sc_lc_recvmsg_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35744:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35745:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
35746:            fun() ->
35747:                    is_not_windows(), % recvmsg does not work on Windows
35748:                    has_support_ipv6()
35749:            end,
35750:            fun() ->
35751:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
35752:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
35753:                                  protocol => tcp,
35754:                                  recv     => Recv},
35755:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
35756:            end).
35757: 
35758: 
35759: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35760: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35761: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
35762: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
35763: 
35764: sc_lc_recvmsg_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35765:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35766:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
35767:            fun() ->
35768:                    is_not_windows(), % recvmsg does not work on Windows
35769:                    has_support_unix_domain_socket()
35770:            end,
35771:            fun() ->
35772:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
35773:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
35774:                                  protocol => default,
35775:                                  recv     => Recv},
35776:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
35777:            end).
35778: 
35779: 
35780: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35781: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35782: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
35783: %% Socket is IPv4.
35784:
