35785: sc_lc_recvmsg_response_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35786:     tc_try(sc_lc_recvmsg_response_udp4,
35787:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
35788:            fun() ->
35789:                    ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35790:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
35791:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
35792:                                  protocol => udp,
35793:                                  recv     => Recv},
35794:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
35795:            end).
35796: 
35797: 
35798: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35799: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35800: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
35801: %% Socket is IPv6.
35802: 
35803: sc_lc_recvmsg_response_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35804:     tc_try(sc_recvmsg_response_udp6,
35805:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
35806:            fun() ->
35807:                    ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35808:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
35809:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
35810:                                  protocol => udp,
35811:                                  recv     => Recv},
35812:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
35813:            end).
35814: 
35815: 
35816: 
35817: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35818: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35819: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
35820: %% Socket is Unix Domain (dgram) socket.
35821: 
35822: sc_lc_recvmsg_response_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35823:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35824:     tc_try(sc_recvmsg_response_udpL,
35825:            fun() ->
35826: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
35827: 		   is_not_windows()
35828: 	   end,
35829:            fun() ->
35830:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock, To) end,
35831:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
35832:                                  protocol => default,
35833:                                  recv     => Recv},
35834:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
35835:            end).
35836: 
35837: 
35838: 
35839: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35840: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35841: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
35842: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
35843: %% git the setup anyway.
35844: %% Socket is IPv4.
35845: 
35846: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35847:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35848:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp4,
35849:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
35850:            fun() ->
35851:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
35852:                                  protocol => tcp},
35853:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
35854:            end).
35855: 
35856: 
35857: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35858: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35859: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
35860: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
35861: %% git the setup anyway.
35862: %% Socket is IPv6.
35863: 
35864: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35865:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35866:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp6,
35867:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
35868:            fun() ->
35869:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
35870:                                  protocol => tcp},
35871:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
35872:            end).
35873: 
35874: 
35875: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35876: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
35877: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
35878: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
35879: %% git the setup anyway.
35880: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
35881: 
35882: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
35883:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
35884:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL,
35885:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
35886:            fun() ->
35887:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
35888:                                  protocol => default},
35889:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
35890:            end).
35891: 
35892: 
35893: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
35894: 
35895: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState) ->
35896:     PrimAcceptorSeq =
35897:         [
35898:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
35899:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
35900:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
35901:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
35902:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
35903:                    end},
35904:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
35905:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
35906:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
35907:                            ok
35908:                    end},
35909: 
35910:          %% *** Init part ***
35911:          #{desc => "which local address",
35912:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
35913:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
35914:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
35915:                    end},
35916:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
35917:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
35918:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
35919:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
35920:                                {ok, Sock} ->
35921:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
35922:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35923:                                    ERROR
35924:                            end
35925:                    end},
35926:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
35927:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
35928:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
35929:                                ok ->
35930:                                    ok;
35931:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35932:                                    ERROR
35933:                            end
35934:                    end},
35935:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
35936:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
35937:                            socket:listen(Sock)
35938:                    end},
35939:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
35940:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
35941:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
35942:                            ok
35943:                    end},
35944: 
35945:          %% The actual test
35946:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
35947:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
35948:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
35949:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
35950:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
35951:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35952:                                    ERROR
35953:                            end
35954:                    end},
35955:          #{desc => "await connection",
35956:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, timeout := Timeout} = _State) ->
35957:                            case socket:accept(LSock, Timeout) of
35958:                                {error, timeout} ->
35959:                                    ok;
35960:                                {ok, Sock} ->
35961:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
35962:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
35963:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
35964:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35965:                                    ERROR
35966:                            end
35967:                    end},
35968:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept timeout)",
35969:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
35970:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_timeout),
35971:                            ok
35972:                    end},
35973:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
35974:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
35975:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
35976:                    end},
35977:          #{desc => "close socket",
35978:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
35979:                          sock   := Sock,
35980:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
35981:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
35982:                                ok ->
35983:                                    State1 =
35984:                                        unlink_path(Path,
35985:                                                    fun() ->
35986:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
35987:                                                    end,
35988:                                                    fun() ->
35989:                                                            State
35990:                                                    end),
35991:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
35992:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
35993:                                    unlink_path(Path),
35994:                                    ERROR
35995:                            end;
35996:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
35997:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
35998:                                ok ->
35999:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
36000:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36001:                                    ERROR
36002:                            end
36003:                    end},
36004:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
36005:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
36006:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
36007:                            ok
36008:                    end},
36009: 
36010:                                                 % Termination
36011:          #{desc => "await terminate",
36012:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
36013:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
36014:                                ok ->
36015:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
36016:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36017:                                    ERROR
36018:                            end
36019:                    end},
36020: 
36021:          %% *** We are done ***
36022:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
36023:         ],
36024: 
36025:     SecAcceptorSeq =
36026:         [
36027:          %% *** Init part ***
36028:          #{desc => "await start",
36029:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
36030:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
36031:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
36032:                    end},
36033:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
36034:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
36035:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
36036:                            ok
36037:                    end},
36038:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
36039:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
36040:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init)
36041:                    end},
36042: 
36043:          %% The actual test
36044:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
36045:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
36046:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
36047:                    end},
36048:          #{desc => "accept",
36049:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
36050:                            case socket:accept(Sock) of
36051:                                {error, closed} ->
36052:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
36053:                                {ok, _} ->
36054:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
36055:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36056:                                    ERROR
36057:                            end
36058:                    end},
36059:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept closed)",
36060:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
36061:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_closed)
36062:                    end},
36063: 
36064:          %% Termination
36065:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
36066:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
36067:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
36068:                                ok ->
36069:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
36070:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36071:                                    ERROR
36072:                            end
36073:                    end},
36074: 
36075:          %% *** We are done ***
36076:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
36077:         ],
36078: 
36079:     TesterSeq =
36080:         [
36081:          %% *** Init part ***
36082:          #{desc => "monitor 'primary acceptor'",
36083:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
36084:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36085:                            ok
36086:                    end},
36087:          #{desc => "monitor 'secondary acceptor 1'",
36088:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36089:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36090:                            ok
36091:                    end},
36092:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 2",
36093:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36094:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36095:                            ok
36096:                    end},
36097:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 3",
36098:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36099:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36100:                            ok
36101:                    end},
36102: 
36103:          %% Start the primary server
36104:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' start",
36105:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
36106:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
36107:                            ok
36108:                    end},
36109:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (init)",
36110:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
36111:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, init),
36112:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
36113:                    end},
36114: 
36115:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 1
36116:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' start",
36117:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
36118:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
36119:                            ok
36120:                    end},
36121:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (init)",
36122:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36123:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, init)
36124:                    end},
36125: 
36126:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 2
36127:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' start",
36128:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
36129:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
36130:                            ok
36131:                    end},
36132:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (init)",
36133:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36134:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, init)
36135:                    end},
36136: 
36137:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 3
36138:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' start",
36139:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
36140:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
36141:                            ok
36142:                    end},
36143:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (init)",
36144:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36145:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, init)
36146:                    end},
36147: 
36148: 
36149:          %% The actual test
36150:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
36151:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
36152:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
36153:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
36154:          %% server to return with error-closed.
36155: 
36156:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to continue (accept)",
36157:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36158:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
36159:                            ok
36160:                    end},
36161:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
36162:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to continue (accept)",
36163:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36164:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
36165:                            ok
36166:                    end},
36167:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
36168:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to continue (accept)",
36169:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36170:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
36171:                            ok
36172:                    end},
36173:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
36174:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue",
36175:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
36176:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, ?SECS(5)),
36177:                            ok
36178:                    end},
36179:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (accept timeout)",
36180:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
36181:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, accept_timeout)
36182:                    end},
36183:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue (close)",
36184:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
36185:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
36186:                            ok
36187:                    end},
36188:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (close)",
36189:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
36190:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, close)
36191:                    end},
36192:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (accept closed)",
36193:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36194:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, accept_closed)
36195:                    end},
36196:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (accept closed)",
36197:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36198:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, accept_closed)
36199:                    end},
36200:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (accept closed)",
36201:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36202:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, accept_closed)
36203:                    end},
36204: 
36205: 
36206:          %% Terminations
36207:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to terminate",
36208:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36209:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
36210:                            ok
36211:                    end},
36212:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' termination",
36213:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = State) ->
36214:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
36215:                                ok ->
36216:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc3, State)};
36217:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36218:                                    ERROR
36219:                            end
36220:                    end},
36221:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to terminate",
36222:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36223:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
36224:                            ok
36225:                    end},
36226:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' termination",
36227:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = State) ->
36228:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
36229:                                ok ->
36230:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc2, State)};
36231:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36232:                                    ERROR
36233:                            end
36234:                    end},
36235:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to terminate",
36236:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36237:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
36238:                            ok
36239:                    end},
36240:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' termination",
36241:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = State) ->
36242:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
36243:                                ok ->
36244:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc1, State)};
36245:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36246:                                    ERROR
36247:                            end
36248:                    end},
36249:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to terminate",
36250:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
36251:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
36252:                            ok
36253:                    end},
36254:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' termination",
36255:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
36256:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
36257:                                ok ->
36258:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_acc, State)};
36259:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36260:                                    ERROR
36261:                            end
36262:                    end},
36263: 
36264: 
36265:          %% *** We are done ***
36266:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
36267:         ],
36268: 
36269: 
36270:     i("start 'primary acceptor' evaluator"),
36271:     PrimAccInitState = InitState,
36272:     PrimAcc = ?SEV_START("prim-acceptor", PrimAcceptorSeq, PrimAccInitState),
36273: 
36274:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 1' evaluator"),
36275:     SecAccInitState = #{},
36276:     SecAcc1 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-1", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
36277: 
36278:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 2' evaluator"),
36279:     SecAcc2 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-2", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
36280: 
36281:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 3' evaluator"),
36282:     SecAcc3 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-3", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
36283: 
36284:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
36285:     TesterInitState = #{prim_acc => PrimAcc#ev.pid,
36286:                         sec_acc1 => SecAcc1#ev.pid,
36287:                         sec_acc2 => SecAcc2#ev.pid,
36288:                         sec_acc3 => SecAcc3#ev.pid},
36289:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
36290: 
36291:     i("await evaluator"),
36292:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimAcc, SecAcc1, SecAcc2, SecAcc3, Tester]).
36293: 
36294: 
36295: 
36296: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
36297: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
36298: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
36299: %% Socket is IPv4.
36300: %%
36301: %% To minimize the chance of "weirdness", we should really have test cases
36302: %% where the two sides of the connection is on different machines. But for
36303: %% now, we will make do with different VMs on the same host.
36304: %%
36305: 
36306: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
36307:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
36308:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
36309:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
36310:            fun() ->
36311:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
36312:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
36313:                                  protocol => tcp,
36314:                                  recv     => Recv},
36315:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
36316:            end).
36317: 
36318: 
36319: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
36320: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
36321: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
36322: %% Socket is IPv6.
36323: 
36324: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
36325:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
36326:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
36327:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
36328:            fun() ->
36329:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
36330:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
36331:                                  protocol => tcp,
36332:                                  recv     => Recv},
36333:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
36334:            end).
36335: 
36336: 
36337: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
36338: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
36339: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
36340: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
36341: 
36342: sc_rc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
36343:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
36344:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
36345:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
36346:            fun() ->
36347:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
36348:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
36349:                                  protocol => default,
36350:                                  recv     => Recv},
36351:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
36352:            end).
36353: 
36354: 
36355: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
36356: 
36357: sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
36358:     %% Each connection are handled by handler processes.
36359:     %% These are created (on the fly) and handled internally 
36360:     %% by the server!
36361:     ServerSeq =
36362:         [
36363:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
36364:          #{desc => "await start",
36365:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
36366:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
36367:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
36368:                    end},
36369:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
36370:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
36371:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
36372:                            ok
36373:                    end},
36374: 
36375:          %% *** Init part ***
36376:          #{desc => "which local address",
36377:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
36378:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
36379:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
36380:                    end},
36381:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
36382:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
36383:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
36384:                                {ok, Sock} ->
36385:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
36386:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36387:                                    ERROR
36388:                            end
36389:                    end},
36390:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
36391:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
36392:                          lsock  := LSock,
36393:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
36394:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
36395:                                ok ->
36396:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
36397:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36398:                                    ERROR
36399:                            end;
36400:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
36401:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
36402:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
36403:                                ok ->
36404:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
36405:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
36406:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36407:                                    ERROR
36408:                            end
36409:                    end},
36410:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
36411:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
36412:                            socket:listen(LSock)
36413:                    end},
36414:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
36415:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
36416:                          tester   := Tester,
36417:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
36418:                            %% Actually we only need to send the path,
36419:                            %% but to keep it simple, we send the "same"
36420:                            %% as for non-local.
36421:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
36422:                            ok;
36423:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA, lport := Port}) ->
36424:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
36425:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
36426:                            ok
36427:                    end},
36428: 
36429:          %% The actual test
36430:          #{desc => "await continue (accept all three connections)",
36431:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
36432:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
36433:                    end},
36434:          #{desc => "accept 1",
36435:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
36436:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
36437:                                {ok, Sock} ->
36438:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
36439:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(1, Recv, Sock),
36440:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
36441:                                    {ok, State#{csock1   => Sock,
36442:                                                handler1 => Handler}};
36443:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36444:                                    ERROR
36445:                            end
36446:                    end},
36447:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
36448:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
36449:                          handler1 := Handler1} = _State) ->
36450:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler1, handler1, init, 
36451:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
36452:                    end},
36453:          #{desc => "accept 2",
36454:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
36455:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
36456:                                {ok, Sock} ->
36457:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
36458:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(2, Recv, Sock),
36459:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
36460:                                    {ok, State#{csock2   => Sock,
36461:                                                handler2 => Handler}};
36462:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36463:                                    ERROR
36464:                            end
36465:                    end},
36466:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
36467:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
36468:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
36469:                          handler2 := Handler2} = _State) ->
36470:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler2, handler2, init, 
36471:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
36472:                                              {handler1, Handler1}])
36473:                    end},
36474:          #{desc => "accept 3",
36475:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
36476:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
36477:                                {ok, Sock} ->
36478:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
36479:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(3, Recv, Sock),
36480:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
36481:                                    {ok, State#{csock3   => Sock,
36482:                                                handler3 => Handler}};
36483:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36484:                                    ERROR
36485:                            end
36486:                    end},
36487:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
36488:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
36489:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
36490:                          handler2 := Handler2, 
36491:                          handler3 := Handler3} = _State) ->
36492:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler3, handler3, init, 
36493:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
36494:                                              {handler1, Handler1},
36495:                                              {handler2, Handler2}])
36496:                    end},
36497:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept all three connections)",
36498:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
36499:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
36500:                            ok
36501:                    end},
36502: 
36503: 
36504:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
36505:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
36506:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
36507:                    end},
36508:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to receive",
36509:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36510:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
36511:                            ok
36512:                    end},
36513:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to receive",
36514:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36515:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
36516:                            ok
36517:                    end},
36518:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to receive",
36519:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36520:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
36521:                            ok
36522:                    end},
36523:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 1 (recv)",
36524:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
36525:                          handler1 := Pid1,
36526:                          handler2 := Pid2,
36527:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
36528:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid1, handler1, recv, 
36529:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
36530:                                                   {handler2, Pid2},
36531:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
36532:                                {ok, Result} ->
36533:                                    Result;
36534:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
36535:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected failure: "
36536:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
36537:                                    ERROR
36538:                            end
36539:                    end},
36540:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 2 (recv)",
36541:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
36542:                          handler1 := Pid1,
36543:                          handler2 := Pid2,
36544:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
36545:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid2, handler2, recv, 
36546:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
36547:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
36548:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
36549:                                {ok, Result} ->
36550:                                    Result;
36551:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36552:                                    ERROR
36553:                            end
36554:                    end},
36555:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 3 (recv)",
36556:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
36557:                          handler1 := Pid1,
36558:                          handler2 := Pid2,
36559:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
36560:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid3, handler3, recv, 
36561:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
36562:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
36563:                                                   {handler2, Pid2}]) of
36564:                                {ok, Result} ->
36565:                                    Result;
36566:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36567:                                    ERROR
36568:                            end
36569:                    end},
36570:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed from all handlers)",
36571:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
36572:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
36573:                            ok
36574:                    end},
36575: 
36576:          %% Termination
36577:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
36578:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
36579:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
36580:                                ok ->
36581:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
36582:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36583:                                    ERROR
36584:                            end
36585:                    end},
36586:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
36587:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36588:                            %% Pid ! {terminate, self(), ok},
36589:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
36590:                            ok
36591:                    end},
36592:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
36593:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
36594:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
36595:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock1,   State),
36596:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler1, State1),
36597:                            {ok, State2}
36598:                    end},
36599:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
36600:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36601:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
36602:                            ok
36603:                    end},
36604:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
36605:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
36606:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
36607:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock2,   State),
36608:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler2, State1),
36609:                            {ok, State2}
36610:                    end},
36611:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
36612:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36613:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
36614:                            ok
36615:                    end},
36616:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
36617:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
36618:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
36619:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock3,   State),
36620:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler3, State1),
36621:                            {ok, State2}
36622:                    end},
36623:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
36624:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
36625:                          lsock  := LSock,
36626:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
36627:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
36628:                                ok ->
36629:                                    State1 =
36630:                                        unlink_path(Path,
36631:                                                    fun() ->
36632:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
36633:                                                    end,
36634:                                                    fun() ->
36635:                                                            State
36636:                                                    end),
36637:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
36638:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36639:                                    unlink_path(Path),
36640:                                    ERROR
36641:                            end;
36642:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
36643:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
36644:                                ok ->
36645:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
36646:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36647:                                    ERROR
36648:                            end
36649:                    end},
36650: 
36651:          %% *** We are done ***
36652:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
36653:         ],
36654: 
36655:     ClientSeq =
36656:         [
36657:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
36658:          #{desc => "await start",
36659:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
36660:                            {Tester, {NodeID, ServerSA}} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
36661:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester, 
36662:                                        node_id   => NodeID, 
36663:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
36664:                    end},
36665:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
36666:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
36667:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
36668:                            ok
36669:                    end},
36670: 
36671:          %% *** Init part ***
36672:          #{desc => "create node",
36673:            cmd  => fun(#{node_id := NodeID} = State) ->
36674:                            {Peer, Node} =
36675:                                ?START_NODE(?CT_PEER_NAME(f("client_~w",
36676:                                                            [NodeID]))),
36677:                            {ok, State#{node => Node, peer => Peer}}
36678:                    end},
36679:          #{desc => "monitor client node 1",
36680:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
36681:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
36682:                            ok
36683:                    end},
36684:          #{desc => "start remote client on client node",
36685:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
36686:                            Pid = sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node),
36687:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
36688:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
36689:                    end},
36690:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
36691:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
36692:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36693:                            ok
36694:                    end},
36695:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
36696:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
36697:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
36698:                          protocol  := Proto}) ->
36699:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, {ServerSA, Proto}),
36700:                            ok
36701:                    end},
36702:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
36703:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
36704:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
36705:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init, 
36706:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
36707:                    end},
36708:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
36709:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
36710:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
36711:                            ok
36712:                    end},
36713: 
36714:          %% The actual test
36715:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
36716:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
36717:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
36718:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect, 
36719:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
36720:                            ok
36721:                    end},
36722:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
36723:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
36724:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
36725:                            ok
36726:                    end},
36727:          #{desc => "await client process ready (connect)",
36728:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
36729:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
36730:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, connect, 
36731:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
36732:                    end},
36733:          #{desc => "announce ready (connected)",
36734:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
36735:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
36736:                            ok
36737:                    end},
36738:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
36739:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
36740:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
36741:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close, 
36742:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
36743:                            ok
36744:                    end},
36745:          #{desc => "order remote client to close",
36746:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
36747:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, close),
36748:                            ok
36749:                    end},
36750:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (closed)",
36751:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
36752:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
36753:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, close, 
36754:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
36755:                    end},
36756:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
36757:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
36758:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
36759:                            ok
36760:                    end},
36761: 
36762:          %% Termination
36763:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
36764:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
36765:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
36766:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
36767:                                                      [{rclient, Client}]) of
36768:                                ok ->
36769:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
36770:                                {error,
36771:                                 {unexpected_exit, rclient, noconnection}} ->
36772:                                    %% Global might have disconnected => SKIP
36773:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("lost connection "
36774:                                                "to remote client node => SKIP"),
36775:                                    {skip, {rclient, noconnection}};
36776:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
36777:                                    ERROR
36778:                            end
36779:                    end},
36780:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
36781:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient}) ->
36782:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try kill remote client ~p", [RClient]),
36783:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(RClient),
36784:                            ok
36785:                    end},
36786:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
36787:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient} = State) ->
36788:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(RClient),
36789:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client ~p terminated",
36790:                                        [RClient]),
36791:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
36792:                            {ok, State1}
36793:                    end},
36794:          #{desc => "stop client node",
36795:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
36796:                            {ok,
36797:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
36798:                                 ok ->
36799:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
36800:                                 {error, Reason} ->
36801:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
36802:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
36803:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
36804:                             catch
36805:                                 C:E:S ->
36806:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
36807:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
36808:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
36809:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
36810:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
36811:                             end}
36812:                    end},
36813:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
36814:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
36815:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown: "
36816:                                        "~n      ~p", [Node]),
36817:                            receive
36818:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
36819:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
36820:                                    State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
36821:                                    State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
36822:                                    {ok, State2}
36823:                            end;
36824:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
36825:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
36826:                            State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
36827:                            State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
36828:                            {ok, State2}
36829:                    end},
36830: 
36831:          %% *** We are done ***
36832:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
36833:         ],
36834: 
36835:     TesterSeq =
36836:         [
36837:          %% *** Init part ***
36838:          #{desc => "monitor server",
36839:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
36840:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36841:                            ok
36842:                    end},
36843:          #{desc => "monitor client 1",
36844:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36845:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36846:                            ok
36847:                    end},
36848:          #{desc => "monitor client 2",
36849:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36850:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36851:                            ok
36852:                    end},
36853:          #{desc => "monitor client 3",
36854:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36855:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
36856:                            ok
36857:                    end},
36858: 
36859:          %% Start the server
36860:          #{desc => "order server start",
36861:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
36862:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
36863:                            ok
36864:                    end},
36865:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
36866:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
36867:                            {ok, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
36868:                            {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}}
36869:                    end},
36870: 
36871:          %% Start the client(s)
36872:          #{desc => "order client 1 start",
36873:            cmd  => fun(#{client1   := Pid, 
36874:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
36875:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {1, ServerSA}),
36876:                            ok
36877:                    end},
36878:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (init)",
36879:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36880:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client1, init)
36881:                    end},
36882:          #{desc => "order client 2 start",
36883:            cmd  => fun(#{client2   := Pid, 
36884:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
36885:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {2, ServerSA}),
36886:                            ok
36887:                    end},
36888:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (init)",
36889:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36890:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client2, init)
36891:                    end},
36892:          #{desc => "order client 3 start",
36893:            cmd  => fun(#{client3   := Pid, 
36894:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
36895:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {3, ServerSA}),
36896:                            ok
36897:                    end},
36898:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (init)",
36899:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36900:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client3, init)
36901:                    end},
36902: 
36903:          %% The actual test
36904:          #{desc => "order server continue (accept)",
36905:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
36906:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
36907:                            ok
36908:                    end},
36909:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
36910:          #{desc => "order client 1 continue (connect)",
36911:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36912:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
36913:                            ok
36914:                    end},
36915:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (connect)",
36916:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
36917:                          client1 := Client1,
36918:                          client2 := Client2,
36919:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
36920:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client1, client1, connect, 
36921:                                             [{server,  Server},
36922:                                              {client2, Client2},
36923:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
36924:                            ok
36925:                    end},
36926:          #{desc => "order client 2 continue (connect)",
36927:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36928:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
36929:                            ok
36930:                    end},
36931:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (connect)",
36932:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
36933:                          client1 := Client1,
36934:                          client2 := Client2,
36935:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
36936:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client2, client2, connect, 
36937:                                             [{server,  Server},
36938:                                              {client1, Client1},
36939:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
36940:                            ok
36941:                    end},
36942:          #{desc => "order client 3 continue (connect)",
36943:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
36944:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
36945:                            ok
36946:                    end},
36947:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (connect)",
36948:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
36949:                          client1 := Client1,
36950:                          client2 := Client2,
36951:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
36952:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client3, client3, connect, 
36953:                                             [{server,  Server},
36954:                                              {client1, Client1},
36955:                                              {client2, Client2}]),
36956:                            ok
36957:                    end},
36958:          #{desc => "await server ready (accept from all connections)",
36959:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
36960:                          client1 := Client1,
36961:                          client2 := Client2,
36962:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
36963:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, accept,
36964:                                             [{client1, Client1},
36965:                                              {client2, Client2},
36966:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
36967:                            ok
36968:                    end},
36969:          #{desc => "order server continue (recv for all connections)",
36970:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
36971:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
36972:                            ok
36973:                    end},
36974:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
36975:          #{desc => "order client 1 continue (close)",
36976:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
36977:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
36978:                            ok
36979:                    end},
36980:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (close)",
36981:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
36982:                          client1 := Client1,
36983:                          client2 := Client2,
36984:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
36985:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client1, client1, close, 
36986:                                             [{server,  Server},
36987:                                              {client2, Client2},
36988:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
36989:                            ok
36990:                    end},
36991:          #{desc => "order client 2 continue (close)",
36992:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
36993:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
36994:                            ok
36995:                    end},
36996:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (close)",
36997:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
36998:                          client1 := Client1,
36999:                          client2 := Client2,
37000:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
37001:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client2, client2, close, 
37002:                                             [{server,  Server},
37003:                                              {client1, Client1},
37004:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
37005:                            ok
37006:                    end},
37007:          #{desc => "order client 3 continue (close)",
37008:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
37009:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
37010:                            ok
37011:                    end},
37012:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (close)",
37013:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
37014:                          client1 := Client1,
37015:                          client2 := Client2,
37016:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
37017:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client3, client1, close, 
37018:                                             [{server,  Server},
37019:                                              {client1, Client1},
37020:                                              {client2, Client2}]),
37021:                            ok
37022:                    end},
37023:          #{desc => "await server ready (close for all connections)",
37024:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
37025:                          client1 := Client1,
37026:                          client2 := Client2,
37027:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
37028:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_closed,
37029:                                             [{client1, Client1},
37030:                                              {client2, Client2},
37031:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
37032:                            ok
37033:                    end},
37034: 
37035:          %% Terminations
37036:          #{desc => "order client 1 to terminate",
37037:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
37038:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
37039:                            ok
37040:                    end},
37041:          #{desc => "await client 1 termination",
37042:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = State) ->
37043:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
37044:                                ok ->
37045:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client1, State),
37046:                                    {ok, State1};
37047:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
37048:                                    ERROR
37049:                            end
37050:                    end},
37051:          #{desc => "order client 2 to terminate",
37052:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
37053:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
37054:                            ok
37055:                    end},
37056:          #{desc => "await client 2 termination",
37057:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = State) ->
37058:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
37059:                                ok ->
37060:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client2, State),
37061:                                    {ok, State1};
37062:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
37063:                                    ERROR
37064:                            end
37065:                    end},
37066:          #{desc => "order client 3 to terminate",
37067:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
37068:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
37069:                            ok
37070:                    end},
37071:          #{desc => "await client 3 termination",
37072:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = State) ->
37073:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
37074:                                ok ->
37075:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client3, State),
37076:                                    {ok, State1};
37077:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
37078:                                    ERROR
37079:                            end
37080:                    end},
37081:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
37082:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
37083:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
37084:                            ok
37085:                    end},
37086:          #{desc => "await server termination",
37087:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
37088:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
37089:                                ok ->
37090:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
37091:                                    {ok, State1};
37092:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
37093:                                    ERROR
37094:                            end
37095:                    end},
37096: 
37097:          %% *** We are done ***
37098:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
37099:         ],
37100: 
37101:     i("start server evaluator"),
37102:     ServerInitState = InitState,
37103:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
37104: 
37105:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
37106:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
37107:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
37108:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
37109:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
37110: 
37111:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
37112:     TesterInitState = #{server  => Server#ev.pid,
37113:                         client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
37114:                         client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
37115:                         client3 => Client3#ev.pid},
37116:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
37117: 
37118:     i("await evaluator"),
37119:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server,
37120:                             Client1, Client2, Client3,
37121:                             Tester]).
37122: 
37123: 
37124: sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node) ->
37125:     Self = self(),
37126:     Fun  = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_client(Self) end,
37127:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
37128: 
37129: 
37130: sc_rc_tcp_client(Parent) ->
37131:     sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent),
37132:     {ServerSA, Proto} = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
37133:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
37134:     Sock     = sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto),
37135:     Path     = sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain),
37136:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
37137:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
37138:     sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA),
37139:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect),
37140:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, close),
37141:     sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path),
37142:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, close),
37143:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
37144:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate"),
37145:     exit(Reason).
37146: 
37147: sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
37148:     put(sname, "rclient"),
37149:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
37150:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
37151:     ok.
37152: 
37153: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
37154:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
37155:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
37156: 
37157: sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto) ->
37158:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_create -> entry"),
37159:     case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
37160:         {ok, Sock} ->
37161:             case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd) of
37162:                 {ok, FD} ->
37163:                     put(sname, f("rclient-~w", [FD])); % Update SName
37164:                 _ ->
37165:                     ok
37166:             end,
37167:             Sock;
37168:         {error, Reason} ->
37169:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
37170:     end.
37171: 
37172: sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
37173:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_bind -> entry"),
37174:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
37175:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
37176:         ok ->
37177:             case socket:sockname(Sock) of
37178:                 {ok, #{family := local, path := Path}} ->
37179:                     Path;
37180:                 {ok, _} ->
37181:                     undefined;
37182:                 {error, Reason1} ->
37183:                     exit({sockname, Reason1})
37184:             end;
37185:         {error, Reason} ->
37186:             exit({bind, Reason})
37187:     end.
37188: 
37189: sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
37190:     ?SEV_IPRINT("ready ~w", [Slogan]),
37191:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
37192: 
37193: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
37194:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w continue", [Slogan]),
37195:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
37196: 
37197: sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA) ->
37198:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_connect -> entry"),
37199:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA) of
37200:         ok ->
37201:             ok;
37202:         {error, Reason} ->
37203:             exit({connect, Reason})
37204:     end.
37205: 
37206: sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path) ->
37207:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_close -> entry"),
37208:     case socket:close(Sock) of
37209:         ok ->
37210:             unlink_path(Path),
37211:             ok;
37212:         {error, Reason} ->
37213:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed closing: "
37214:                         "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
37215:             unlink_path(Path),
37216:             {error, {close, Reason}}
37217:     end.
37218: 
37219: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
37220:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
37221:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
37222:         ok ->
37223:             ok;
37224:         {error, Reason} ->
37225:             Reason
37226:     end.
37227: 
37228: 
37229: %% The handlers run on the same node as the server (the local node).
37230: 
37231: sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(ID, Recv, Sock) ->
37232:     Self     = self(),
37233:     Fun      = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Self, Recv, Sock) end,
37234:     {Pid, _} = erlang:spawn_monitor(Fun),
37235:     Pid.
37236: 
37237: sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Parent, Recv, Sock) ->
37238:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd), Parent),
37239:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, recv),
37240:     RecvRes = sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock),
37241:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, RecvRes),
37242:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate),
37243:     exit(Reason).
37244: 
37245: sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, {ok, FD}, Parent) ->
37246:     put(sname, f("handler-~w:~w", [ID, FD])),
37247:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
37248:     ?SEV_IPRINT("started"),
37249:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, init),
37250:     ok.
37251: 
37252: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate) ->
37253:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
37254:     ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, tester);
37255: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, Slogan) ->
37256:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w", [Slogan]),
37257:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
37258: 
37259: sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock) ->
37260:     ?SEV_IPRINT("recv"),
37261:     try Recv(Sock) of
37262:         {error, closed} ->
37263:             ok;
37264:         {ok, Data} ->
37265:             ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected success: "
37266:                         "~n   (Unexp) Data: ~p"
37267:                         "~n   Socket Info:  ~p", [Data, socket:info(Sock)]),
37268:             {error, unexpected_success};
37269:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
37270:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive error: "
37271:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
37272:             ERROR
37273:     catch
37274:         error:notsup = Error:Stack ->
37275:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive ~w error: skip"
37276:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [Error, Stack]),
37277:             exit({skip, Error});
37278:         C:E:S ->
37279:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive failure: "
37280:                         "~n   Class: ~p"
37281:                         "~n   Error: ~p"
37282:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
37283:             {error, {recv, C, E, S}}
37284:     end.
37285: 
37286: sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Result) ->
37287:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready"),
37288:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Result),
37289:     ok.
37290: 
37291: 
37292: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
37293: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
37294: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
37295: %% Socket is IPv4.
37296: 
37297: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
37298:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
37299:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4,
37300:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
37301:            fun() ->
37302:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
37303:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
37304:                                  protocol => tcp,
37305:                                  recv     => Recv},
37306:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
37307:            end).
37308: 
37309: 
37310: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
37311: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
37312: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
37313: %% Socket is IPv6.
37314: 
37315: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
37316:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
37317:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp6,
37318:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
37319:            fun() ->
37320:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
37321:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
37322:                                  protocol => tcp,
37323:                                  recv     => Recv},
37324:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
37325:            end).
37326: 
37327: 
37328: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
37329: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
37330: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
37331: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
37332: 
37333: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
37334:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
37335:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcpL,
37336:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
37337:            fun() ->
37338:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
37339:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
37340:                                  protocol => default,
37341:                                  recv     => Recv},
37342:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
37343:            end).
37344: 
37345: 
37346: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
37347: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is
37348: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
37349: %% The remote client sends data, then shutdown(write) and then the
37350: %% reader attempts a recv.
37351: %% Socket is IPv4.
37352: %%
37353: %% To minimize the chance of "weirdness", we should really have test cases
37354: %% where the two sides of the connection is on different machines. But for
37355: %% now, we will make do with different VMs on the same host.
37356: %% This would of course not work for Unix Domain sockets.
37357: %%
37358: 
37359: sc_rs_recv_send_shutdown_receive_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
37360:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
37361:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
37362:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
37363:            fun() ->
37364:                    MsgData   = ?DATA,
37365:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) ->
37366:                                        socket:recv(Sock)
37367:                                end,
37368:                    Send      = fun(Sock, Data) ->
