40747:              fun({_Cnt, 0})   -> ok;
40748:                 ({Cnt,  Val}) ->
40749:                      throw({error, {invalid_counter, Cnt, Val}})
40750:              end,
40751:              Counters));
40752: traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters, [{Cnt, Val}|ValidateCounters]) ->
40753:     %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> try validate ~w when"
40754:     %%             "~n   Counters:         ~p"
40755:     %%             "~n   ValidateCounters: ~p", [Cnt, Counters, ValidateCounters]),
40756:     case lists:keysearch(Cnt, 1, Counters) of
40757:         {value, {Cnt, Val}} ->
40758:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> ~w validated", [Cnt]),
40759:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
40760:             traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters2, ValidateCounters);
40761:         {value, {Cnt, _Val}} when (Val =:= any) ->
40762:             %% ?SEV_IPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
40763:             %%             "~w validated (any) when"
40764:             %%             "~n   Counters: ~p", [Cnt, Counters]),
40765:             Counters2 = lists:keydelete(Cnt, 1, Counters),
40766:             traffic_sar_counters_validation2(Counters2, ValidateCounters);
40767:         {value, {Cnt, InvVal}} ->
40768:             ?SEV_EPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
40769:                         "~w validation failed: "
40770:                         "~n   Expected Value: ~p"
40771:                         "~n   Actual Value:   ~p", [Cnt, Val, InvVal]),
40772:             {error, {invalid_counter, Cnt, InvVal, Val}};
40773:         false ->
40774:             ?SEV_EPRINT("traffic_sar_counters_validation2 -> "
40775:                         "~w validation failed: Unknown", [Cnt]),
40776:             {error, {unknown_counter, Cnt, Counters}}
40777:     end.
40778: 
40779:                           
40780: 
40781: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
40782: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test the counters
40783: %% for both read and write.
40784: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
40785: %% We use UDP on IPv4.
40786: 
40787: traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
40788:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
40789:     tc_try(traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4,
40790:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
40791:            fun() ->
40792:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
40793:                                  proto  => udp,
40794:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
40795:                                                    socket:recvfrom(S)
40796:                                            end,
40797:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
40798:                                                    socket:sendto(S, Data, Dest)
40799:                                            end},
40800:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
40801:            end).
40802: 
40803: 
40804: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
40805: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test the counters
40806: %% for both read and write.
40807: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
40808: %% We use UDP on IPv6.
40809: 
40810: traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
40811:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
40812:     tc_try(traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp6,
40813:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
40814:            fun() ->
40815:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
40816:                                  proto  => udp,
40817:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
40818:                                                    socket:recvfrom(S)
40819:                                            end,
40820:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
40821:                                                    socket:sendto(S, Data, Dest)
40822:                                            end},
40823:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
40824:            end).
40825: 
40826: 
40827: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
40828: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test the counters
40829: %% for both read and write.
40830: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
40831: %% We use default (UDP) on local.
40832: 
40833: traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
40834:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
40835:     tc_try(traffic_sendto_and_recvfrom_counters_udp4,
40836:            fun() ->
40837: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
40838: 		   is_not_windows()
40839: 	   end,
40840:            fun() ->
40841:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
40842:                                  proto  => default,
40843:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
40844:                                                    socket:recvfrom(S)
40845:                                            end,
40846:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
40847:                                                    socket:sendto(S, Data, Dest)
40848:                                            end},
40849:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
40850:            end).
40851: 
40852: 
40853: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
40854: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test the counters
40855: %% for both read and write.
40856: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
40857: %% We use UDP on IPv4.
40858: 
40859: traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
40860:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
40861:     tc_try(traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udp4,
40862:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
40863:            fun() ->
40864:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
40865:                                  proto  => udp,
40866:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
40867:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of
40868:                                                        {ok, #{addr  := Source,
40869:                                                               iov   := [Data]}} ->
40870:                                                            {ok, {Source, Data}};
40871:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
40872:                                                            ERROR
40873:                                                    end
40874:                                            end,
40875:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
40876:                                                    Msg = #{addr => Dest,
40877:                                                               iov  => [Data]},
40878:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
40879:                                            end},
40880:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
40881:            end).
40882: 
40883: 
40884: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
40885: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test the counters
40886: %% for both read and write.
40887: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
40888: %% We use UDP on IPv6.
40889: 
40890: traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
40891:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
40892:     tc_try(traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udp6,
40893:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
40894:            fun() ->
40895:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
40896:                                  proto  => udp,
40897:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
40898:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of
40899:                                                        {ok, #{addr  := Source,
40900:                                                               iov   := [Data]}} ->
40901:                                                            {ok, {Source, Data}};
40902:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
40903:                                                            ERROR
40904:                                                    end
40905:                                            end,
40906:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
40907:                                                    Msg = #{addr => Dest,
40908:                                                               iov  => [Data]},
40909:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
40910:                                            end},
40911:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
40912:            end).
40913: 
40914: 
40915: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
40916: %% This test case is intended to (simply) test the counters
40917: %% for both read and write.
40918: %% So that its easy to extend, we use fun's for read and write.
40919: %% We use default (UDP) on local.
40920: 
40921: traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
40922:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
40923:     tc_try(traffic_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_counters_udpL,
40924:            fun() ->
40925: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
40926: 		   is_not_windows()
40927: 	   end,
40928:            fun() ->
40929:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
40930:                                  proto  => default,
40931:                                  recv   => fun(S) ->
40932:                                                    case socket:recvmsg(S) of
40933:                                                        {ok, #{addr  := Source,
40934:                                                               iov   := [Data]}} ->
40935:                                                            {ok, {Source, Data}};
40936:                                                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
40937:                                                            ERROR
40938:                                                    end
40939:                                            end,
40940:                                  send   => fun(S, Data, Dest) ->
40941:                                                    Msg = #{addr => Dest,
40942:                                                               iov  => [Data]},
40943:                                                    socket:sendmsg(S, Msg)
40944:                                            end},
40945:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState)
40946:            end).
40947: 
40948: 
40949: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
40950: 
40951: traffic_send_and_recv_udp(InitState) ->
40952:     ServerSeq =
40953:         [
40954:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
40955:          #{desc => "await start",
40956:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
40957:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
40958:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
40959:                    end},
40960:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
40961:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
40962:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
40963:                            ok
40964:                    end},
40965: 
40966:          %% *** Init part ***
40967:          #{desc => "which local address",
40968:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
40969:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
40970:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
40971:                    end},
40972:          #{desc => "create socket",
40973:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
40974:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
40975:                                {ok, Sock} ->
40976:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
40977:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
40978:                                    ERROR
40979:                            end
40980:                    end},
40981:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
40982:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
40983:                          sock     := Sock,
40984:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
40985:                            case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
40986:                                ok ->
40987:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
40988:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
40989:                                    ERROR
40990:                            end;
40991:                       (#{sock     := LSock,
40992:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
40993:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
40994:                                ok ->
40995:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
40996:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
40997:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
40998:                                    ERROR
40999:                            end
41000:                    end},
41001:          #{desc => "initial counter validation (=zero)",
41002:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
41003:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41004:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41005:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial counters: "
41006:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41007:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
41008:                            catch
41009:                                C:E:S ->
41010:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41011:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41012:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41013:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41014:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41015:                            end
41016:                    end},
41017:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
41018:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
41019:                          tester   := Tester,
41020:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}}) ->
41021:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
41022:                            ok;
41023:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
41024:                          lport    := Port}) ->
41025:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
41026:                            ok
41027:                    end},
41028: 
41029:          %% The actual test
41030:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
41031:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41032:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
41033:                    end},
41034:          #{desc => "recv (1)",
41035:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
41036:                          recv := Recv} = State) ->
41037:                            case Recv(Sock) of
41038:                                {ok, {ClientSA, Data}} ->
41039:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41040:                                    {ok, State#{client_sa => ClientSA,
41041:                                                read_pkg  => 1,
41042:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
41043:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41044:                                    ERROR
41045:                            end
41046:                    end},
41047:          #{desc => "validate (recv 1)",
41048:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
41049:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
41050:                          read_byte := Byte} = _State) ->
41051:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41052:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41053:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
41054:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41055:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
41056:                                      Counters,
41057:                                      [{read_pkg,   Pkg},
41058:                                       {read_byte,  Byte},
41059:                                       {read_tries, any}])
41060:                            catch
41061:                                C:E:S ->
41062:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41063:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41064:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41065:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41066:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41067:                            end
41068:                    end},
41069:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
41070:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41071:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
41072:                            ok
41073:                    end},
41074: 
41075:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 1)",
41076:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41077:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
41078:                    end},
41079:          #{desc => "send (1)",
41080:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
41081:                          send      := Send,
41082:                          client_sa := ClientSA} = State) ->
41083:                            Data = ?DATA,
41084:                            case Send(Sock, Data, ClientSA) of
41085:                                ok ->
41086:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41087:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => 1,
41088:                                                write_byte => size(Data)}};
41089:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41090:                                    ERROR
41091:                            end
41092:                    end},
41093:          #{desc => "validate (send 1)",
41094:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
41095:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
41096:                          read_byte  := RByte,
41097:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
41098:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
41099:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41100:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41101:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
41102:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41103:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
41104:                                      Counters,
41105:                                      [{read_pkg,    RPkg},
41106:                                       {read_byte,   RByte},
41107:                                       {write_pkg,   SPkg},
41108:                                       {write_byte,  SByte},
41109:                                       {read_tries,  any},
41110:                                       {write_tries, any}])
41111:                            catch
41112:                                C:E:S ->
41113:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41114:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41115:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41116:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41117:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41118:                            end
41119:                    end},
41120:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 1)",
41121:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41122:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
41123:                            ok
41124:                    end},
41125: 
41126:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
41127:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41128:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
41129:                    end},
41130:          #{desc => "recv (2)",
41131:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
41132:                          recv      := Recv,
41133:                          read_pkg  := Pkg,
41134:                          read_byte := Byte} = State) ->
41135:                            case Recv(Sock) of
41136:                                {ok, {Source, Data}} ->
41137:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41138:                                    {ok, State#{client_sa => Source,
41139:                                                read_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
41140:                                                read_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
41141:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41142:                                    ERROR
41143:                            end
41144:                    end},
41145:          #{desc => "validate (recv 2)",
41146:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
41147:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
41148:                          read_byte  := RByte,
41149:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
41150:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
41151:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41152:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41153:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
41154:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41155:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
41156:                                      Counters,
41157:                                      [{read_pkg,    RPkg},
41158:                                       {read_byte,   RByte},
41159:                                       {write_pkg,   SPkg},
41160:                                       {write_byte,  SByte},
41161:                                       {read_tries,  any},
41162:                                       {write_tries, any}])
41163:                            catch
41164:                                C:E:S ->
41165:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41166:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41167:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41168:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41169:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41170:                            end
41171:                    end},
41172:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
41173:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41174:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
41175:                            ok
41176:                    end},
41177: 
41178:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 2)",
41179:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41180:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
41181:                    end},
41182:          #{desc => "send (2)",
41183:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
41184:                          client_sa  := ClientSA,
41185:                          send       := Send,
41186:                          write_pkg  := Pkg,
41187:                          write_byte := Byte} = State) ->
41188:                            Data = ?DATA,
41189:                            case Send(Sock, Data, ClientSA) of
41190:                                ok ->
41191:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41192:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => Pkg + 1,
41193:                                                write_byte => Byte + size(Data)}};
41194:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41195:                                    ERROR
41196:                            end
41197:                    end},
41198:          #{desc => "validate (send 2)",
41199:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
41200:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
41201:                          read_byte  := RByte,
41202:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
41203:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
41204:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41205:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41206:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
41207:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41208:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
41209:                                      Counters,
41210:                                      [{read_pkg,    RPkg},
41211:                                       {read_byte,   RByte},
41212:                                       {write_pkg,   SPkg},
41213:                                       {write_byte,  SByte},
41214:                                       {read_tries,  any},
41215:                                       {write_tries, any}])
41216:                            catch
41217:                                C:E:S ->
41218:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41219:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41220:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41221:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41222:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41223:                            end
41224:                    end},
41225:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 2)",
41226:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41227:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
41228:                            ok
41229:                    end},
41230: 
41231: 
41232:          %% Termination
41233:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
41234:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
41235:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
41236:                                ok ->
41237:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
41238:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41239:                                    ERROR
41240:                            end
41241:                    end},
41242:          #{desc => "close socket (just in case)",
41243:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
41244:                          sock     := Sock,
41245:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
41246:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
41247:                            State1 =
41248:                                unlink_path(Path,
41249:                                            fun() ->
41250:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
41251:                                            end,
41252:                                            fun() -> State end),
41253:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
41254:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
41255:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
41256:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
41257:                    end},
41258: 
41259:          %% *** We are done ***
41260:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
41261:         ],
41262: 
41263:     ClientSeq =
41264:         [
41265:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
41266:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
41267:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local} = State) ->
41268:                            {Tester, Path} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
41269:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, server_path => Path}};
41270:                       (State) ->
41271:                            {Tester, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
41272:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, server_port => Port}}
41273:                    end},
41274:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
41275:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41276:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
41277:                            ok
41278:                    end},
41279: 
41280:          %% *** Init part ***
41281:          #{desc => "which server (local) address",
41282:            cmd  => fun(#{domain      := local = Domain,
41283:                          server_path := Path} = State) ->
41284:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
41285:                            SSA = #{family => Domain, path => Path},
41286:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA, server_sa => SSA}};
41287:                       (#{domain := Domain, server_port := Port} = State) ->
41288:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
41289:                            SSA = LSA#{port => Port},
41290:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA, server_sa => SSA}}
41291:                    end},
41292:          #{desc => "create socket",
41293:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain,
41294:                          proto  := Proto} = State) ->
41295:                            case socket:open(Domain, dgram, Proto) of
41296:                                {ok, Sock} ->
41297:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
41298:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41299:                                    ERROR
41300:                            end
41301:                    end},
41302:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
41303:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
41304:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
41305:                                ok ->
41306:                                    ok;
41307:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41308:                                    ERROR
41309:                            end
41310:                    end},
41311:          #{desc => "initial counter validation (=zero)",
41312:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
41313:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41314:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41315:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Validate initial counters: "
41316:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41317:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(Counters)
41318:                            catch
41319:                                C:E:S ->
41320:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41321:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41322:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41323:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41324:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41325:                            end
41326:                    end},
41327:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
41328:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41329:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
41330:                            ok
41331:                    end},
41332: 
41333:          %% The actual test
41334:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 1)",
41335:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41336:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
41337:                    end},
41338:          #{desc => "send (1)",
41339:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
41340:                          send      := Send,
41341:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = State) ->
41342:                            Data = ?DATA,
41343:                            case Send(Sock, Data, ServerSA) of
41344:                                ok ->
41345:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41346:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => 1,
41347:                                                write_byte => size(Data)}};
41348:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41349:                                    ERROR
41350:                            end
41351:                    end},
41352:          #{desc => "validate (send 1)",
41353:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
41354:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
41355:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
41356:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41357:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41358:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
41359:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41360:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
41361:                                      Counters,
41362:                                      [{write_pkg,     SPkg},
41363:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
41364:                                       {write_tries,   any},
41365:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
41366:                            catch
41367:                                C:E:S ->
41368:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41369:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41370:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41371:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41372:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41373:                            end
41374:                    end},
41375:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 1)",
41376:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41377:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
41378:                            ok
41379:                    end},
41380: 
41381:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
41382:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41383:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
41384:                    end},
41385:          #{desc => "recv (1)",
41386:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
41387:                          recv      := Recv,
41388:                          server_sa := #{family := local} = ServerSA} = State) ->
41389:                            case Recv(Sock) of
41390:                                {ok, {ServerSA, Data}} ->
41391:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41392:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => 1,
41393:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
41394:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41395:                                    ERROR
41396:                            end;
41397:                       (#{sock      := Sock,
41398:                          recv      := Recv,
41399:                          server_sa := #{addr := Addr, port := Port}} = State) ->
41400:                            case Recv(Sock) of
41401:                                {ok, {#{addr := Addr, port := Port}, Data}} ->
41402:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41403:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => 1,
41404:                                                read_byte => size(Data)}};
41405:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41406:                                    ERROR
41407:                            end
41408:                    end},
41409:          #{desc => "validate (recv 1)",
41410:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
41411:                          read_pkg  := RPkg,
41412:                          read_byte := RByte,
41413:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
41414:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
41415:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41416:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41417:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
41418:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41419:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
41420:                                      Counters,
41421:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
41422:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
41423:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
41424:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
41425:                                       {read_tries,    any},
41426:                                       {write_tries,   any},
41427:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
41428:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
41429:                            catch
41430:                                C:E:S ->
41431:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41432:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41433:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41434:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41435:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41436:                            end
41437:                    end},
41438:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
41439:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41440:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
41441:                            ok
41442:                    end},
41443: 
41444:          #{desc => "await continue (send_and_validate 2)",
41445:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41446:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, send_and_validate)
41447:                    end},
41448:          #{desc => "send (2)",
41449:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
41450:                          send       := Send,
41451:                          server_sa  := ServerSA,
41452:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
41453:                          write_byte := SByte} = State) ->
41454:                            Data = ?DATA,
41455:                            case Send(Sock, Data, ServerSA) of
41456:                                ok ->
41457:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("sent ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41458:                                    {ok, State#{write_pkg  => SPkg + 1,
41459:                                                write_byte => SByte + size(Data)}};
41460:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41461:                                    ERROR
41462:                            end
41463:                    end},
41464:          #{desc => "validate (send 2)",
41465:            cmd  => fun(#{sock       := Sock,
41466:                          read_pkg   := RPkg,
41467:                          read_byte  := RByte,
41468:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
41469:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
41470:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41471:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41472:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
41473:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41474:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
41475:                                      Counters,
41476:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
41477:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
41478:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
41479:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
41480:                                       {read_tries,    any},
41481:                                       {write_tries,   any},
41482:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
41483:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
41484:                            catch
41485:                                C:E:S ->
41486:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41487:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41488:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41489:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41490:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41491:                            end
41492:                    end},
41493:          #{desc => "announce ready (send_and_validate 2)",
41494:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41495:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_and_validate),
41496:                            ok
41497:                    end},
41498: 
41499:          #{desc => "await continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
41500:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41501:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_and_validate)
41502:                    end},
41503:          #{desc => "recv (2)",
41504:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
41505:                          server_sa := #{family := local} = ServerSA,
41506:                          recv      := Recv,
41507:                          read_pkg  := RPkg,
41508:                          read_byte := RByte} = State) ->
41509:                            case Recv(Sock) of
41510:                                {ok, {ServerSA, Data}} ->
41511:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41512:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => RPkg + 1,
41513:                                                read_byte => RByte + size(Data)}};
41514:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41515:                                    ERROR
41516:                            end;
41517: 		      (#{sock      := Sock,
41518:                          server_sa := #{addr := Addr, port := Port},
41519:                          recv      := Recv,
41520:                          read_pkg  := RPkg,
41521:                          read_byte := RByte} = State) ->
41522:                            case Recv(Sock) of
41523:                                {ok, {#{addr := Addr, port := Port}, Data}} ->
41524:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv ~p bytes", [size(Data)]),
41525:                                    {ok, State#{read_pkg  => RPkg + 1,
41526:                                                read_byte => RByte + size(Data)}};
41527:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41528:                                    ERROR
41529:                            end
41530:                    end},
41531:          #{desc => "validate (recv 2)",
41532:            cmd  => fun(#{sock      := Sock,
41533:                          read_pkg  := RPkg,
41534:                          read_byte := RByte,
41535:                          write_pkg  := SPkg,
41536:                          write_byte := SByte} = _State) ->
41537:                            try socket:info(Sock) of
41538:                                #{counters := Counters} ->
41539:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("validate counters: "
41540:                                                "~s", [format_counters(Counters)]),
41541:                                    traffic_sar_counters_validation(
41542:                                      Counters,
41543:                                      [{read_pkg,      RPkg},
41544:                                       {read_byte,     RByte},
41545:                                       {write_pkg,     SPkg},
41546:                                       {write_byte,    SByte},
41547:                                       {read_tries,    any},
41548:                                       {write_tries,   any},
41549:                                       {read_pkg_max,  any},
41550:                                       {write_pkg_max, any}])
41551:                            catch
41552:                                C:E:S ->
41553:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket info: "
41554:                                                "~n   Class: ~p"
41555:                                                "~n   Error: ~p"
41556:                                                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
41557:                                    {error, {socket_info_failed, {C, E, S}}}
41558:                            end
41559:                    end},
41560:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
41561:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41562:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_and_validate),
41563:                            ok
41564:                    end},
41565: 
41566:          %% Termination
41567:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
41568:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
41569:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
41570:                                ok ->
41571:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
41572:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41573:                                    ERROR
41574:                            end
41575:                    end},
41576:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
41577:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
41578:                          sock     := Sock,
41579:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
41580:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
41581:                            State1 =
41582:                                unlink_path(Path,
41583:                                            fun() ->
41584:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
41585:                                            end,
41586:                                            fun() -> State end),
41587:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
41588:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
41589:                            socket:close(Sock),
41590:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
41591:                    end},
41592: 
41593:          %% *** We are done ***
41594:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
41595:         ],
41596: 
41597: 
41598:     TesterSeq =
41599:         [
41600:          %% *** Init part ***
41601:          #{desc => "monitor server",
41602:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
41603:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
41604:                            ok
41605:                    end},
41606:          #{desc => "monitor client",
41607:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
41608:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
41609:                            ok
41610:                    end},
41611: 
41612:          %% Start the server
41613:          #{desc => "order server start",
41614:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
41615:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
41616:                            ok
41617:                    end},
41618:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
41619:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
41620:                          server := Pid} = State) ->
41621:                            {ok, Path} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
41622:                            {ok, State#{path => Path}};
41623:                       (#{server := Pid} = State) ->
41624:                            {ok, Port} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
41625:                            {ok, State#{port => Port}}
41626:                    end},
41627: 
41628:          %% Start the client
41629:          #{desc => "order client start",
41630:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
41631:                          client := Pid,
41632:                          path   := Path} = _State) ->
41633:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Path),
41634:                            ok;
41635:                       (#{client := Pid,
41636:                          port   := Port} = _State) ->
41637:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Port),
41638:                            ok
41639:                    end},
41640:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
41641:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
41642:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
41643:                    end},
41644: 
41645:          %% *** The actual test ***
41646: 
41647:          #{desc => "order server to continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
41648:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41649:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, recv_and_validate),
41650:                            ok
41651:                    end},
41652:          #{desc => "order client to continue (send_and_validate 1)",
41653:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41654:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_and_validate),
41655:                            ok
41656:                    end},
41657:          #{desc => "await client ready (send_and_validate 1)",
41658:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41659:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_and_validate)
41660:                    end},
41661:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
41662:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41663:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_and_validate)
41664:                    end},
41665: 
41666:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
41667: 
41668:          #{desc => "order client to continue (recv_and_validate 1)",
41669:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41670:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, recv_and_validate),
41671:                            ok
41672:                    end},
41673:          #{desc => "order server to continue (send_and_validate 1)",
41674:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41675:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_and_validate),
41676:                            ok
41677:                    end},
41678:          #{desc => "await server ready (send_and_validate 1)",
41679:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41680:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_and_validate)
41681:                    end},
41682:          #{desc => "await client ready (recv_and_validate 1)",
41683:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41684:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_and_validate)
41685:                    end},
41686: 
41687:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
41688: 
41689:          #{desc => "order server to continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
41690:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41691:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, recv_and_validate),
41692:                            ok
41693:                    end},
41694:          #{desc => "order client to continue (send_and_validate 2)",
41695:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41696:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send_and_validate),
41697:                            ok
41698:                    end},
41699:          #{desc => "await client ready (send_and_validate 2)",
41700:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41701:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_and_validate)
41702:                    end},
41703:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
41704:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41705:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_and_validate)
41706:                    end},
41707: 
41708:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
41709: 
41710:          #{desc => "order client to continue (recv_and_validate 2)",
41711:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41712:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, recv_and_validate),
41713:                            ok
41714:                    end},
41715:          #{desc => "order server to continue (send_and_validate 2)",
41716:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41717:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Server, send_and_validate),
41718:                            ok
41719:                    end},
41720:          #{desc => "await server ready (send_and_validate 2)",
41721:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41722:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, send_and_validate)
41723:                    end},
41724:          #{desc => "await client ready (recv_and_validate 2)",
41725:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41726:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, recv_and_validate)
41727:                    end},
41728: 
41729:          %% *** Termination ***
41730:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
41731:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
41732:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
41733:                            ok
41734:                    end},
41735:          #{desc => "await client termination",
41736:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
41737:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
41738:                            State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
41739:                            {ok, State1}
41740:                    end},
41741:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
41742:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
41743:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
41744:                            ok
41745:                    end},
41746:          #{desc => "await server termination",
41747:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = State) ->
41748:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
41749:                            State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
41750:                            {ok, State1}
41751:                    end},
41752: 
41753:          %% *** We are done ***
41754:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
41755:         ],
41756: 
41757:     i("start server evaluator"),
41758:     ServerInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
41759:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
41760: 
41761:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
41762:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
41763:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
41764: 
41765:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
41766:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
41767:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
41768:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
41769: 
41770:     i("await evaluator"),
41771:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
41772: 
41773: 
41774: 
41775: 
41776: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
41777: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
41778: %% behave as expected when sending and/or reading chunks.
41779: %% First send data in one "big" chunk, and read it in "small" chunks.
41780: %% Second, send in a bunch of "small" chunks, and read in one "big" chunk.
41781: %% Protocol is tcp and Domain is IPv4.
41782: 
41783: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
41784:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
41785:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
41786:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
41787:            fun() ->
41788:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
41789:                                  proto  => tcp},
41790:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState)
41791:            end).
41792: 
41793: 
41794: 
41795: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
41796: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
41797: %% behave as expected when sending and/or reading chunks.
41798: %% First send data in one "big" chunk, and read it in "small" chunks.
41799: %% Second, send in a bunch of "small" chunks, and read in one "big" chunk.
41800: %% Protocol is tcp and Domain is IPv6.
41801: 
41802: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
41803:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
41804:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
41805:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
41806:            fun() ->
41807:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
41808:                                  proto  => tcp},
41809:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState)
41810:            end).
41811: 
41812: 
41813: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
41814: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
41815: %% behave as expected when sending and/or reading chunks.
41816: %% First send data in one "big" chunk, and read it in "small" chunks.
41817: %% Second, send in a bunch of "small" chunks, and read in one "big" chunk.
41818: %% Protocol is 'default' and Domain is UNix Domain (Stream).
41819: 
41820: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
41821:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
41822:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
41823:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
41824:            fun() ->
41825:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
41826:                                  proto  => default},
41827:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState)
41828:            end).
41829: 
41830: 
41831: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
41832: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
41833: %% behave as expected when sending and/or reading chunks.
41834: %% First send data in one "big" chunk, and read it in "small" chunks.
41835: %% Second, send in a bunch of "small" chunks, and read in one "big" chunk.
41836: %% Protocol is SCTP and Domain is IPv4.
41837: 
41838: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_sctp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
41839:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
41840:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
41841:            fun() ->
41842:                    has_support_ipv4(),
41843:                    has_support_sctp()
41844:            end,
41845:            fun() ->
41846:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
41847:                                  proto  => sctp},
41848:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState)
41849:            end).
41850: 
41851: 
41852: 
41853: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
41854: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
41855: %% behave as expected when sending and/or reading chunks.
41856: %% First send data in one "big" chunk, and read it in "small" chunks.
41857: %% Second, send in a bunch of "small" chunks, and read in one "big" chunk.
41858: %% Protocol is SCTP and Domain is IPv6.
41859: 
41860: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_sctp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
41861:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
41862:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
41863:            fun() ->
41864:                    has_support_ipv6(),
41865:                    has_support_sctp()
41866:            end,
41867:            fun() ->
41868:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
41869:                                  proto  => sctp},
41870:                    ok = traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState)
41871:            end).
41872: 
41873: 
41874: 
41875: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
41876: 
41877: traffic_send_and_recv_chunks_stream(InitState) ->
41878:     ServerSeq =
41879:         [
41880:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
41881:          #{desc => "await start",
41882:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
41883:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
41884:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
41885:                    end},
41886:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
41887:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41888:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
41889:                            ok
41890:                    end},
41891: 
41892:          %% *** Init part ***
41893:          #{desc => "which local address",
41894:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
41895:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
41896:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
41897:                    end},
41898:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
41899:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
41900:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
41901:                                {ok, Sock} ->
41902:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
41903:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41904:                                    ERROR
41905:                            end
41906:                    end},
41907:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
41908:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
41909:                          lsock    := LSock,
41910:                          local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
41911:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
41912:                                ok ->
41913:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
41914:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41915:                                    ERROR
41916:                            end;
41917:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
41918:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
41919:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
41920:                                ok ->
41921:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
41922:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
41923:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41924:                                    ERROR
41925:                            end
41926:                    end},
41927:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
41928:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
41929:                            socket:listen(LSock)
41930:                    end},
41931:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
41932:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
41933:                          tester   := Tester,
41934:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
41935:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
41936:                            ok;
41937:                       (#{tester   := Tester,
41938:                          local_sa := LSA,
41939:                          lport    := Port}) ->
41940:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
41941:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
41942:                            ok
41943:                    end},
41944: 
41945:          %% The actual test
41946:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
41947:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41948:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
41949:                    end},
41950:          #{desc => "accept",
41951:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
41952:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
41953:                                {ok, Sock} ->
41954:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
41955:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41956:                                    ERROR
41957:                            end
41958:                    end},
41959:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
41960:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
41961:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
41962:                            ok
41963:                    end},
41964: 
41965:          #{desc => "await continue (recv-many-small)",
41966:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
41967:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_many_small)
41968:                    end},
41969:          #{desc => "recv chunk 1",
41970:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
41971:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
41972:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
41973:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 1 of ~p bytes",
41974:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
41975:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)]}};
41976:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41977:                                    ERROR
41978:                            end
41979:                    end},
41980:          #{desc => "recv chunk 2",
41981:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
41982:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
41983:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
41984:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
41985:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 2 of ~p bytes",
41986:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
41987:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
41988:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
41989:                                    ERROR
41990:                            end
41991:                    end},
41992:          #{desc => "recv chunk 3",
41993:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
41994:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
41995:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
41996:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
41997:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 3 of ~p bytes",
41998:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
41999:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
42000:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42001:                                    ERROR
42002:                            end
42003:                    end},
42004:          #{desc => "recv chunk 4",
42005:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
42006:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
42007:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
42008:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
42009:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 4 of ~p bytes",
42010:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
42011:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
42012:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42013:                                    ERROR
42014:                            end
42015:                    end},
42016:          #{desc => "recv chunk 5",
42017:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
42018:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
42019:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
42020:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
42021:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 5 of ~p bytes",
42022:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
42023:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
42024:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42025:                                    ERROR
42026:                            end
42027:                    end},
42028:          #{desc => "recv chunk 6",
42029:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
42030:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
42031:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
42032:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
42033:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 6 of ~p bytes",
42034:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
42035:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
42036:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42037:                                    ERROR
42038:                            end
42039:                    end},
42040:          #{desc => "recv chunk 7",
42041:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
42042:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
42043:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
42044:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
42045:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 7 of ~p bytes",
42046:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
42047:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
42048:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42049:                                    ERROR
42050:                            end
42051:                    end},
42052:          #{desc => "recv chunk 8",
42053:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
42054:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
42055:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
42056:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
42057:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 8 of ~p bytes",
42058:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
42059:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
42060:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42061:                                    ERROR
42062:                            end
42063:                    end},
42064:          #{desc => "recv chunk 9",
42065:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
42066:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
42067:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
42068:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
42069:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 9 of ~p bytes",
42070:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
42071:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
42072:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42073:                                    ERROR
42074:                            end
42075:                    end},
42076:          #{desc => "recv chunk 10",
42077:            cmd  => fun(#{csock  := Sock,
42078:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
42079:                            case socket:recv(Sock, 100) of
42080:                                {ok, Chunk} ->
42081:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("recv of chunk 10 of ~p bytes",
42082:                                                [size(Chunk)]),
42083:                                    {ok, State#{chunks => [b2l(Chunk)|Chunks]}};
42084:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42085:                                    ERROR
42086:                            end
42087:                    end},
42088:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv-many-small)",
42089:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
42090:                          chunks := Chunks} = State) ->
42091:                            Data = lists:flatten(lists:reverse(Chunks)),
42092:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_many_small, Data),
42093:                            {ok, maps:remove(chunks, State)}
42094:                    end},
42095: 
42096:          #{desc => "await continue (recv-one-big)",
42097:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
42098:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv_one_big) of
42099:                                {ok, Size} ->
42100:                                    {ok, State#{size => Size}};
42101:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42102:                                    ERROR
42103:                            end
42104:                    end},
42105:          #{desc => "recv (one big)",
42106:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, csock := Sock, size := Size} = _State) ->
42107:                            %% socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
42108:                            case socket:recv(Sock, Size) of
42109:                                {ok, Data} ->
42110:                                    ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester,
42111:                                                        recv_one_big,
42112:                                                        b2l(Data)),
42113:                                    ok;
42114:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42115:                                    ERROR
42116:                            end
42117:                    end},
42118: 
42119:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
42120:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
42121:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
42122:                                ok ->
42123:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
42124:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42125:                                    ERROR
42126:                            end
42127:                    end},
42128:          #{desc => "close connection socket (just in case)",
42129:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
42130:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
42131:                            {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)}
42132:                    end},
42133:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
42134:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
42135:                          lsock    := Sock,
42136:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
42137:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
42138:                            State1 =
42139:                                unlink_path(Path,
42140:                                            fun() ->
42141:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
42142:                                            end,
42143:                                            fun() -> State end),
42144:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
42145:                       (#{lsock := Sock} = State) ->
42146:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
42147:                            {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)}
42148:                    end},
42149: 
42150:          %% *** We are done ***
42151:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
42152:         ],
42153: 
42154:     ClientSeq =
42155:         [
42156:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
42157:          #{desc => "await start",
42158:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
42159:                            {Tester, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
42160:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester,
42161:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
42162:                    end},
42163:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
42164:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
42165:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
42166:                            ok
42167:                    end},
42168: 
42169:          %% *** Init part ***
42170:          #{desc => "create node",
42171:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
42172:                            {Peer, Node} = ?START_NODE("client"),
42173:                            {ok, State#{peer => Peer, node => Node}}
42174:                    end},
42175:          #{desc => "monitor client node",
42176:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
42177:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
42178:                            ok
42179:                    end},
42180:          #{desc => "start remote client",
42181:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
42182:                            Pid = traffic_snr_tcp_client_start(Node),
42183:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
42184:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
42185:                    end},
42186:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
42187:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
42188:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
42189:                            ok
42190:                    end},
42191:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
42192:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
42193:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
42194:                          proto     := Proto}) ->
42195:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, {ServerSA, Proto}),
42196:                            ok
42197:                    end},
42198:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
42199:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42200:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42201:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init,
42202:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
42203:                    end},
42204:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
42205:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
42206:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
42207:                            ok
42208:                    end},
42209: 
42210:          %% The actual test
42211:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
42212:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42213:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
