42214:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect,
42215:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
42216:                            ok
42217:                    end},
42218:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
42219:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
42220:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
42221:                            ok
42222:                    end},
42223:          #{desc => "await client process ready (connect)",
42224:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42225:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42226:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, connect,
42227:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
42228:                    end},
42229:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
42230:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
42231:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
42232:                            ok
42233:                    end},
42234: 
42235:          #{desc => "await continue (send-one-big)",
42236:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42237:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
42238:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester,
42239:                                                     send_one_big,
42240:                                                     [{rclient, Client}]) of
42241:                                {ok, Data} ->
42242:                                    {ok, State#{data => Data}};
42243:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42244:                                    ERROR
42245:                            end
42246:                    end},
42247:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send)",
42248:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client, data := Data}) ->
42249:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Data),
42250:                            ok
42251:                    end},
42252:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send)",
42253:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42254:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42255:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send,
42256:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42257:                                {ok, Result} ->
42258:                                    Result;
42259:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42260:                                    ERROR
42261:                            end
42262:                    end},
42263:          #{desc => "announce ready (send-one-big)",
42264:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
42265:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_one_big),
42266:                            ok
42267:                    end},
42268: 
42269:          #{desc => "await continue (send-many-small)",
42270:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42271:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
42272:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester,
42273:                                                     send_many_small,
42274:                                                     [{rclient, Client}]) of
42275:                                {ok, Data} ->
42276:                                    {ok, State#{data => Data}};
42277:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42278:                                    ERROR
42279:                            end
42280:                    end},
42281:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 1)",
42282:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42283:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42284:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42285:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 1: "
42286:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42287:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42288:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42289:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42290:                    end},
42291:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 1)",
42292:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42293:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42294:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42295:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42296:                                {ok, Result} ->
42297:                                    Result;
42298:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42299:                                    ERROR
42300:                            end
42301:                    end},
42302:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 2)",
42303:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42304:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42305:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42306:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 2: "
42307:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42308:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42309:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42310:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42311:                    end},
42312:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 2)",
42313:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42314:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42315:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42316:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42317:                                {ok, Result} ->
42318:                                    Result;
42319:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42320:                                    ERROR
42321:                            end
42322:                    end},
42323:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 3)",
42324:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42325:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42326:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42327:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 3: "
42328:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42329:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42330:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42331:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42332:                    end},
42333:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 3)",
42334:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42335:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42336:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42337:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42338:                                {ok, Result} ->
42339:                                    Result;
42340:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42341:                                    ERROR
42342:                            end
42343:                    end},
42344:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 4)",
42345:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42346:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42347:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42348:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 4: "
42349:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42350:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42351:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42352:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42353:                    end},
42354:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 4)",
42355:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42356:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42357:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42358:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42359:                                {ok, Result} ->
42360:                                    Result;
42361:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42362:                                    ERROR
42363:                            end
42364:                    end},
42365:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 5)",
42366:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42367:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42368:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42369:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 5: "
42370:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42371:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42372:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42373:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42374:                    end},
42375:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 5)",
42376:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42377:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42378:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42379:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42380:                                {ok, Result} ->
42381:                                    Result;
42382:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42383:                                    ERROR
42384:                            end
42385:                    end},
42386:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 6)",
42387:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42388:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42389:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42390:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 6: "
42391:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42392:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42393:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42394:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42395:                    end},
42396:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 6)",
42397:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42398:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42399:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42400:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42401:                                {ok, Result} ->
42402:                                    Result;
42403:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42404:                                    ERROR
42405:                            end
42406:                    end},
42407:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 7)",
42408:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42409:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42410:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42411:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 7: "
42412:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42413:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42414:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42415:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42416:                    end},
42417:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 7)",
42418:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42419:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42420:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42421:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42422:                                {ok, Result} ->
42423:                                    Result;
42424:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42425:                                    ERROR
42426:                            end
42427:                    end},
42428:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 8)",
42429:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42430:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42431:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42432:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 8: "
42433:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42434:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42435:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42436:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42437:                    end},
42438:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 8)",
42439:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42440:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42441:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42442:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42443:                                {ok, Result} ->
42444:                                    Result;
42445:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42446:                                    ERROR
42447:                            end
42448:                    end},
42449:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 9)",
42450:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42451:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42452:                            {Chunk, RestData} = lists:split(100, Data),
42453:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 9: "
42454:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42455:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42456:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42457:                            {ok, State#{data => RestData}}
42458:                    end},
42459:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 9)",
42460:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42461:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42462:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42463:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42464:                                {ok, Result} ->
42465:                                    Result;
42466:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42467:                                    ERROR
42468:                            end
42469:                    end},
42470:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send chunk 10)",
42471:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client,
42472:                          data    := Data} = State) ->
42473:                            {Chunk, []} = lists:split(100, Data),
42474:                            %% ?SEV_IPRINT("order send of chunk 10: "
42475:                            %%             "~n   Size: ~p"
42476:                            %%             "~n   ~p", [length(Chunk), Chunk]),
42477:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, Chunk),
42478:                            {ok, maps:remove(data, State)}
42479:                    end},
42480:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send chunk 10)",
42481:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42482:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42483:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42484:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42485:                                {ok, Result} ->
42486:                                    Result;
42487:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42488:                                    ERROR
42489:                            end
42490:                    end},
42491:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (send stop)",
42492:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client} = State) ->
42493:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, send, stop),
42494:                            {ok, maps:remove(data, State)}
42495:                    end},
42496:          #{desc => "await client process ready (send stop)",
42497:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
42498:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
42499:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, send, 
42500:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
42501:                                {ok, Result} ->
42502:                                    Result;
42503:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42504:                                    ERROR
42505:                            end
42506:                    end},
42507:          #{desc => "announce ready (send-many-small)",
42508:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
42509:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, send_many_small),
42510:                            ok
42511:                    end},
42512: 
42513:          %% Termination
42514:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
42515:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
42516:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
42517:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
42518:                                                      [{rclient, Client}]) of
42519:                                ok ->
42520:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
42521:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42522:                                    ERROR
42523:                            end
42524:                    end},
42525:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
42526:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
42527:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
42528:                            ok
42529:                    end},
42530:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
42531:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client} = State) ->
42532:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
42533:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
42534:                            {ok, State1}
42535:                    end},
42536:          #{desc => "stop client node",
42537:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
42538:                            {ok,
42539:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
42540:                                 ok ->
42541:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
42542:                                 {error, Reason} ->
42543:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
42544:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
42545:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
42546:                             catch
42547:                                 C:E:S ->
42548:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
42549:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
42550:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
42551:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
42552:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
42553:                             end}
42554:                    end},
42555:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
42556:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
42557:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown"),
42558:                            receive
42559:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
42560:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
42561:                                    State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
42562:                                    {ok, State1}
42563:                            end;
42564:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
42565:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
42566:                            State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
42567:                            {ok, State1}
42568:                    end},
42569: 
42570:          %% *** We are done ***
42571:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
42572:         ],
42573: 
42574:     TesterSeq =
42575:         [
42576:          %% *** Init part ***
42577:          #{desc => "monitor server",
42578:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
42579:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
42580:                            ok
42581:                    end},
42582:          #{desc => "monitor client",
42583:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
42584:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
42585:                            ok
42586:                    end},
42587: 
42588:          %% Start the server
42589:          #{desc => "order server start",
42590:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
42591:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
42592:                            ok
42593:                    end},
42594:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
42595:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
42596:                            {ok, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
42597:                            {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}}
42598:                    end},
42599: 
42600:          %% Start the client
42601:          #{desc => "order client start",
42602:            cmd  => fun(#{client    := Pid, 
42603:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
42604:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, ServerSA),
42605:                            ok
42606:                    end},
42607:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
42608:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
42609:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
42610:                    end},
42611:  
42612:          %% The actual test
42613:          #{desc => "order server continue (accept)",
42614:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
42615:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
42616:                            ok
42617:                    end},
42618:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
42619:          #{desc => "order client continue (connect)",
42620:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
42621:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
42622:                            ok
42623:                    end},
42624:          #{desc => "await server ready (accept)",
42625:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
42626:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
42627:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, accept,
42628:                                             [{client, Client}]),
42629:                            ok
42630:                    end},
42631:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
42632:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
42633:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
42634:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, connect, 
42635:                                             [{server, Server}])
42636:                    end},
42637: 
42638:          #{desc => "generate data",
42639:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
42640:                            D1 = lists:seq(1,250),
42641:                            D2 = lists:duplicate(4, D1),
42642:                            D3 = lists:flatten(D2),
42643:                            {ok, State#{data => D3}}
42644:                    end},
42645: 
42646:          %% (client) Send one big and (server) recv may small
42647:          #{desc => "order server continue (recv-many-small)",
42648:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
42649:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv_many_small),
42650:                            ok
42651:                    end},
42652:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
42653:          #{desc => "order client continue (send-one-big)",
42654:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid, data := Data} = _State) ->
42655:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, send_one_big, Data),
42656:                            ok
42657:                    end},
42658:          #{desc => "await client ready (send-one-big)",
42659:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
42660:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
42661:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_one_big, 
42662:                                                  [{server, Server}])
42663:                    end},
42664:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv-many-small)",
42665:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
42666:                          client := Client, 
42667:                          data   := Data} = _State) ->
42668:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_many_small,
42669:                                                  [{client, Client}]) of
42670:                                {ok, Data} ->
42671:                                    ok;
42672:                                {ok, OtherData} ->
42673:                                    {error, {mismatched_data, Data, OtherData}};
42674:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42675:                                    ERROR
42676:                            end
42677:                    end},
42678: 
42679:          #{desc => "order server continue (recv-one-big)",
42680:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid, data := Data} = _State) ->
42681:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv_one_big, length(Data)),
42682:                            ok
42683:                    end},
42684:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
42685:          #{desc => "order client continue (send-many-small)",
42686:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid, data := Data} = _State) ->
42687:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, send_many_small, Data),
42688:                            ok
42689:                    end},
42690:          #{desc => "await client ready (send-many-small)",
42691:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
42692:                          client := Client} = _State) ->
42693:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, send_many_small, 
42694:                                                  [{server, Server}])
42695:                    end},
42696:          #{desc => "await server ready (recv-one-big)",
42697:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
42698:                          client := Client, 
42699:                          data   := Data} = State) ->
42700:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_one_big,
42701:                                                  [{client, Client}]) of
42702:                                {ok, Data} ->
42703:                                    {ok, maps:remove(data, State)};
42704:                                {ok, OtherData} ->
42705:                                    {error, {mismatched_data, Data, OtherData}};
42706:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42707:                                    ERROR
42708:                            end
42709:                    end},
42710: 
42711:          %% Terminations
42712:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
42713:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
42714:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
42715:                            ok
42716:                    end},
42717:          #{desc => "await client termination",
42718:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
42719:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
42720:                                ok ->
42721:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client, State),
42722:                                    {ok, State1};
42723:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42724:                                    ERROR
42725:                            end
42726:                    end},
42727:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
42728:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
42729:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
42730:                            ok
42731:                    end},
42732:          #{desc => "await server termination",
42733:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
42734:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
42735:                                ok ->
42736:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
42737:                                    {ok, State1};
42738:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
42739:                                    ERROR
42740:                            end
42741:                    end},
42742: 
42743: 
42744:          %% *** We are done ***
42745:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
42746:         ],
42747: 
42748:     i("start server evaluator"),
42749:     ServerInitState = InitState,
42750:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
42751: 
42752:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
42753:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
42754:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
42755: 
42756:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
42757:     TesterInitState = #{server => Server#ev.pid,
42758:                         client => Client#ev.pid},
42759:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
42760: 
42761:     i("await evaluator"),
42762:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
42763:     
42764: 
42765: 
42766: traffic_snr_tcp_client_start(Node) ->
42767:     Self = self(),
42768:     Fun  = fun() -> traffic_snr_tcp_client(Self) end,
42769:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
42770: 
42771: traffic_snr_tcp_client(Parent) ->
42772:     {Sock, ServerSA, Path} = traffic_snr_tcp_client_init(Parent),
42773:     traffic_snr_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
42774:     traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
42775:     traffic_snr_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA),
42776:     traffic_snr_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect),
42777:     traffic_snr_tcp_client_send_loop(Parent, Sock),
42778:     Reason = traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
42779:     traffic_snr_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path),
42780:     exit(Reason).
42781: 
42782: 
42783: traffic_snr_tcp_client_send_loop(Parent, Sock) ->
42784:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, send) of
42785:         {ok, stop} -> % Breaks the loop
42786:             ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, send, ok),
42787:             ok;
42788:         {ok, Data} ->
42789:             case socket:send(Sock, Data) of
42790:                 ok ->
42791:                     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, send, ok),
42792:                     traffic_snr_tcp_client_send_loop(Parent, Sock);
42793:                 {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
42794:                     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, send, ERROR),
42795:                     exit({send, Reason})
42796:             end;
42797:         {error, Reason} ->
42798:             exit({await_continue, Reason})
42799:     end.
42800: 
42801: traffic_snr_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
42802:     put(sname, "rclient"),
42803:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
42804:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
42805:     {ServerSA, Proto} = traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
42806:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
42807:     Sock     = traffic_snr_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto),
42808:     Path     = traffic_snr_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain),
42809:     {Sock, ServerSA, Path}.
42810: 
42811: traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
42812:     i("traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
42813:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
42814: 
42815: traffic_snr_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto) ->
42816:     i("traffic_snr_tcp_client_create -> entry"),
42817:     case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
42818:         {ok, Sock} ->
42819:             Sock;
42820:         {error, Reason} ->
42821:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
42822:     end.
42823: 
42824: traffic_snr_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
42825:     i("traffic_snr_tcp_client_bind -> entry"),
42826:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
42827:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
42828:         ok ->
42829:             case socket:sockname(Sock) of
42830:                 {ok, #{family := local, path := Path}} ->
42831:                     Path;
42832:                 {ok, _} ->
42833:                     undefined;
42834:                 {error, Reason1} ->
42835:                     exit({sockname, Reason1})
42836:             end;
42837:         {error, Reason} ->
42838:             exit({bind, Reason})
42839:     end.
42840: 
42841: traffic_snr_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
42842:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
42843: 
42844: traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
42845:     i("traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_continue -> entry"),
42846:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
42847: 
42848: traffic_snr_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA) ->
42849:     i("traffic_snr_tcp_client_connect -> entry"),
42850:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA) of
42851:         ok ->
42852:             ok;
42853:         {error, Reason} ->
42854:             exit({connect, Reason})
42855:     end.
42856: 
42857: traffic_snr_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path) ->
42858:     i("traffic_snr_tcp_client_close -> entry"),
42859:     case socket:close(Sock) of
42860:         ok ->
42861:             unlink_path(Path),
42862:             ok;
42863:         {error, Reason} ->
42864:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed closing: "
42865:                         "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
42866:             unlink_path(Path),
42867:             {error, {close, Reason}}
42868:     end.
42869: 
42870: traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
42871:     i("traffic_snr_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
42872:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
42873:         ok ->
42874:             ok;
42875:         {error, Reason} ->
42876:             Reason
42877:     end.
42878: 
42879: 
42880: 
42881: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
42882: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
42883: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
42884: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
42885: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
42886: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
42887: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
42888: %% This is the 'small' message test case,
42889: %% for TCP and IPv4.
42890: 
42891: traffic_ping_pong_small_send_and_recv_tcp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
42892:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
42893:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
42894:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
42895:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
42896:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
42897:            fun() ->
42898:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
42899:                                  proto  => tcp,
42900:                                  msg    => Msg,
42901:                                  num    => Num},
42902:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
42903:            end).
42904: 
42905: 
42906: 
42907: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
42908: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
42909: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
42910: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
42911: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
42912: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
42913: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
42914: %% This is the 'small' message test case,
42915: %% for TCP and IPv6.
42916: 
42917: traffic_ping_pong_small_send_and_recv_tcp6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
42918:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
42919:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
42920:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
42921:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
42922:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
42923:            fun() ->
42924:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
42925:                                  proto  => tcp,
42926:                                  msg    => Msg,
42927:                                  num    => Num},
42928:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
42929:            end).
42930: 
42931: 
42932: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
42933: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
42934: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
42935: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
42936: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
42937: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
42938: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
42939: %% This is the 'small' message test case,
42940: %% for TCP (default) and Unix Domain (stream) socket.
42941: 
42942: traffic_ping_pong_small_send_and_recv_tcpL(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
42943:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
42944:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
42945:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
42946:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
42947:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
42948:            fun() ->
42949:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
42950:                                  proto  => default,
42951:                                  msg    => Msg,
42952:                                  num    => Num},
42953:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
42954:            end).
42955: 
42956: 
42957: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
42958: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
42959: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
42960: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
42961: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
42962: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
42963: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
42964: %% This is the 'small' message test case,
42965: %% for SCTP and IPv4.
42966: 
42967: traffic_ping_pong_small_send_and_recv_sctp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
42968:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
42969:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
42970:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
42971:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
42972:            fun() ->
42973:                    has_support_ipv4(),
42974:                    has_support_sctp()
42975:            end,
42976:            fun() ->
42977:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
42978:                                  proto  => sctp,
42979:                                  msg    => Msg,
42980:                                  num    => Num},
42981:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
42982:            end).
42983: 
42984: 
42985: 
42986: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
42987: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
42988: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
42989: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
42990: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
42991: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
42992: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
42993: %% This is the 'small' message test case,
42994: %% for SCTP and IPv6.
42995: 
42996: traffic_ping_pong_small_send_and_recv_sctp6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
42997:     ?TT(?SECS(15)),
42998:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
42999:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
43000:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43001:            fun() ->
43002:                    has_support_ipv6(),
43003:                    has_support_sctp()
43004:            end,
43005:            fun() ->
43006:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
43007:                                  proto  => sctp,
43008:                                  msg    => Msg,
43009:                                  num    => Num},
43010:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43011:            end).
43012: 
43013: 
43014: 
43015: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43016: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43017: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43018: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43019: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43020: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43021: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43022: %% This is the 'medium' message test case,
43023: %% for TCP and IPv4.
43024: 
43025: traffic_ping_pong_medium_send_and_recv_tcp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43026:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
43027:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
43028:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43029:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
43030:            fun() ->
43031:                    ?TT(?SECS(30)),
43032:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43033:                                  proto  => tcp,
43034:                                  msg    => Msg,
43035:                                  num    => Num},
43036:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43037:            end).
43038: 
43039: 
43040: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43041: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43042: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43043: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43044: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43045: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43046: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43047: %% This is the 'medium' message test case,
43048: %% for TCP and IPv6.
43049: 
43050: traffic_ping_pong_medium_send_and_recv_tcp6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43051:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
43052:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
43053:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43054:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
43055:            fun() ->
43056:                    ?TT(?SECS(30)),
43057:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
43058:                                  proto  => tcp,
43059:                                  msg    => Msg,
43060:                                  num    => Num},
43061:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43062:            end).
43063: 
43064: 
43065: 
43066: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43067: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43068: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43069: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43070: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43071: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43072: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43073: %% This is the 'medium' message test case,
43074: %% for TCP (default) and Unix Domain (stream) socket.
43075: 
43076: traffic_ping_pong_medium_send_and_recv_tcpL(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43077:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
43078:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
43079:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
43080:     tc_try(traffic_ping_pong_medium_send_and_recv_tcpL,
43081:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
43082:            fun() ->
43083:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
43084:                                  proto  => default,
43085:                                  msg    => Msg,
43086:                                  num    => Num},
43087:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43088:            end).
43089: 
43090: 
43091: 
43092: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43093: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43094: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43095: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43096: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43097: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43098: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43099: %% This is the 'medium' message test case,
43100: %% for SCTP and IPv4.
43101: 
43102: traffic_ping_pong_medium_send_and_recv_sctp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43103:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
43104:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
43105:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43106:            fun() ->
43107:                    has_support_ipv4(),
43108:                    has_support_sctp()
43109:            end,
43110:            fun() ->
43111:                    ?TT(?SECS(30)),
43112:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43113:                                  proto  => sctp,
43114:                                  msg    => Msg,
43115:                                  num    => Num},
43116:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43117:            end).
43118: 
43119: 
43120: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43121: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43122: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43123: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43124: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43125: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43126: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43127: %% This is the 'medium' message test case,
43128: %% for SCTP and IPv6.
43129: 
43130: traffic_ping_pong_medium_send_and_recv_sctp6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43131:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
43132:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
43133:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43134:            fun() ->
43135:                    has_support_ipv6(),
43136:                    has_support_sctp()
43137:            end,
43138:            fun() ->
43139:                    ?TT(?SECS(30)),
43140:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
43141:                                  proto  => sctp,
43142:                                  msg    => Msg,
43143:                                  num    => Num},
43144:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43145:            end).
43146: 
43147: 
43148: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43149: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43150: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43151: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43152: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43153: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43154: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43155: %% This is the 'large' message test case,
43156: %% for TCP and IPv4.
43157: 
43158: traffic_ping_pong_large_send_and_recv_tcp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43159:     ?TT(?SECS(60)),
43160:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_LARGE),
43161:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_LARGE_NUM),
43162:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43163:            fun() ->
43164:                    has_support_ipv4(),
43165:                    is_old_fedora16(),
43166:                    is_slow_ubuntu(Config)
43167:            end,
43168:            fun() ->
43169:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43170:                                  proto  => tcp,
43171:                                  msg    => Msg,
43172:                                  num    => Num},
43173:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43174:            end).
43175: 
43176: 
43177: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43178: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43179: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43180: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43181: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43182: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43183: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43184: %% This is the 'large' message test case,
43185: %% for TCP and IPv6.
43186: 
43187: traffic_ping_pong_large_send_and_recv_tcp6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43188:     ?TT(?SECS(60)),
43189:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_LARGE),
43190:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_LARGE_NUM),
43191:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43192:            fun() -> is_old_fedora16(),
43193:                     has_support_ipv6(),
43194: 		    is_slow_ubuntu(Config) end,
43195:            fun() ->
43196:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
43197:                                  proto  => tcp,
43198:                                  msg    => Msg,
43199:                                  num    => Num},
43200:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43201:            end).
43202: 
43203: 
43204: 
43205: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43206: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43207: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43208: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43209: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43210: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43211: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43212: %% This is the 'large' message test case,
43213: %% for TCP (default) and UNix Domain (stream) socket.
43214: 
43215: traffic_ping_pong_large_send_and_recv_tcpL(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43216:     ?TT(?SECS(60)),
43217:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_LARGE),
43218:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_LARGE_NUM),
43219:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43220:            fun() ->
43221:                    has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
43222:                    traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond()
43223:            end,
43224:            fun() ->
43225:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
43226:                                  proto  => default,
43227:                                  msg    => Msg,
43228:                                  num    => Num},
43229:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43230:            end).
43231: 
43232: 
43233: 
43234: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43235: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43236: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43237: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43238: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43239: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43240: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43241: %% This is the 'large' message test case,
43242: %% for SCTP and IPv4.
43243: 
43244: traffic_ping_pong_large_send_and_recv_sctp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43245:     ?TT(?SECS(60)),
43246:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_LARGE),
43247:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_LARGE_NUM),
43248:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43249:            fun() ->
43250:                    has_support_ipv4(),
43251:                    has_support_sctp(),
43252:                    is_old_fedora16(),
43253:                    is_slow_ubuntu(Config)
43254:            end,
43255:            fun() ->
43256:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43257:                                  proto  => sctp,
43258:                                  msg    => Msg,
43259:                                  num    => Num},
43260:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43261:            end).
43262: 
43263: 
43264: 
43265: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43266: %% This test case is intended to test that the send and recv functions
43267: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43268: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43269: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43270: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43271: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43272: %% This is the 'large' message test case,
43273: %% for SCTP and IPv6.
43274: 
43275: traffic_ping_pong_large_send_and_recv_sctp6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43276:     ?TT(?SECS(60)),
43277:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_LARGE),
43278:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_LARGE_NUM),
43279:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43280:            fun() ->
43281:                    has_support_ipv6(),
43282:                    has_support_sctp(),
43283:                    is_old_fedora16(),
43284:                    is_slow_ubuntu(Config)
43285:            end,
43286:            fun() ->
43287:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
43288:                                  proto  => sctp,
43289:                                  msg    => Msg,
43290:                                  num    => Num},
43291:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState)
43292:            end).
43293: 
43294: 
43295: 
43296: %% This test case is a bit extreme and fails on some hosts
43297: %% (e.g. OpenIndiana Hipster), so exclude them.
43298: traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond() ->
43299:     traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond(os:type(), os:version()).
43300: 
43301: traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond({unix, sunos}, _) ->
43302:     skip("TC does not work on platform");
43303: traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond({unix, linux}, _) ->
43304:     traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond2(string:trim(os:cmd("cat /etc/issue")));
43305: traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond(_, _) ->
43306:     ok.
43307: 
43308: traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond2("Welcome to SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 10 SP1 (i586)" ++ _) ->
43309:     skip("TC does not work on platform");
43310: traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond2("Fedora release 16 " ++ _) ->
43311:     skip("Very slow VM");
43312: traffic_ping_pong_large_host_cond2(_) ->
43313:     ok.
43314: 
43315: 
43316: etc_issue() ->
43317:     string:trim(os:cmd("cat /etc/issue")).
43318: 
43319: is_old_fedora16() ->
43320:     is_old_fedora16( etc_issue() ).
43321: 
43322: %% We actually only have one host running this, a slow VM.
43323: is_old_fedora16("Fedora release 16 " ++ _) ->
43324:     skip("Very slow VM");
43325: is_old_fedora16(_) ->
43326:     ok.
43327: 
43328: 
43329: %% This is a bit subjective, but...
43330: %% ..we have some WMs that is not "fast enough", but the only
43331: %% thing we can test on is 'esock factor' (other than host name).
43332: %% This means we actually skip this on platforms where its
43333: %% not actually needed.
43334: %% The host in question is a Ubuntu 20.04...
43335: is_slow_ubuntu(Config) ->
43336:     case lookup(kernel_factor, 1, Config) of
43337: 	F when is_integer(F) andalso (F > 1) ->
43338: 	    case os:type() of
43339: 		{unix, linux} ->
43340: 		    case etc_issue() of
43341: 			"Ubuntu 20.04" ++ _ ->
43342: 			    skip("Slow Ubuntu host");
43343: 			_ ->
43344: 			    ok
43345: 		    end;
43346: 		_ ->
43347: 		    ok
43348: 	    end;
43349: 	_ ->
43350: 	    ok
43351:     end.
43352: 
43353: 
43354: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43355: %% This test case is intended to test that the sendto and recvfrom 
43356: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43357: %% The same basic test case is used for two different message sizes; 
43358: %% small (8 bytes) and medium (8K).
43359: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43360: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43361: %% This is the 'small' message test case, for IPv4.
43362: 
43363: traffic_ping_pong_small_sendto_and_recvfrom_udp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43364:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
43365:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
43366:     tc_try(traffic_ping_pong_small_sendto_and_recvfrom_udp4,
43367:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
43368:            fun() ->
43369:                    ?TT(?SECS(45)),
43370:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43371:                                  proto  => udp,
43372:                                  msg    => Msg,
43373:                                  num    => Num},
43374:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendto_and_recvfrom_udp(InitState)
43375:            end).
43376: 
43377: 
43378: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43379: %% This test case is intended to test that the sendto and recvfrom 
43380: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43381: %% The same basic test case is used for two different message sizes; 
43382: %% small (8 bytes) and medium (8K).
43383: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43384: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43385: %% This is the 'small' message test case, for IPv6.
43386: 
43387: traffic_ping_pong_small_sendto_and_recvfrom_udp6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43388:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
43389:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
43390:     tc_try(traffic_ping_pong_small_sendto_and_recvfrom_udp6,
43391:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
43392:            fun() ->
43393:                    ?TT(?SECS(45)),
43394:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
43395:                                  proto  => udp,
43396:                                  msg    => Msg,
43397:                                  num    => Num},
43398:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendto_and_recvfrom_udp(InitState)
43399:            end).
43400:

43402: 
43403: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43404: %% This test case is intended to test that the sendto and recvfrom 
43405: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43406: %% The same basic test case is used for two different message sizes; 
43407: %% small (8 bytes) and medium (8K).
43408: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43409: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43410: %% This is the 'small' message test case, for Unix Domain (dgram) socket.
43411: 
43412: traffic_ping_pong_small_sendto_and_recvfrom_udpL(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43413:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
43414:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
43415:     tc_try(traffic_ping_pong_small_sendto_and_recvfrom_udpL,
43416:            fun() ->
43417: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
43418: 		   is_not_windows()
43419: 	   end,
43420:            fun() ->
43421:                    ?TT(?SECS(45)),
43422:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
43423:                                  proto  => default,
43424:                                  msg    => Msg,
43425:                                  num    => Num},
43426:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendto_and_recvfrom_udp(InitState)
43427:            end).
43428:

43510: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.

43522:            fun() ->
43523:                    is_not_windows(),

43525:            end,

43527:                    ?TT(?SECS(20)),
43528:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43529:                                  proto  => tcp,
43530:                                  msg    => Msg,
43531:                                  num    => Num},
43532:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream(InitState)

43594: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43595: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43596: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43597: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43598: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43599: %% This is the 'small' message test case,
43600: %% for SCTP and IPv4.
43601: 
43602: traffic_ping_pong_small_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_sctp4(Config)
43603:   when is_list(Config) ->
43604:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
43605:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
43606:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43607:            fun() ->
43608:                    is_not_windows(),
43609:                    has_support_ipv4(),
43610:                    has_support_sctp()
43611:            end,
43612:            fun() ->
43613:                    ?TT(?SECS(20)),
43614:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43615:                                  proto  => sctp,
43616:                                  msg    => Msg,
43617:                                  num    => Num},
43618:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream(InitState)
43619:            end).
43620: 
43621: 
43622: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43623: %% This test case is intended to test that the sendmsg and recvmsg 
43624: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43625: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43626: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43627: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43628: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43629: %% This is the 'small' message test case,
43630: %% for SCTP and IPv6.
43631: 
43632: traffic_ping_pong_small_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_sctp6(Config)
43633:   when is_list(Config) ->
43634:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_SMALL),
43635:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_SMALL_NUM),
43636:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43637:            fun() ->
43638:                    is_not_windows(),
43639:                    has_support_ipv6(),
43640:                    has_support_sctp()
43641:            end,
43642:            fun() ->
43643:                    ?TT(?SECS(20)),
43644:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
43645:                                  proto  => sctp,
43646:                                  msg    => Msg,
43647:                                  num    => Num},
43648:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream(InitState)
43649:            end).
43650: 
43651: 
43652: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43653: %% This test case is intended to test that the sendmsg and recvmsg 
43654: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43655: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43656: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43657: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43658: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43659: %% This is the 'medium' message test case,
43660: %% for TCP and IPv4.
43661: 
43662: traffic_ping_pong_medium_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_tcp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
43663:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
43664:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
43665:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43666:            fun() ->
43667:                    is_not_windows(),
43668:                    has_support_ipv4()
43669:            end,
43670:            fun() ->
43671:                    ?TT(?SECS(30)),
43672:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43673:                                  proto  => tcp,
43674:                                  msg    => Msg,
43675:                                  num    => Num},
43676:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream(InitState)
43677:            end).
43678: 
43679: 
43680: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
43681: %% This test case is intended to test that the sendmsg and recvmsg functions
43682: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43683: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43684: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43685: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43686: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43687: %% This is the 'medium' message test case,
43688: %% for TCP and IPv6.
43689: 
43690: traffic_ping_pong_medium_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_tcp6(Config)
43691:   when is_list(Config) ->
43692:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
43693:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
43694:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43695:            fun() ->
43696:                    is_not_windows(),
43697:                    has_support_ipv6()
43698:            end,
43699:            fun() ->
43700:                    ?TT(?SECS(30)),
43701:                    InitState = #{domain => inet6,
43702:                                  proto  => tcp,
43703:                                  msg    => Msg,
43704:                                  num    => Num},
43705:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream(InitState)
43706:            end).

43713: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).

43715: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43716: %% This is the 'medium' message test case,
43717: %% for TCP (default) and Unix Domain (stream) socket.

43800: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
43801: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
43802: %% small (8 bytes), medium (8K) and large (8M).
43803: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
43804: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43805: %% This is the 'large' message test case,
43806: %% for TCP and IPv4.

43809:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_LARGE),
43810:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_LARGE_NUM),
43811:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
43812:            fun() ->
43813:                    is_not_windows(),
43814:                    has_support_ipv4(),
43815:                    traffic_ping_pong_large_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_cond()
43816:            end,
43817:            fun() ->
43818:                    ?TT(?SECS(60)),
43819:                    InitState = #{domain => inet,
43820:                                  proto  => tcp,
43821:                                  msg    => Msg,
43822:                                  num    => Num},
43823:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream(InitState)
43824:            end).
43825: 
43826: 
43827: traffic_ping_pong_large_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_cond() ->
43828:     traffic_ping_pong_large_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_cond(os:type(), os:version()).
43829: 
43830: traffic_ping_pong_large_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_cond({unix, linux}, {M, _, _})
43831:   when (M < 3) ->
43832:     skip("TC may not work on this version");
43833: traffic_ping_pong_large_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_cond(_, _) ->
43834:     ok.
43835:

43986: %% small (8 bytes) and medium (8K).

43988: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
43989: %% This is the 'small' message test case, for IPv6.
43990:

44008: %% by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
44009: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
44010: %% small (8 bytes) and medium (8K).
44011: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
44012: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
44013: %% This is the 'small' message test case, for Unix Domain (dgram) socket.

44019:            fun() ->

44035: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.

44037: %% small (8 bytes) and medium (8K).

44039: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).

44059: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.

44061: %% small (8 bytes) and medium (8K).

44063: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).

44067:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
44068:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
44069:     tc_try(traffic_ping_pong_medium_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_udp6,
44070:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,

44078:            end).

44081: 
44082: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
44083: %% This test case is intended to test that the sendmsg and recvmsg 
44084: %% functions by repeatedly sending a meassage between two entities.
44085: %% The same basic test case is used for three different message sizes; 
44086: %% small (8 bytes) and medium (8K).
44087: %% The message is sent from A to B and then back again. This is 
44088: %% repeated a set number of times (more times the small the message).
44089: %% This is the 'medium' message test case, for Unix Domain (dgram) socket.
44090: 
44091: traffic_ping_pong_medium_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_udpL(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
44092:     Msg = l2b(?TPP_MEDIUM),
44093:     Num = ?TPP_NUM(Config, ?TPP_MEDIUM_NUM),
44094:     tc_try(traffic_ping_pong_medium_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_udpL,
44095:            fun() ->
44096: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
44097: 		   is_not_windows()
44098: 	   end,
44099:            fun() ->
44100:                    ?TT(?SECS(60)),
44101:                    InitState = #{domain => local,
44102:                                  proto  => default,
44103:                                  msg    => Msg,
44104:                                  num    => Num},
44105:                    ok = traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_udp(InitState)
44106:            end).
44107: 
44108: 
44109: 
44110: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
44111: 
44112: %% Ping-Pong for TCP
44113: 
44114: traffic_ping_pong_send_and_recv_stream(InitState) ->
44115:     Send = fun(Sock, Data) -> socket:send(Sock, Data) end,
44116:     Recv = fun(Sock, Sz)   -> socket:recv(Sock, Sz) end,
44117:     InitState2 = InitState#{send => Send, % Send function
44118:                             recv => Recv  % Receive function
44119:                            },
44120:     traffic_ping_pong_send_and_receive_stream(InitState2).
44121: 
44122: traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream(#{domain := local} = InitState) ->
44123:     Recv = fun(Sock, Sz)   -> 
44124:                    case socket:recvmsg(Sock, Sz, 0) of
44125:                        %% On some platforms, the address
44126:                        %% *is* provided (e.g. linux)
44127:                        {ok, #{addr  := #{family := local},
44128:                               iov   := [Data]}} ->
44129:                            {ok, Data};
44130:                        {ok, #{addr := _} = Msg} ->
44131:                            {error, {msg, Msg}};
44132:                        %% On some platforms, the address
44133:                        %% is *not* provided (e.g. FreeBSD)
44134:                        {ok, #{iov   := [Data]}} ->
44135:                            {ok, Data};
44136:                        {ok, Msg} ->
44137:                            {error, {msg, Msg}};
44138:                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
44139:                            ERROR
44140:                    end
44141:            end,
44142:     InitState2 = InitState#{recv => Recv},  % Receive function
44143:     traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream2(InitState2);
44144: traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream(InitState) ->
44145:     Recv = fun(Sock, Sz)   -> 
44146:                    case socket:recvmsg(Sock, Sz, 0) of
44147:                        {ok, #{iov   := [Data]}} ->
44148:                            {ok, Data};
44149:                        {ok, Msg} ->
44150:                            {error, {msg, Msg}};
44151:                        {error, _} = ERROR ->
44152:                            ERROR
44153:                    end
44154:            end,
44155:     InitState2 = InitState#{recv => Recv},  % Receive function
44156:     traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream2(InitState2).
44157: 
44158: traffic_ping_pong_sendmsg_and_recvmsg_stream2(InitState) ->
44159:     Send = fun(Sock, Data) when is_binary(Data) ->
44160:                    Msg = #{iov => [Data]},
44161:                    socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg);
44162:               (Sock, Data) when is_list(Data) -> %% We assume iovec...
44163:                    Msg = #{iov => Data},
44164:                    socket:sendmsg(Sock, Msg)
44165:            end,
44166:     InitState2 = InitState#{send => Send}, % Send function
44167:     traffic_ping_pong_send_and_receive_stream(InitState2).
44168: 
44169: 
44170: traffic_ping_pong_send_and_receive_stream(#{msg := Msg} = InitState) ->
44171:     Fun = fun(Sock) -> 
44172:                   {ok, RcvSz} = socket:getopt(Sock, socket, rcvbuf),
44173: 		  ?SEV_IPRINT("RcvBuf is ~p (needs at least ~p)", 
44174: 			      [RcvSz, 16+size(Msg)]),
44175:                   if (RcvSz < size(Msg)) ->
44176:                           NewRcvSz = 1024+size(Msg),
44177:                           case socket:setopt(Sock, socket, rcvbuf, NewRcvSz) of
44178: 			      ok ->
44179: 				  ok;
44180: 			      {error, enobufs} ->
44181: 				  skip(?F("Change ~w buffer size (to ~w) "
44182:                                           "not allowed", 
44183:                                           [rcvbuf, NewRcvSz]));
44184: 			      {error, Reason1} ->
44185: 				  ?FAIL({rcvbuf, Reason1})
44186: 			  end;
44187:                      true ->
44188:                           ok
44189:                   end,
44190:                   {ok, SndSz} = socket:getopt(Sock, socket, sndbuf),
44191: 		  ?SEV_IPRINT("SndBuf is ~p (needs at least ~p)", 
44192: 			      [SndSz, 16+size(Msg)]),
44193:                   if (SndSz < size(Msg)) ->
44194:                           NewSndSz = 1024+size(Msg),
44195:                           case socket:setopt(Sock, socket, sndbuf, NewSndSz) of
44196: 			      ok ->
44197: 				  ok;
44198: 			      {error, enobufs} ->
44199: 				  skip(?F("Change ~w buffer size (to ~w) "
44200:                                           "not allowed", 
44201:                                           [sndbuf, NewSndSz]));
44202: 			      {error, Reason2} ->
44203: 				  ?FAIL({sndbuf, Reason2})
44204: 			  end;
44205:                      true ->
44206:                           ok
44207:                   end,
44208:                   case os:type() of
44209:                       {win32, nt} ->
44210:                           ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, rcvbuf, 12*1024);
44211:                       _ ->
44212:                           ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, rcvbuf, {12, 1024})
44213:                   end
44214:           end,
44215:     traffic_ping_pong_send_and_receive_stream2(InitState#{buf_init => Fun}).
44216: 
44217: traffic_ping_pong_send_and_receive_stream2(InitState) ->
44218:     ServerSeq =
44219:         [
44220:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
44221:          #{desc => "await start",
44222:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
44223:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
44224:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
44225:                    end},
44226:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
44227:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
44228:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
44229:                            ok
44230:                    end},
44231: 
44232:          %% *** Init part ***
44233:          #{desc => "which local address",
44234:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
44235:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
44236:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
44237:                    end},
44238:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
44239:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, proto := Proto} = State) ->
44240:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
44241:                                {ok, Sock} ->
44242:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
44243:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
44244:                                    ERROR
44245:                            end
44246:                    end},
44247:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
44248:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
44249:                          lsock  := LSock,
44250:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
44251:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
44252:                                ok ->
44253:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
44254:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
44255:                                    ERROR
44256:                            end;
44257:                       (#{lsock := LSock, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
44258:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
44259:                                ok ->
44260:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
44261:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
44262:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
44263:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
44264:                                    ERROR
44265:                            end
44266:                    end},
44267:          #{desc => "maybe init buffers",
44268:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, buf_init := BufInit} = _State) ->
44269:                            BufInit(LSock)
44270:                    end},
44271:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
44272:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
